i got my haircut here once. the people were nice and the woman who cut my hair did a good job for a great clips. if you want a great clips haircut, do not hesitate to come to this one : )also, as always, they accept walk-ins. it's the perfect place for when you must get your hair cut immediately or you'll find yourself streaking or stabbing the person next to you at that cafe with a plastic fork. you're going to be okay.

three weeks ago, i got a haircut here on a whim and was underwhelmed. the stylist got both my first and last names wrong, even though i spelled them. i asked her to give my bangs attention, but she missed a spot altogether. and something wasn't right about the back...she'd chipped into the sides but left the center long. after pinning up my hair for three weeks, i was tired of compromising. i got a corrective bang trim elsewhere today (which ended up becoming a full-fledged cut), and it was then that i really saw all the mistakes in my hair. my stylist today had to take at least an inch off the back to fix it. i see a lot of good reviews here, so maybe i caught her on a bad day. but two haircuts in three weeks is too costly to take that chance again.

good haircut but this is the second time i went in there and was assaulted by why trump is better than hilary.  i'm seeing ads everyday and so i don't need it from the stylists to.  and the stuff they are saying isn't even factual. just cut my hair, ugh.  two people left saying they would never go back, and i would make the third in a row.  i have always known never to talk about politics or religion with clients.  these two have no clue that they are running people out of the store with their attacks on hilary and unprofessional political vomit that is completely misinformed.  if any of my employees talked about politics to my clients it would be an automatic write up.  if three clients said they wouldn't be back because of them, they would be fired.  sportclips is just down the street, a little more expensive but i won't be assaulted be political ads.

a big thank you to the hairdressers who were there on 5/13! i went in to shave my head for medical reasons and they handled it such poise and understanding. had to leave quickly with just thank you because tears were coming fast.

do not come here. i read the reviews on this place, and they were mostly bad, but i just get a simple cut--trim, long layers--so i figured i'd give it a try for a quick cut. the woman who cut my hair was nice, asked how i was, typical small talk. then, her phone rang while she was in the middle of cutting my hair. 1. why can i hear your personal cell phone ringing while you are at work? 2. she stopped, mid haircut to try to pick up the phone call, but she missed the call. 3. she called the person back, and had at least a 5 minute conversation. i was shocked. she came back, and apologized, but i didn't want to say anything until she finished cutting my hair. then, while she was finishing my haircut, the other stylist went in the back and was talking on her personal cell phone, which i could clearly hear the entire conversation.then, more customers walked in, so the other stylist came from the back, still on her phone, and my stylist told her in spanish, to hurry up and get off the phone because there are customers. the other stylist continued to talk on her phone for another minute before she greeted and helped them.my haircut is fine, but that kind of service is obscene, especially when the cut itself did not take longer than 10 minutes, but their conversations were obviously more important than their customers.

i have used these guys a couple of times... never again. each time i come into this place their first questions/statement is not "hello welcome to great clips" or "hi how are you today" or "haircut today?" rather it is "did you check in online?" thats all fine and dandy. and its perfectly ok if you adhere to your own rules. the last times i have been there the person who checked in (person or online) was first. i checked in at home and it said clearly "zero minute" wait. i rode my bike and was there in under 10 minutes. i saw two people freshly sat down and their haircuts just begun. i also saw the normal "check in" monitor ominously turned off. then the stylist took time to help a customer by hairgel mid-haircut and their day went on. oblivious to their own rules for their own convenience. so two can play at this game. you have lost a customer for life. i will never return to this great clips again.

i've been coming here for years. never gotten a bad haircut (been to over 5 of there stylists). i started coming here when i lived in oak park. i have lived in lincoln park and now riverside and style get my hair cut here. thanks gclips oak park.

i have been coming here for my 3boys for the last 5 years and the service has always been mediocre but this was the last straw. i checked in at 4:30 from home and the website allows me. i loaded my 3 boys into the car in the snow, arrived by 4:45 and they wouldn't take us for our haircuts!! their website specifically stated that i would be taken if i arrived before 5 which i did. so frustrating. so even though this place is in a convenient location, i won't be coming back. great job losing a 5 year longtime customer great clips oak park.

i've gone to great clips at a different location and have zero problem. i came to this location after i moved and never again. the staff was fake friendly, and barely greeted me before asking if i wanted a cut. the other location asked what i wanted, if i wanted  a shampoo, and were super friendly. the woman who cut my hair didn't listen either, and cut it way too short. when she was done, i had to tell her that it was uneven. she evened it out, all the while saying it was how my hair was styled so it looked uneven. she also took two phone calls in the middle of my haircut! terrible service.

finally found my hair stylist in oak park! for some reason all the barber shops in the area charge $30+ for a men's haircut. i get mine done about once every 3-4 weeks and a cut as straightforward as mine doesn't warrant an insane price tag. i found great clips through yelp, went in at 5:15 on a monday and was in a chair having my hair cut no more than 5 minutes later. my stylist, mary, was super friendly and cut my hair with zero effort. normally when i get a trim done, it takes a few days for it to look half decent even with globs of clay and pomade, but miraculously it looked great the moment i finished my post haircut shower. the haircut for a male is $13 so with tip it cost me $16. i have had few better haircuts than this and for the price, it's a serious bargain. hope i can improve this place's rep because it is definitely deserving of it! will be coming here again and again.
update: have since been back and gotten my hair cut by 2 other hairdressers and they did a great job!

groupon users beware.  i'm a regular.  the cut is usually good- but this one time with a groupon- completely horrid. presented my coupon to the hair stylist- and blam everything changed.  here's what was completely different. 1- did not use the white tape around the neck to prevent hair from getting into shirt2- used a razor to trim sides, and trimmed off top by hand.  however did not trim edges around once, offer to even out my sideburns or use a mirror to show the back of my head. 3- total time for hair cut ~10 min.  previous visits were 15-18 min. 4- barely trimmed the top- i had to ask her to do a little more, which she did haphazardly. 5- did not offer hair gel (usually does). 6- at the end i was going to tip her as i always do- her response - "oh, i'm sorry i didn't know you were going to tip.  i don't even know how to charge you for a tip".  another 5 min later after getting another stylist to the computer she was able to charge me- at that point i was ready to give her zero. now, my previous visits- i'd give them 4 stars easily, they were solid cuts.  but with a groupon everything changes.  buyer beware.

i just received a haircut from mary (she has tattoos). the haircut is not bad but the experience was bad. she pulled my hair and gave off a cold rude vibe. don't get a haircut from her unless you're a masochist.

i've been coming here for about a year and a half, and ana has been my stylist basically the whole time. she always does a great job, and i typically receive compliments whenever she cuts my hair. i would definitely recommend her.

really like that you can log in from their app. never have to wait. all their staff are very skilled. i'm impressed that they keep track of how you like your hair cut, so your cut is just how you like it no matter which stylist cuts it. never had a bad haircut.

honestly, i'd give zero stars if it were an option. brought in two 3 year olds for hair cuts. we've been before and have always been very satisfied. stylist didn't take her time, doesn't know how to communicate with children, both boys ended up with horrible, uneven hair cuts, the stylist took less then 10 minutes on both cuts combined. fall family photos have to be postponed because the cuts are that terrible. we will not be going back.
it's where i take my kids for their cuts.  it works.  i wouldn't my haircut there though.   they are quick and friendly.
mary just did me.  she pulled my hair jusst righhhht. ;-)

is this the best haircut you can find in the op?  no, it is not.  however, the next better haircut costs $35 before a tip.i get in and out of great clips quickly, i don't need an appointment, and it costs only $12!  i pay $15 and i feel like mr. big shot big tipper.the women working there are a little quiet and shy (in my experience), but they don't mess around.  they are efficient and respectful.  they check in with me to make sure i haven't changed my preferences since my last visit.  and if i feel that something needs to be fixed at the end, they keep at it until it is done.one note about the great clips system...  it appears that they store certain information about how i like my hair, such as what length to set for the trimmers.  however, this isn't as effective as the great clips overlords probably think it is.  so many other aspects go into a haircut than you could easily store in a database in a retail environment.  you still need to hire skilled, experienced workers who know their way around many different heads of hair.

wavered between 3 and 4, nothing fancy, but nice personable folks who give you a good value for the money.  my wife and i both have been here and we think it's a good place for a hair cut.  i would go back.

america - great mens stylist! why spend $40-50 on a mens haircut? i've been seeing america regularly for about the last 1.5 years. she's the general manager, and is great and super friendly. i sometimes bring in pictures of what i want for a new style, and she goes right to it and does a fantastic job. price is unbeatable, $9.99 if you get in before noon on weekdays, otherwise it's $13.99. i go about every 2.5 weeks, so to me it makes sense financially. also, if you download their app, you can put your name on the list ahead of time and it's much easier to predict your wait time. of course, if you request a specific stylist, the wait can be a little longer than the estimated wait time they give you.

i usually have becca cut my hair (who is fantastic) was not in this evening so pierre had cut my hair.  he very friendly and professional.   i am very hair with my service that i had received from him  i would recommend him.

pretty much the worst hair cut i've ever gotten. i asked for an undercut and specifically told my stylist that both sides should have a part and not be blended. after taking off my glasses and letting her for her work for a while i out them back on to find that the top of my hair is blended my the left side to the right side with the left side being about an inch and a half longer. i pointed it out to her and she proceeded to try fixing it my cutting the right side even more. absolutely horrible cut. no questions were asked while cutting and no affirmation of what she was about to do was asked for. go somewhere else if you want anything more than a very simple trim.

i go there sometimes for a blow dry. my hair is shoulder length and wavy. most of the time i'm pleased but today i was disappointed.when i got home after running around doing errands, i looked in the mirror and was so embarrassed when i realized i walked around the city with my hair looking like "i" didn't know what i was doing. i noticed a big portion of my hair looking frizzy so i put my hand through it to smooth it out when i realized a big portion on the side of my hair wasn't blow dried (straightened)- it was wavy and poofy underneath. my whole head was fine with the exception of one part, which was sticking out.today, i can honestly say my hair didn't look like i just stepped out of a salon. i had to finish straightening it myself. what did i spend $33 plus tip on? very disappointing.

received the worst haircut of my life. this cut is choppy and uneven all over my head. when she showed me my hair was soaking wet and i couldn't tell anything. i'm embarrassed that i waked around in public before i got home and realized this is what my hair looked like drywould give zero stars if possible.also want to point out that my husband got his hair done the same time and his looks great. so when i find out the lady's name who did mine i will be reaching out to corporate and posting it here.

i had a horrible haircut experience here. i hate how expensive haircuts are, so i figured i'd give great clips a try. my stylist's idea of layering was just chopping off the front half of my hair (i think another reviewer posted a photo that looks pretty synonymous to my hair). if you want anything other than a buzz cut, i would go somewhere else.
the cut was well done.   i'm happy with the price and the good job the stylist did on my hair.   i'll be back.  :)

to say i had a horrible experience at this salon is an understatement!!!!! i was in the chair about 45 seconds and during that time the hair stylist chopped 6 inches off my hair before i could even let him know that i wanted a litte trim. when i proceeded to stand up as i was extremely upset he pushed me back in the chair and told me he was almost finished (this was 60 seconds in to the appointment). when i starting asking "what are you doing"  his only response was "all your hair is dead". as seen in the picture he not only cut my hair completely off he also cut it wrong, as one side is visibly longer than the other. the worst part of this entire experience is, i have been growing my hair to donate to a child i know who is desperate need of a wig. not only was this hair stylist rude and unprofessional, he robbed this little girl of a beautiful wig.  i have been crying now for a solid 24 hours due to this man's lack of kindness, professionalism and overall respect for his customer.  shame on this establishment.
i got a haircut from elia. it was the worst haircut. she probably doesn't know to do a proper haircut. my hair was cut so unevenly. such a frustrating experience

hairstyler told my son he supposedly had lice, when he just had flakes from dry sculpting gel. very unprofessional and very loud he started saying he needed to sterilized the chair and his hands. i search my son hair and scalp and nothing, no lice! he ashamed us in the middle of the salon and in front of other clients. we left, crossed the street and went to another salon, they washed my son hair and cut it with no problems nor lice. definitely not coming back.
elia gives the worst haircuts in the world! stay away!  america (yes, name of another stylist) is very good. go to her!

so sad to learn that luis is leaving the shop and going to the old town shop.  he wouldn't discuss why, but this site is losing my favorite hair cutter.  for the price you can't beat great clips.please bring luis back to broadway.

employees are nice, but act like robots. they won't give you helpful suggestions and won't let you know if something is going to look bad. if you want a simple cut, great; if you actually want a specific cut or style, they will not do a good job. they are not paid to make you look good. they are only paid to cut hair.

i've lived in the city for a while now, but never ventured out to find a place to get my hair cut. i visited gc a lot when i lived out in the burbs and being on a very tight budget, decided to give this one a shot. i'm very happy i did. first off, there was a promotion for a 5.99 haircut. it boggles my mind people spend over $40 for a cut, but must be nice for them. anywho, rebecca was the one cutting my hair and she did a wonderful job. i brought in a picture of what i wanted, she complemented the style, and went right to work. she asked be how short i wanted it to be a few times, and giving some recommendations along the way. when i've visited other gc locations, i felt as if the haircut was pretty rushed, and while she did get it done in a quick time, she also made sure it was turning out the way i wanted it to. at the end of it all, she also recommended me products, but didn't push me to buy anything from the salon, which is always nice. my hair feels and looks great and i'm very happy. i'm definitely a repeat customer now.

been using them for years. i think i stopped using supercuts across the street because they pissed me off at one time and i wasn't crazy about the hair cuttery either. i never have too much of a wait here either - especially with the early check-in program they have.i'm usually in and out with a simple buzz.

what a mistake! i went in just to get  my long hair trimmed about an inch, and walk out with the shortest haircut i have had in the last 10 years from a stylist named "elia".  i just will never understand how asking someone to cut off one inch of dead ends translates to......cut my hair that is almost to the middle of my back  to about my shoulders, and add layers to my hair that was all one length (shortest layer now being to my chin).:( i cant even bring myself to wear it down because it brings me to tears to even look at it.

when you go ask for katie! she is awesome. the reason for my two stars is generally i have good experiences but i don't know if now i will be back because i went in today and showed the person (not katie) who was cutting my hair exactly what i wanted. thought it was going to look nice because i have a wedding to go to this weekend. the person cutting my hair waited until after i was done to tell me that he couldn't get it to look the way i wanted it to. um hello!? why didn't you say anything?!? i showed you exactly what i wanted and you said you could do it and now i have to pay for a hair cut that i hate and doesn't even look the way i wanted it to. definitely left feeling like i got ripped off.

i would like to take a minute to thank this wonderful stylist names elia. i was so proud of my hair looks in front of my family in this thanksgiving dinner. everyone liked my hair cut. and i promise myself to go back there again... feeling excited :)

i went there yesterday and the left side of my hair is three inches longer than the right!!! besides i had a nicethree layer haircut and i asked to trim the ends keeping the same hair cut.. i have like 50 layers all different lenghts and loos like my hair got chopped wih a machee!! never going back!!!!
i go there if luiz is working because my hair is long & i want it to stay that way. he is great hair dresser.

was working in coppell last week and needed a trim and the folks at great clips were wonderful. very friendly and fast. i stopped in shortly after they opened and was in and out quickly and my haircut was done well, grant it i just do a quick clipper cut, but it was still done well.

my normal hairstylist at another store wasn't working today. i went back here to get a haircut. i had to ask her to fix several spots on my head and she tried her best. as usual, i had to fix my hair when i got back home.

probably won't ever come back to this location. kind of a long wait, and whenever people come in, instead of saying something like "i'll be with you shortly", they take time from cutting your hair to walk over to the computer. about 5 people walked in while i was there, and my haircut lady decides to walk over to the computer. just didn't seem like the right thing to do. maybe use a sign in sheet or something?other complaint was they didn't allow me to use my online coupon. so a little disappointed there for paying $19 for a marginal experience. i could have used my coupon at sport clips! get the mvp treatment lol.but really though, i don't care about my hair too much, so i am just going to wait around til the next $7.99 sale.

been going to great clips for years in different states.  this place is okay depending on the stylist the good ones are always busy and the bad ones are really bad.  couple times the stylist had to stop and bring another stylist over  to see what to do next.  sorry not interested in being a testing dummy anymore.

quality of the cut depends upon the stylist, but is generally okay (not great, but not terrible) for the price.  the last time my son and i tried to get a haircut there we went in about 30 minutes before closing.  the chairs were all full, but no one was waiting.  we were told it was too close to closing for them to take us.  i pointed  out that there was no one waiting, they didn't close for 30 minutes, and our haircuts typically take about 15 minutes, max.  no luck.  i guess closing early for the day is more important than taking care of regular customers.  we won't be back, ever.

i just needed a quick trim so i decided to come to my local hair salon to check them out.  i have another friend who has long hair like mine and who just likes to get a few trims thru out the year just to clean it up.  why pay $40 for that!  great clips was perfect for what i needed done.  i was in and out within 30 minutes and i left a happy customer!  i highly recommend this place.

first time here. kwi was excellent. this place opens at 10am on sundays, which is a huge differentiator from local competition. waits can get long right when doors open so make sure to do online check-in.
nice clean location with online check in. always get a perfect cut with miss kwi..she has been cutting my hair this last year and always does a great job.

today was my second time to have my hair cut here. the first time i had juan. he was great patient and very knowledgeable. the second time i came i had kwi. she was a lot of fun very talkative and easy to get along with. i am fairly simple when i get my haircut take an inch off six players leave as much on my head as possible. both times have come here they have honored my wishes and i have left happy! enough to the point where i purposely came on to you out to leave a great review for them. i'm not sure who the woman at the counter was who answer my phone call but she was very sweet and nice and talk to us as she was also cutting another man's hair. it was like a big party lots of fun. i left being charged only $14 for haircut so i left a pretty decent tip. i definitely will return and recommend this place to others.

terrible! not only incompetent hairstylists but no concept of customer service and rude managers! bad haircuts followed by refusal to fix a bad job with an attitude that you are just one less customer. maybe this place is fine for kids or men who just want a trimmer run through their head, but certainly not for women or anyone wanting a decent style.

not accepting gift card bought from another locationbought gift card (5 hair cuts for $55) from lewisville tx and used for 1 hair cut.tried to use at coppell tx location - was told the card is not valid, so paid by credit card.called customer service and was told the card is valid at coppell, tx but had to pay full pricecalled the salon again to check and was told that the card is valid, but still $15.called customer service back and was told it is valid at coppell and they should be charging only $11don't know what is going on with great clips@coppell.
they do a decent job here for my done who is 9. just don't be afraid to speak up and tell them what you like and don't like. juan is the best.

i have been going here for a little over 4 years now. by now, most of them know me pretty well. they are all very friendly, and in general cut my hair pretty well. the thing i love the most about this place, besides the people who work here, is the fact that they have an online reservation system. that way, i don't really have to go there and wait for too long. let's just say that i like this place so much that even though i don't live in coppell anymore, i always drive to coppell to get my haircut.
great service. never disappointed. may be a bit pricey than the other locations, but it's worthy of every extra dollar you spend.
poor customer service.  would rather try mutt works (yes a dog grooming and specialty store) located a few doors down,  than come back here.

most of the people that come here are regulars, and most have preferred stylists.  i am one of those that found a favorite stylist.  the staff turnover is extremely low, so a great feeling of "family" exists when visiting.  everyone is extremely friendly.  another deal that can't be beat for regulars -- you can buy a $50 gift card and get haircuts for $10, a savings of $20 ($4 off per haircut).  it's like getting 1.5 free haircuts!  the online checkin is also a bonus.  yup, there's even an app for it!  i can see what the wait time is and check in before i leave work, often arriving in time to walk right into a chair.

went back again for another hair cut. got the same stylist, and everything was amazing again. very quick and i got exactly what i wanted: shorter hair. highly recommended. best place i've ever been for haircuts.

please if you are going here do not let anyone cut your hair but enrique. the other workers just flat out don't know how to cut hair and they look at you and say it's just your type of hair or it's a cow lick. you've been warned. if enrique is not there walk away fast before they butcher your hair. managers and owners should be paying attention to what's going own in their businesses. i won't be going back again.

check in two of my nephews to get a haircut. bethany came up to the counter and called out a donald that was already being assisted then she announced my 4 year old nephews name. once she realized that he was a little kid she made a nasty expression like she didn't want to cut his hair. she took about 3 minutes to "cut" his hair. she didn't even bother brushing his hair nor wiped the bit amount of hair she cut off that was all over his face. extremely disappointed in the service, bethany shouldn't be working there if she doesn't know or want to cut hair. we had to leave without my second nephews hair cut because it was such a bad experience. never again going here.

the only person i see here is kate.  why?  she is always sweet and always cuts my hair right.i like this place because it's pretty nice and not old looking like the other gc'sthe only reason they get 4 stars is kate.  so she better not leave.  it took me a while to find her after my last hair girl got pregnant.

when he started looking like a girl, i took my teenage son here for a haircut and when we left, he had locks that had been missed.  they were one-three inches longer than the other hair next to them!  when he got in the car, he ran his hands through his hair and handfuls of cut hair fell out.  apparently, they didn't comb his hair while or after cutting it. i've never seen such a thing!  it was horrible.  we went right back in to have it redone and they played it off like all haircuts have handfuls of loose cut hair left in them (as a cook, i'd estimate about 1.5 cups of hair).  someone else fixed it, but no one ever apologized or offered anything extra for the trouble.

sabrina did an amazing job on my hair.  she truthfully gave me one of the best haircuts i've ever had (and trust me, i've had a lot - from both chop shops like great clips and professional salons like t & g).  she kept my layers long, framed my face perfectly, and even showed me all the spots where the last hair dresser messed up.  sabrina also gave me some really good product recommendations for my hair type, and took the time to double-check her work when she was finished to make sure everything turned out perfect.  i will never go to another great clips again so long as sabrina works at this one, and, if she ever leaves, i'm going with her.  no joke.the other woman who cut my husband's hair (i think her name was darlene) did an ok job, but could have done better.  she left it somewhat longer than we wanted, and it looked a bit choppy on the sides.  if sabrina is there tonight, we're probably going to go back and see if she can fix it up a bit.(update - 05/01/15)sabrina is now the only person my husband uses too.  i think it's fair to say that i'm very picky about my hubby's hair, and she does it perfectly every time.  we never go to anyone else.

i went in to get hair cut and nancy was assigned to me to cut my hair. it hair cut only took 10 minutes. literally. overall experience was never good, i actually thought she never learn how to cut hair.i told her how i wanted my hair to be done and even in the middle of cutting my hair, i gave more instruction. all of them was taken lightly by her. she never took my request seriously and went ahead with her own perspective of my request. she pulled my hair very hard that it hurts my scalp. also, while she's making a conversation with me, she would hit my arm. she tried to be nice and everything but little did she know that she hit me too hard for a friendly gesture.hair cut like this cost me $14 (excluding tips). i can get it for $5 (tips included) in some chinatown. it's not the level of service i expected. very not recommended.
bad experience today. she did not even clean hair on me. i wont give even a single star if there is am option.
i walked in and eliza greeted me warmly, knew what style would look best, and kept great conversation with me while she did the cutting.  great customer service! i'm definitely coming back.

i would not recommend this place to be honest. i have gone twice and have had mixed reviews. the first time i went one of the ladies cut my hair and did a pretty nice job (i get a fade and have them go from a 1/2 to a 3 and 1/2, standard guy haircut). it wasn't anything special but she cut my hair right.the last time i went was terrible. i was greeted by a girl who sat me down and asked what i wanted. when i told her, she walked away and a different girl came out and moved me to a different chair (i guess the first girl didn't know how to cut a fade?). i told her what i wanted and she didn't think my hair was long enough for a 3 and 1/2 on top so she ran the clippers through my hair with the bit on it, but did not turn on the clippers. as the clippers yanked out my hair, she figured out that my hair was more than long enough. after cutting my hair the first time, i found that there were several spots that were very uneven and it looked patchy. she said she noticed it but didn't do anything about it until i saw it (did she just want to see if she could get away with me not noticing?). she cleaned it up a bit more and when she was done the haircut looked ok at best. i used to cut my hair on a regular basis and what she did was at the level of what i could have done on my own. i go to a place to get a great cut, not just something that i could do at home.i would not recommend this place. after 2 times there i won't be going back for a 3rd. good thing hair grows back and i can get this redone somewhere else afterwards.
$14 a cut?! great for ppl on a budget, like me, and i have been to other locations and have had great stylists every time.
kate is a great stylist been seeing her for over a year now. i have been in on days she has been off gotten a cut and regretted it. giving this place 4 stars and they are all for her....

a decent haircut... will work for me.  i'm not very picky.  problem i have is the price.  this is going to sound odd... but i've never tipped people to give a haircut.  it doesn't make any sense to me.  charge the fee that you want to charge, and don't expect more than that.  restaurants should do the same, but especially hair salons.  great clips charges $14 for a guy's haircut (mind you, that's without a shampoo before hand, which i got for $16 in georgia).  but i'm not complaining about the haircut.  so if they would have charged me $20, i would have paid it (that would have been $5 cheaper than other salons in the area), and it would have given the stylist $6 extra dollars and he wouldn't have to worry about people giving tips. probably won't go back, as i'm not a fan of strip-mall salons like this.  i'm used to a more homely atmosphere, not so professional... warmer.  (since i'm from georgia... southern, if you like. )

the stylist that was doing my 4 year old daughters hair quit working at great clips. went back to have it done by someone else and they completely messed it up. i had to ask another stylist to make it better and she  helped it a little. now we will be waiting about a month for a bad inverted-bob haircut to grow out, then go somewhere else to get it fixed.

just went in today and got my kids hair cut. fantastic service. the ladies did an amazing job on their hair. my kids are extremely happy. also, super quick service. we were a walk in and were helped immediately by the staff. they are extremely sweet. i will definitely bring my family back to this location. the lady named tina cut my son's hair and a lady named maggie cut my daughters. amazing jobs ladies.

new rowlett location off dalrock...went there with a style in mind showed it to the guy and it went down hill from there. did not realize how bad it was till i went home to blow dry it. i called up there and was told i could see maggie and she. would fix it. i went up there today to get it fixed to walk into the location to hear the original guy that cut my hair talking trash about me. i was super pissed and just walked out went some where else to get my hair  fixed. but because he took so much off i still could not get the style i was originally going for.

just wasted 30 min of my time! i just wanted a shampoo, blow out, and straightened was told $30 by one girl( very friendly). then when it was my turn the lady who was going to do my hair said it was more like $45. so now my hair isn't done and i am super annoyed!

7/23/17 to great clips corp. please consider removing the online check in tool, it's diluting the great clips brand. i have had many situations where the posted online wait times are extremely understated upon arrival and i'm afraid this is becoming the norm. very frustrating.

the store is okay. never go to crystal she has no idea what she is doing. she can't read the notes previous stylists use. she screwed up my hair. she us d the machine where it's clearly said to use the "scissors". i look like i just had a head surgery. she was in a rush to get me out of these. didn't even blow the hair properly just wiped my neck and let me out. i have been going to this location for more than a year. everyone i dealt with were experienced and knew how to read.

had haircut here for a long time. regular stylist left, tried a new stylist here.  she used an unclean pair of clippers that gave me a scalp infection.  tried to contact the owner and they never called me back.

i've only been here once and i'm never returning. yes i was greeted warmly and helped promptly but those were the only good things. none of the stylists there were either cleaning or sterilizing their equipment. that's how infections and parasites get passed.and the lady that did cut my hair went way too fast, as well as put in a fade after i specifically asked to not get one. and she left the right side of my hair an inch longer than the other. overall, avoid going here at all.
i checked in online and went in with no waiting. my stylist today was khammy. she did an excellent job; very detail oriented.

within about 10 seconds of walking in, someone got my name down and told me i'd be taken care of as soon as they could get to me. i literally walked over to the chair, sat down, and sat for about 10 seconds before brandon let me know he was just cleaning his station for me. he cleaned it up quickly and got my name and after that he actually made the effort to call me by it. he made double sure i was ready for the haircut (i've been growing it out 5 years and asked for a shorter inverted bob) before cutting my hair. now, folks, i have a lot of hair. he probably cut about 8 to 10 inches off in most places, and my hair is crazy thick. he got my hair cut the exact way i wanted it and did it in about 30 minutes. not bad. not bad at all. plus he never complained about how long or thick my hair was. he made a comment that i had a lot of hair, but never once did he complain or act rude to me, even when telling me about the screaming kids before me he wasn't dogging on them, he just told me the story and didn't talk bad about the family at all. when i went to leave he said, "see you in about 8 weeks!" i will definitely be back for a haircut here. i've never gotten such a great experience from a generic hair place. brandon definitely made it worth the short trip over there!

you just created a loyal customer! i walked in here with no appointment (because no appointment is required) and got seen within 10 minutes. my stylist asked me questions that i've never been asked before. at first i was a little perplexed as to why i was being asked so many questions, but then i realized that the stylists are systematically trained to deliver the perfect haircut each time. i've been to expensive hair stylists before, and the cut that they delivered is right on par (and even better) than most. it was executed so quickly, too. my stylist recommended some hair strengthening products to address my concerns of thinning hair. the cost for a hair cut is something like $15, which is a great deal. the best part about this is that they have a system that takes visual notes on your haircut so that every time you come back (to any location in the world), they can deliver the perfect haircut to you. man. i'm surprised i have not heard about you all sooner. this is great!

have been going to this location for a few years and have always been pleased for the most part.  today was horrible.  the stylist that cut my hair hurried through the haircut asking no questions about what i wanted, etc.  the hair is cut way up over one ear and the other is down and uneven.  sideburns are just as bad.  there are long hairs everywhere.  she cut way up on the sides and back in the temple.  didn't even ask about the neckline.  it is so bad it is too bad to go out in public!  i don't think she cared and certainly didn't act like she wanted to be there.  horrible stylist!!!  the salon is ok but i will wait an hour before i'll let her cut my hair again.

my 2 year old daughter wiggles like crazy when i try to cut her hair.  i totally messed it up, but gigi fixed it for us!  she did a great job and was very patient when samantha tried to move from the scissors.  i asked adela to trim up my neck while i was there, and she ended up giving me a great haircut!  we had coupons for a haircut for $5.99, so for $11.98 plus tip, my daughter and i look great.  we will be back!!

my husband and son get their haircuts here and they alway do a great job. and, i'm a picky wife and mom about my guy's appearance. they keep a record of the type of haircut that they get, so it's easy for them to walk in and always get a consistent haircut. also, my husband loves the online check in app. it's so helpful because they walk in and are seated in a timely manner.
cheapest place around - there are lots of choices - and quality is ok.  little concerned about the cleanliness - you never see anyone clean their scissors between customers.

i'm standing in front of the great clips at 9:03 and there is no one inside - what's the point of store hours if you don't honor them? i'm guessing a staff member overslept but the manager/owner has to be all over that. hope to hear from the owner and get an apology.update: someone came at 9:10 and told me to be system was down so they couldn't cut my hair. if they knew it was down when they closed, the least you can do is put a note on the door or something.
this ls the worst place, they do not care about online appointments at all, the staff is rude and careless
i have been here few times and found out that hair stylist don't cut hair as instructed. i am planning to change the salon.

my 88 year old mom got a great haircut from sue. she cut my mom's hair just like we asked. we love it. sue was so very kind to her.  we waited less than 10 minutes. next time we will use their app and check in on line.

owner commented below my review,  he put his spin on what happened,   i have used the online check in system many times before with no problem.   it could have  been faulty the morning this situation happened. i don't know, but  i checked at the right right location and arrived within the time the online system alerted me to be there.   it looks like as i read the reviews, much time is spent disputing the reviews.  it seems the reviews tell the real story,  my review stands.  i was treated horrible by the manager, screamed at by this person and was treated in a very poor manner showing no respect what so ever no matter the situation.  owner commented that its a busy salon, should be with a huge population/economic growth in this area, but as always what goes around comes around, good luck, it will be needed. my original review stands:place a total disaster.  manager screamed at me because when he did not see my name on list of people that check in online.  i checked in online at the right location on time and arrived on time.   rude  rude rude rude,  call 800 number for great clips,   owner did contact me with a less than sincere apology, but spent more time attempting to justify manager's actions and attitude and trying to put all the blame on me the customer.  .      no way,  beware..

i love virginia !! she does a great job all the time since i sat in her chair 4 yrs ago i am always satified and she is always listening  to my crazy stories and takes her time to inform me about products !!
worst cutting i have done before. i never visit this place again i recommend don't cut your hair

i was a walk-in, first time customer and they were able to help me almost immediately. the lady that did my hair - carmen - was very professional and friendly. i'm pretty picky with my hair and usually think stylists cut too much of my hair off when i ask for a quarter inch trim, but she did an excellent job. will definitely be going back!

this place is really helpful if you are working on how to improve your patience!you go there and think, aah there is one guy ahead, ok i am after him. then all of a sudden the vips show up with electronic "check-in" and you fall back in line. i think they should have one numbering system running sequentially for both electronic or personal check-in and just call the number to avoid all this silliness. it's hair-cutting for god's sake; it won't be long before someone creates an app to check-in for toilets, just to let the vips know which urinals/stalls are empty.i've found a better and cheaper place, so my patience is still a work in progress.

place was clean, but neither employees there today spoke english very well at all, which i suppose is fine... but it is a bit difficult to describe the haircut you want if you don't speak the same language.when i was leaving, i signed the receipt and handed it to her and she just took it without even looking at me and just called the next person up. which again, no big deal, but it was pretty impersonal.the haircut was average, it does not look bad at all, but it was overall not the most pleasant experience.

this is the place where i usually go for a hair cut. its clean inside but not enough parking spaces outside. all the employees are friendly i would say, not all of them are good at english but they are good at doing their job. this young guy at the desk, i think his name is edward, is kind of rude. other than that this place gets your job done. don't forget to check-in online before you go there so that you don't have to wait when you reach there.

worst service in this place..no point in checking in online . the guys who cuts the hair just screams at you when asked where you stand in the queue ..horrible customer service..i have been to many great clips locations but never ever coming to this place..he says u can just walk away ..how rude is that!!!horrible horrible horrible!!!

i was very surprised to see that this location had a 3 star. i have always had a great experience at this location. it is definitely busy, so you need to prepare. i always check in on-line to make sure i have a spot, but once i enter the staff is always very friendly. i am in and out in no time. i will continue to go back over and over again!

the employees in this facility do a super hasty job and they don't spend more than 7-8 minutes per customer. i was afraid if the stylist would hurt my ears. i've experienced a similar situation at the same facility earlier and thought it was an issue with only that particular stylist. with this time, i decided that all employees working at this facility do a similar job.
"if the stylist won't take the time to do their own hair very well, imagine what they are going to do to you!"6.99 special mistake!
they do a good job but they should designate parking spaces for their store. only 2 people inside getting a haircut and 0 parking available.

upon entering great clips in irving it was clear that cutting kids hair was clearly not welcomed business by the male manager of the store. whereas as most adept managers would welcome 4 clients with a smile, especially considering the hair salon was empty and they have the possibility of repeat business, instead we were greeted by the man with a grimace as he sat... and sat.. and sat. he had no appointment waiting and when prompted to help with the others childrens' hair he remained in repose. in contrast, the female stylist helen was pleasant cordial, and great with kids. since we were  told that the male stylist/manager would cut the girls hair along with helen we were surprised when helen was left with four kids hairs to cut as he twiddled his thumbs.. let me be clear he is infact a hair dresser. later he quasi pretended to count the money in his drawer. when another stylist arrived she said she could not cut the baby's hair as she had a belly ache. and asked helen to do it as well. at this point i commented that it was not right to come into a salon and two very able employees just refuse to actually do their job. the man, who admitted he was the manager, let us know that he was the manager and he could essentially do what he wanted.. just to be very clear the  children were  behaved the entire time.it was a terrible experience and no matter how convenient it seems and how lucky they are as far as a fortunate location the manager does not deserve the business of moms and dads who want to have their kids leaving with a nice experience from a hair salon.. albeit, helen was the exception.

the wait was incredible. only two employees were working and they sent the third one home. someone who i assume was the owner was standing there staring at the employees and customers. he was also taking our pictures. for what, i don't know. i had to leave and went to sport clips and even got a discount for the problem here.

i just moved to irving from denton where i was a regular of great clips on teasley lane for six years. since i have received great cuts there i decided to look for a great clips in irving. nidia of great clips on mcarthur blvd. was very attentive to listening to me explain about how i liked my hair cut. she also offered a few ideas in helping me grow out my hair while keeping it well groomed in the process. who says you have to spend a fortune to get a great cut?
this place is great! the staff are very knowledgable and experienced -- they cut quickly and efficiently. the price is great as well. i highly recommend this location!

horrible!!! i brought my daughter here to get a simple cut and on walking out realized her hair was uneven we walked back in and i told the lady and she cut more of her hair to make it even... we left and after her shower we realized it was was worse that i thought... i will never go back here again

absolutely awful place. i would give this place 0 stars if i could. my boyfriend went in and showed the man a picture of what he wanted. not only was it not even remotely close to what he asked for (he pretty much shaved his entire head), but he cut into his beard and left a bald spot in his beard. these people have no idea what they are doing and we walked out of there with a free "haircut". dismal and disappointing. stay away from here. literally, run.

i visit this location monthly. i've only had great interactions with the staff. they are efficient and friendly. the prices have gone slightly up but i'm sure that's a company thing and not just this location. usually in an out in 30 minutes. the only negative i can point out is parking up front. it's a busy side and if you go around peak time you will have to really look for a spot.

i have been going here for the past 3 years. the service really depends on your stylist. so far from my experience, the blondes (two of them) and one black lady were very professional, friendly, take their time to do the job, pay attention to details etc. very good experience through them. but there are few asians working there, definitely stay away from holly, she is very rude, not courteous at all, unfriendly and just after the tip as she races to get it done for more head counts. i had multiple bad experiences through her and she was consistently rude and unprofessional.  i wouldn't recommend her at all. couple other asian ladies working there are friendly and did an ok job but if you really want to get it done the right way, please stick with the non asians.

i was really nervous about getting my hair cut by someone other than my normal stylist but brianna couldn't have been better! i needed my hair to be trimmed and evened out (the left side was shorter due to my trichotillamania) but didn't want to lose my length. brianna was really friendly and talked me through how she was going to cut it and it turned out awesome. my hair is the perfect length and the cheap price can't be beat.

diana cleaned up my sons hair so nice. she does a wonderful job. the staff were so friendly brianna made me feel extra welcome. the facility was nice and clean. i am defiantly coming back, and recommend you bring your whole family. they know how to take care of you!

my partner went here and loved it.  and if he is happy, i am happy. the 2 ladies working that night were super friendly and helpful.  it seems as though they weren't in a speed race or anything  like most of the big chain places.  he is really picky about his hair and liked the service.  he will be going here from now on.  good thing it is right beside the mall for me. lol

my husband and children have been coming here for years. my husband works close and takes iunch breaks to get his cuts. he is actually really picky about his hair but needs somewhere he can drop in on a dime when he is free. plus, my hair stylist charges about double for a cut.there are a few good stylists here. kim is the best, she takes her time. james  and vicki are good as well. we love the check-in app! they are quick and very nice to my children, they love coming to get haircuts. we actually live in rowlett and come here instead of the rowlett one because they are so much better. the value and cut is great. look for coupons, they come about 4-5 times a year. usually around holidays or special occasions.
used to come here until tonight when i found out they dont take a discount card for people at firewheel. super cuts it is for on now.

a good haircut is as good as the experience. it's not about how many you can churn through in an hour, but the relationship each stylist has with their client. with this said, my wife goes to aveda, and full disclosure, i could do the same, but that's not me. holly at great clips firewheel is the reason i spend my money at this location. and i realize that by dropping my favorite stylist's name may make my ability to see her a little less easy, i strongly feel she deserves the recognition. if the franchise owner is reading this, please know you have an amazing stylist that has the ability to make lasting connections, and keep clients coming back.

always a decent cut. for around $12. son like the cuts here so i get mine here too. the app sign in is awesome! you can look to see what the wait is and sign in. most of the time i walk in and they are calling my name.

if we could give "zero" stars we would. do not go to dennis. it is a bit difficult to find someone who speaks english here, and dennis does not speak or understand english. my son clearly explained what he wanted and even showed him a picture - leaving his hair longer on top. dennis did not listen at all (or just did not understand english). he completely shaved his head all the way around, the same length, the same blade, and just shaved it all off.  this is for his senior prom!! there are places all around here that i would pick before i would ever go back to this place. beware!!

so iim not a local, but i needed to get a haircut in a pinch.the asian lady (vietnamese) was very friendly and cut my hair with concentration and took a bit longer than most folks, but this was probably the best haircut i've had in a while. not sure if it's because i'm also asian, so she 'knows' my hair texture and such, but she was really good a blending my hair and texturizing the top. if i lived here locally, i'd definitely make her my long term hair cutter person... stylist?
friendly,small 3 salon pros 11 am sat.  yeah it did the trick in a pinch.

would never visit this place...   called on the phone to get information (because i am new to the area) and was talked to very rudely by the guy that answered the phone.  if that it the kind of customer service they have, i definitely do not want them cutting my hair.

when this location opened up, it was awesome as we were happy with the great clips off lover's in dallas back when we lived in that area. the first visit was great, husband & son got their haircuts & came out satisfied.after their first visit, i decided to give 'em a try as i'm rather low maintenance. just needed a thinning out & 2 inches off. when it was my turn, i got a guy who probably did haircuts in the army. i quickly remembered that i wasn't asking for much so i'd go with the flow. when i left, my hair looked fine and i was just happy to get so much weight off my head (i have outrageously thick hair, hence the need for a thinning).i get home, shower and realize that one side is longer than the other side of my head. the next day i go back and explain the situation. they tried to fix it, but to absolutely even it out, i'd have to get a shorter 'do and i really didn't want it shorter than what i had already gotten. they gave me a coupon for a $3.99 haircut for when it grew out a bit more, they'd be able to fix it. yay for uneven hair for two months!i've always said, 'you get what you pay for', so i really didn't feel the need to complain and poo-poo this great clips location until i took my son. he's four. he's traumatized by haircuts ever since his 2nd haircut when he was 10 months old. the hairstylist was rough and it was just downhill from there for him & haircuts.my son got his umpteenth haircut at this location because the staff is actually nice. i trusted they would be kinder, and i'm sure they would have been if we didn't show up at 8:40pm one night.i knew that it was 20 minutes before closing, and like myself, they have things to take care of outside of work. i totally understand that. i was planning on giving a good tip just for the mere fact that we showed up around closing time. i remember being a waitress and people would come to the restaurant 10 minutes before we closed... it was a turn off, but worth the effort since they always left a great tip. i was paying it forward, in my mind.we come in and i could immediately tell the ladies were ready to call it a day. their attitudes couldn't have made that fact clearer. i figured if i kept a positive attitude, things would lighten up.the didn't. the lady that cut my son's hair was harsh. she was purely angry at the fact that we showed up at 8:40pm. i'm sorry, but you close at 9pm. not 8:40pm. she was twisting my son's head back and forth, not even using the clippers carefully, and he was on the verge of tears. i mean, this lady was in a hurry to get out of there.fortunately, my son only needed a trim, so the traumatic experience was over in 10 minutes, and all those 10 minutes were spent on me giving her the crazy eye. i would've grabbed my son, given her the finger and left... but i didn't want my son to have crazy hair. i just let her do her thing, all while comforting and telling him it would be okay. but i made a mental note to immediately write an angry email to great clips.we paid, and we didn't tip.my husband emailed great clips, and within the week we recieved an apologetic phone call and a gift card for 3 haircuts. needless to say, we used the gift card at the great clips off lavon(which, btw is waaaay better). we haven't stepped foot into this location since that fiasco.point of story? don't go in at 8:40pm, because apparently that's when they close.

obviously, i don't need a stylist or barber.  i've been shaving my head for five years.  however, i have a 13 year old kid with hair that grows like mint, so i'm still forced to visit random hair joints when he starts to look too mark twain-ish.great clips is 1) fast, 2) cheap, 3) filled with stylists that speak understandable english.my needs aren't vast and my expectations are low.

i moved to this area looking for a great clips i've used them in the past and was going to continue to use them, at the location it said no wait! on the door i waited 15 min, once i got in told the girl how i wanted my hair cut and was told no i can't cut it that way because i might cut my fingers (point cut). i the long run hair turned out ok but felt harassed for address and info and probably to drive a bit to go to a sport cuts.

i was visiting dallas and was out and about and decided on needed,a haircut. christy took good care of me. the place was clean, nothing or no one smelled bad as other reviews suggest. i am happy with my haircut and if i lived in dallas, i'd probably come back.

total rip off. she barely did anything. so uneven that using clippers at home would be better. meanwhile the competent stylist was doing fine at the chair across the room. avoid this location and go to the other one nearby. this attempt at saving time has created more work to fix it.

we normally go to the great clips in casa linda. went here because the wait was 60 mins there, but this one had no wait.now i know why. rude and impatient staff. had to go to another expensive salon to fix the damage. do not go to this location
i wish i could show you how horrible my hair looks. everyday i get sad when i look in the mirror
i have been getting haircuts from great clips for many years. i have to say this is by far the worst one. i would recommend whoever that's reading this to not come to this location.

why would i need to give you my phone number and email address for a haircut? maybe you're confused about how this works.... i have money.... you have haircuts... i give you money... you give me a haircut. that's all. we're not buddies. you don't need anything from me but my money. thanks anyway.

i would have gave them no star if that was an option. my husband got a haircut with covi last night & came home & it looks like a 4 year old gave a hair cut. she didn't cut the front enough & messed up the back so bad, i have no idea how she has a license to cut hair. i'm so disappointed & taking my complaint to cooperate. this is unacceptable!

normally use the location near my home (casa linda).  used this one since it was near my office.  at 57 years of age, i have had a lot of haircuts.  hands down- this was the worst cut i have ever had.  i have an appt to get it corrected, as much as can be done, this weekend- not at great clips.  clearly there is a total lack of quality control standards between locations so i am scratching great clips off my list as a whole.  one bad franchise location can give the whole brand a very bad reputation.  great clips needs to check on this particular store location.
this is what i get for trying to save a buck. worst haircut of my life. i am literally going home to shave my head now. i am so so so so mad!!!!!
devanny was amazing she took the time to see what i wanted, and gave a great cut. wait time was minimal, will come back.

i've been here several times and it's rare to remember the times i had a good experience getting a simple haircut. i always keep "trying"and hoping i would get someone good. all i need is a simple haircut and for whatever reason they can't deliver it.  i just can't come here anymore - it's very convenient since i live nearby but it's tough; i will try somewhere else.guys... avoid going late in the evening. the good stylists work at normal hours - the bad ones work more until they close (especially on weekdays). avoid them!!!
met a nice lady in the am shift today. i like my hurcut. haha i was laughing out the door, she's really nice. :)
terrible. uneven cut. a patch of long hair in the back. didn't even take a minute to wipe hairs off the back of my neck. woman even smells bad.

kid haters (or racist)  at this salon. i went in tonight and waited in line behind a hispanic dad with his three sons. the dad asked the stylist to even out his child's sideburns, which the stylist did. i saw the dad tip the stylist ten dollars then leave. i was then called over to the chair. i reluctantly sat down in a chair that was above piles of cut hair underneath. as soon as the clippers hit my head, the stylist opened her mouth to say how much she hated cutting the hair of the kid before me. she said the dad always calls her attention to the "stupid sideburns."  the other stylist defended the father and proceeded to clean her area waiting for the next patron.  someone entered and sat in the other stylist's chair. i overheard her ask the gentleman if he was new to the area and if he had kids. he said no and she said good because he did not want his kids in disd. i spoke up at that point and asked what that comment was about. she said that several of her customers are teachers and that they all say the kids are bad because the parents do not parent their children. she went on an on about how bad the parents must be. i suggest that all parents in the area take their kids for haircuts elsewhere since the stylist at this salon apparently dislike the parents correcting a bad haircut and the stylist must believe that the kids in disd are all bad since they spoke of such with conviction. oh and my haircut - terrible!

went in for a trim, and just a little bit of layers. what can i say? you get what you pay for. when i got home, i washed my hair and straightened it. yeah.... it was uneven. i had about five inches trimmed off, and there was a little part that was still not cut off. some parts were uneven so i had to cut it myself. i can always curl it or style it some other way to show less of the uneven. i hate getting my hair cut. it's a yearly thing or when i get a lot of split ends. i've paid more and had the same experience, which is why two stars and not one. i'm just glad that hair grows back.

going to great clips is like rolling the  dice. you never know what your going to get. i can tell you exactly what you can get at this location bad service! bad hair cut! unless you want extensions then you might be fine

this is the worst haircut experience i've ever had in the 27 years of my life. i got a haircut here yesterday and these people razor burned the entire back of my neck when straightening it up. the entire back of my neck has burned ever since and i could barely sleep with how painful it was and still is.i would not recommend this place to anyone.

i had an absolutely horrible experience here. if ever you have to get your hair cut here, please, please avoid the short black lady. i was screaming inside while she was doing my hair. it took her no more than 5 minutes(not an exaggeration) to do my hair. neither one of her short arms could reach the top half of my head, and she didn't even try to put effort into cutting my hair on both sides. to be honest, a chimpanze can probably do a better job with a couple minutes of training. this is seriously the worst hair cut experience i've ever had.

i once again had a great experience at this great clips in richardson. be sure to request lisa she is awesome!! very professional, timely, and sweet! lisa always remembers the style i prefer and i'm picky. the staff keeps the place clean and is always so courteous. do yourself a favor ask for lisa and enjoy a fantastic haircut experience!!

went in sunday with 5 people to get hair cuts, 3 where great 2 not so much.  the woman i had could not understand what i was telling her and i did not get what i wanted. my daughters hair was not done as i wanted, was told it would look like a boy hair cut, but since she had cut her hair by her self ( the 4 year old ) she needed the shorter cut to even it out so i paid for her to get a trim ( waste of my money).  the three boys where perfect.

absolutely awful!!! i have tried this place 3x. they must be hiring the stylists at the bottom of their class. i asked for a low fade and even pointed out where i wanted the line to be. she shaved the side of my head. i asked her to stop and got up and left

walked in yesterday after going to sweet & sassy at firewheel and getting declined for not having an appointment. had a great experience! thank you for my son's first fabulous hair cut! major looks so handsome! thank you pretty lady with those awesome green nails!!

we've taken our toddler there several times and always had a good experience, until our last visit.a lady named kiwi or kiri, not sure, cut his hair. she didn't have much patience like the other ladies have had and left our little boys hair so short and uneven that i have no choice but to wait until it grows to try and fix it. just terrible. at that my little guy does very well when getting a haircut he doesn't move a whole lot and cooperates more than the average toddler would. very disappointed. i usually don't write negative reviews but i can't help but regret going into this salon the day we did.

i informed the person i wanted a trim. bethany, decided to start cutting without clarifying. i felt like a big chunk was taken off and i asked how much  are you taking off? she replied two inches and i asked what, i said a trim. she said that is a standard trim.  far from a trim!!! every other trim i have had is defined by a half inch to and inch. and then she proceeds to tell me it makes your hair grow faster. lie. trimming your hair has nothing to do with the follicles at my scalp. trimming helps it make healthier as it grows. ridiculous. reminds me why i haven't got my hair trimmed by incompetent people at great clips in years but with the time crunch of getting to a wedding i could sneak by with a trim. apparently not!!  i would give zero stars if i could. bethany - next time ask what the definition of a trim is to your customer before you start cutting.

i went to trim my nack hair into straight line. the stylist, kiwi hiwi, said she need to see my neck so she open the cape??!! the hair was not even long enough to touch the cape yet!! so all the hair fell onto and inside my clothes!!!! i told her kindly that no one does that. she didn't listen. after she said she was done trimming, my hair was still not in a straight line!! i found untrimmed hair like 5 times and told her to trim it. this is the worst experience i have ever had! she felt no shame and charged me full price!
i like to have haircut at this place. it's a good place with affordable price.

there is about a 50% chance you will get a great clip here... ive been here 4 times and there has been completely different staff every time i come here. i was here last wednesday,  went in and was told they are only taking cash. i went and got cash, came back and there were 3 people that had just arrived.. one dirty homeless looking guy. the lady i just talked to ( tattoo titties hanging out giant giant hair) put me at the end of the line..i told her i had already been there and just went to get cash.. well she still put me at the end, now i have to wait even longer and go after the nasty guy! no thanksi don't know who manages this place.. but this day in age to not have your credit/debit fixed by 3pm  is just sloppy

i've come here a few times now, and they've become my go-to for a good haircut! i've never had a long wait (i always come after work on a weeknight), they keep track of how i like my hair done, and they always do a pretty good job.

i went here last thursday and it was almost completely empty only one customer and about three workers as soon as we walked in the lady (katherine) asked for our number and since my mom doesn't  know english she said "huh" and she yelled "your number" ok well that doesn't really matter i kinda just ignored her i went inside to get a haircut and i told the lady ( with purple hair african american )i want about 6 inches cut off and i showed her with my hands about how much i want to be cut off  then she took me to the back and she wet my hair after we came back from wetting my hair she asked me 4 inches right? and i said yes assuming  she knows what she's talking about so she started cutting my hair and i don't even think she tried to communicate with me once instead of her saying "you have a lot of hair child" but that's fine so she cut my hair and she cut my bangs the right way ( thank god ) and when she was done she gave me a mirror as soon as she gave me the mirror i had realized she had cut my hair at least about 10 inches instead of " 4 inches" according to her but you know what at the end of the day i liked my hair even though it was way shorter then i had thought and i don't recommend this place if you are extremely picky about your hair

i am so disappointed in the way this store treats customers. i took my son tonight for a back to school haircut, and took my two year old daughter with me. we stood by watching my son, taking picture to commemorate this occassion. my daughter stood close to me quietly singing or dancing while we waited. three fourths of the way through the stylist gets a call from her boss. apparently the boss drove by and saw my daughter. she told her employee to tell me to "keep my child seated in a chair and get her under control" i can not believe the audactity of this store manager to dictate to a parent, when they can not even see or interact in person to correctly assess the situation.i will never return, and i will be quite vocal on how poorly i was treated.

great service!!! fast and friendly staff and i love the clean environment!! all the lady there are nice and the price are awesome!!! it's so convenient for me. this location is right by my house!!!! all the stylists are so helpful when i needed to purchase products!!! i just love everything about this salon!!

in my quest for the perfect cheap barber in dallas, i've found good & cheap here, but still finding barbers who ask you what you want, and then cut your hair the way the want.the good:  quick service, good basic haircut, facility is clean, inexpensive. stylist was nice. the not so good: i asked that my hair be left the same length in the back, this was basically ignored. hair grows back so no big deal. if you want an inexpensive, good, quick, no frills cut, this is the place.
almost never busy and the haircuts are reasonably priced. i've never had a bad experience here.

this place can be great, it depends on who you get. i've had good experiences with everyone there except katherin. i think shes the oldest one there. i've been nice about it and let her cut my hair more times than i should hoping she knows what shes doing but i've come to realized either she just doesn't know how to cut hair or shes super sloppy/lazy at it. she really screwed it up this time. if the place wasn't so close and i didn't have a $50 haircut card (which only works at the one you bought it at), than i'd go somewhere else. katherin is also not great at taking criticism or following any kind of directions, she seems like a nice person, but she just doesn't know how to cut hair or wants to be done so she cuts corners (pun intended). when i came home and rinsed and dried my hair i noticed it was uneven with parts of it sticking out all over, i probably would've noticed earlier but she likes to rush you out the door so she can get back to sitting.from now on i'll be sure not to let her cut my hair.  if it wasn't for her i'd give this place at least 4 stars.
terrible,terrible,terrible!  will never go back.  cut my hair and didnt even blow dry the hair off of me.  just removed smock and said you are good.
i would not recommend this place to anybody . these people don't have any idea how to cut hair , they did a really bad job to my kids . i ll never come back again. no more that one star is worth!!
great haircuts and great service!! everyone is very knowledgeable on products and haircuts!!

i seriously don't think anyone here truly knows how to cut hair, my boyfriend and i went in today to get our hair cut. i asked for my split ends to be cut high so they don't grow back, i asked for 3 inches off. i got maybe a half inch trim and still have split ends when i left. they didn't do my boyfriends hair at all like he asked, they practically made him bald around his ears and didn't blend the hair on his neck at all, it looks like half bald to long hair. unless you just want a shitty little haircut that you have to pay 15 dollars for, i'd say go somewhere else.

great consistent experience with chad. i had my hair cut here by other stylists too and no problems at all.just wish there was an online schedule, so that once you get to know a stylist you can just schedule online or on the app instead of having to call in.

i had a fantastic experience at this great clips! let me start by saying, i have been going to a stylist in uptown for 3 years who i still really like, but i can't bring myself to pay $80 (with tip) for a hair cut! i also live in northwest dallas now, so needed something closer.i was desperate for a cut and found this location via yelp with good reviews so decided to check it out. i was very nervous and anxious but i had to try! i went on a sunday afternoon and got right in, my stylist was phal (if i remember correctly). she listened attentively to what i wanted and it turned out great! i have naturally curly hair, but soft curls, not super tight curls. if it is cut bad, it's hard to cover up. i have a bob style and just needed a trim and she nailed it. $24 included my wash and cut with tip! hard to beat and i will definitely be going back. i feel like great clips can get a bad wrap from time to time, but if you have been on the fence about a cheap haircut, give this place a try!

doesn't deserve a star at all. won't ever come back to this location. i checked in online since the normal location i go to was busy. i went in, they said "welcome to go great clips". so since everyone was busy and no one came to the counter, i sat down and waited (my name already on the list). a gentleman walks in, gets taken back immediately. then a lady comes back to the counter and asks if i'm getting a cut and i told her yes i checked in online. she responded, quite rudely, that next time i need to let someone know and not just sit here. to which i stated that when i came in, no one came to the counter so i sat down to wait. she then takes me back. i'm only getting a trim. she makes me stand during my haircut (b/c she states my hair is over the chair) which i have never had to do for any reason!! then she doesn't even let my hair properly. she just pulls it all to be back and cuts it straight across and says ok you're done! i've had plenty of haircuts and nothing like that! i had to tell her to trim the front part of my hair too. to which her response was, oh you want me to cut that too? uh, yes dear, last time i checked it was part of my hair and i came in for a hair trim. i will be going back to my regular location for them to fix the mess this woman made. how can anyone make a trim look horrible??

i wish there was a zero star. 1. for the price- hair styling and blow dry is extra $25 versus fantastic sams and super cuts charge only additional 5-10 dollars max. 2. hair cut was worse. shape of hair is uneven both sides, inspire of me pointing out to the guy who did his haircut. another member had a similar experience. the guy who cut his hair has sweaty smelly hands... overall a nasty place with zero stars...avoid this place if possible..

went in early on a friday and got my haircut by a complete stranger! julius took my ratchet outgrown pixie cut (i've been calling it my mullet if that helps you get the picture) and turned it into an adorable bob! i didn't show him any pictures, i just said make it look better and he did! amazing haircut in less than 30 mins for half of what i would normally pay!
jazmine is amazing the only one in dallas that has been able to "cut into" the front of my hair symetrically.make sure to schedule an appointment she only works 2 days a week.

jeanne the manager is a doll!  she has turned around this location and it shows.  with the great attitude of the staff and the quality of the cuts - you have to do a double take..."i'm at great clips??"  what!?  they remember your name and treat you like a vip.  this is where i'll be going from now on.  kudos to jeanne and her team.

maybe it was just this location but the haircut was below average and the lady who cut my hair had zero interest in being friendly. i asked her the standard haircut questions, how is your day, how long have you been cutting hair, are you from the area. answers: fine, 30 years, yes. i felt i was an inconvenience to her day. i will never go back here.

i am loving my haircut from great clips!! almost everytime i have tried to get layers in my hair the stylist has never cut it right.  this time however they got it so right!!i had my hair cut by jeanne and she did an amazing job!  i will definetly be back in the future!!! thank you jeanne!!

quick , efficient service. i went with jeanne. she is very polite , friendly , great customer service. she said hi to everyone who walked in. gave me a nice haircut, did not push me to buy products. would definitely come again. $20 with tip , who can beat that?
i got my cut from diane. she is really good and understands what you want. i would definitely be coming back.
