this place sucks like anything. had a lousy and crappy haircut . never get a haircut here at least from the person who did my haircut, shanette( deserves the name here due to the rudeness)when i called back, she was rude and hung up. never going back  and lost a recurring business for at least 2 yrs

this place is the worst!! i will never go back to this place again. stay away!! gloria and shannette were the corner stone of this place. shannette is a very talented hair stylist. she used to cut my hair, my daughter's and my son's. she is amazing!! she is also very nice, funny and talented. i was so disappointed to hear she was gone.gloria also is very talented she used to cut my wifes hair. i went in the other day, only to find out that they are both gone!! unbelievable..rumor was they were mistreated and managers used to curse at them in front of customers. my son needed a haircut so i walked in to see if someone would cut his hair, and to my surprise all you can hear is gossip and cursing from the two african american ladies talking about their employees. that is so unprofessional!!!  calling them b*tches and talking about  them in front of other customers really!! i was so embarrassed my 9 year old boy looked at me and we just walked out.  while walking to our car a lady said did they just ruin your hair too. i laughed and said 'no way" did not give them a chance. this place has changed so much..i felt like when i left i was walking straight outta compton..so sad..

we might have a beauty school drop out on our hands. gloria and lauren are great. but blank (feel bad putting her name) needs additional training in basic hair-cutting techniques. okay. i usually get my hair cut from lauren, who is an amazing hair stylist. but she wasn't working today, so i rolled the dice. i ended up with blank who seemed nice enough. i told her to buzz the sides, trim the top, and blend it all together. that's usually more than enough information. the problem was that she had no idea how to blend. i tried to guide her through the process, but i'm a guy and there's only so much guidance i can give. at one point she got snarky and said in an impatient tone, "i just did what you asked me to do."  well, what i ended up with was sides that were nicked up and looked like absolute garbage and were not blended into the top at all. i cut my loses and paid the bill, feeling uncomfortable because i knew my hair looked terrible and that blank did not have the skill to cut it adequately. i walked out and asked my girlfriend (who was waiting in the car) if she thought it looked as bad as i thought. and she gasped and said it looked terrible. so, i went back in and luckily the attractive blonde haired woman named gloria took over and actually trained the other girl as to how to blend the buzzed portion with the scissored portion. within moments, my hair was fixed. so the two i can vouch for are lauren and gloria. blank is sub-par and needs additional training. the other stylists are probably good. i would give more stars because my hair looks fine now, but it's saturday and i didn't need all the nonsense. back to beauty school.

i went in for a haircut and i was greeted by gloria who was with another client and that she'll be right with me. so a few minutes later she comes to me checks me in and i'm in the chair. this was the first time i was at a legit salon. so i showed her 3 pictures and off she went walking me through the whole time she knew i was weary since i always got a buzz cut. i got a tight fade and she cleaned up the top a bit and spiked it and am i freaking happy! she's awesome...highly recommend her. oh plus i was running late and i got out of there with waiting to get in the chair in about 10-15 mins. i am very pleased. she gained my trust and i will be a repeat customer. only problem is...i lost my $10 coupon for my next cut hopefully they honor it. anyway i recommend gloria.

so i decided to get my hair cut here since my normal lady was unavailable at my usual spot. i tend to get the same cut, short with layers,  but i'm also picky as to how it should be. i must say that i'm not disappointed with my cut. the girl that did mine (i forgot her name but she had red hair and tattoos) was nice. she took her time and did exactly what i wanted. it was also nice that i didn't have to wait very long.
i like it better than the supercuts up the road because it is less pretentious.  but wash your hair before you come, because there is no hair washing sink here.

gloria is the best hair stylist i have had work on my hair. my hair is super fine and thin and she manages to make it so even i can style it without much effort. when she does the style it looks fantastic for a couple of days. she's the only reason i go to great clips, if she isn't working, i'll go another day.

i'm not going to lie. the only reason i came here was because they sent me a coupon for $5 hair cut coupon.  i mean $5 for a haircut?! even if i end up looking like larry, moe or curly, i'm down only $5. i went on a sunday, and it was unexpectedly crowded. i guess because more hair salons are closed on the holiest day of the week. the wait wasn't too bad, maybe half an hour. my hair is short and simple so i just got a 1' fade. it was a really good cut. i was pleasantly surprised that it was. they seem to do hair for all types of clientele so they seem skilled. i noticed that they did try to sell their hair products, especially to women. regular cuts for men and women are $14. i would go back... sooner if they gave me a another $5 coupon.

this place is just okay. i prefer supercuts down the street. i think it's the decor and colors that make me feel that great clips is for older folks. i came here when it first opened when prices where low and i only return here when i get coupons in the mail. the haircuts seem standard but with less finesse and skill than at supercuts. eh, i would come here in a pinch but i don't prefer it.

this is a great hairstylist! they take care of everyone that comes there and listen to what you want. i even gave them a picture and they were able to duplicate it. they are friendly knowledgeable and helpful. i'd recommend them to everyone.

i am a female and started going here about 6 months ago.  i get my hair cut every 4 weeks. it's very short and i like it cut a certain way.  i was fortunate that the first girl i had did a great job.  came back a second time and she was gone.  i then had a second girl cut my hair, she was patient and eventually got it the way i like it.  after using her for 3 cuts, she's now gone.  not knowing she was gone, i went there again, expecting to have her and was told she was not in and not sure when she's coming back.  i now had a 3rd girl cut my hair.  she was nervous and unsure, but fortunately she also did a good job.  today, i went in expecting to see my second stylist and there was not a familiar face. i used a women that was very confident and assured about cutting short hair.  she used her fingers, a comb and a buzzer and i still walked out unhappy.  i was informed that there is a constant turnover and the haircuts are timed, so she could only devote a certain amount of time to me.  she bragged that there was no wait today because she was there and she bangs them out (the haircuts).not sure i will return there because i cannot keep explaining to different people all the time how i like my hair.  now i know why they keep notes in the computer, to keep the next person informed.  this particular women refused to even check the notes in the computer.  i hope someone in a higher capacity checks these reviews and can correct the problems.

i've been bringing my kids here since they were babies bc well, it's cheap and it's a kid cut. but dear lord, after the hack job one of their "new" stylists did on both my kids, never again! the turnover rate in this place is unbelievable, but come on now, if you can't cut hair straight, please, just turn in your scissors. like, my kids are getting the simplest of hair cuts. the last time, some new yapper who claimed she used to own a salon, (and now you are working at great clips?), cut both of my kids hair at lightening speed claiming since she's been doing this for so long, she can cut this fast. i was horrified after i did my kids hair the next day, her hair was cut on a complete angle with the left side being about 3 inches longer. even my kid noticed, so it must have been bad. will never return to this or any other chain type hair "salon" again.

i've been going there for some time now. being able to check in on line is a great help to me as i am usually very busy. they keep a record of your last haircut style. i try to get the same stylists every time, like patty or renee, but you can't make appointments , you have to wait for them. there are also some two star stylists in my experience. you have to find who you like. otherwise, they are quick, clean and efficient.

i had a specific request. i gave a picture and everything. now my hair is at least 3 inches shorter than what i wanted. they basically gave me a pixie cut. it's the worst haircut i've ever gotten. i have no idea how i'm going to fix it. the sides are uneven. it's just a huge mess. so now i have short hair and i have no idea what to do with it. i will never come back. going there was a huge mistake.

i've been using this salon since it opened a few years back. i've always been pretty happy with the cut and service. the only problem is hair stylists leaving, without a word, after you've used them for a couple of years. today i decided to once again pick a new stylist.  i walk in, two girls are both working. i take off my coat, sit and wait. neither girl acknowledges me. usually they greet you and check you in. nothing. okay, so i wait. the first girl who finishes says she needs to use the bathroom so i say i'll wait. that was a lie as she got a cigarette and proceeded to chat with the other stylist.  now i have to wait for the second girl who's giving a woman a trim off the bottom of her long hair. that's it.  but she's talking so much that it's taking longer than it need be. i stand and say, i think i need to come back later. oh honey you need to be somewhere. yes, i'll come back another time. then she proceeds to talk about me to the woman whose hair she's cutting as if i couldn't hear her. hello, i'm standing right here. i hope the doctor who owns this salon reads this and speaks to her employees.  i'll be looking for another salon. way too much competition.
was there 2-3 times hoping they'll do nice men's haircut, but all they can do is to cut your hair as you're a child going to school. terrible experience, will never go there again

i have always dreaded having to get a haircut. i have a very hectic schedule. i never got into the notion of going to a specific place for a specific barber/stylist, and having to be available for them when they are available. this has lead me to jump to various places trying to find a place i'm happy with, and haven't found it until now. i always ran into problems having to tell someone new what i like and don't, even if i went to the establishment before. other places spend more time trying to push the products they sell rather than cut your hair. then there are places that turn a basic cut, into giving you a cup of coffee, try to sell you  a shave and whatever else. all nice and all, but i just want to get in and out. which bring me to great clips - been there now a few times. hours are convenient, the online check in, and seeing how long the wait is awesome. the staff is always friendly, and best of all, they take notes! i walked in for a recent cut, they welcomed me and they started reading notes of how i liked my hair cut done from my previous visit.....wasn't even aware they took the time to write notes from my last visit. this takes one of the biggest pains for me out of getting a haircut. i can go to great clips at any time, and be helped by anyone on their staff..... and they have notes how i like a cut. they have products for sale, but never pushy about it. everything fits the bill, for someone that always dreaded getting haircuts. ....not to mention the bill itself isn't all that much, especially with coupons they send out. ( which like the another reviewer noted, i enjoy ... not so much to save money.... but it allows me to tip more to the staff)

very friendly staff!, i love making an online reservation and not needing to sit for long when i go. i have gone to several of the people there and they all gave great clips!  i am a big fan of the coupon i get in the paper or in valpak for a $8.99 haircut which allows me to tip the haircutter very well!  nobody anywhere beats that and my hair grows very fast so i save $$$.
the staff is very friendly and do a fine job. i would like to see them offer free wifi. while waiting i noticed their wifi was locked. providing free wifi would be fantastic.

zero -i received a coupon in the mail and had to use by a date- it was $8.99 and jackie was to cut my hair last night. i always like to find a picture of what i want to show so the haircutter- has a good idea what i want- i went there - and no one was getting any haircut last night- and they did not have a large selection of haircut books- but i found one- a shorter style than what i had- so i dont think jackie even wet the hair- i showed her- she made no comment or advice like if it would look good- etc- i said it was shorter ok- summer is coming- she started to cut- the back- and it felt little short- then the sides were longer with angle- she was finished in like 10 minutes- no gel put in nothing really- she had  a poor attitude- and maybe it was due to my coupon - she just sort of lopped off my hair- i thought it was okay. after looking at it- more- the front pieces - one is longer than the other and fatter- it is noticeble- and where she lopped on one side - its not even blended- ive gone to beauty schools and got better blended cuts = upon close look it does not look finished and professional- i called joy the manager who said she will redo it- and blend on april 9 but i cant wait until then so i will go on saturday- co workers say it looks god but they did not see it up close- it looks good and fresh because i lopped off alot of hair - but the haircut is not good- unblended-by  disgruntled hairdresser- i hope they can fix this- they need an attitude change-mistakes dont deserve tips either-

the staff here is great awesome people to deal with and really felt like i was getting a haircut at home that is how friendly the girls are here i would definitely recommend this s poo t to anyone who wants a great cut and great conversation

came here today my son got a quick haircut no real line there was 2 ladies workinggave my son a faux hawk 12.00 simple and quickthey sold good products and gave my son a lollipop young heavyset latino girl did the cut

this 5 star rating is based purely from the point of view of roi . the ladies reading this review , if you , like me , find spending upwards of $20 on a haircut an indulgence , and upwards of $30 an exorbitant amount to pull out from your wallet for this particular activity, chances are , that like me , you don't have too many options . well - good news , after much thought and research , i finally found this place which will give you a decent haircut without charging you an arm and a leg . so , are there places that can give you a crazy , totally ott hair cut that make you feel like beyonce for the day ? of course . but then you gotta pay like queen bee or if you are in the mood of saving some money and still getting a pretty good service , go right ahead and give this a go !

i would highly recommend this hair cutting place! i had called around town for prices and all of them were disappointing. i called asking if they do donation hair cuts(sending your cut hair to company's that make wigs for children with cancer) most places wanted to charge me a nauseating price for me doing a good deed. i called great clips and the women was very respectful and professional and was willing to help me. i walked right in didn't have to wait as i have in previous places. she was very comforting and made the hair cutting experience very calming. i was nervous to cut a large amount off. i will definitely be going back and telling my friends about the amazing experience i had.
there are slight nuances of my haircut depending on the stylist. i get a simple fade and trim. overall, everyone is welcoming. rarely is there a long line, which is a huge selling point for me.

i needed a quick trim the last time i went. one of the lady's who did my hair was awesome.  i wish i remember her name. everyone is professional an they no their scissors. i will definitely come back if i am in a squeeze for time. the prices are not expensive so i feel take advantage of it.
this place is a nightmare. i went in for a simple trim, and ended up with botched layers. have to go to a real salon today to have it fixed. you get what you pay for.

you will find a 2 year old who cuts better hair than the staff at this hair salon.  terrible isn't even a strong enough word to describe the haircuts they give.  i can not tell you how much you will regret ever going to this place.  i once went in there and told them to cut the sides and back of my hair short and keep the top medium.  you know what they did?  took a electric razor and just shave my head.  no scissors on top, just a 2 minute buzz cut and charged me.  maybe i was the only one who had a bad experience, right?  not at all.  my sister went in their to get layers, all they did was trim it in a straight line.  my brother and uncle went in their to get haircuts similar to mine or just a trim, they too went through the 2 minute slaughter that they call a haircut.  the haircut is around $10, but please, spend just 5 more on a hair salon that actually knows what they are doing.  even if you are a person who just likes a buzz cut or a shaved head, the cuts you get from their speedy process is not worth it.  it's as if they are in a competition of who can give the worst possible haircuts, how this place hasn't shut down yet is just mind puzzling.  take my advice, do not go here

this place has really good service, wait time is very short and staff is very friendly, the one girl i go there for sindy does my hair really well i prefer her each visit. the pricing is very affordable and its very convenient to check in online before you get there unlike most haircut/hairstyle salons.

great place to get your haircut! the place is clean and customer service is outstanding! this is my first time here and definitely not the last time when i'm in northern nj. my stylist name was "anita". she was very courteous and professional. anita's skill is shown through my result. she asked me what style i would like and also made recommendations. it was a pleasure to visit this place for the first time! i do recommend it to all... also "great clips" offered a free haircut on this nov. 2016 veterans day to all veterans past and present! i salute you "great clips"!

if you want a $15 haircut, you're gonna get a $15 haircut. it's hit or miss with this place. sometimes they get it right and sometimes they screw it up. i'm done with the russian roulette. perhaps it's my fault for not having a dedicated stylist i go to. i just wait for whoever is available. i'll be taking my business elsewhere.online check in is pretty cool

i have gone here quite a few times and it's not very good. the only reason why i even kept going was strictly out of convenience. my boys are young so they arent too picky. the prices are cheap but you get what you pay for! every time i went here they messed up my sons hairline. i've tried every single employee they've had in the past few years and not one was able to do the shape up even and straight. seriously now... is it too hard to ask for a straight line? i told them every time to make their side burns pointy but they always cut them off. how irritating! i have found a barber for my boys that does an amazing job now. its $14 per child but well worth it! i've also had my hair cut here and they did aan okay job. nothing to rave about. it was $12 so that made me happy lol. this place does a much better job on females than males. not one of these ladies was able to shape up a hairline!! not one. i will not be returning here.

a very nice hair salon where you can get a good haircut at a very good price. the staff is very friendly and accommodating. they recognize and greet regular customers. there are discounts available, including an $11 haircut for seniors.

good, solid place to get a haircut. very friendly management and staff that does a good job for each and every client. haircuts are affordable as is, but be on the lookout for frequent coupons on the back of shop rite receipts for added value.

the few times ive been there, (same haircutter) been totally disappointed, she really had no clue how to give a good haircut, or what she is even doing. trims one sideburn only, leaves patches of hair uncut, seems to be in a rush. what is up with that? and why would a place keep a loser like that employed there?  if you care about what your hair looks like after its cut, find another place!
destroyed my hair .. i asked for a simply low fade and trim on top and i got an uneven fohawlk .. if you do go, don't let jennifer cut your hair

i was out getting my nails done when i heard of a great deal on hair cuts. i was told about a 7.99 hair cut so i had to go and find out. i went into this location and had a shampoo and cut. nielsa assisted me and was very friendly. i went in for a basic trim but nielsa talked me into some long layers and i am very happy with the result. i am pretty sure that i will be back every month for a trim. the wait was near zero. the store is clean and fresh looking.
fran cut my hair and she did a very good job. you can tell she loves hair by her knowledge of all things hair. highly recommend her to anyone and would definitely get a hair cut with her again.

staff was always complaining. they don't take any time to do a decent job. they pay attention to you if you are a regular. if not, good luck with getting a decent haircut. please note: the asian chick in her late 40's is a airhead & the worst of the bunch. ...good luck!!

i usually come here all the time but this time another worker worked here and her name is jeannine. not only did she have attitude but she was laughing at me because i asked a question. totally unnecessary and that was not needed at all. i will not be getting a haircut when she's around

i've been going to barber shops for over 15 years but today i found myself in a desperate situation so i figured i'd give this place a shot based on other yelp reviews.  i'll admit i was nervous about getting my haircut here but carol was really nice, very friendly and gave me a great haircut...better than what i had been getting to be completely honest.  she'll be getting my business again.

i've been to this place 3 times expecting to get a decent haircut....always end up walking out dissatisfied. the stylists there are only good to you if they know you very very well. anything other than that, you'll walk out with a patchy haircut........last time i was there, i can hear the lady getting annoyed every time she sees a customer walk in. i say she should call it a day and leave if she cant take anymore customers. it was on a sunday at 1pm. the result was she decided  to rush through my haircut and i ended up with a bad haircut. that is when i decided that i'll try my luck somewhere else....take my advice and take you business somewhere else.
it's shark week. my kid loves sharks and josefina gave him a great sharkhawk. he loves it and so does my wife!

i have taken my son here for hair cuts since he was 11 months old. every single time he has gotten his hair cut, he has cried. he is a toddler. he doesn't like his head held and he doesn't like sitting still. but, guess what? we've always survived. i took him in today for a quick cut. after waiting 40 minutes, i told the lady cutting his hair that he would sit on my lap ( like normal) and that he normally does cry but that's why i brought a pacifier, cartoons, and snacks. then, she changed her attitude.she told me she will immediately stop cutting his hair if he cries or if another customer says something about said crying. um what? i am also a paying customer, so why shouldn't i get service as well? do we kick babies off of planes because they cry? nope, we deal. do we kick toddlers out of restaurants because they make messes? nope, we deal.if you don't want to cut a toddler's hair because they will cry, then don't say you're a family establishment and have prices just for toddlers. i immediately left and the lady gave me dirty looks without offering a solution. i'm not going to risk getting half of a hair cut just in case my kid starts crying and annoys the two other customers that were in there. hey stylist: you work at great clips; if you want to discriminate, then maybe work somewhere better.there's a reason this place has low starts--crappy service and crappy stylists.
great service jelen was very patient with my daughter and took her time to give her a great haircut!

i'm giving this 3 stars but should be 2.5 at most. this place gets the job done when you need a quick little touch up and clean up. nothing fancy. they are barely ok hairdressers. they get you in and out asap and looking decent and presentable when you need it in a pinch. this is why i go there often. and because it's very close to home. you get your haircut there at your own risk. either way, they are fairly nice ppl that work there.

we had a great experience at great clips! our 8-year-old chopped off her hair past shoulder length into a pixie cut. they do excellent quality work for low prices- she got her hair cut with a super deluxe treatment (spray, gel, etc.) for only $12 for a child! the lady who cut her hair seemed to truly care that she did a good job and smiled each time our 8-year-old did. the job was quick and lasted less than  the expected time they told us of 40 minutes,  so that was a pleasant surprise. not only are the hair cuts cheap, but the great clips "menu" listed several other services, including shampoo, etc. all for roughly $15 or more, depending on the service. great clips has the quality of any hair salon or barbershop with prices that can't be beat, and we certainly enjoyed our experience at this branch- we tipped $10, almost doubling the cost of the cut!

i go every two weeks and i get great service.  it's best if you have an idea about your preferred length and ask to cut a little bit if you're unsure.  as my old barber used to say: i can take it off but i can't put it back on.  i check in online and usually don't wait.

for some reason, the people here do not listen to what i want. they act like they are trying to rush you through and as if they do not want to cut my hair. 7min to cut my hair and got the exact opposite of what i asked for. had the same experience now 4 of 5 times i have gone here.

i've had some pretty bad experiences at this location but nothing tops last night. i was in a pinch and had to get a haircut for the new job i'm beginning. i specified low fade knowing my hair sticks up and doesn't look professional if it is to high. the lady, i think josefina bruno, proceeds to start off low and then buzzes the entire side part out of my hair. if i had wanted the hipster style without a side part,  i would have asked for it! i'm trying to look professional and she completely ruined that chance for me. i have never grabbed the sheers out of the barbers hand regardless of how bad the cut was,  but this lady kept on creeping up on the sides and her fade was completely disheveled looking, so i grabbed her sheers to stop her from cutting anymore. the manager came and took over my cut to fix it,  and even admitted that whatever she did was the best she could do to not make my hair look weird. she even suggested that i not do my hair as i've been doing because it won't look good for now. but after all of this,  i had to still pay for this horrible haircut and will be able to get a free haircut only next time if that manager is there? are you freaking kidding me? what the hell makes you believe i want to ever step foot in this location or any great clips ever again? as i said,  i'm not someone to ever complain and for me to write this is a big deal. i'm still seething from how horrendous the experience was, and this is about 12 hours later. something needs to be done! people should stop going here not let these awful people ruin anyone else's hair!

i've had one good experience and one bad. it depends on who cuts your hair. the last time i went, the "stylist" cut my shoulder length hair in just 3 minutes. since it was damp i couldn't quite tell if she got it right. she said it would cost me extra to dry it. two months ago, another stylist spent a good 15 minutes cutting my hair and lightly styled it with a blow dryer so that i could actually see the cut - and all for the same price. she made an effort. clearly the other stylist did not care about customer satisfaction which is the biggest issue with this place. in fact she was annoyed to know that another stylist had lightly blow dried my hair at no extra cost.

so, i get sucked in by the $2.99 grand opening special and planned to get a trim since i couldn't make it to my regular stylist.  parking is ample but poorly designed for this new complex ... an accident waiting to happen.  just drive slowly and avoid the over-eager parkers and watch the turns (narrow lanes and bad visibility).great clips is an a la carte shop.  cuts are normally $14, shampoos another $4.  not sure if the styling is extra (i.e, blow dry) but regular styling was listed at $20.  i arrived at the salon and there was only one woman and her son in the waiting area.  great!  i should be second on the list.  nope, there were five other names in front of me.  no big deal ... so i'll wait.  the receptionist called the next person on the list via phone and waited 15 minutes for her party of four to get in.  irked that there isn't a first come, first served policy, i still waited patiently for my $3 trim.  while i waited, i saw several women and children get their hair cut.  after seeing their results, i got a little scared and debated whether i was about to make a big mistake.  layers and lengths looked uneven and i saw the woman who was in front of me point out several points of concern on her new hair cut to the stylist.  then she had the stylist fix her son's hair (he had gotten it cut the day before).  taking that as my cue, i headed for the door.  a bargain is a bargain but a bad hair cut is 3 months.i think this place is great for kids and people who may want non complicated hair styles.  but i'm not sure if i will take a chance on this place.
beware stay away ! they chopped my hair !! the woman did not know how to use scissors. i did not pay them and screamed for what they had done to my beautiful hair. 0 stars
not that bad. it depends on the person that does cutting.  i had some good experiences and i had a couple of really bad once. i would give them another try.

worst haircut ever. its so uneven i have to now go get it fixed somewhere else. whatever you do, don't let sun cut your hair. i said i just wanted a trim and she totally butchered me. do yourself a favor and spend the extra $ and go somewhere else!

ok i have to say that i went there with extremely low expectations due to all the negative reviews.  however i really needed a trim and i had spare time after my wax at european wax right next door.  on a saturday morning at 9:15am there was no wait.  i was greeted quickly by the next available stylist, katelynn.  she asked me what i needed done then we proceeded to get a wash.  the wash was just okay, but that could just be me since i am used to the ones in chinatown where they really scrub with their nails and give me a massage afterwards.  anyways, i digress... once i got into the chair, the stylist was nice enough to advise that everything is a la carte so i don't get surprised by the bill in the end.  i appreciated that as some salons hit you with a big tab afterwards with no warning.  katelynn was very careful and made sure to ask me how much to take off since i am growing out my hair and hate short bangs.  the blowout was nice too but i think it was a bit pricey since i have gotten better ones in the city for much cheaper (like $15 cheap!!). ultimately i am happy with my last minute decision to walk in despite the reviews.  it's just a matter a luck with great clips depending on who you get paired with.  final bill $55 ($20 for wash and cut plus $35 for blowout).

despite the reviews i decided to stop by on a monday evening for a quick trim for me and my 6 year old girl, and gotta say it was quick and pleasant , place was clean amanda was super nice and patient with my daughter , they used biolage products to wash our hair, i didnt style it so i'm not sure how it is as far as blow drying but for a basic wash and cut i was pleasantly surprised!

well, gotta say, after not getting the best haircut in the world on my first visit, i went back, and katrina, the manager, assured me that it would be corrected. she cut it exactly the way i liked it and really knew what she was doing. she took care of me, even staying later than normal, as i came in late. she makes a great manager and i'm sure this great clips will be successful. the other girl that was working that night that cut my son's hair did a great job as well.kudos to them for reversing my initial decision! and thanks so much to karen as well! ;-)

stay away!!!! i took my 2,5 yr old son and crystal chopped his hair so bad that i had to take him somewhere else to get it fixed. crystal, the stylist was so miserable from the start and has a major attitude problem. she is so unfriendly and has no idea how to cut a boy's hair. she cut my son's hair crooked and gave me a huge attitude when i kindly asked her to fix it. she then cut it even worse. i will never go there again!!!!!!!

nobody speaks english therefore i couldn't get across what i wanted. literally just had my sides done then went somewhere else for top because she used a 1 clip instead of a 3. i should have checked out yelp!

pretty bad ....messed up my son's hair and had to fix it at home.  i did call and ask if they cut hair for 18 month olds....they said yes.  the woman that cut my son's hair kept on saying he's moving too much and she's afraid to cut...well, if they had experience then they would know.  you get what you pay for....going back to pumpkin and bean...expensive but they know how to handle yound kids.

awful service. nobody even acknowledged me as i stood at the desk waiting to be checked in. so i stood there awkwardly for 2-3 mins before someone told me to have a seat. i was only there for a trim, but i was surprised the woman cut my hair without wetting it at all. if you're looking for an inexpensive haircut, try supercuts in hoboken.

quality hair cut from friendly stylist.  not a high end salon and not priced like one.  in cut and out.  much better than the city ave location which is more culturally diverse.   need a quick cut, this is the place in drexel hill.

this is one branch of a big chain. the good news is-* clean and neat* competitive pricing* decent hours* in and out relatively quickly with no appointmentthe bad news is it can be difficult to get the same person each time.  if that's important to you another alternative may be your best choice.

3 strikes and they're out.  there are plenty of other local places that are inexpensive that will give you a good cut.  i've tried them as well as others i know, and it's not worth having them ruin your hair then you have  to grow your hair out just to have another stylist fix your cut.  skip, skip skip!

i bring my son here for his haircuts and the stylists consistently do a great job. they maintain a computerized record of the clippers that were previously used, so there is no guesswork in trying to figure out what made the last haircut so great. the salon is tastefully decorated and i've never had to wait more than about 20 minutes - usually there is no wait at all early on a saturday morning or weekday evenings. you can also use the computer check in service to reduce your wait, but i haven't found the need. they have lolipops for the kids after a job well done. high
i've been here quite  a few times and never had a bad experience.  everyone here is so pleasant and the store is clean as can be.   $13 haircut - yes please!  keep up the good work!

what a rude, snotty staff....even laughing and saying they don't want to work on you to their other co-worker like you're not standing right there in front of them when we're donating for locks of love. it's not like anyone was even in the shop when we came in. wow...thanks katie. i don't know why we just didn't leave if it weren't to donate the hair. a tip shouldn't have even been given to the other co-worker who seemed to tolerate us until she was given the more than deserved tip for her attitude. what a disappointing visit to philly, especially when we were out to do a good deed.
decent and cheap haircuts in the newtown square, you pay 12-14$ as a child or man, women pay more. my goto place around work

disgusting-don't ever go here. dirty is an understatement. stylists will upcharge you and sneak it on your receipt- that's what they did to me. nickel and dime, bait and switch to a loyal customer. after confronting their tactics they told me, "we don't care if you ever come back, your dad, too. you can go to hair cuttery and look like an idiot when they screw up your hair." this particular franchise does not care about their customers whatsoever. they'll likely be out of business very soon treating people in this manner. some small businesses truly deserve our money...this one does not. shameful. infinite negative stars.one year after i wrote this review and i contacted great clips corporate and received not even a return call, the owner "joe g." comments on all of the bad reviews with a copy/paste apology. it's laughable and demonstrates exactly the issue with great clips. i wouldn't return even if it was free haircuts for life. are you even real "joe g"? and if you are the owner, a blanket copy/paste apology to negative reviews is a pitiful attempt at saving face on social media that will not counter the scarred reputation of this store or bring back past loyal customers. a year later...smh.
i showed her a picture, i asked her to not take anything off the length. she totally ignored me and cut it so short i could cry. i'll never go back again!!!!

i took my mom for her hair cut.  she is 86 most certainly a senior.  they have a senior cut for $12.00.  it cost her $35.00 because she wanted her hair dry before she left.  she did not get her hair washed either.  but we were told the $12 was a cut only.  who goes out of a hair salon with wet hair. really $24 to have your hair washed and dried is ridiculous and nobody would go into the cold with wet hair.  a ridiculous ploy to pull seniors or anybody for that matter.  not to mention they did not seem professional. never will we return.
consistent haircut every time with fast service.
this shop is terrific!  larissa and irene are very good.  haircut is efficient, personal, and always what i want.  the haircut is so good that it is literally wash and go at home - very good styling.
the staff was pretty unfriendly, which is always weird because you expect the person cutting your hair to converse at least a little. the haircut was quick and to the point, just not friendly.

so normally i like this place for a quick cut for my oldest. i showed them a picture of what he wanted. something like that.  she says " yeah i can do that but the edging up there? that's not going to happen. i can do the rest but that i cannot". ok i understand you don't know how to do that because it's a "barber" thing. but to say "that's not going to happen". learn how to talk to customers. that's not the way it's done. you say that you cannot do that it's more detailed than you can do and maybe a barber would be best. but "that's not going to happen" just made me want to deck her. will not be coming back for a quick fix. i'll make the appointment at the regular and just wait it out.  that just brought the 4 star to a 2.
check in on line, then wait again in shop. store is a hot mess and the associated was not nice. waste of time.

i checked in online and got serviced right away when i arrived.  usually when i get a haircut it takes about 45 minutes start to finish.  i was here for 20 minutes tops.  they rush through and don't take their time to get to know what you want.  i feel like there are parts of my hair that didn't even get cut.  there are plenty of other places in the area that are in the same price range and are better.

i was a walk in on a busy saturday and was prepared to wait forever.  instead of forever, it was more like 10 minutes, which was nice.  carina did my hair and she did a really great job.  i went in there and told her that i wanted it short with an angle, and she went above and beyond making sure i looked good.  she asked me several times if i liked what she was doing and made sure that i was comfortable.  really excellent job for only $13.  i will definitely be back in the future!

cynthia.....my wife has been thrilled with the care and the time that cynthia spends with her. i tried telling her for years that you don't have to spend $65 to get a good cut and now she's a big fan. she cuts mine as well; although there's a lot less to cut, but spends time with mine as well

the good: - adult hair cuts are $15. - wait time are short, plus you can make a reservation ahead of time online. - easy to get it & plenty of parking. - clean location & friendly staff. the bad: - the skill level is not totally there. i left my most recent haircut unhappy as the hair dresser did not follow my request and completely missed strands of hair. unfortunately the good does not outweigh the bad here & ill be finding somewhere else for my next hair cut.

not a good experience.  i checked in online and when i arrived told the woman at desk i wanted hair cut, blow dry, and style.  it seems she was annoyed i wanted " the works" as she told another customer why there was going to be a wait. if this is a problem then the service should not be offered.  will not be going back there.
r u serious ...$14 for kid hair (7 yrs old) cut....wow! they didn't even do a great job! the faded isn't right it goes up and down like a zig zag.

after two calls to corporate headquarters with promises that the owner would call me to discuss, a negative review on yelp, and a complaint to the bbb, i finally received a phone call today from a manager stating that they would refund the $25.00 they charged for my daughter to get her hair washed and blown dry. they want me to come back in on wednesday to receive the refund. when i questioned why my sons were charged adult prices, they informed me that those prices reflect 10 and under. my one son is 10, and i pointed that out. the manager told me i had paid that price for him before after looking back at our records. they will not refund the money for charging him as an adult. so---the fact that they've been scamming me for a while makes it okay, i guess? they also said coupons would be sent in the mail. honestly, they can keep them. it's a shame. my family has been patronizing this place for years. there was a much better way to handle this and it started with the manager working with me the night i was upset that my daughter's haircut was $44.00 without any warning. avoid this place at all costs.

not that it is that difficult to cut my balding hair, but for some reason i am always happy when i walk out of great clips. the stylists are always very friendly and try to make conversation with you.  they only charge 15 for a cut and certain times you can go in and get it for less.i did not make an appointment or check in online but i have never had to wait for more than five minutes.  this time was no exception.  the place always seems clean and organized.  i have to other places where they leave the hair on the floor between cuts and the stylists is always rummaging around in her draw looking for a clipper attachment or something.bottom line, quick, reasonably priced, friendly, clean, and they make me look good, what's not to like?

what a great place. the staff was friendly and upbeat. online check-in got me in and out really quickly. the area is great too, close to restaurants , other businesses and a grocery store. the shop was quick and convenient and great quality. i will certainly be back.
better haircut in this area.  adrienne did my hair cut, she was good.  they charge $15 for adult hair cut.

they do an online check in which i don't get, but, also so walk inns. they don't do color, but, do cuts and the basics. i'm not sure why i ever allowed anyone but tiffany to touch my hair, she is the absolute best stylist in the area! if you're looking for a great haircut, new style....someone who is approachable, funny, sweeeeeeet, and a great stylist see tiffany.

horrible !!! i'm giving one star because i have got haircut from this place before also and they were good, otherwise the last experience with one of the hair stylist deserves zero star and was the worst ever. i'll just suggest them to stick with basics: be nice to people, and don't take customers at the 8th hour if you don't want to serve them. some hair stylist working at this place neither have skills nor experience with hair cutting, they r just pass timers..issued in public interest:- do not go to this place on thursday evening.
cheap decent hair cuts. been coming here for years with my son. everyone has always been friendly.

i've been a great clips customer for 5 years at the voorhees shop; this was my third visit to the marlton crossing shop. never again!  my son flew in from l.a. on an all-night flight to attend a friend's wedding.  we took him to great clips for a trim which should have taken no more than 5 minutes. we called ahead to make sure the shop was open, then we went right over from the airport. it was about 8:20 on saturday morning when we entered the shop. the stylist was with a customer (no one else was waiting).  she asked if we checked-in online and we told her we did not. she told us that, nonetheless, we would be next and our wait would be 10-15 minutes.  although my son was very tired, we felt 10-15 minutes was reasonable, so we sat down to wait.  about 25 minutes later a man walked in, said he checked in online, and was then taken before us. how can an online check-in trump an in-person check-in?  my wife objected because we had been waiting patiently in excess of our estimated wait time; however the stylist just turned her back on us as she escorted the online customer to a chair. wonderful customer service, right?  if this is great clip's policy, then conceivably we could wait all day as people keep checking in online and we keep getting bumped. such a policy is also discriminatory toward the elderly, many of whom do not have or use a computer. it's time to say goodbye to great clips.
worst haircut i ever got from one of the stylists here. i have got haircuts from this location earlier, and they have been good. this review just reflects the one experience that i had.

although the staff was very friendly - i will never be going back to this place.  after cutting five inches off about half of my daughter's hair - i see the stylist combing thru the back of her head.  i walk over to ask if there is a problem and she tells me there is lice.  another stylist comes over to -confirm.  after i freak out - first about the lice and then about them leaving her hair like that - they took her in the back and did a hatchet job cutting the other half.  they tried to sell me their $42 kit to get rid of lice but we left and got it at cvs for half that amount.  after four hours of treatment and combing thru her hair piece by piece - we come to find out that it was actually just sand!  we had been at the beach earlier in the day.  in my panic - i did not mention that at the salon but i would think they should be able to tell the difference between lice and sand.  and if they bothered to shampoo the client before cutting the hair - it would not have been a problem but apparently they just wet the hair.   they did not charge me for the "haircut" but i wasted $20 and four hours of time - not to mention having my daughter so upset!   i also now have to get her hair cut again to fix the unevenness.  total customer service fail.  i am livid!

i'm not sure if new people were hired but this place has gotten a little better. got the haircut i asked for, quick and easy.a few mistakes here and there but they don't question and they're glad to fix it!if you want a inexpensive and quick haircut, go here.but don't expect it to be perfect!

very disappointed with this place.my son always ask for this barber gene that cuts his hair multiple times in this place.we went because we knew he would be there.checked in and waited 10minutes for this specific barber since he was cutting someone's hair and then he was done.we were the only one waiting then a guy came in and was asked if he registered online and he said yes.he took him right away and we ended up telling them to cancel us because we asked specifically for gene.why did the other guy go first instead of my son?

terrible. checked in online and it said 0 wait time. got there about 5 minutes later and i was somehow 7th in the queue with a 35 minute wait time. they also took someone lower on the queue ahead of me. someone even said something and they still took him ahead of his place in the queue. the stylist i had didn't listen to me at all and cut layers into my hair despite me saying not to. and cut more off than i asked for. you get what you pay for i guess but that wasn't even worth $16. for that experience they should have paid me $16.
just got vincenzo's first hair cut at great clips in springfield!! great experience!! thank you so much to our wonderful hair dresser danielle!!

worst experience ever! went here to get my daughter's haircut. we just moved to the area. the lady was so rude told my husband she would just cut my daughter's hair all off. my daughter is a 8 year old, who does get tangles easily. she had a few knots in her hair but nothing a little brushing would not have taken care of. this lady made my daughter cry and said some really hurtful things. my husband did not get her name unfortunately, but it happened today january 2. i would never suggest anyone go here unless you like being insulted. wish i could give zero stars. went to regis salon at springfield mall immediately afterwards, my daughter got a great cut and was treated wonderfully there.

they butchered my son. my 11 year old son has the easiest hair ever. seriously i have 3 kids and this one is a no-brainer which is why i allow my husband to take him to great clips. yes that's a loaded statement but all he needs is a buzz. seriously. we have never had a problem getting him a decent buzz cut. well.... not only did they use the wrong setting (a 1 vs a 2) but the neck line was completely crooked and they completely shaved bald his forehead line which again was crooked right across the front of his head. it is the craziest thing i ever saw. my son was in tears before he even left great clips and no one said anything (yes including my husband who paid and tipped for this atrocity.) i was heartbroken for my son when he returned. i have photos but will not post them in public. if anyone from great clips wanted to contact me i would be happy to share with you directly. i'm appalled at the horrible cut. i can't imagine the person who did this was even a licensed professional. luckily his hair grows fast and he is easy to forget. we will head to a seasoned professional stylist next time and pay more for a cut. i would think twice before entrusting your hair to anyone at a great clips especially this one in springfield.

i've been here a few times and, overall, haven't had the best experiences. the real reason why i get my hair cut here is because it's close by - not for any specific stylist.frankly, all i've ever seen when i walk in here is semi-depressed looking people. no, not the customers, the workers. that's with the exception of only one woman which of whom i don't know the name of that is very bubbly, seems nice, and actually knows what she's doing. on top of that, they don't have any one person manning the register so people sometimes fight over who was waiting longer since no one was able to put anyone in the system for their waiting iist.i must say, though, that i've had a few stylists who have made my hair exactly how i wanted. but that shouldn't be as hard as they make it for a simple pixie cut.

if you want a nice haircut avoid this place at all costs. it seems like the common theme amongst all these reviews is they don't listen or care. i've gone to this place the last few haircuts and i can't do it anymore. they're very inconsistent. i get the same haircut every time and they always find a way to screw it up. latanya the lady that cut my hair this time finished my hair in less than two minutes just so she could chat with other coworkers. now my hair is very uneven and i'm embarrassed to go to work.

customer service wasn't great, stylist spoke more to others then me. my hair was not  washed just sprayed with a spray bottle. my cut was ok but no offer to dry my hair. i left with my hair feeling dirtier then when i went in.

my son went to great clips in springfield, pa, as he usually does, but this time he was very dissatisfied due to the butchering he received from the stylist.  we told him that if he was going to be butchered like that he was better off going to roy tweedy's ( which is a real butcher shop). i'm not sure if it was because he was a teenager, or for the fact that he use the coupon that was mailed to us, but either way they did a horrible job, and it costs more to fix his hair the way it should have been done in the first place. my husband called the salon upon my sons return, to see if we could resolve the situation, but of course we never received a response. no call back from any manager, or any apologies whatsoever. i would highly advise that no one go to great clips in springfield until they get their act together! as for us, we are a large family and we go there a lot, but will never step foot in that place again!

this is a chain, but a good place for a haircut. the people are always very friendly and talkative, and the haircuts are good, at least for easy hair like mine.they ask for your phone number, but don't worry- they won't call you, they just save any information about how to cut your hair and associate it with the number. that way, the next time you come in you don't have to explain what you want! for someone who lacks hair vocabulary, it's a big help.the only problem is that they will brush your neck with a lot of baby powder without asking you- you must let them know if you don't want that much.walking there from swarthmore is not the most pleasant, as you have to cross baltimore pike.

needed to get my hair did- i live in the area and have stayed away from this place since you have to pay for a wash and a cut and a blow dry. but if i'm going to pay $30 somewhere else- why not!they do not offer color or other specialties- only cuts. i went friday night, 5pm and was in and out. i have had some scalp issues so sahara used tea tree shampoo and conditioner and spent some extra time working it in- it felt awesome.i wasn't expecting miracles since it's a walk-in salon but she gave be a good text-book layered hair cut. she was pleasant to talk with and didn't talk too much.nice work!

used to be typical now terrible. seriously twice i've gotten cuts by trainees who really are not experienced. one didn't even get how to blend/fade and i have the worlds thickest easiest hair to cut. i had to have her buzz it all off so i didn't look like a damn crooked rooster. after complaining to corporate, come to find out this is a franchise and they flat out don't care. fortunately chain chop shops are a dime a dozen.adding a point because another great clips location saw how messed up the cut was and fixed/recut for a huge discount.
they close 10 minutes after i got there and told me they're not accepting any more clients. i can get a crappy haircut anywhere but i choose you because you're close.

i thought this great clips used to be really great. but, tonight's customer service was so horrible that i actually decided to install yelp app and give review so that folks will expect what kind of service they are getting. i would like to request the management team to start looking into their employees attitudes. not all of them are bad. some are really good actually. but, it's usually one that creates seriously disgusting customer experience. one bad experience might overshadow the past good experiences. i intend to visit this facility in coming days. i hope the management team takes my review seriously and i hope get to better quality services.p.s: tonight's haircut was so horrible that i could have done better job myself. i am never letting the same hairstylist touch my hair again.

twice now, my husband has come here and the stylist has messed up to the point of just giving him a shaved head because there was a lack of communication or knowledge, i am not sure, on the stylist part. i then foolishly thought this place might be better for my children and my son now has uneven hair and my daughters hair just hangs with no style or shape. very disappointed, we will not be going back.

my husband went to get a haircut yesterday, saturday, and was greeted by a pleasant and professional young african american woman. (the only reason i'm mentioning that is he forgot to get her name.)we were both so pleased with his haircut  and she now has a permanent client. we can't speak for the other stylists, but she did a great job. my husband's hair is very fine, and the way she cut it was perfect.

i went to get a haircut on sunday, march 25th. the posted hours say that they close at 5pm. i tried to use the app so they knew i was on the way, but could not since it was within the last half hour of the store being open. i drove over and arrived at 4:42. and was promptly told they were not taking any more customers. there were no customers waiting and no customers being serviced. if i had arrived at 2 or 3 minutes before closing, i might understand. but it normally only takes about 15 minutes to cut my hair. needless to say, if i hadn't pre-paid for a card for the year, i would not be going back. i would like to know if the owner has other stores in the area where i could use the pre-paid card so i don't have to go back. i never had any problems for the 5 years i was using the store in ridley township, but apparently there is a dramatic change in professionalism when you move just 8 miles away.
decent haircut for a reasonable price. the quality of the haircut greatly depends on the stylist you get.

was really in need of a good haircut the other day so i stopped in this great clips.  my hair was in terrible shape after having been butchered by a woman from another hair place over 6 months ago, and then being "trimmed" here and there by my mom and two daughters.  had a wash and cut for $16 plus a tip which wasn't bad at all.  dee did a great job, and thanks to her, i feel so much better now!

i went to great clips after my stylist at another salon left.  i brought two pictures to give the stylist an idea of what i wanted.  she asked me some questions, restated what she thought i wanted to make sure she understood, and gave me a fabulous cut! it's so rare to find someone that actually listens! the cut was exactly what i wanted.  it was $12, plus tip.  ive paid $60 or more at local salons and wasn't nearly as happy as i am with this cut.  this particular stylist is no longer there, but they all seem excellent.  women are constantly complimenting me on  my hair and asking me where i go.  they are shocked when i tell them.

my boyfriend went in for a haircut today and from the second the girl started we both knew she had no idea what she was doing. she was super young and looked completely lost. the haircut was patchy and just looked all around awful. the manager i guess had to to fix it, and still didn't do much. would definitely not recommended this place.
they do a fine job. it's quick. the ladies are always nice. it's inexpensive. i do recommended checking in online or on the app ahead of time; otherwise you could wait a long time.
you get what you pay for. i was the youngest guy inside. all seniors. well, the clip was nice. no razor neck shave like barbers do. people were friendly and nice.

let me start off by saying i've been going here for about 5 + years. i went in to get it clean up. and easy bob with a tapered underneath. nothing hard. nothing fancy. while i was waiting i even found a picture of the length and the taper that i wanted. so i show "rosemary", get in her chair and it just goes downhill... she starts to cut, walks away to talk to another stylist, comes back and continues. not long after i asked for a mirror. i had told her due to a cervical spinal surgery last may i could not feel the back of my head. when i look in the mirror i knew i was going to have a terrible panic attack (i do suffer from anxiety). she had cut my hair so short up the back she could have used clippers. my hair is in the shape of a horseshoe! the back is completely butchered up to the top of my head and she left long sides so from the front it looks like a super duper short bob! after having cervical spinal surgery last year they had to cut open the back of my head. there is no way i would get a haircut this short to highlight a scar that runs into my head like that. i was so upset i begged my husband to cancel our trip down the shore. it was only two nights but he had surprised me with a" you deserve this trip baby, it's been a hard recovery for you". being on disability, i cannot afford to cancel a trip like this. i reached out to corporate great clips who put me in touch with someone who works with the owner. i told him what happened, i showed them pictures, and all i want is to be refunded for my trip. not much to ask right? do you think that's happened? the moral of my story here is do not go here! and if you are, if you are that desperate, do not let rosemary near your head! great clips has enough customers and they can afford to lose 1 after 8 years. they can afford lose you too!!!

jacqueline gave my son a huge bold spot and didn't have the decency of telling us it happened. we noticed when we got home. very unprofessional for not reporting her mistake and apologizing for it. she should not be cutting anybody's hair.

a great haircut doesn't have to have a big price tag.  i've visited this great clips on several occasions and have yet to be disappointed.  worth driving to this location because the girls here know what they are doing.  never too long a wait and check in a available online is an added plus.

i feel bad because the staff here is always so nice but the past few times i was very specific about how i wanted my kids hair cut and either my requests were just ignored or the skill level isn't there. it was always hit or miss but too many misses for me lately. not going back again.

great value where you can get haircut very affordably if you're not looking for frills i highly recommend it. i have been here 4 times and they always do exactly as i request. for an additional affordable fee they will wash your hair - to save money they suggest going with freshly washed hair. online check in saves time they're very friendly clean and professional here.
love this place. i feel like family every time i am there. and they make me look like a million bucks :)

they listen to your needslook, they talk to you if you want to be talked to, or they just cut your hair. but, they ask you what you want.they also always suggest styles, cuts, . products for your hair and scalp.they are helpful and good at what they do. i've never had a bad experience. i drove from philadelphia just to go to this location.

i'm giving this place 1 star, i went there a year ago and loved my hair cut. i went there 2 weeks ago and was mortified with how short she cut it after telling a specific length to cut it, i just now straightened my hair to try getting used to it and she butchered my hair. she was rushing to get out by 4, my whole wash and hair cut took about 20 minutes, having long, thick, curly hair it should've taken longer. a year ago i would've recommended this place to everyone, after the experience i just had.... absolutely not.

my first time here, after recently moving to the neighborhood.  i waited about 2 minutes to get in , and michelle gave me a great haircut, with very confident hands !!  what more could you ask for ? !

i walked in about 15 minutes before closing in hopes of getting my son a quick trim. all three of the hair dressers turned to look at my family but said nothing. an extra rude glance was given by the other blonde haired woman in the first booth. after awkwardly waiting for a few minutes we decided to leave. again, on our way out the door the older blonde woman gave another rude look. i understand it was near closing time but if you don't want costumers, instead of making us feel like were not wanted please just lock the door.

never a long wait.  i recommend lindsey. she is attentive, child-friendly and sociable unlike the other cryptkeepers that work there.  the tan, feathered,  farah wannabe is one to avoid.  i hate that they don't take phone appointments. otherwise, great place.

i've been using this great clips for about 2 years. i always get great service. i understand the level of customer service that needs to be given with the public but the girls there go above and beyond. only complaints i have are with great clips itself. it's hard for someone to stop cutting hair and then jump back and forth and answer phones and service the walk ins and still go back to cut hair! hire a desk girl already! let the stylists focus on the customer. and any other customer reading this... understand these ladies are doing mulitple jobs, tip them well!

i went in with middle of my back long, practically one length hair. i needed a quick easy trim and couldn't get to my normal girl at a real salon for 2 weeks. i told the stylist that i wanted about an inch off, maybe 1 1/2 - 2 inches if i really really needed it.. during conversation, she asked how i usually have my hair cut. i told her usually i have the stylist put a long layer in it (note: i did not ask this stylist to do that.  just a trim).  by the end of my haircut my hair was completely butchered!!!!!!! there was a layer in my hair that came to mid cheek.. i haven't had bangs since the 90's and my hair felt like i was in the mid stages of growing bangs out (ladies you know what i mean!).. i was in such shock about what my hair looked like that i couldn't say anything. i just paid and left. when i got home, i realized i couldn't even put my hair in a ponytail, low or high without using bobby pins to secure the pieces that were too short to be pulled back. i also realized that my hair was uneven and the layers were not even blended. this cut gave new meaning to the word 'choppy'.. i didn't go back and complain because all they would do is tell me that they would like the chance to fix it. i have a problem with that for 2 reasons. #1: channel would never touch my hair again  #2: the only way to fix this mess would be to cut it even shorter and at that point i would have practically a pixie cut.  i am just going to let it grow for a month or 2 and then go to the real salon i normally go to and have a real stylist fix what someone at great clips destroyed..  you really do get what you pay for and i would never recommend this place to anyone. it is awful!!!!

we lucked out on this beautiful weather sunday.  after getting our dog groomed at 'petsmart,' i saw the signs for $7.99 haircuts at 'great clips.'  both of my children needed cuts, so this deal was too perfect!   we barely sat down for literally one minute (despite the crowd) and they were both taken back.my daughter loved her trim (just 1/2" off the length and trimmed up layers) and her sweet hairdresser, kristina.  my son, who is ultra picky about his hair being too short on top, was happy w/ his cut too (not initially).  he's pretty quiet but his hairdresser, erinne, went out of her way to let my son look through a magazine to pick out what he wanted.  very nice girl as well (with funky blue hair!). we'll def be back :)

i came here for my hair donation. i can't remember the name of the stylist that cut me, she was blonde. the cut was free, so i can't complain too much, but the "clean-up" was hardly clean at all. i have lots of pieces that are uneven and i have to wait a while to get a trim to even everything out or my hair will be shorter than i want it to be. because of this, i have to put my hair in a ponytail because it looks bad if i wear it down. 0/10 will not come back here.

worst experience at this location. checked in online got to the store and confirmed we checked in. then the three employees pretended we didn't exist. sadly i used to think this location was half way decent. must be due to poorly trained staff who wanted to hurry and leave. again, horrible experience at this location. my review does not reflect other locations who take pride in their customers and recognize negative posting will effect foot traffic. i will never ever patronize this location again and will spread the word about my terrible experience.

the worst haircut ever.  go elsewhere.  save your money and go to a real stylist.  when was the last time a hair hacker 'feathered' your bangs?  when farrah fawcett was a charlie's angels.  incompetent hackers
i get my haircuts here and i've never had a problem. the staff is courteous and professional.
fast and no waiting, hair cut wasn't bad and the price was right too!if you're going for a "fast food" hair cut, you shouldn't have to wait!

just got my hair cut. no wait and the cut was quick. jo ann was fantastic. i'm usually indecisive when it comes to how i like my hair to look. i told her an idea and she made it look better than what i was expecting. i'm definitely coming back.

i gave this place another try last night. different stylists were working and was greeted and was about a twenty minute wait which was less than i waited last week who thought anyone even greeting me or putting my name on a waiting list. heather did a good haircut and will look for her again in the future. i think the stylists last week just were not into their work that day as usually in the past service has been very good. there was an elderly man ahead of me and i think neither of them wanted to cut his hair so both just kept dragging their feet so the other stylist would finish first and have to deal with the old guy. i understand having to wait when a shop was busy but they really were not that day. great clips location is convenient for me to get to so hope in the future service is better than that day last week.
my daughter went for a trim and then asked to cut it in a blunt style.  it looked like a chop job.  all uneven and i wonder if the hair cutter has a license to cut hair since its so uneven.

i went in this location for this first time today and was greeted promptly by one of the barbers, and he "assigned" boris to me.  i explained what i wanted, which was a simple buzz cut the same length all around.  very easy.yet he started right away with a choppy, hard, inch-by-inch hack job of my scalp.  instead of an easy smooth buzz, i literally received a constant banging against my head with his heavy clippers, until i asked him to go easy.  he said fair, but didn't really change his style.  instead of a nice quick buzz cut i was subjected to an unpleasant experience.  additionally, his workspace was unclean and his trimmers were filled with other customers hair.  not good!!i will not be going back to this location.

nothing great about that clip. i did not plan to get a haircut yesterday but after an errand next door i walked in and asked if there was a wait. there was no wait. a lady took my name and typed it very very slowly in the computer. she did not know english very well which is fine i get it. after she asked me how i wanted my hair cut i told her to clip it using number three and make it pretty short on the sides but not so short that you can see my scalp. i took off my glasses and she went to work. she used one clipper and cut the bulk of it and then switched to a closer attachment and cut it shorter and shorter. at this point i started worrying and looked concerned i asked her if she was cutting it any shorter. i put my glasses to look at my hair. it was very short, shorter than i wanted. she asked me if it is ok. i said it's shorter than i wanted. i take my glasses back off so she can finish the top and she puts another blade on and before i could even say a word she cuts it even shorter on the sides. i said it's too short and she tries to remove the attachment altogether and but my hair with the bare clippers. at this point i said no no stop stop too short. she said ok ok and kept doing her thing. i finished the hair cut, it was almost completely shaven on the sides.i checked out, paid and left the place completely pissed off.the worst haircut i ever had.at the end of the day i know it's only hair it will grow. my wife, kids and people i work with will stop teasing me in a couple of weeks as the hair grows back. but stay out of this place.

i have been getting my hair cut here for several months, mostly out of convenience to my gym. i have a fairly straight forward hair cut. two on the sides and scissors on top for a comb over. you literally cannot mess it up. well, apparently you can. or at least carmella can. it was my first time getting my hair cut by her. she acted like she knew exactly what i wanted and then took big chunks off the top of my hair. i keep about 2 inches up top so i can blow dry it. so cutting down to the scalp was a problem. i stopped her once i realized that she was a complete idiot and she was arguing that i do my hair wrong. like, what? okay, so she tries to fix it but it looks like i let a child cut my hair, and on top of that, when my hair does grow back, nothing will be the same length. i don't know what the hiring process is here, but if carmella can't do a simple cut then she's gotta go. i'm not coming back until she's gone.

i come into the same bala cynwyd location i always do. ask for the same haircut i always do. tint fade. it's recorded. nasirah asks what do i want to do with the top. i said "don't touch it, i'm growing it out." she then proceeds to do what she wants and cuts the sides off. that's not a tint fade. i ask her later if she knows what a tint fade is. she says there's no such thing. and she's supposed to be a manager? check the records of my previous haircuts! google "tint fade haircuts." it's very simple. she ruined my hair. i now look like a conehead. it will not grow back evenly the way i had it before. i just wanted the bottom side trimmed down, not the entire side. which is why i was very specific with her!
great service - nashira always gets it done right. check in online before hand always saves time

after a few trial and error experiences here, i found mainly through luck a good stylist.  going blindly into a chain like this is pretty much a crap shoot and chances are the person who cuts your hair might not be there the next time.  all and all a friendly place.

i rushed to get to the store for a quick haircut and arrived just before 6:00 on a sunday.  i was informed that they were no longer taking any more customers...even a quick clipper hair cut.  they have just lost a repeat customer!

i was very happy with my cut here. i didn't need an appointment; i just walked right in, sat down, and started to get my hair cut right away. my stylist/barber was very kind, gentle and conversational. it didn't take too long and it was only 12$ (i believe?) for a men's haircut. (this was the cheapest i could find it in the area for a men's cut.)

first review, i've ever written....worst.haircut.ever. and even after pointing it out, still was charged full price...south st barbers...a little farther, more expensive...worth every cent...do not go here
great clips gives the terrible hair cuts. apparently they will give anyone a job with a degree in cosmetics or whatever it is. never going back there again.
doris did a wonderful job cutting my husband's hair just now. she was very kind and did a nice job cleaning all the hair off after she was done using alcohol pads *more sanitary.

so far, one cut that i was happy with, and one not so much.  one very friendly stylist, and one not so much (i'm pretty sure she was grabbing bites of her snack or lunch in between cutting my hair).  prices are very reasonable and the location is very convenient for me, so i will probably come back.
jacquelyne did an exceptional job. neat fade, precision and great service was displayed on her part. oh except the constant teasing between us :p  a job well done nonetheless

this is nothing against the employee who were very friendly and courteous with my short interaction with them. my complaint here is about the the poor business model implementation. getting people to sign up for an app provides the business tremendous amounts of insight and information that is of huge monetary value, significantly more than the few bucks for a haircut. in turn i would expect the business to offer a little more in return than a piss poor estimated wait time -- in my circumstance, being told to wait another 30mins having shown up a few minutes shy of the estimated wait time. i understand the concept of variance but 30 minutes? it really defeats the purpose of checking in. the short: the user information provided to the business is worth more than the elementary linear model they are using to "predict" weight times.. it is 2018 for christ's sake!

i have been going to this great clips for almost 10 years. they had some of the best hairdressers.  that has all changed. there's new manager and she has replaced almost everybody who has been there a long time. it's sad because now the haircut quality has dropped off immensely. i've had to return to have my hair cut correctly because the girl left it uneven. my children have been getting their haircut there and my son's hair looks horrible. it's uneven and not layered correctly.it's time for me to find a new salon. i recommend finding someplace else to get your haircut.
