if you want the best haircut please go see melissa....she is awesome and she always does an amazing job.
just left this place and i have to say that the lady who cut my hair was the rudest most unpleasant ever!!! its ok though because she saved me 6 bucks in tip.

i've been getting my hair cut at great clips for some time. they're cheap and usually do a good job. one thing that has always bothered me however, is their massive indoor air pollution problem. the second you step into the place, you're assaulted by the nauseating, concentrated odor of toxic hair chemicals in their air. it smells like someone just emptied the major part of a hairspray bottle into the air.great clips seems to have no effective or no air filtration system at all. i think what they're spraying just gets recycled through the ac. this is true for all their locations in tempe, not just the one at mill and southern.for people with allergies and asthma like myself, this is no small problem, and today i've decided that i've had enough, and will no longer be a great clips customer. i instead got my hair cut at keep it cut at rural and baseline, where the air is actually breathable.
i always get the results i want here.  melisa always does a great job!  they greet me with a smile and welcome when i walk in.  i recommend them to my family and they all come to this location.

this place is hit or miss.  i would never have my hair cut at a great clips (i have naturally curly hair, but even if i didn't....no, sorry) so this may skew my review a bit, simply because i have never seen quality work consistently come out of any great clips and would never trust them with my hair.  my husband, on the other hand, favors this place only because they are cheap.  his hair grows quickly, so if he doesn't like it, it won't matter in a few days anyway.  i keep trying to talk him out of going there every time and spend money on a place that will actually do a good job, but he insists on going back because he refuses to spend $10 more.  there was one young lady who is impossibly thin (i didn't catch her name.  she has big pretty eyes and is very thin) that cut his hair and did an absolutely terrible job.  every time he looked in the mirror, my totally not self-conscious husband would say "worst haircut ever.  that chick messed my hair up."  if he complains, it's bad.

okay, this is a long story...but joy is amazing! go this location of great clips and ask for joy. she is 100% amazing in every aspect. first off, she's beyond friendly and cares about every person that steps in her salon. she realizes that haircuts are important to people and ultimately illustrates how they personally see themselves. long story short, i had my haircut done a while back and i knew what i wanted, but i did not have someone near as great as joy. i felt very unhappy about my experience and knew right away i needed to go back to joy. i showed her a pic of what i wanted done and she went above and beyond my expectations. i feel so more confident and back on the top after seeing her. one million percent, got to joy! thanks joy and great clips! mill and southern location

asked for a low fade, got a high fade. looks like i'm about to re-enlist now. the haircut was clean and no uneven lines. just not at all what i asked for. staff was friendly, checked in online and wait was only a couple minutes.

i've gone to several great clips locations, and have had great experiences-- this was not one of them. i went in today asking for a half inch trim-- the first thing my stylist does is try to get me to buy some product. i respectfully listen, but she spends more time talking about the product, rather than focusing on my hair. i had to point out that she left half of my hair untrimmed and longer than the rest. she didn't even check my part, did a half-assed job, and continued to talk about buying the product. some advice-- please don't spend the whole appointment trying to get customers to buy product while paying little to no attention to the actual haircut. i will never be returning to this location again.

never had any problems with this location. like all great clips you're really rolling the dice if you decide to walk in and expect a quick haircut. wait times can get long quickly, so always check in online or with the mobile app. in my experience great clips can be hit or miss from location to location and this is definitely one of the better ones. i'll drive several miles out of my way and past other locations to get my haircut at this location. i always seem to regret it when i don't.

stephan went above and beyond. he took the time to discuss what i wanted, and made excellent suggestions. the result of my visit was the best haircut of my life, and for only $8 (during the sale). i wasn't sure what i wanted, but afterwards ended up with something i didn't know i could have asked for. highly recommended. stephan is my new spirit animal.

been here twice since living in tempe and im just gonna say i rather get my hair cut here than a fancy salon. every time i come here to get a hair cut they always leave my hair looking great. i just got it cut about three weeks ago and the person who cut my hair was amazing. he asked me how i liked to style it and even added personal touches the style i asked for.i cant remember his name but i will go back to him when i need a trim.
i just had my hair cut my michael at the great clips on mill. he did a great job and was super professional. he definitely understands how to cut short hair for women!

of course it depends on who you get, but my husband and i deal with the best at this salon. daisy sure knows how to work a cute short hair do. i am far from being a picky person about my hair, but i did have something in mind. and she did a perfect cut. everyone loves my hair. i went from long to short. thanks daisy! now my husband goes to heather and has been going to her for years. i love this team of ladies cause they sure make us both look good. ;)
great place !!!! bonnie was amazing!!! def would go back!!! very clean and professional !!!!and fast !!!

i've been a returning customer of great clips consistently for about 2 years for a reason. when looking for a hair cut i like to be in and out and their online check in makes that possible, love walking in and skipping ahead of everyone waiting!  also i went here to get my hair styled for my engagement pictures and daisy did a wonderful job!  who knew?!

i have been coming to this great clips for over 3 years, before, i was going to the great clips on 24th street and baseline for bridgette. when she moved stores, i decided to make that extra commute to get my hair cut by her. i highly recommend asking for bridgette, she has spent time perfecting her skills. bridgette have been going beyond my expectations of great clips and this is the only reason why i go to this location. please give her a try, she will spend time learning about you, instead of the typical 15 minutes haircut where you are left feeling awkward wondering who cut your hair. you won't be disappointed!

hey i goto great clips all the time - in fact the same person just recently cut my hair for when i asked my girlfriends parents for their daughter's hand, for my engagement, for my wedding and fixed what the wife tried to do.  always very kind, relaxing experience. and always a good haircut.

i have gone here several times to get a men's hair cut here, nothing complicated. however, the two times i have had my hair cut by the older woman i have ended up with an awful hair cut. after getting home and showering, the top of my head was left at the same length it was before (about an inch difference) and the angles from the transitions on the sides of my head were completely different.if you go here, get one of the younger ladies to cut your hair, they are more competent and i've never had issues with their work.

walked in about 2 weeks ago, only had to wait 10 minutes.was lucky & got sandra, she did a fantastic job & knew what needed to be trimmed to get style i wanted before i even asked. turns out we had a lot in common & loved talking with her! she did a great haircut & am definitely going back to her in future!

came to get a haircut at this location and left with uneven hair. the stylist didn't seem to know what he was doing at all. i immediately went to the great clips at hayden plaza and they did a wonderful job and didn't even charge me since my hair looked terrible. i decided to come back to get a refund and was told they wouldn't do that because i should've had it re-done at the location that did a terrible job on my hair. i wouldn't recommend coming here.

i checked in online at this location on a saturday afternoon. there was no wait and i only needed my hair shampooed and blow dried. when i arrived, there was only one customer at a station and 3 other stylists without clients. when i requested my service, the manager said, no - only hair cuts today! whaaaat? i thought it was a joke, but was quickly informed that it was not. they would not shampoo and dry or style my hair because they did not have "enough stylists on the floor" * possibly the most ridiculous thing i have ever heard of! * absolutely the poorest customer service i have ever had at a great clips! or anywhere actually i went to my car and drove to the great clips at squaw peak plaza on 16th st where i was greeted by susan. this location appeared to be busy and only had 2 stylists on the floor. susan did not bat an eye and was happy to have me as her customer. she did a fantastic job and was a pleasure to work with! i would encourage you to save yourself the trip and aggravation and skip great clips located at 4312 e. cactus in phoenix and head straight over to the great clips at 6825 n 16th st, phoenix.  you will receive much better service and enjoy the experience. i wish i could let the cactus store know that i bought $100 worth of product and tipped 25%. just sayin'

i was a walk in.  started my experience with two hairstylist debating (in front of me during check-in) on who had the right to do the cut. guess i should have walked out right then!  explain to the hairstylist over 3 times- how my hair needed to stay in a ponytail (rubber); since it was going to be donated.  3-5 times later she finally paid attention/understood; after removing the river band and trying to come out the hair. never had clippers used to shave off a ponytail before. will never have it done again!! nora don't understand how a hairdresser, does not realize wet here is one length compared to dry hair.  besides-the underneath/back hair is now shorter than the top/sides. also-ended up being shorter than what i request.  since the ponytail was not cut straight, the stylist had to trim it up. again-too short!!!!will not return to that stylist, maybe even that location. beware before you sit down!!!!

took my 4 year old son in this evening. we did the mobile check in which worked out perfectly. wade cut my son's hair and did a good job! he knew what to do & was good with talking to my son. enjoyable experience! thank you!
always bring my grandchildren here. great cut and very reasonable prices would recommend this place for good hair cuts.

the national weather service issued excessive heat warning's for sunday and monday saying that temperatures on the sidewalks and streets could get up to 170°   right now great clips has this man working on a street corner. on a day where people are supposed to avoid going outside if possible is it really necessary to put an older gentlemans health at risk by having him stand out in this for hours?the city of phoenix and churches are setting up shelters and the power company is putting on extra workers to make sure everybody has air. considering all of this, wouldn't it behoove the company to think of a persons health before advertising that may not even bring in more income?

two bad experiences with chelsey. first time she told me i was second in line when i was was fifth. today she argued with me about my cut/style. she spent maybe 5 minutes on the cut. its uneven and the worst i've ever had. she pressed the clippers in to my neck, leaving burns and red streaks. this person has no business working with the public and should never be allowed near a salon. i called the customer comment line and the box was full. obviously, i won't be back.

i've come to this location for years as has my family. they have several good stylists. but the fact that the owner, randy, won't  fix the hot water heater is absurd. it's been broken for months!!! so do not ask for a shampoo unless you want to have a shampoo with very cold water. everyone's shampoos should be free until this is corrected. he owns multiple locations and this is ridiculous that he is making both his customers and employees suffer through cold water. stop being cheap!!!

horrible service. i came in for a blow dry and it looked like the stylist definitely did not know what she was doing. normally, it would take close to 45 mins to do a decent job. i was there for one and a half hour with absolutely no results. she even asked her colleague to help and she tried to style my hair completely straight. on being asked for feedback, when i politely said this isn't what i was expecting...she snapped back at me saying i should know the weather is humid. the lady was extremely rude and i think it was a total rip off. i would never go there again and stay away from such unpleasant staff.

ask for chelsey especially if you have a child with autism or special needs. she's been cutting my hair since she was 18 and is the only one who can cut my sons hair. she's got a great sense of style.

hands down, the worst experience i have ever had with getting a haircut.  i live between two great clips of about equal distance so i alternate back and forth.  the notes are the same, as i get the same boring, and very easy haircut.  i have been getting the same cut since about 2009.  yesterday, i knew i was in trouble when i had to explain 3-4 times what the notes meant before the guy even started.  i understand that new people start, but they need to have their skills tested before hacking up customers.  the guy just couldn't understand what i was telling him, it was a joke.  other stylists could see what was going on, and one even tried to come over and help.  i think that others seeing how bad he was doing and not intervening made the situation worse.i finally just told him to stop, i couldn't take any more.  i will get it fixed elsewhere.  he really didn't understand he was doing so bad.  the same girl that tried to help came and told him to apologize to me and offer me some product.  he made some half assed apology, truly not understanding there was an issue, and then offered 50% off one little bottle of shampoo.  he also couldn't figure out how to ring me out.  i just gave money and left, again, there was no way i was waiting around there any longer.  too bad, i usually get really good treatment here, but i won't ever go back now.
ask for jeniffer. she pays attention to detail and make your hair look the way you want. she did a really good job

it seems that the person cutting hair does not listen. as a female, i am given a man's cut.as i am waiting, i have seen more time taken cutting a man's hair. my last visit maria hadno regard for my request. uneven cut. i will find another shop that will listen to my request.you can't grow hair back after the damage has been done.
i love this place. in and out quick. the staff is really friendly. ask for chad, a master at work:)

i take my children to great clips.  on this particular visit, we arrived around 8pm, and were informed of a short wait.  we waited about 10 minutes before the first daughter was called back for her wash and cut.within another 10 minutes, the other daughter went back.  both were given personalized attention and enjoyed the scalp massage with the shampoo.both haircuts came out fine, symmetrical, etc.  friendly and efficient hair cutters.  price for 2 cuts, including shampoo and tip:  $34.00  ~~ and the girls were happy with the results.we will return to this location.
been getting my hair cut by one of the girls here for years.   jennifer does a great  job.   i love her.

i called this location to see what their wait time was and the woman who answered, angie, informed me that there was no one there and to come in. i asked to put my name in and she stayed that it wasn't necessary. i asked her again and she insisted that i didn't need to. i drove the 4 minute drive from my location to this great clips and when i arrived every seat was full and there was a 35 minute wait. i mentioned that i had just spoke with someone and asked to put my name in and every person acted oblivious. no apology whatsoever, horrible customer service.

not so great clip.... from my experience.  i'm not going to write a book about it, but the service is okay, the workers are disgruntled (bad ownership from what they said), but my biggest pet-peeve, the stations are covered with hair and they didn't clean up prior to me being seated.  i had to ask her to clean up.

non-existent customer service. quite literally. i walk up to the desk, the guy working there ignores up - i'm standing at the counter inches from where he just finished ringing up a customer - when i get to the counter, he turns away from me and walks away. walks. away. from. a. customer. like i have cooties or  something. wtf? i'll go elsewhere for my haircut.

i've been coming to this great clips for several years for haircuts. they're quick and pretty much always do a good job. sure, i've had a person every now and then that wasn't all that great, but i've never had anyone completely butcher my hair. all the hairdressers are friendly.i always check in on the app when i come in (they don't take reservations) and i never have to wait more than about 10 mins when i arrive. at $14 a haircut they're pretty reasonable to begin with, but they offer deals a few times throughout the year & are always mailing out coupons.
very nice people, clean and professional. get a decent haircut for a decent price and don't spend all day in the salon.

they are always in a rush to finish my haircut within ten minutes. every single time they fail to cut my hair how i ask them.  i ask them for a fade, they cut it all one length. i ask them for a disconnect, they literally just didnt do it then insisted they did. cuts have been uneven and sloppy, consistently!  i have gone to a different person each time snd still get terrible service. the customer service and professionalism just isnt there. on top of that i have always been a great tipper.  i have tipped between 30% and 50 % for sub par results.  i have gone here about 100 times in the past few years but this time is definitely my last.

juanita was amazing. i apologize for not remembering the lady who was going to do my hair. but, i give her kudos for admitting she was hesitant about doing my hair. i have a lotttt so i don't blame her. juanita stepped up and did fabulous! before and after
this place is terrible. the only positive is that it opens early on the weekends for morning birds like me but i will never come back to this place because of the terrible cut i got.

coleen had good reviews.. took a chance.. i said to her if she knew how to cut the style i wanted, said was familiar.. said she was a stylist for 9 years.  did the typical men's cut as they are known for.. uneven cut, 1/2inch on the top..never ever to to any great clips again.. does great job on men's hair..did not check in on web site... i had 3 people ahead of me. waited well over a hour...

giving 3 stars here kind of sucks for me. i am torn. i do like a lot of the stylists i have used. i just had one situation where i felt like they pushed product on me and then when i went to return it the return policy is that they send you a check in the mail 4-6 weeks later......whaaat? how about i paid with a credit card, put it back on that.i'll be back, but only for a cut:)

just had the best haircut experience of my life thanks to bailey. i am 57 with frizzy blonde hair. she cut and styled it too look like something out of a magazine. she did the styling part while i was turned to the side, so i wasn't sure what i was going to see when spun around. i literally dropped my jaw when she turned me to look at my hair. she is very talented and i had no idea my hair could look so great. plus she is great fun to talk to.!
they did a great job not sure why ppl are blasting them on yelp specially if your going to a wedding and you talk about how great your hair is
just got a cut from gabriella and she did a fantastic job. she actually listens and follows through with a great cut. i love it thank you gabriella! i will be back

wow i cannot even believe this place. words can not even express my anger. i went in to get a little trim 2 months before my wedding i was not looking for a new look i was just wanting a little maintenance. my hair stylist knew my goals. i have a long beautiful hair that goes all the way down my back and jeffrey took it upon himself to chop off 5 inches and cropped it just below my shoulders. i am devisisted. i should have known just from looking at him that i was gonna be in trouble. never trust a hairdresser that has a funky haircut. they all think they're artist and they all think they know best & do whatever they want even if you don't agree with it. i took my concern to the manager colleen but she treated me even worse. she was completely condescending and rude. "yes mrs, i will refund your $14" even though i spend $100 on the service and no amount of money can buy me my hair back before my big day.

i came here with average expectations but needed a haircut fast.  i waited less than 15 minutes and florentina was my stylist.  she was amazing.  my hair was a mess and i showed her a photo of the style i wanted and it was exactly the same as the photo.  would definitely come back!  the price is great too!
just needed a trim and bailey was quick and efficient. also gave me tips for my dry scalp. thank you!!

i've been coming here for about a year now and i'm always happy with their quality of work and professional.  flo gave my son and i excellent hair cut on wednesday.  we will both be sure to request her in the future.

went in on a recommendation from someone whose haircut i complimented, and i'm so glad i did! lance did a great job of cutting off my shoulder length hair...love my new pixie cut. (i was also observing flo and she looks very good as well.)

if you've never been to a great clips, be sure to get someone's attention before assuming your in line by sitting down, like any other barbershop.after waiting 15 minutes, i realized you have to sign up with your phone and address before your "in line".so after doing so, they decide to help someone who came in after me. walked out. never going to this chain clip shop again.
my hair cut is great! down side? my hair stylist was very aggressive. she shampooed and conditioned my hair, it felt as i if she was trying to rip my scalp off then wash my hair.....

fast, friendly and affordable. i have thick hair that's layered and juanita always does a great job and my hair moves & falls just right. ray used to cut my hair but he's no longer there, he did magic with his shears! i love the online check in! they always cut your hair exactly as you asked. highly recommend!!

i am back in az and need my hair cut...three weeks ago.  danielle did such a fabulous haircut for me that i decided to wait it out.  i want my hair cut today but i will have to wait until tomorrow because she is not in today. hope she has a great day off and stays cool!

need a quick haircut? stop by and someone will seat you within minutes. i always ask for the manager, colleen because she does a great job.i just read youri's comment about the app and looked it up on my phone. the app is called great clips online check in. use it to add your name to the list so that you have the chance of being next when you arrive. love it!
i really only get my hair cut once a year, but everytime i come here they're incredibly friendly. prices aren't bad, standard of your chain hair salons.

this place is very conveniently located to me so i've gone there a few times since they've opened.  they seem to have a high rate of employee turnover there so it's hard to get the same person more than once.  i've also had to go to another location to get my cut fixed on two separate occasions.

i checked in on line and when i walked in i was 1 on the screen. a man was checking in in person so he was 2 on the screen. adela tells me that the man was next since he checked in before me (the screen clearly showed him as 2). so what's the point of the on line check in if it's not being followed. very upsetting and she obviously doesn't know how to read a screen!

just returned from a first time visit to great clips on nacogdoches where my sister and i both dropped in for a cut.  having recently moved from oregon where the same person cut my hair for the last 10 years, i was nervous about trying out someone new.  relax!  lane was my stylist and he gave me as good a cut as i ever received in my nyc days or my portland, or days!  i was absolutely thrilled with the job he did and made sure that he knew that both verbally and with a tip.  similarly, my sister was exceptionally happy with the job jennifer did on her.  recognizing that hair stylists may come and go with uncommon frequency, i would proudly recommend lane to anyone looking for a professional experience at an unbelievably reasonable cost.  thank you lane!  will see you soon.
great place, great staff, great haircut ! definitely coming back ! the staff listened to what i wanted and the wait was low.

went there to get a haircut saw they informed me the wait would be awhile.i had to be on the way to work in a hour.left to stop and get something at another store thought to myself okay i killed some time let me go back and see how it looks.i would be next up great so i waited.was informed the manager would be doing my haircut.she was sweeping and cleaning up got on her phone and just kept talking.i was checking the time getting impatient.the manager knew i was waiting she saw me.another employee saw i was in a rush let her know my situation looked at the manager and the manager said she was having a crisis.and walked off.i left she lost a customer who would go there as well as my kids will never go back there again.

14 bucks for a men's haircut and i was in and out in less than 20 minutes on a friday afternoon... the heb kiddy corner from it also offers coupons for 9 dollar haircuts on the back of the receipts... nice staff as well latoya was very professional and new how to cut my hair on my first visit!
went next door for dunkin donuts. then for hair cuts. very convenient and easy to get in and out.

usually this location does a good job. today i had one of the worst haircuts i've had in years.  it started off as a trim but she kept cutting until it left my hair a way-too-short chopped-up mess. yes, the price is reasonable, but i'm not sure i'll ever ask for n----- to cut my hair again.

i had some good haircuts there befor, but this time the stylist  just did want she wanted . good location  but i'm  not coming back i told her don't cut the front, only thr back . i  walked out with a short front.just not happy with cindy,she is probably  a good barbor.
i have been to this great clips about 4 times.  my last two hair cut were done by alicia.  great job!  she does a wonderful job!

got a little clean up done today by joe, dude did awesome! i usually (like every time) hate getting hair cuts and am pretty disappointed after wards, but leaving this visit i was extremely satisfied and happy with the outcome.  thanks joe!

the only reason i'm not leaving one star is because they have online check-in(which is pretty nifty) and he did, in fact, cut my hair. which is what i paid for(however begrudgingly). my barber did not do anything that i asked for. all i wanted was a simple harcut, fade from the bottom to the top and then longer on the top. this is not what i received. he cut one side longer than the other, none of it is even, my bangs are all messed up, and i was not given the shampooing that i asked for. i am very displeased and i will not be coming back, i will also be recommending against great clips in the future. thank you for the waste of money.

sadly my previous stylist has left and the review has no more merit and the last few times have not gone so well... and then the most recent time i took my son for a visit clean up, half of his sideburn was cut diagonal in the wrong direction and super short, plus i had to go home and clean up the mess she left from using the thinning scissors without going over to clean up long uneven strands sticking out. i was tending to my toddler while he got his haircut and the stylist didn't even tell me. i noticed when we got tot he car... i'm not looking for amazing (which i actually got from a couple of stylist who used to work her) but not really bad can't be too much to ask. looks like i'm going to have to find a new place that can deliver some consistency

i have never been so rudely greeted by the barbers at this location which is the one i go to so often! i went in for a neck trim-when my grandkids and i walked in one of the ladies stated all these people are here and only one hair cut!! rude and unprofessional! i will prolly start going down the road to the helotes location if this is the way we will be treated

an inch is not 2 inches. i asked for a trim with no more than an inch removed. as the "stylist" began trimming she started on the back and cut  2 1/2 inches off. i just sat there stunned. at this point what can i say or do?  i know it's just hair but crap. i'm on vacation in san antonio for 7 weeks and i just needed a quick trim because i was going to the beach. i have a hair stylist in my hometown of reynoldsburg, ohio that i've been going to for 20+ years.  i'm was planning on going to her when i get home.  my advice, don't patronize this place unless you don't mind a hack job.  only reason i gave it a 2 star was because they have an online sign in.
i usually go to this place and always have someone different cut my hair.  i prefer to be in and out. with that said, i trust all the staff to cut my hair as i like it, without any long waiting time.

i do not give out my cell number because of privacy. i went to this location for a trim and when i politely refused to give my cell number the girl promptly said "someone else can deal with this" and walked away from the counter. i asked if they are refusing to cut my hair she said no but turned around and walked away. i can't believe a business would turn down my hard earned dollars over a phone number. rude, embarrassing, frustrating and a total waste of my time.

this is your standard great clips, maybe a step above some of the ones you'll find in san antonio. the staff is all friendly and nice and i was pleased with the way the woman did my hair. the only complaint i have is the wait time. i went on two different occassions and the wait was about 20 or 30 minutes... not unbearable, but not fun. i have two great clips i could go to and this is the one i choose because it is nicer than the other option. i recommend.

i just had a horrible experience at your bandera pointe location (1215hrs on 8/18/2014) in san antonio texas. a little history my son is less than a year old and he has already had five haircuts all at this location. all of our previous experiences has been wonderful the stylists have been patient and have done a great job at cutting my infant sons hair.today upon walking into the great clips store we didn't receive much of a welcoming greeting from the stylist that was about to cut my sons hair. as i sat down and placed my son in my lap the stylist began wetting down his hair as she started to cut i could tell that she was having a bad day or had little experience cutting children's hair by the look of frustration upon her face. after getting upset with me and my son twice because i refuse to force an infant not to move a little i got up and departed the location. after leaving the bandera pointe location my son and i proceeded to the huebner commons location here in san antonio where we where professionally greeted and i have to say dinorah who cut my sons hair did a wonderful job. i regret to say i didn't get the name of the lady at the bandera pointe store, but can describe her as an older red headed lady who's station if you were to walk in the front door is the first one on the left. i'm sorry if she was having a bad day, but her lack of professionalism will result in me advising other parents of small children to refrain from doing further business at that location.

i have been coming to this location for years,  i will be finding somewhere else going forward.  i got a bad haircut,  i can deal with that,  going back and getting a refund to be barked at and insulted by the guy who cut my hair is unacceptable.  having the manager recognize my bad haircut,  listen to her employee be extremely rude and not even apologize?! go anywhere else,  you'll thank yourself.

this place cut my hair so bad. i literally begged the older lady that helped me to only take off the very tips of my hair.. i started off asking for only a half inch to be cut; she told me she would have to trim a little more than that. basically she kept working me up the length she was going to cut it. she asked to cut 2 1/2 inches. i literally begged her to only trim 1 1/2. i was so obviously uncomfortable and felt like now that she had the scissors in her hands it wasn't really important what i wanted. i was right too, she ended up cutting a total of 4 inches off of my hair! literally! yeah yeah it's just hair and it grows back.. but hair is really important to girls, especially me.. anyway i shed a few tears over it lol. i had hair that touched my hips. now it barely covers my chest.. yeah.. that's fucked up. i spent years growing it out and she just chopped it into a generic medium length cut even after i begged her and showed her pics. anyway you get the point. i'm pissed.

i was so glad when this location opened!  close to home. as most great clips i've been to, clean, cool, and friendly peeps. a few have been here since opening but then again...  i typically don't come on the same days of the week. if you haven't yet, download the app and check in online. makes life easy when you arrive and also gives you a heads up on the wait.

haircuts can be expensive. ok now that i got captain obvious out of the way, great clips crosses a line.when they first started, haircuts were $8, then went up to $9...then $12...currently $14.now i can live with inflation...however...normally, i request a rinse after a haircut so i am not shedding clippings all day, and not itching either, and normally they give me a rinse.the last two times i went in, they refused the rinse because the manager or owner said that since it's not a regular menu service, they won't do it.  i went back after the first time thinking that was a one time thing, but nope... it's a thing. so they made me get a $4 shampoo in order to get rinsed. that effectively took the haircut up to $18, then tip took it over $23.now, for that price, i could go to the good barber or any sports clips and get a shampoo, hot towel, and neck and shoulder massage, and free neck trim between haircuts.  so basically, if i am forced to pay that amount, why bother to go to great clips at all if they offer less of a service? no brainer. i know, right!? i complained to corporate and they said they would contact the owner who, not surprisingly, never bothered to call me back.summary: for the most bang for the buck, great clips is totally not worth it. their menu reasoning is stupid. if you follow that reason, there are dozens of things that aren't in the service menu that they do anyway but shouldn't, right? until they change that a-hole policy, i won't go back. too bad for the employees, and it isn't their fault.still no word from the owner. the stylists are really cool here...the owner doesn't care one bit about you

if you're going to stop in here first check in online.  they get very busy and the wait can be long.  second when you get there ask for christine!  she is the only one who has been able to cut my hair the same visit after visit and she's great with my girls who have very curly hair!  i can't say we've had all the other stylists but a few and it wasn't great.  so my stars are for christine!

i recently moved to san antonio and have been missing my hair stylist in va who knew exactly how to cut and style my hair.1. have gotten my hair cut here a total of 3 times. first time the stylist did a great job. she normally does not work at this salon but, was there helping out. 2. went in for a trim a month or so later.  new person not the same person i had the first time the girl butchered my hair. i came home and washed and blew dried it out and my hair was unevenly cut. long strands here and there. it was terrible. one side longer than the other. how do you do this especially if you are supposedly professionally trained. 3. called great clips and they said i could come in and get my hair fixed for free. (they call it a redo) 4. luckily for me i got the first stylist and she fixed my hair and did a great job. i wish she was there permanently. seems like she is the only one that can cut hair. have not gone back since.

had a truly wonderful experience with ms. victoria! i have a regular hairstylist who does my color & she is wonderful, however i can no longer afford the $55 & up for a hair trim/cut. a friend referred me to victoria at this great clips location. i admit, i had pretty low expectations but i was blown away! victoria was very sweet & quick yet precise. i have to say this was one of the best haircuts i have ever had!!

they do a very bad job in this place. i have three boys that get haircuts and the only person that does a good job are nancy and the gentlemen that i can not remember his name. everyone else does a very poor job. i usually do not provide reviews, however, i gave up on this place because most of the hair stylists do an awful job. to bad because the place is very close to where i live.

this place is terrible. it have constantly given them chances and they always screw up. i always come out looking worse than i could imagine. it's just this great clips. the people that work their are just terrible at cutting hair. i will never consider going to a great clips again. they are the worst.

came to see yvette on my sister's recommendation and was not disappointed! she listened to what i wanted and understood my hairs texture and weight immediately. she suggested a few modifications to what i described, and my hair turned out great! love how the computer keeps track of how many visits to a discount, so there's no loyalty card to lose. this location is a little out of my way, but i will definitely be back!

great experience!  checked in online and glad i did.  went on a monday night and it was super busy.  the wait online said 38 minutes but when i got there 10 peeps had their name put in.  3 stylists there so i figured it would go by fast.  i was right.  i didn't wait more than 10 minutes.  nancy was friendly and listened while i told her and showed her what i wanted.  it didn't take her more than 15 minutes to get what i wanted.  $13.  great deal.  will be back.
the worst.. hair came out lopsided and all i asked for was a 2" cut, nothing fancy. lupe was the hair cutter.

i came to this great clips for a spur of the moment trim and i'm so glad that i did. i too had yvonne and she was wonderful. she was super nice and friendly but didn't force awkward small talk like some stylists do. she also gave me suggestions when i asked but was not overly pushy with them. she did an incredible job and i will definitely be back to see her!

i've been going here since the place opened. never ever had a bad cut. sometimes (extremely rare)  i'll get a cut that's not spectacular but still decent, but 9.9 out of 10 times i'll get exactly what i want and it looks amazing. even on their busiest days they take the time to ask all the right questions and check with you through the process. i've probably seen 8 or 10 different stylists there and they get it right. today i went and saw vanessa. it was busy but she took time, went above and beyond. in my opinion she stands out among the place. very good at what she does. i've gone to her twice now and both times did exactly the same thing going above and beyond what i asked for. i can totally tell she loves what she does. i won't be surprised when i find out she gets her own place. you'll be amazed no matter who cuts your hair but if you get vanessa, you'll see what i mean

i got out of my vehicle and checked my 14 year old son in for a hair cut an hour before closing.  i ran an errand accross the street.  i text my son i am omw and he responds that "the lady will not cut my hair because a parent is not here":(  i rush to great clips and get there 10 min before closing.  i ask my son if he likes his hair cut and he says no.  the lady was rushing.  now i have to pay again to fix this rush job.  another point is they have notes on the type of style of hair cut each member of my family likes so i do not know what the problem was.  not like my son needed to sit on my lap so i can make him stay still.  better yet, ask my son how he likes his hair cut.respectfully, dissatisfied customer

wish i could give zero stars. rude, rude, rude employees.  we checked in online, it was extremely busy when we got there.  three different employees were very rude to us: all before we even got checked in at the counter.  my husband asked me a rhetorical question, what is going on (as in why is it so busy).  several (4 or 5) were standing at the counter in spite of the volume of customers.  one sarcastically and loudly said, "its back to school, that's what's going on", in a tone that was very condescending.  meanwhile, another employee asked if we checked in online, i confirmed.  she asked for the name, i gave the last name.  she snapped at me and said "names, names, i need the names of everyone getting their haircut"...there were 3 of us).  then when referring to my daughter (who is told by everyone she is model material), she referred to her as "him", which i believe was done on purpose.  lastly, when the "names!" girl was asking names and spellings i confirmed her questions with "yep" instead of yes... which prompted a third girl (who was picking her fingernails and manually scraping chipped polish off while standing at the counter)to loudly mock me.  are you kidding?  unprofessional all around.  we turned around and left and never, i mean never going back.

worst haircut ever, i wish i could give this place a zero star. she was rushing with hair cut, she finished with in 10 mins. horrible customer service. i gave this place a second chance and they fucked it up once again. would never recommended to anyone. stay away from this place to save your time and money.

don't go, unless you're in basic training. actually, still don't go. places like these will lure people in because they're fast and cheap, but let me tell you they're gonna butcher it. avoid this establishment like the plague!!!

disorganized system of checking in clients that literally skipped over my husband who checked in online. as we waited in the shop we saw my husbands name go up the screen to number 1 and after that other clients went ahead of him and not one stylist there bothered to call out his name. the receptionist was not where she was supposed to be to validate check in so the system for online check in is completely useless. the manager was "on vacation" so of course there was  no one we could lodge a complaint with. never going back to this location. i feel that if you have an online check in system for your clients that come in for service that system should be used better.

i had a lot of anxiety before coming here. i can say all that was eased by melissa, she was so awesome and patient with me. she knows how to frame a face and i appreciate the time she took on me. i got in line online and only waited 15 mins to be seen. melissa is a total professional and i recommend her to anybody who's thinking about going. i like that they aren't pushy and don't try to up-sell.

horrible.  stylist was getting ready to take my child when someone else walked in and was helped right away because they checked in on line.  the whole process was horrible as nothing was explained to me.  i saw her getting set up for a four year old and then she tosses the booster aside and helps someone else without a word to me.  won't ever be back.  customer service goes a long way.

i'm fairly specific as to how i want my hair cut, i had gone to great clips last month and my stylist did a fantastic job.  however, i went in this morning and the experience was ridiculous.  after signing in on-line with no wait (that's nice), i asked the stylist assigned to me (christina) to provide the following:1. a number two clipper tapered to in line just below my temple (holds hands to demonstrate position).  2.from that point, my remaining hair should be the same length -- with approximately 1/2" to be cut.  that makes a sharp transition, not a gradual taper above the line i specified.  i can't have that or my hair will appear to spike between the taper and the top -- which i hate.3. i reiterated that i wore my hair exactly as i was wearing it when i walked in, so it should be symmetrical. i told her that like the sides of my hair to hang slightly over the taper and then demonstrated by pulling my hair on both sides and letting it drop over the sides.christina said, "no problem" and then started the taper.  she started off fine, the usual banter,  and confirmed the top length before cutting.  then she started blending the taper into the rest of my hair...,wait, what? halfway through the clearly uneven cut, she says -- "do you comb it to the side?" "uh, no -- i wear exactly as i did when i walked in."  however, i can't do that any more because of the chop job she did.  the taper was uneven on both sides and carried higher than i requested, i tell her as much to which she replies, "well, i think it looks good." i disagreed and she says: "no, it looks real good, you should wear it like that." i respond with, "well, i guess i've got no choice really."  here's some advice: your opinion of what the haircut looks like is not as important as delivering the haircut i requested.  i suppose some of these stylists are capable of a single haircut and that's what you're going to get when you walk in.she then asks, "is there anything else you want me to do?"  from the customer perspective, that's a nonsensical question.  you didn't do what i asked you to do the first time so why would i bother providing additional instructions.  however, as a glutton for bad hair styles, i tell her we'll have to continue the taper and take more length off the top or it's going to be difficult to style.  she tells me again that it looks good.  nice.  i told her i was done and walked out at 9:39 am  with what can only be described as the worst haircut i've ever received.  but hey, christina liked it, so i guess that's all that matters.    bottom line, i've had a great stylist (i think she was a manager -- she was awesome) and one that ignored everything i said.  unfortunately in business you're only as strong as your weakest staff member.  so, one star.

horrible experience... walked in friday morning at 10am with my morning coffee and my fiance. i sat down to wait for him in the waiting area and was told by a woman who was vigorously tapping a handwritten sign by the register no drink allowed. i asked since i was just sitting in the lobby if that was ok and all 3 of the employees now at the register stated in unison, no it's not allowed. needless to say we walked out and he went elsewhere. i understand kids, spills, cleanup, etc. but a grown woman with a lidded coffee??

went in for the first time and got a hair cut within 5 minutes. samantha was my stylist and she was great. she talked most of the time and seemed to like her job. she was very tentative to styling my hair and to asked if i was happy with it so far and what she needed to do to it. will be going back. *update* i have been to this location for over a year now and go every 3-4 weeks. they have quite a bit of turn over but all the girls they get are good and always a good cut. enjoy!

the online check-in is a great plus for this place. it's always very busy, so that's a good sign that they do well. they are in line with pricing. just wish they would keep the personal banter to a minimum. it can get very sexually vulgar with these ladies. keep in mind if you bring kids.

totally messed up mine and my sons  hair! from out of town and i saw good reviews, went and was very disappointed. have a wedding to go to and have to make due with what i have. never coming here again when i'm in town. rather let it grow out.

with all the commutable illnesses that can be contracted, the service industry needs to be on high alert regarding cleanliness. i walked into this place with hair balls in the carpeted area. the "stylists" work area was covered in hair and her scissors were covered in the last person's (or others before) hair. when i asked if she had other clean scissors. she stopped what she was doing (about to cut my hair with dirty scissors) and cleaned them off with barbacide (sp?) and a dirty towel. sorry but i will not be going back there again. one nic from a dirty clipper and you'll never know what you'll get.
the whole family had had a haircut here at some time.  they do a great job and the cut is $10 for kids and $12 for adults.  they are always courteous even when the place is packed.
got a cut by stephanie. she was great. did exactly what i wanted and made sure i didn't want any changes when she was done.

this hair salon doesn't offer any way to sign up for their extensive wait of at least an hour and a half except for walk ins and downloading their corporate app. if you call, they are abrupt and push you off the phone. when you finally get a haircut they tell you most things are against policy and one of their stylists will use your shoulder to get the hair off you by hitting your collarbone over and over, leaving a bruise. also havjng gone multiple times there have been no repeat stylists, forcing me to have to repeat what i need to a person who won't cut it exactly the same way as my previous hair cut. overall crap, for children and never for business or military. their fades are absolute crap and will make it so you have to come back in and ask for a redo from another stylist.

i considered giving this locations a one star review but lucked out from learning if it would earn such a review. i walked in today to see the place was busy; there were five stylists working and five people on the list before me. when i checked in the stylist was rude, expressing her frustration that i was a new customer with a groan and eye roll and she'd need to input my name and number. she was unable/unwilling to give an estimated wait time. once seated, i saw another customer walk toward the cashier after receiving a cut; his haircut was bad, the hair line on the back his neck was obviously crooked. this poor guy clearly had no clue what was going on the back of his head. i immediately got up and left.with all the other options in the area, the choice was easy for me to go down the street.
excellent service: johnny is as good as any salon barber.the sign in is a great feature!!

we have been customers at their locations in san antonio for over twenty years.the past two years we have noticed that the stylists have changed every week.the quality of many of the new techs is pretty bad and we can never get our favorite stylist because they always transfer people from their normal locations.   unlike most hair salons, great clips does not believe you should rely on a certainperson to cut your hair. now, every time you visit great clips you take a chance on a potluck stylist and that will not work for us.  contacting the corporate office for great clips does not work. they have no control of the local owners who don't care. they just want to grow as large as they can and make lots of dough. the individual customer is of zero concern at great clips.

don't bother coming here. use your money on more experienced stylists.  most of these girls seem straight out of school and don't do a good job at listening to what you want done and also overlook the cut they've done, because the past 3 times my son's hair always had hair peices that are long and they didn't cut or...his line was crooked and had to take him back twice.  they don't act too friendly and inviting especially the manager. i do not reccomend coming here. take your son's to a actual barber. the dudes tend to take their time and get it right unlike the females.

terrible customer service. online check in completely inaccurate.  checked in online and was quoted a 20 minute wait time. arrived 5 minutes prior to our appointment time and when we checked in we had a 25 minute wait from that point. stylists are extremely rude and do not care that your quoted wait time is grossly underestimated.  don't waste your time on the app or this mismanaged business. so many other options in ah where your business is appreciated.

i had been going to this location for hair cuts, however today i was treated very rudely and did not get the type of service i expect. i went to check in online and was received a message stating that they were not accepting online check-ins. they showed a 56 minute wait on the website. so, i called and dominic answered the phone. i told him that i was trying to check in online and it would not let me, and he did not know why it would not let me perhaps for the length of wait time. i asked if he would check me in over the phone and he stated he could not do that it was only available online. he stated i would have to come to the location to check in. i let him know that did not make sense to me and he got a very condescending tone and said if i want to get in that is what i have to do or wait until. it does not make any sense to me that they would want me to drive in, check in, and wait for an hour sitting there. they created the check in service so their clients would not have to wait like this and i am confused on why it matters how you check in. so i let dominic know that i would find a new location to get my hair cut, for good.

they have an app for androids and iphones now. this app tells you how long the wait time is and let's you check in. if your taking the whole family you can check everyone in. so convenient and so web 2.0.got my cut by maria today. she took her time and did an excellent job.
hit or miss depending on who is working that day. staff is friendly, ample parking, and it's great that they save info from your last visit, but the haircuts are not consistently good.

i always said i'd never get my haircut at a place like this due to my overwhelming fear of getting my hair butchered. the girls at great clips put my fears to rest. always super friendly and upbeat you can't go wrong here. great clips have saved me in a pinch and they'll do the same for you!!

my 80-year-old father went for a haircut at this great clips recently.  five minutes after this great clips ran his credit card, which he handed to the gc employee to pay for his haircut (and tip), that card was also "somehow" billed for an $800 online purchase with a company we have never heard of.  and then another online purchase was made. our bank alerted us.to activity on my father's credit card because it was highly unusual for his card.   when we called this gc store, the great clips manager was of no help though.  thus, we will never go there again.  be careful of this particular store.

even though this is convenient and we come here all the time - i was very dissappointed with the last trip.  i thought my husband was to blame every time my son came home with all of his gorgeous curly hair cut to bits.  so - i took him this time and gave specific instructions on his haircut.  did she listen to one word i said?  no!   it was awful - i will not go back and let them do that again to my five year old again!   poor kid, i think he's young enough that he won't be scarred for life.   hello - listen to your cusomers please!!!!   they got two stars because they give free lollipops after your haircut and it is fast.  (maybe fast because they don't listen and cut everyone's hair the same or however they heck they want to do it!!!!)

i have been using this great clips for over 2 years. i've met the owners. they had a stylist who has since moved on, i was sad, he was awesome. even styled my hair in a way that covered a defective hairline. but the last 2 times, treecey has been my stylist. wow the conversation, the attention to detail and helping me look my best. treecey is the best!!! and trust me, i need all the help i can get!!!for reasons i do not want to get in to, i have a reasonable special accommodation - not getting cuts at a certain station, this place is awesome in making us feel welcomed and valued and appreciated. treecey is really the best !!!

i get haircuts on a regular for military training. i decided to try this location because i was in the area and had a good experience there before. i am not one to write a bad review but when an employee gets a whole store to laugh at a customer its just not right. i was a bit hesitant to write this but i honestly have nothing good to say. i check in and get taken right away by tamber. she was the only one that didnt have people waiting for her so i guess that should have been a sign for me to not go with her. i get seated and she makes small talk, which was nice until i commented on the lenght of the top of my hair. i made a comment asking her to "make it short on the top and that you can't really mess it up because if anything goes wrong i can just shave my head since i am military." her response to me was "don't judge me, remember i'm the one cutting your hair". as soon as she said that everyone in the waiting area started laughing, including herself. i took it as her making fun of me and i felt embarrassed and humiliated in front of everyone. i'm not saying she's bad at cutting hair but she can improve her skills with her customers or maybe have a different approach because not every customer is open to being laughed at. i'm a very quiet and to myself person but i also feel like if i wanted to get laughed at i would be at a comedy club. tamber is not someone i would recommend going to. i hope no one has to endure what i did but i highly dont recommend tamber at all.

i don't like posting negative comments but....horrible service and several rude people working there.never going there again; other great clips out there that will do a better job and actually value my business; courtesy and customer service goes a long way and folks there need re-training in those key areas!

very rude employee told us they were closed at 7pm when online and in store said closing time was 8 pm we also were checked in online.the employee immediately told us in very rude tone that they were closed and demanded us to leave without an apology or any sympathy towards customer.

i told the lady what i wanted, 4 on the sides tapered to a 0 (with the 0 being really low) she brought the zero basically up to the crown of my head on the sides and you can see perfect squares on the back taper. when i told her if she could blend it in better she said "your head is shaped weird with bumps but i can try to make it not show". i have never been to a barber in my entire life who has commented on any "weird bumps" on my head that has affected my haircut. i have been here before and enjoyed it, but this lady (lagenia is on the receipt) showed lack of understanding of what i told her i wanted and lack of skill to complete the job i paid her to do and then blamed it on me for her lack of skills. i have faith in the store but not in this women. i guess it's my fault for assuming if you can get hired you should be half decent at your job.

walked in and two barbers free and no one waiting. purple hair lady checked me in asked if i checked in online, when i said no she told me to have a seat. waited 10 min, she got her check in and mademe wait. the either barber walked in the back room.  as i got up to leave he left too. crappy service. more concerned about corporate wait time.  ever going back, plenty of other shops in town

got my haircut by daniel today and i know who'll be cutting my hair from now on! talk about skill he gave me a fantastic haircut and was very attentive to what i wanted done. he's a fantastic stylist!

i normally come to this great clips and it's always been awesome until today new staff and they guy that i was getting my haircut had some attitude he asked what i wanted and i said i'll get the same haircut like last since they always document notes for your next haircut nope he was having a really bad attitude and when i gave him a look of disgust he played it off by saying he was joking and the rest of the haircut went awful as i was just saying anything to get out of there and not get pissed off. the other employees saw as well and did nothing nor accommodated for it all they said was there's your total and expected a tip

today i got my hair cut for the first time in over a year. i was really hesitant to go to great clips since the last time my hair was cut way shorter than i asked for. kelly was my hair stylist and she made me super comfortable. she would consult me on every cut she made. even though i live in helotes, i will drive to this great clips because i felt that as a customer i actually mattered.

first time back to a great clips/chain haircut place since asking for a 1 on the sides and getting a buzz cut at a sportsclips. i was impressed by the check-in system which makes the waiting process slightly less tedious but really just saves you the trouble of writing your name on a piece of paper or remembering who came in before and after you - for that i give 2 stars for keeping up with the times. now for the cut. after about 30-45 min of waiting, which is very good for a sunday afternoon, i was shown to my seat by linda whom i trusted with her 40+ years of cutting hair. i had my hair styled in a classic side part, pretty straight forward and standard. just a trim is all i asked for, keeping the same style, straight tapered side burns with a hard part for emphasis/ease in future styling for myself. i knew this wasn't going to be prettying when she begins to cut my sideburns and the clipper randomly turns off and rips the hair out of the side of my head. this happened 2 more times until she switched clippers and plugged into a new socket. things afterward went fairly normal but the end product ended up with a terrible blend on the sides that puffs out and top that was equally trimmed. i now have an ice cream cone hair shape instead of my clean, slicked sides and top which took 4 months of cuts with my barber in houston to achieve. needless to say, i've lost all faith in these run of the mill salons that get people in and out. it's great for kids who don't need anything out of the ordinary but if you're a guy looking for a serious cut, take the time to find a barber who knows men's hair - it's well worth the "trouble". but hey, it's just hair, it'll grow back, right?

after leaving the bandera pointe location dissatisfied  today , my son and i proceeded to the huebner commons location here in san antonio where we where professionally greeted and i have to say dinorah who cut my sons hair did a wonderful job.  john used to cut my hair for many years until the drive got to be too far but i have to say he is one of the best. i highly recommend both of these stylist if your looking for a great haircut.

erika (i think that was her name) gave me the best first-time haircut in my life. that is no joke. we had never met and i just walked in off the street. then i waited a long time to go back since i wanted to see if she could do it again, even if she kind of forgot me. when i went back, she sort of did not remember me, which was good for my plan. and guess what? another perfect cut. wow. here's the kicker: when she asked me how i wanted it cut, both times, i just said, "make it look good". and she sure did.i wish i could go to her for the rest of my life. but since i am not now in texas, here's hoping she will open her own line of salons and/or salon school. please, please, please erika, teach others to give those kinds of cuts! maybe great clips could get her to be national trainer or something. whenever i am back in town, i will be stopping by.(btw, if i have the wrong name, sorry, but i also recall her having a partial gold crown on a tooth. that would be another way to find her.)

i have to cut my hair once a month so i have been here a couple of times.  if you come early on a weekday there is no wait and you can get in and out in 10-15 minutes.  the staff is friendly and competent so if you need a trim in a hurry, this is the place to go.
the pricing is not too bad, but the quality is really not there.i'm sure it's a hit or miss since they have multiple hair dressers, but i think quality control can definitely use some work.

i walked in and two stylist where sitting down they said it will be a few minutes. another customer walks in and goes straight to a chair a few minutes later another customer walks in and sits straight down. then i look back at the screen and i go from next to position 5 on the list while no one else walked in

wow this is the worst place ever! i walked in to get my veterans card and this so called manager lakent gave me the worst attitude about getting my card.  he said i had to get a service today and all this song and dance and told me to adjust my attitude. someone made this guy the manager. yea if you want attitude served on a platter this is the place and so much for the respect of other veterans.

so it's haircut time an i decided to try out this location instead of my usual hair stylist but oh my yelper's i think i made a mistake but it's ok i'm on yelp helping my brother an sister yelper's don't come here unless you a different hair stylist then who i had her name was sarah an wow she definitely needs to look into a new line of work first of all talk to your customers i mean talk about awkward silence we could of talked about the weather or my day or even yours we could of talked about your two time hair two tone hair of blonde an black i would have been happy to talk about your upper center lip piercing anything but silence not good in my opinion but if you like that type of stylish omg you'll love her not me then 2nd thing (shaking my head) in dis belief of the mistake you made following not talking to me, yelper's can you believe it my fade was uneven when i told her she even tried to fix it but was unsuccessful made it even more uneven i was completely flabbergasted by this that after attempting to fix her own mistake i gave up an said forget it what's done is done so finally when i thought it can get worse it does wow i said finger length top no not sarah she does what she wants an then her come the clippers not sure where she was gonna cut with the clippers by the time she did the top of my head it was to late why sarah well if she thought it was gonna look good she was wrong not only did she leave my hair uneven it now it's also extremely short no need to style well i will say a few good things about this place so i don't seem like i'm bashing it too harsh when i walked in i was immediately greeted felt very welcome to arrive thank you an the restroom is excellent clean  good luck yelper's if you choose to cut your hair here if i knew this was gonna happen i would have gone to a kindergarten school to cut my hair by kindergarteners i'm sure it would of came out better then this

these people really don't care about their job. they don't care about the customer. when i went, i had to sign up using the online wait list. the waitlist told me that i had a specific time to show up. i showed up 10 minutes before that time, but i was never registered in their system or i was skipped. the clerk told me that i needed to register online again or register in person and wait for another hour. this has happened twice now and i felt that i was just another number in their system. definitely do not want to return here ever again. they don't care about keeping their customers and so i will not come here again.
horrible experience here came in for a trim and came out with a high and tight.... i will not be getting a hair cut at great clips here again

went in for a quick trim and left totally butchered. throughout the cut my stylist was distracted and left my seat about 15 times to handle the front desk and reprimand employees in front of everyone. should have gone with my gut and got out of there asap, but i had to take my glasses off for the cut and i couldn't see what was happening.  terrible move. i asked for a trim and to blend it a little longer up top, and came away looking like a damn adolf toadstool from mario brothers and had to pay $15 bucks to walk out in my hat. terrible. if you have hair and want anything other than a buzz, do not go here.

the wait here is horrendous and even if you check in online they don't see you on time, so what's the point. the only they are busy is because there no other salons or places to get your haircut nearby. i only use this place when i have to and i usually regret it. funny thing is i never have these issues at other great clips locations.

i've never had to wait too long at all here when i check in online. i've always gotten good haircuts and never had any complaints. i had rose and she did a wonderful job and was very friendly the whole time.

don't get a haircut from jennifer she cuts your hair really rough & she seems a little bitchy i just can't believe how bad she cut my hair and my hair was a simple men's haircut and she was complaining how long its taking to cut my hair. um i'm a guy!!! my hair is not that long!!! it's only been 2 weeks since i got my hair cut from another stylist at this location..so i don't understand why your complaining.. you need to find a different job!! and i'll stick to the other stylist thanks!!

hasn't given me any issues and they know how to cut my hair because of the frequent customer app they run. only reason it is not 5 stars is their conversation to each other was unprofessional and they didn't tell me about the free rinse after until i asked about it.  i mean every guy hates that itchy feeling around the neck after a haircut.

i recently moved from out of town and am very loyal my hairstylist but it was time for me to find a new place.   this particular location is close to my home and the first time a man there cut it all wrong however i went back and they fixed it up.  now i went again and the girl that i got this time cut my ear and didnt tell me. i felt a knick but that was that, i was disappointed slightly with the cut but when i got home i saw my ear was bleeding. i became furious and went back in.  they just cant seem to get it right.  a lady with salt and pepper hair is always the one who takes my complaint.she seems to be the only one that knows what she is doing , everyone else not so much

this is about one particular hairstylist name nancy. usually i don't have a problem with great clips, but this time, it was awful. she was brushing through my hair and claimed that she sees head lice. um, what? she then brush flake off to show me... it was dandruff. but she kept insisting it was lice. so i left and went to my doctor's office. it was dandruff. how can someone be so stupid to accuse a customer of having head lice when you can't tell the difference between dandruff and lice? never coming back there again.

unfortunately i forgot the woman's name who cut my hair, but she was very nice to me and gave me a great cut. i was very surprised. i have gone to a few different great clips and it's usually a terrible cut, but she was great. i just moved to san antonio and it was a nice to talk to a friendly person.

might as well have done it myself...earlier today i took my son for a haircut. after waiting for over half an hour as others "previously signed in" took their seats, my son finally was served.my son is a special needs person, and is very uncomfortable with confrontations or advocating actively for himself. at the end of the alleged "haircut" session, he was left with a "wicked comb-over" for the front of his scalp, and a poorly shaped occiput and collar line. to add insult to injury, the employee (whom i refuse to call a "stylist") accepted a gratuity exceeding 50% of the bill, without missing a beat.i strongly encourage prospective customers to look elsewhere, or just cut your own hair. you'll be better satisfied, and you'll save some money.
like i said in my last post, i went back and i am happy and satisfied even more. kim did amazing job and now i know for sure i will be back.
i understan this places they do a lot of employee rotation. but personally i got a very good service from diana.

thanks,  heidi..... for giving my son a great haircut for the last few days of school. the cut looks awesome for our vaca.   it was a quick, painless, visit as always!!  there were about 10 people waiting to get haircuts and everyone got taken care of quickly.   that is what we hope for when it is beautiful outside.

the service was lackluster, but i wouldn't expect much better from a quickie haircut place. they could have been a bit friendlier. i didn't get my haircut, but my friend did and the end result was good. nobody was there at noon on a saturday, so if you're in a hurry, i'd recommend it, just don't expect the friendliest of people.

steven is the worst stylist in this establishment. he smells and coughs everywhere. he has cut my hair the last 2 times i've been in and totally screwed up. today he cut one side of my bangs but not the other. don't worry i fixed it myself.

cindy is the best!!! def give her a try! they take appointments and walk ins at this place too. not to mention it was pretty cheap too. i am very picky on who i let do my hair but i needed a trim really bad so i gave this place a try. i can say that i have found a home for my hair. they do men's and women's and cindy is very nice, funny, and talented. you won't be sorry!

horrible i just got my haircut there today and it looks horrible worst haircut i've ever gotten. you definitely get what you pay for,  the staff is very unprofessional and you can tell that some of them don't know what they are doing. now i have to go somewhere else and pay more to get it fixed should've just paid extra to go somewhere better in the first place

i like getting my hair cut but online check in system is bull crap. when i walk in 2 onlines ahead of me. only my son and i are here i got hair cut my son had to wait for these 2 guys because they showed up. they keep the online check ins for an hour. total crap i always try not to go here anymore because of this

i don't even know where to start, our experience was bad all around.  i went in with my husband and two sons and all three of them got a bad haircut.  the worst was my six and half year old.  jackie, the woman cutting his hair, actually hurt him cutting his hair and made him cry.  i thought at first he was just being whiney but then i saw that he was actually bleeding!!!  seriously??  he was being still there was no reason for him to be bleeding.  amanda b cut my husband's and two year old's hair did an ok job but she was incredibly unfriendly.  actually there didn't seem to be a friendly person in the place.  as soon as we walked out i promised my older son that we would never go back there.  do yourself a favor and go across the street to sports clips.

i would take away stars if i could.  worst experience for me and my family.  two days ago i took my 5 yr old daughter & 4 yr old son there because i thought it would be more affordable than the kid places and just as good - i was so wrong!my daughter has loose curls and i have straight hair so i don't always know who things are going to turn out with her hair.  i explained to the woman cutting that my daughter wanted short hair - like at the end of rapunzel - and showed her what i meant.  i also let her know that i was worried since i knew the curls would spring up and didn't know what it would turn out like.  i asked her if i should keep it longer or if the cut works on short hair?  she couldn't give me any idea what so ever.  she said, "so you want it to hit her neck?"  i said, "no, not if it won't look right.  what will curly hair  look like?"  she just looked at my daughter's hair and didn't say anything but sort of shrug her shoulders.  since the woman had long hair with some curl in it, i told her to just trim and keep it long with layers.  usually they can do someone else's hair like their own. the layers are horrible!  it's like she tried to give it a feathery look that just doesn't work with curls.  instead of the beautiful individual curls we started with, she now has one continuous wave at the back of her head.my son's hair didn't turn out any better from the other woman who cut his hair.  my husband stood by and explained to keep it a little long on top.  she took the order and spent the rest of the time talking to another associate.  she cut it short like a military cut (which i did not want).  and my poor son has crooked cuts all over his head!i gave it two days to see if their hair would settle to something nicer, since fresh cuts sometimes (but rarely) be deceiving, but i can still see the jagged cuts in my son's hair and my daughter's hair is even less cooperative even though i'm using products that usually tame it.  the only reason i haven't gone in to complain is because i would have to bring the kids to show what's wrong and i don't want the kids to hear me say something negative about their cuts.sorry i don't have staff names, but it was not the cindy mentioned in the other review.
thanks shannon! love my hair ! u did an excellent job! hadnt had my hair cut in a long time and u nailed it!!!much thanks!!!lucy

went here for my son's haircut on a referral from family in the area. wait was 45+ minutes when we signed in but that was my fault for waiting to come in until the evening. the place is clean, including the restroom. decent amount of products in stock. "imma" cut my son's hair and did a pretty good job. she made sure to put his haircut description into their system so the next time we go in, the stylist will already know what he prefers. likes: i liked that as you sign in a monitor faces the customers so you can see how many people are ahead of you. i liked that as people came in they are greeted. i liked that customers are apparently able to sign in online/on an app. dislikes: none as of yet.
