got the military cut with a 2 on sides on longer on top. the woman who cut my hair said she had 37 years of experience...i got home and my hair line was jacked. none of my fade was even and the blending was awful. worst haircut i've ever received. i went up to the scripps ranch location and luckily they fixed it for me for free. i don't do yelp reviews much so that tells you how awful this cut was!

trang did an awesome job on my hair. at first i was nervous because i'm new to town and it was my first haircut in san diego. when she was done i was a little bit skeptical because she did it so quickly but i have friends telling me it's one of the best haircuts i've ever had. she saw that i wasn't happy at first and told me i didn't have to pay. i felt bad because she did a great job. i'll definitely go back to her again.

i've come in to this great clips location twice in the last few months, and all i have to say is wow.the first time i came in was to fix a haircut that was done poorly by another (not great clips) shop. christiano did an amazing job fixing it, and even though it was busy i was in and out quickly.the second time i came in was for a normal haircut and it was months later. christiano remembered me personally and once again the service was fantastic. he even trimmed my beard. i will continue going here for my cuts, and highly recommend them!

this place is awesome!!! walked in and was out in no time!!! the staff is amazing and the price was great. christiano (manager) has a phenomenal personality and his staff is very kind and helpful. we shared some laughs and i totally felt like i was at home. my best hair experience here in california by far! this is a great cohesive team on the rise. thank you so much christiano for the trim and layers!!! keep up the great work :) morgan witherspoon

i came in and did not realize the coupon was a week expired. they did not honor the coupon. i ended up paying $18 for the hair cut. with tips i paid $20 for a hair cut. i am cheap. i've never paid for more than $15 hair cut.

this great clips is well...great! the staff was friendly on the phone and when i arrived. they are also knowledgable and cut my hair well. i felt welcome and that my business was appreciated. online check in was very convenient. i will definitely be returning.

this may be a great hidden secret for a good, reasonable hair cut. i took my son to this location late one weeknight because the great clips we usually go to had a 23 minute wait. so we checked-in online at this location close to our house. there was no one in there except for the two hair stylists. ruben cut my son's hair. he did an amazing job. he knew exactly what to do to make my son's hair look good and i didn't have to tell him much of anything. just confirmed his usual.i made sure to find out when he works and he told me that he usually works nights. great. i'll plan on coming back with my other son!
very nice haircut place i always come here . zakia was super nice and took the best care of me . i got a fresh haircut and will be back!super fast too

i just got home with my son and i want to cry. i explained to the lady who called us to her chair that he has autism and doesn't always respond to verbal commands......she then took it upon herself to buzz his head, she had already run the clippers across his head before i could even utter a word. we never ask for clippers because my son has a few cowlicks and keeping it a bit longer helps. i walked in to show my neighbor and she immediately noticed all the uneven areas on his head. i would go complain but he's 3 and it will grow back. i just know now i need a new place to take him.
got a great haircut from cheri at great clips tonight. she knows how to blend the sides to the top really well. i got exactly the haircut i wanted and my wife liked it too. always a plus.

yelp reviews are rarely checked before one goes, eats or visits a location. it it used to find places and some will browse reviews, but most are smart enough to know that people have opinions.... and opinions are like... yada yada yada.... you know the rest.  soooo here is my opinion.   service is... ok. a few stylist that cant cut hair right to save their lives, but most are decent and a couple are really good. but not worth $18! so if i have a coupon or special... yep, i will go. otherwise you can get same service or better pretty much anywhere in the 10 mi radius of this location.  they have huge turn around here and most saturday afternoons.. its dead! so that says a lot. try for yourself... again, just my opinion.
this place is fucking ass, i use to always go here. not anymore, i've had to redo my hair again just because people here don't know how to cut.

came here to this location for the first time and impressed with the quick service. zakia was really good. she is quick and gave me a great haircut. and also told what kinds of hairstyle i can do in future. i am definitely coming back to her

came here for the first time today on a recommendation and i was very happy with my haircut.  ruben did a great job and i really enjoyed his expertise and customer service. i'll be back. the salon was very nice and clean too.   cori went back for a second time. i was charged way too much. felt like bait and switch to me. it cost much higher than i expected because of the higher prices.  cori
they have messed up my hair on multiple occasions, but have offered to fix it for free. might come again, prices are okay.

ive come here multiple times and i am very satisfied with the haircuts they give me. they are friendly and make you feel comfortable. i've been coming here for a while now. my hair cuts are all done by the barber rubenes never messed up my hair.

ruben cut my hair tonight. he did a great job. i'm a previous customer from the poway location by target. due to lack of customer service and one stylist that smelled like an ash tray i am no longer going to go there. thanks ruben, best haircut i've had in a very long time!!!

i usually don't have the best experiences when i just walk in to have my sons hair cut but when ruben cuts it.....always on point!! i hope and pray is there everytime i go.  from now on im just going to call and make sure first.  he is so personable and always doing his best to make sure everyone is happy!! ask for ruben!!!

it's so hard to find a great hair stylist!  been shuffling between various locations and people!  i got a haircut at a different location and they messed up my hair!  then came into this location the next day to get my hair redone and ruben helped me out and did a fantastic job!  he did such an awesome job i would recommend him to anyone and everyone!  still come to get my haircut and will always request ruben!  thank you great clips and especially ruben for the great fantastic haircut!!!

i have been going to this great clips since 2007 and i have to say i have been satisfied until today. today's visit was awful. i felt like i was being pressured into buying products. all i wanted was to go in for a trim and to leave. i was not only being pressured by the stylist but also by a manager which i thought was rude in more than one way. he made a comment about my gray hair that i didn't appreciate and he also was talking to my stylist about a mistake she made prior to helping me. i thought he could have waited until she was done trimming my hair before talking to her. because of these experiences i think i may find a new place.

everyone was nice,i left thinking that the cut i had was good, until i got home. my wife pointed out a lot of big chop and uneven, just careless work. i wont be returning there.i would name the stylist but maybe she was having a bad day on my cut, none the least inexcusable.i went to your competitor to get it straightened out. tayler

i've been coming to the location for the last 2 months for 1 reason and 1 reason only: ruben. he cuts your hair so gently and precisely. i used to go to a different great clips location, only 5 minutes from my house, but once i heard ruben moved locations to rancho, i go here every time, even though it's 25 min from my house now.
very responsive to our needs as a family and myself as a professional working in hospital.

i am responding to this because a couple people have unfairly characterized jacqui, a hairstylist i have been seeing for about ten years now. i simply will not allow anyone else to cut my hair. over the last ten years my hair style hasn't changed much, slight tweaks here and there to keep up with the times. but one thing that has never changed is my satisfaction with jacqui's work. i honestly can't review anyone else at this great clips because she's the only one i will see.
i always come to this location and always end up with a great haircut and shampoo, love love this place.....

i usually go to this place for my haircuts. i'm pretty satisfied with all my haircut experiences here (4 or 5 times so far). it's clean. easy to check-in. i get my haircut by kim. she's friendly and does a good job. very comfortable place to get my simple haircut.
fast hair cut...un friendly lady...doesn't say a word...she handles the clipper and scissors like she is force to cut my hair. i will never...ever go back to that place

worst hair cut ever.asian lady is so horrible . she made my hair exotremely short. i have asked her to do something else and she has done like man hair cut. she is horrible .i m planning to complain about her to the great clips head quarter and make her fire .

my husband took our 5 year old son to great clips for a haircut this week. they have a sign in their window saying "military discount" . when my husband went to pay for the haircut he showed his military id but was told the discount is not for dependants.  won't be going to great clips anymore!

i get my hair cut here and every time i think i want to try somewhere else i end up coming back here to get my hair fixed. i have had just about everyone here cut my hair and they are all really good. i absolutely love yafa though. love. love. love. love. she is awesome! she's also really honest when i need opinions about anything so its nice talking to her while getting my hair cut. this place is really cheap for a hair cut and i really don't understand how they only have 2 stars on yelp. i don't dye my hair so i can't comment on that aspect but the cuts are solid. i also really enjoy getting the conditioning treatments here. they make my hair feel super soft and silky after. i also love that while i'm here they never try to push products on me. the staff is also very patient with all my strange and untraditional requests for random cuts here and there.

this is the worst place i have ever been too. my hair looks like a freaking lawn mower went over my head. the tall black lady(jackie) had no idea what she was doing!!! she was careless didnt even listen to what i wanted just started hacking away... not only does my hair look like crap but when she was cutting my hair she was flinging her scissors around could have cut me if they feel off her fingers. no blending done to my hair when i got home i had to have my roommates fixed all extra long areas... do not go here. i had to call and complain to the manager. horrible !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

this great clips is my hole in the wall, quick touch up spot. it's almost always not busy, very easy to just stroll in and sit right down. place is pretty clean, minus the location on the side of the strip mall. the employees are okay. not very chatty and don't look like they like what they do. i wouldn't choose this location for any major hair job. quick touch ups, yeah stop by.

where to start? the russian woman is great, and does a good job. don't even considering seeing anyone else. they seem to train a lot of people, there are usually 2 to 4 people there who don't even know to work the clippers. my brothers haircut is usually pretty terrible, but this time it took the cake. she spent 30 minutes cutting his hair without clippers, and when she used the clippers on his neck she took a chunk out of the line and just left it. see attached picture. didn't know how to work the register, confirming that she was another trainee. there's one good woman there, but she is always busy so don't even dream about walking in and finding her available.
ok , old ladies in as stylist they don't understand english they know traditional way of cutting onlycannot do what pictures u show them .  was not satisfied hm they did not blow drive wholly too hm

i've gotten my hair cut by four of the different stylist/barbers and they are without a doubt the best i've been to. i can speak from personal experience that if you get your hair cut by jackie (i know i spelled this wrong), kim or debbie you will not be disappointed. love this spot!

we've been coming to this great clips for a few years, and they always do a good job. my wife gets her hair cut by kim and she always loves it! for men it's fast too, and they don't try to up sell you with unnecessary stuff which is great. can't beat the price either.

we took our daughter for an emergency fix hair cut here after someone at the pb location butchered her haircut. melissa was wonderful and somehow salvaged my daughters hair. we are grateful for her help!
kim is the best, always a good haircut. she is super friendly and does a great job. check in online and save yourself some time.

i walked in and it was empty, so that was different from my usual hairdresser. i showed her a picture of what i wanted and told her i would like 5 inches cut off. instead of 5 inches she doubled of what i had asked for! aside from that it was nothing like the picture! besides that the hairdresser was also rude. you're better off getting a pair of scissors for home and cutting it yourself instead of spending money here. they ruined my hair, do not come here!

i had a very bad experience today. the lady with russian accent cut my hair today. i like my hair to be short. i have clearly mentioned 6 on the top, 2 and 1 on the sides. instead of cutting with scissors, she used a machine with 5!!!  what the heck is that. she did not put any care in cutting my hair properly. she tried to finish the job asap. i have to look into mirror and ask her to cut the hair properly. i strongly recommend to avoid this lady with russian accent.

the price is reasonable and comparable with other barber shops for a short male-cut.i usually go to the happy barber on clairmont mesa, but this is now closer for me. this is a perfect place to take my two little kids; i can't comment on anyone but quin (formerly nguyen) who did a great job with my 3 yr old and 9 month old. with a coupon, the price is pretty much the same as happy barber. i haven't tried the online booking feature and haven't had a problem as a walk in.
literally the worst place ever for a haircut. there is a russian of slovakian lady who has no idea what she is doing at all. do not go here. ever. she botched my hair completely

i've been here twice now and both times got major haircuts from long (10+ inches) to pixie. both times i had great experiences and was very happy with the results.samantha cut my hair this last time i went, and she was very patient taking her time on the cut and humoring my special requests. she checked in at various steps to ensure that i was on board with what she was doing, and also offered helpful suggestions from length of the bangs to styling products.would go back!

came here looking for a last minute haircut (short, curly hair) before school starts. we were greeted promptly and serviced after waiting less than 5 minutes. my daughter was nervous about getting a cut by a man but her nerves were quickly calmed after chatting with mark before her cut. he understood exactly what she was looking for and executed it to the t. she loved her wash and the delicate care of her cut. we will definitely be back for a cut with mark. thank you.
jessica took her time with me and gave me a great cut. my hair came out better than some cuts that i've gotten from barbers who charge twice as much. thanks jessica! i feel great

this was my first time at this location and i was in need of haircut. i wanted to do a simple medium length cut and i showed my hairstylist jessica a picture of what i wanted. she was very friendly and made great suggestions which i was open to. she gave me the cut i wanted as well as making sure it framed my face shape. in the end i liked the way it turned out and i would come back to maintain my haircut.
if you want a bitchy stuck up woman who probably learned how to cut hair out of a coloring book, get your haircut here.
absolutely horrendous, i walked in for a haircut and i walked out looking like an egg.
long story short.. i got a skin fade 0 to 3 on top.. but never got the fade haha came back lady looked at me like she never heard a fade before i just walked out and hit up another barber shop

terrible haircut!stylist very timid and seemed afraid to even cut hair. bad fading and edging. could have gotten a better haircut in the barracks. marines do not come here. overpriced and really bad quality.
great service! anna was extremely efficient and quick, plus was spot on with the hair cut! will come back!!!

horrible hair salon..we went there for my husband's haircut , he mentioned specifically many times to keep the length and they just blindly cut everything with clipper..didnt even use scissors..why pay 20 bucks for something we can do at home only .they dont understand customer requirements at all..v disappointed..

jamshid did an excellent job! just got my hair cut today and i've already gotten a few compliments on it tonight. i've always had a great experience regardless of who does my hair at this location but i was especially pleased with jamshid's styling. he's cute, too.

absolutely horrible customer service! walked in was told they had people who checked in a head of me so had to check in and wait even though no one was in the store... 3 people working but two were on the computer for 15mins. told them i was gonna run to my car and they confirmed i'd be right back. then come back after not even two minutes. they had let a walk in go ahead of me and said sorry we have to take who is here when we're ready! really??    so rude! then told me i could wait another 30 mins for my sons haircut.

got my haircut here in hopes to get rid of the dead ends and have overall healthy looking hair. i have very dry curly hair so moisturizer and a comb is needed in order to prevent breakage. you would think the stylist would be mindful since that is their profession. the women stared to brush my hair completely dry before my cut, i had to ask her to please at-least fully wet my hair thinking she would understand she's not only 1. hurting me 2. breaking my hair. she sprays my hair a few times barely making it dampand i proceed to ask for some sort of conditioning to proceed with the brushing. at this point she is not caring what so ever about being mindful of my hair. i tell her let's just wash it 4$ more but maybe with my hair fully wet she will be more gentle and not have to cause more damage. after the wash she continues to mistreat my hair. pulling at knots until they ripped! i was shocked she proceeded yanking the comb and brush throughout this process. what shocked me the most was she proceeded to cut my hair without fully combing it. i understand i have a lot of knotting and curls but that is no excuse for a half ass job. on top of everything my hair is severely shorter and not at all what i asked for. hiring stylist who are mindful of other people's needs and hair types should be top priory for hair cut salons. horrible experience .
our usual place closed with no warning, so we needed a new place.  this is where we ended up ... thanks to yelp.  our new stylist is zachary and he did a fabulous job for my mom and me!

briana cut my hair yesterday at about 2:00 pm.  there was nobody else waiting at that time.she is cute, she is experienced and she has excellent personality(also her first day at this location.)have been getting my hair cut here for about 3 years, simply out of convenience, have never had a particularly bad cut(i get buzzed with a #2 guard), but there is not a lot of art to that.briana had excellent conversation skills, and she got my hair cut with a little extra flair(great job on the sideburns) and had me finished professionally with a minimal amount of fuss.if she doesn't continue working at this location i'm going to be extremely bummed out.  she made the experience of getting my hair cut actually fun.
check in online. download the app so you can lower your wait time. makes it so much easier.
i took my two kids to get their haircut today as a walk in and the stylist are very friendly to both my kids. there is no one there when we walk in so there is no wait time. very great service
got my hair styled today for an event, the worst job ever. what a waste of money and time.very disappointing !!!
great haircut as usual. easy to check in and in and out in 15 minutes. keep up the good work.
i went in to get a haircut today and the asian lady cutting my hair didn't even get close to what i was wanting then she charged me more for styling it. i don't recommend this place to anyone.

usually when i come here i always try to get denise but it's so hard to find her sometimes and i'm not sure if she still works their but she was amazing, today i went in and saw a new face his name was ben. if you come here and have the pleasure of meeting ben i suggest you wait for him! super nice and really cared about his job. don't forget to to him ! ;) thx ben

let's start off by saying if i could give zero stars i would. my boyfriend just got home - typically cut his hair myself. 3 all around and clean up the edges. but its insanely hot so thought he could just go somewhere this once. let's just say he will not be returning thanks to itzel. he waited almost 45 mins and then came home with a haircut i'm positive our cat could have done better. uneven and patches of hair everywhere. ridiculous.

i just got my haircut here today and the lady who cut my hair did a fabulous job!  this was my second visit and both times i have left happy.  i will say though that this location does not follow the great clips standards... while i was disappointed about that it won't stop me from going back.  the end result is what really matters and i got a great haircut.  and in case if you're wondering how i know they are not following the standards i use to manage great clips salons for 7 years before i decided to leave the hair industry.  yes i still have a current license,  but it's only for friends and family now.

inconsistent cuts most the time. i sat there for at least 30 minutes getting a very basic haircut (clipper cut /fade). the worker kept going over the same area with the clippers and i was starting to get a headache and somewhat irritated. the youthful looking staff members are unprofessional (well at least one is, consistently, every time i go there.) the manager and some of the older staff members a never/rarely mess up my hair. i didn't complain because i just wanted to get out and go home (after a pretty tiring day at work, this was the least of my expectations).judging by the lack of responses to negative posts on yelp, this reflects the quality of their business. i've gone here on and off for many years.... they have such a high turn over when it comes to keeping barbers. going to kim hair and nail, for 7 bucks is a way better deal than what they charge here, but i got lazy and went here.my hair style is pretty damn simple.... if anyone reading this can do a regular buzz cut/ clipper fade let me know! lol

(fyi - i posted this same review about the evergreen square site, since i visit both of them,, depending on which has the shorter wait time.)what's in a haircut?i never thought much about it until my perspective changed. i had a diving accident in 2014. i'm paralyzed below my chest with no functional use of my arms or hands. so appearances above the chest are more important to me now - you gotta make use of what you have. that means goofy hair is no longer acceptable for me.sadly, it happens when my hair gets too long on the side of my head, because that's where the controls for my wheelchair lie. so i like my hair a bit shorter on the side of my head. i tell the hairstylist what i want, and i get what i ask for. you're gonna like that.i like that they save my haircut online so if i go to a different location i come out looking the same. make sure to use the online check-in to save time! you're gonna like that too.for any wheelchair users, the sites at evergreen square and tully road are approved by me - i have a huge electric chair. the ladies are happy to move their barber seats out of the way and i plug right in.consistency, flexibility, wheelchair compatibility, and all the latest tech. there's a lot i like.

this location has been terrible the second time my husband went too. he asked marylou the stylist to shave his head bald but instead she left pouches of hair on his head.  a terrible job but before she shaved it he ask to wash his hair. she ask if he can transfer from his wheelchair which he said no then she said no we can't wash your hair. the first time he went they were able to wash his hair while he was in his wheelchair.  called this shop twice to complain and yet again they didn't do anything. this is the last time he comes here.

i came here last saturday morning right when they opened. i asked for a zero on the sides and a medium to high fade.i believe the person that serviced me was denise.anyways her razor cut my neck and now i have dry scabs from where the blood clotted.never coming back here again.
friendly staff... came in for a trim and the styles was very kind and fast... they keep your hair cut records.. which kinda caught me off guard lol... but seems in handy for next time..

if yelp had a minus star ratings, this place earned it. they  cut my hair unevenly, so when i went back to bring this to their attention, i waited to  speak to the girl that cut my hair, then all of a sudden two other hair trimmers weighed in on their ideas;  they wanted to cut even more off, but that would have left me bald; then said do i comb over my hair? their next remedy was to let it grow out! then one trimmer said, "i was being a", and then spoke under her breath. that was not exactly how i thought they would handle the issue. so they said leave my number and we will call you back, i was upset with having to argue with employees who have no protocol to deal with issues with their customers. the employees have varying abilities cutting hair and you have to be careful who you get. customer service is terrible. there friendly until you have an problem. then the aprons come off. until they get there employees on the same page, i would go elsewhere.3/18/17 changed my review. their a-ok.p.s. the next mourning i received a message from the owner and a call from the manager, and they pretty much bent over backwards to make it right, which made me feel like doing cartwheels! thank you!
first timer at great clips. needed my hair trimmed. issy cut &styled my hair as good as i've ever had. no reason to pay$$$ ever again. i highly recommend issy as ur new stylist

i don't usually go out to get my hair cut, but i was in need of a trim and had a coupon for $2 off at great clips, so i thought i might as well give it a try. upon arrival i was greeted by the employees and immediately seated. my hair stylist, nancy, was extremely friendly and went right to it. i didn't need much but about an inch and a half off around, as well as an inch off my bangs. nancy was also very good about starting off subtly to make sure not too much was cut off; she made sure to cut off all the frayed ends while keeping my hair at a good length to continue growing out.the session was short, but nancy was such a friendly and accommodating individual that i'm definitely willing to come back for all my hair cutting needs!

on saturdays it's not so bad but i made the mistake of coming on a friday night at 7:30. not busy but there's two stylist just cleaning up while the other is with a client. no checking in on me or letting me know why they haven't tended to me. probably never coming back. the people on saturdays are a lot more courteous so i recommend coming going that day.

this is the worst place you can go to get a hair cut, hands down. my hair was butchered here. asked for a fade halfway up, the lady even pointed out how high she was going to go and continued to go way to high, and didn't even blend the sides.

i spontaneously went in today to get my hair trimmed and i am more than satisfied with their services. katelyn was super friendly! she did exactly what i asked for when she cut my hairs and she did a wonderful job! my hair feels amazingly soft and healthy. definitely will be coming back here.

walked in and had a simple wash, style and blow dry done to my hair. nancy was wonderful. did a good job, gave me advice, refered me to a place in willow glenn that specialized in hair loss, did a great job on my hair looking at every detail. i will definitely return in the future.
was looking for a trim and some more layers added. let's just said they need to get some more education...

i was a little hesitant to come here, but i needed a quick trim since i'm pressed for time. the first time i came here was when they first opened. i had a guy and while the cut was nice he butchered my bangs. they were supposed to be side bangs however he cut them as straight short bangs just pushed to the side. i had to have my uncle fix it once we got home, which is why i was very hesitant about coming here again.i got denise as my hair stylist. she was amazing! she gave me some information about the quality of my hair and how i can make it healthier. she was also very relaxed and humored by my lack of hair knowledge. she didn't get impatient by me not being able to decide. rather she helped me make a decision. overall, denise has changed my opinion about this place. i loved her and i would love getting my hair cut by here whenever i'm up north.

this is my go-to salon.  super new and fresh. i consistently get a great haircut and have a good time, too.  staff here is nice and the facility is very clean.  added bonus is i can reward myself with ice cream, panda, or in n out after my cut.i i've never had a bad cut here, they seem to be staffed well, are clean, and they have people who actually can speak english.  recommend that you give them a try and see for yourself.

omg you'd think that after cutting soooo many people's hair they'd be able to at least give a decent fade... they can't. they ruined my brothers and sons hair at the same time. after they asked for so much info name. address. age. surprised they didn't ask for a social security number. don't do it people. it's not worth the few weeks of having a horrible haircut. for $16!!!

haven't had madison's hair trimmed in awhile. it took a lot of coaxing but i finally got her in here.... first things first, very clean location. has a very new feel to it still. the lady that trimmed her hair made maddie feel extremely comfortable.

i have very long hair and went in for a quick trim as i had not been able to get into the salon. they were helpful, fast and did a good job for basic trim, especially for 18 bucks. the lady also tapered my face layers and feathered the bottom so it was not a super harsh cut, she did great. would go back.

i can't give feedback on their hair cutting because we did not even get that far. the woman at the front (also a stylist) was so dismissive and rude when we entered my 9 year old daughter (who needed the haircut) was appalled at how she treated us. after waiting 20 mim for her to finish and my daughter hopped in the chair and this woman began telling us how bad her hair was and that the cut we wanted would look terrible on her. my daughter was again shocked and we ended up leaving without a haircut because it was so rude, abrasive and offputting. i have never felt like i was unwelcome in a business before. we did end up across the street at another salon where none of that wad an issue and my daughter got exactly the haircut we wanted and it looked fabulous

very long overdue review.  i've been coming here for almost 20 years, since they first opened.  for the most part, the staff has stayed fairly constant for years, so there is a lot of experience cutting hair here.  i always see caroline who is consistent and tremendous at her job.  she has a lot of long term clients.even though i've moved further away, i still make the time to come back and see her.the store itself is clean and well organized.    various products in store to buy also.they have an online app system so you can check in before you get there, which is very convenient.  those complaining about walk ins going first must be confused about this.  prices have gone up over the years, but so have everything else, so people need to get over that.this isn't a high end salon, but if you are looking for a quality cut without the frills or hassle, go here, you'll be happy.

worst great clips in the bay area. great franchise with many talented people that work at other locations (foster city) but this place is horrible. rude, tired, and incapable manager of doing her job. i wanted a shorter haircut in which the manager said she can't because she was going to cut her hands. i don't recommend you go here; please do a little more research and find an alternative. i am the type to get a haircut every two weeks and i expect a good haircut; if you consider yourself someone like me....don't go here.

what a horrible experience!this place spends no time or effort spent on doing a good job ... just use electric clippers all over your scalp and finish up in a couple of min, and for that they charge $18! what a rip off and a terrible feeling about having your hair ruined! no point taking to the staff as they don't seem to be aware of what a good hair cut is!
very clean they took us right in on a saturday it's close to restaurants grocery store kind of a on stop shop they were professional and fast i don't know what else you can ask for

looks great, but skill set to cut kids hair is missing. spoiled my 5 year old by cutting his hair in irregular line. i pointed to the stylist and she insisted what she did was right :(it will grow back, so not worried much. poor kid doesn't know any better :)
fast and can't beat the cost. i often am in here for my kiddo and we always have him see twee. she does a great job and the price is incredibly affordable.

drop in for my fiancé who just needed his hair buzzed off (he rocks the bald look). he barely has any hair, just the captain picard ring. price $17 is too high for this service. glad they took us in quickly though. not a very good job with shaving him for the price either - we get a cheaper, better quality cut at luxury cut hair & nail further up saratoga in the lion market. we won't go to great clips again but we were strapped for time this time, as we were trying to catch a movie and hoped that gc could match for quality at worst. oh well.

absolute worst place to go for a haircut. there is no style when you get a haircut. they just cut your hair off, which is something you can do at home with a razor. if i could find something below one star i would have given this place a -5 star.never go here unless you are desperate to waste your money.

i took my kid for a haircut. there is this old lady who is impatient to listen. when the haircut was not done well, i asked her to make few adjustments, she is so rude and was hurting my kid intentionally with the hair clipper. i had to warn her to be careful with the clipper. i would stay away from this location.

can i give a no star rating? they are completely clueless here.  i dropped in, just like everyone else.  i wanted to get a haircut for my 83 year old mother. i asked them how long the wait would be and they told me 15 minutes.  i told them i was going to get gas and that i would be back in 15 minutes.  i asked them if they needed my name and they said no. i went to get gas and came back before 15 minutes.  i brought my mother in and waited another 15 minutes for one of them to finish with their clients.  they both finished around the same time then took other walk-in clients!  when i approach her about it, she just looked at me like she saw a ghost.  she mumbled something about not having an appointment.  i said i made an appointment a half hour ago!  they should have told me i had to stay there, otherwise i would be giving up my appointment.  i don't know how good they are at cutting hair, but their customer service stinks.

this place is good.  i used to be a regular here when i lived a lot closer to the area.  i really enjoy how great clips keep your hair cut information in the system, so then you don't have to mention to the employees what type of cut you want.  seems like this place is great for people of all ages.  the reason for just 3 stars is the price.  it'll cost you 15 to 16 dollars for a men's haircut.  now some folks might think that's already pretty reasonable, but i guess since my hair is pretty easy to cut, for me i usually go to places that will charge 10 to 12 dollars and still maintain a quality cut.  regarding price again, this place does accept competitor coupons, so make sure to check online or in the mail to see if you could find a coupon before coming here.  the ladies there do a great job so its worth checking out next time you want a hair cut.

awful... i guess they don't care about their reviews because nothing's changed since the first time we went. my son has fairly easy hair to cut & they never get it like he wants it. language barriers also prevent any meaningful communication. it's a hair cutting mill, only there to burn through as many people in a day as possible. sports clips from now on. maybe they'll put this horrible place out of business.

i love great clips, because they store your information, then access it before each cut. they know generally what i want in terms of clip length, then focus down on the details before cutting.they also have great products they recommend, which might seem like a sales pitch to some but a blessing to others. through this store i found nioxin, which thickens hair. the shampoo is quite expensive (i got redken instead, which is not as good but you get a much bigger bottle), but the nioxin hair gel is affordable and really does help.there is one lady who cuts my hair extremely well and gives a great head massage when you get shampooed. i don't want to give out her name or the days she works because i don't want to bombard her with requests, but if you send me a message i'll tell you. i don't know her full capabilities, but she does an asian fade very well.

this is second time i went... first time i went they did satisfactory...but this time when i went some guy did my hair cut within 5 mnt and totally screwed it. so my conclusion is that its very unstable and hair is on your risk since every time different person will cut..... now i have to wait to 1 month to get it rectify..i would not suggest any more thats all...... if you really interested great clips try sunnyvale great clips.. some how they did better job.... but this and santa clara great clips have horrible experience.
below par even for soulless hair salon chains.  been there a few times and had in indifferent to rude service every time. not going there again.

i've been going here for years and i always go to thuy because she is familiar with my weirdo noggin and how to cut my hair so it actually looks good!everyone there is pretty friendly, the prices aren't bad (i will never pay $40 for a men's hair cut) and i rarely have to wait more than 10-15 minutes.
this place gives a great hair cut but won't extend wifi access while you wait. it would be a great idea if they would consider this for their busy customers.

i have a frequent customer card  that i wanted to redeem. they said that my hair cut voucher was not valid to use because it was styled cut and not a regular haircut .  the voucher did not have any restrictions or limitation.  i had paid for 12 haircuts to get the 1 free hair voucher and was told to pay for the $9 difference .  it seems like a  questionable promotion. i had planned on tipping  $5 but changed my mind and only tipped $3 .

i've been going here for about 2 years just about and every time i go i am greeting with warm smiles and feel at home.anh seems to be the lucky gal that gets me the most. she is so sweet and loves to chit chat which makes getting my haircut more enjoyable. i have had several people cut my hair there, and i do not have any complaints!!! you all are wonderful!!!

this place selectively honors app check-ins. today it was a 0 minute wait yet i waited 20 minutes before another guy who didn't check in was taken before me. and then a guy who did check in was taken in front of me. i deleted the app never to return

this place seriously chomped my hair. came by because the place i usually go to was closed...should have just waited a few days. all i wanted was a 1 on the sides and a small trim. what i got was a jacked up hairline and stray hairs everywhere. just stay away.
terrible. i went today for the first time in a while and i paid $28 for a hair & beard cut - the lady couldn't even line up my beard. seriously?! 28 dollars. i do not recommend.

well i asked for below the earsee pic...there was no wait which was a plus... and my daughter enjoyed her hair cut and her little lollipop. the lady did great with herthe gentleman i had... i should have realized before i looked it was going to be bad as i could hear him mumbling... not even, still not even.... crap

worst hack job ever!do not let ky touch your hair unless you want it butchered. not sure if she has ever cut hair before or under the influence of substances, but she was horrible! never going back here. ever.
fast and easy way to get a quick trim. the online appointment lets you miss the crowds.
avoid thu.told him low fade, he didn't see he was using a zero and faded high instead.turned the low fade to a high fade and cut all these different angles into my head!hell no!

best place for a kid's hair cut!i walked in with my 2 yr old toddler, who badly needed a hair cut. i was dreading the moment till lyndsay greeted us with a smile and made us feel she is in charge of the situation and it will be just a cake walk. sure it was! compared to the earlier experiences, my son was super cool, cried less while lyndsay did her magic with her clipper on my son's hair. she was super quick and knew exactly what to do. the hair cut was done in minutes! she is very good with kids. so if you have to get your toddler's hair cut, ask for lyndsay. plus there was no wait, so it was a huge plus for me!!

oh boy... so i got some coupons in the mail and since i wanted an easy yet specific cut, i thought i would try this place out, it helps that they are close to my house. i was greeted by the owner (maybe, he was in charge) and was told 15 minutes. it's was about that so, so far so good. i met kim who told me this was her first day there but that she worked at another salon previously. it all went downhill from here. i told her that i wanted her to take the longest attachment for the clippers that she had, and make all my hair one length. easy yet specific. no thinning shears, leave the sideburns alone, and clean up the neck. part way through, she starts to change the attachment. i stopped her and said all one length. then she takes out the thinning shears, so i tell her no and ask her not to use them. she starts talking about blending and fading and again i say, all one length. so she starts halfassing the rest of the cut and then says she's done. i pay with no tip, because you shouldn't ever have to tell someone cutting your hair the same thing that many times. when i get outside and look closely i see that the sides aren't even the same length, never mind the top being the same as the sides. so i go back in and tell the owner/ manager that it needs to be fixed. at least he did what i requested. since hair can't be added back, all my hair is now about 1/4 of an inch long.they were so bad they are no longer in business.

no stars if possiblei've had a bad haircut in the past. but i've never been anywhere that allowed someone with no experience cutting hair to attempt on the job training with one of their best customers. i've been going to the location above for some time. and before that, went to the location in downtown san jose. i drive several miles to the above store because they have done a good job in the past. but this last experience was very disrespectful to me. the store manager allison has apparently hired a family member or friend (which is admirable); but with zero experience actually cutting hair. i've wasted my time and gas for someone to try and learn to cut hair on a paying customer. i now have to waste more time and gas to get a capable person to fix the screw up caused by your franchise manager's poor judgement! this obviously won't affect your bottom line as these are franchises. but i will not be returning to any great clips. bad reviews hurt all of your stores. and a great clips sign on the door is what the potential customer sees. very very bad experience for what should have been a simple hair cut. 10 minutes tops for the total job. and i always give a good tip. again; very disrespectful for a long time customer!
extremely impolite. very bad customer service. checked in online - wait time kept going up from 15 min to 32min although i was there waiting!!! not worth it - take your business somewhere else.

just had the worst haircut ever by stephanie carter! she did not take a single care when cutting my hair my lines in the back are all crooked, she didn't trim my neck, there was a line all the way around my head where she tried to do a fade, and she did not even comb my hair when she was done. i should get my hair fixed and all my money back. be careful.

2 is generous, but i require a special cut., my wife is still satisfied with them so i can at least give them 2 stars.  after being turned away from 3 salons for a flat top due to skill and complexity requirements, the place who agreed and assured me they know what they were doing was great clips.   usually i reserve the flat top from the barber in mountain view. . ..  far, far to complex a cut for generic salon folk.  i knew in my gut i was making a mistake, but was i trapped with no barber open for a quick fix,i had recently grown my hair out from a 0 shave and was ready for the first flat top in 6 months. perhaps my standards were too high after getting the "oh so darn flat" cut from my barber.   the flat top that made people stop and say "wow thats the flatest i have ever seen ever"what i received from great clips was just right of gumby's hair style.  great slant to one side and really fuzzy on the left6 if you like that kind of thing.   i was regalled with the story of how she watched a lad cut a flat top and did 3 others on kids making her expert.  all of course after the damage was done. fortunately hair grows back, and it was only 15 bucks plus tip.   my barber charges  $9 which i gladly drop $20 for his expertise.lesson: there is a reason barbers still exisit.  plan accordingly or suffer the wrath of the cheap salon.  good news is if i ever need a gumby left cut, they have it in there computer for future reference.

i have now been to this location twice. both times i had to sit and argue with them about how i wanted my haircut. even though i have had the same cut many times before from different places, they wanted to convince me that the cut would not work. while i do realize this is their job, i'm pretty sure i have lived with my same hair for over 25 years and know better than anyone what it will and will not do. they need to listen to their customers wants rather than telling them what they need. i will not make the same mistake again and will be looking for a professional barber at this point.

this review  for my son hair cut. even though his hair type is easy to cut and we asked very simple hair style, he could not do it properly. i think great clips quality is declining these days and i don't know why!

mina the hair stylist did a good job with the haircut.however, i do not like this franchise location. they  charge the highest for hair cuts $16. they do not honor the great clip $11.99 hair cut promotion. you buy $11.99 hair cuts in advance and load them onto the gift card. i bought 5 from this location 6 months ago. the cashier refused to even look on his cashier/computer to see if they could do this.  would never come to again because of poor customer service.

i've been meaning to write a review but haven't had the time. anyway, my story happened a couple months ago when i came in for a haircut. i asked for the asian guy david.  he seemed like a cool guy who cut hair well. but truthfulness was the real problem. as i was paying to leave, i gave david a 20 dollar bill for my 16 dollar cut. not realizing how much change he gave me back, i proceeded to walk out. i was in my car and finally realized david had stole 3 dollars from me because he only gave me a dollar back in change. maybe he thought i wasn't going to tip him? but still, you don't fucking do that kind of stuff. i was about to walk in and call him out, yet there were kids inside so i didnt want to make a huge scene. long story short, i payed, and he didn't give me my full amount of change back because he was trying to sneak a little extra for himself.

they served someone who walked in after me first. while she was shampooing my hair, she wasn't paying attention and was basically shampooing my eyebrows. after shampooing my hair into knots, she proceeded to rip them out with a comb. after telling her what style cut i wanted, she began to cut my hair and then informed that that was not the right style for me. she spent the entire time telling me everything wrong with my hairstyle and color. she even told me that i had to cut my hair like hers to look good. i will not be going back here. i would not recommend this place.

absolutely the worst hair cut ive ever had! if u go there make sure one of the asian ladies cut your hair! im white and not racist but the last two times i was there an older white lady then today a young white lady messed up doing a 1 to 3 fade! lol every time one of the asian ladies cut my hair it came out right! absolute waste of money! i truly told her theres nothing else she could do for me, paid my bill and booked it before she messed it up more than she already did!
quick visit no waiting and reasonable priced hair cut with sylvia ! thanks will be back !
amateur stylists, can't do a good job on both kids and adults, ruined mine and daughters hair style. stay away!

i dislike giving negative reviews but this had to be said. had my boyfriend take our son here for a hair cut. it was his second time with rasario, first time was a decent cut although at that time she refused to fix uneven areas that i pointed out stating "it's just like that". my son didn't want to get back into the chair anyways because she kept squeezing my son's cheeks together while cutting his hair. i was already irritated with her so i stated my frustration and let it go.  second time, my boyfriend thought he'd give it another shot, hoped to get another stylist but got rasario again. she managed to carve one large bald spots in the back of my son's head & a crooked fade on both sides. mind you, my son stays still for his hair cuts. my boyfriend said he asked her to fix it but she refused again & so he left with son thinking it probably wasn't a good idea to have her "fix" the mistakes because my son would probably end up bald. the minute i got home and saw my son, i could see the unevenness, where she did not actually fade instead just cut straight through with no blending. it looked horrible. i was so upset. i called and the guy who answered was nice enough to say sorry and that they'd fix it. horrible customer service from rosario, even more horrible hair cut. thankfully the younger asian lady fixed rosario's mistakes but still, why did this even happen in the first place? ugh. so frustrating.

been here four times. first few visits went well. the stylist was able to get the work done really fast with acceptable quality.the last visit today was horrible. the stylist was not adequately trained,  probably only a trainee, reckless and impatient. she keeps waving the knives and scissors in front of my eyes within a close distance and got my neck hurt when trimming. when finished i asked for a mirror to see the back side, she quickly realized the work was not properly done and continue refining it. definitely not worth $18. better spend a few more to find a better place.

usually i come here right after i go to the gym about once every two weeks.  every time you go there's different people every time and its hard to get a consistent person.  i don't really mind as long as they know what they are doing and my hair looks decent enough.  however, today was so bad that i feel the convenience of this shop no longer worth it.  usually my hair is longer and if they mess up a little bit i can style it in a way to look ok.  but todays cut was so bad that there was no possible product that can save it.  i literally went to my car, looked in the mirror and screamed. never been so mad about a haircut before. good luck to whoever decides to get their haircut here. its like flipping a coin

great price, great jobs, great service.this is the first time i come to this place for my haircut, i will come back and this is will be my favorite shop for now on , i love the way they take care my hair and shampoo,the shop looks very nice and clean, music soft and nice , very friendly and special the service is the best , 5 start definitely giving to this shop , believe me, just come try one time it can say all .1085 e brokaw road san jose ca 95131 .

i am usually hesitant about coming to places such as great clips solely because i've had bad experiences years ago. a few days ago, i thought i'd give it a shot because i was starting school again, and didn't have time to make an appointment at a salon. i walked in and was greeted right away, jennie led me to my seat where i told her what i wanted. i wanted only my dead ends cut, didn't want my hair to go short since i'm trying to grow it longer. and then i told her i wanted layers. okay. layers are supposed to flow evenly with your hair. that didn't happen. i also asked for my hair to be whisky around my face, but didn't allow it to flow evenly with the rest of my hair. kind of like "here's the wisp, and just goes straight into my regular length. definitely doesn't blend well at all. jennie told me she was only cutting 1 inch for dead ends. she ended cutting about 2/3 inches:( in terms of my layers. they are really bad. never had layers like this... my layers came out more of a straight line!:( it looks really bad. i tried telling her, and she said "no, it's supposed to look like that." i didn't want to cause a scene, so i paid $18 and left. i recommend going to an upscale salon if you want your hair cut. she even left one strand of my long hair, which wasn't cut. she's a sweet lady, but doesn't know how to style. really upset. thankfully i made an appointment at elysian hair salon to fix what great clips messed up.

i had a haircut here yesterday with an old asian lady. since my hair was below my waistline, i specifically asked "to cut 6-7 inches for my hair to be at my chest-level" and showed her exactly how long.after the cut, my hair is barely touching my shoulders... it's at least 3-4 inches shorter than what i asked for. would not recommend the old lady working here. she became extremely defensive when i told her this was much shorter than what i asked for, and she tried to blame me for misguiding her?!?it was my first time trying great clips and will be my last. never coming back here again...
the owner offer my dad to go back again for a hair cut. he was happy with the service this time. they listen to him and make sure the length he wants before they started.
owner was extremely sincere in remedying the situation and was kind to offer a free haircut and a refund. i believe he has address the situation and is very sincere about serving the customers.
great place and great price .one of the best haircuts i ever received in the bay area ...

clean, super fast, very friendly. i got a coupon as new resident in the hood so i wanted to take advantage of trimming my hair without spending too much. so that is a perfect approach. for less than $8 i left the salon feeling the queen of mambo! very clean, there was a guy removing the hair of customers from the floor all the time.

been here quite a few times, recommend tc and rasario as stylists. first cut today with rasario and she did great, one of the best cuts i've had in awhile. check in online to avoid longer waits upon arriving.

listen, if you're like me, time is important and on that champagne taste with a kombucha budget then i can't say enough about this place and this location. first off, it's so easy to schedule an appointment. i did it through yelp and they have an app. boom, you know what to expect in terms of waiting time. second, i used to see angel but she no longer is there and i came in today serendipitously and john took me. we chatted for a few minutes about what i was looking to achieve hair style wise and he worked with it.  i closed my eyes, meditated for what seemed like 10 mins and bam  a new beautiful hairstyle appeared! seriously blown away by his listening skills and artistry. he's a professional for sure. highly recommend him and this location. oh and to boot, place is clean, fun music, and clean bathroom. coming back in a few months!

ms. vicky is a great hair stylist. she take her time with my 10 years old daughter and my hair cut. she is knowledgeable stylist here. this is the third time we came back to this place. great customer service from front desk check in. ms. linda is very nice stylist. she is gentle with my 5 yrs old.

my 9 year old gets his hair cut here almost monthly. they have great deals and always sending coupons. he only wants amar he is very patient and listens to exactly what my son wants. my son refuses to let anyone else touch his hair. he always asks my son how he is doing. my son has sensory issues so is sensitive and amar understands. i too have had my hair cut and i had an older asian man and he was great and super fast.

i got haircut by sima. it is the worst haircut i received in bay area. she does not even listen to me what i am asking for and she left all of a sudden when i am asking about some changes and complained the main guy. worst service and you dont get what you ask for. all you will get is what they cut (i still tipped 25%)don't go for haircut over here
natalie was so sweet and gave me a great haircut! i showed her a picture because i wanted of long layers  and she gave me exactly what i wanted, thanks girl!

i was skeptical the first time i came here because i consider this a "discount" place.however, go see linda or tatiana.  both excellent stylist who always give me a great cut and both are worth waiting for.just because this is a "discount" type of place do not forget to tip the gals well.  they are worth every dollar!!
walked in on a monday evening and the wait time was less than 10 minutes. the stylist was very professional and took great care in doing the hair cut.

i had been coming here for many years, and always received an excellent cut.  areli, who has since left, always did an exceptional job.  the others who i found exceptional include evonne, anne, and timmy.  the atmosphere has always been welcoming and relaxing.  i can sometimes get busy, but i found that non-peak times, especially the morning, worked best.  of all the great clips shops i have been to throughout the bay area, this one was the best.

it's impossible to get it cut how you want it. i've been here several times asking for a hair cut a certain way, and they always cut it how they want it, not how you want it and they don't listen to what you say when you ask them to cut it. skip this place, go to a place with people that listen to their clients.

i usually frequent great clips for a trim in  between salon appointments. this last visit left me with short layers cut in back,  which i did not request. i told the stylist  that there was one short layer that i was trying to grow out. i was disappointed to have  choppy layes in the back of my head . please listen to your customers.

decided to come here instead of the usual location in sunnyvale.  the experience was ok.  it looks like the sunnyvale location is not correctly connected to the great clips network.  the stylist could not find any notes from the sunnyvale location regarding how my hair is normally cut, etc.several different stylists at the sunnyvale location have done my hair and i've been happy with each and every one of them.  i was not really "feeling" my haircut from this spot.  so, i will just stick to the sunnyvale spot.
just had a haircut for myself and my two sons. both jenny and mary did a great job!  highly recommended!

this guys s my third visit here. very nice people working here. always respectful, accurate and professional. iris martinez is real professional. she did a great job. it is first time she cut my hairs. i like it! definitely five stars deserved! i will come back for sure!

my boys gets their hair cut here. they love everyone that works here. great customer service and they do not rush you even if it's the not so little ones who are getting them. it can really gets super busy on weekends so check in ahead of time on line.
very poor customer service. checked in online and it said wait is 0 mins. walked in a bit later and had to wait while they took other customers rather than by the order of online check-in.
excellent customer service and professional. araseli cut my hair and washed my hair. she knows how to cut and style your hair. thank you for my new style!!!
had a decent haircut as i asked the person to cut of size 2 for side but he didnot have proper equipment and did a haircut just by approximation. cut was ok but not what was required.

my only issue with this place is the employees coming in late which causes a big backlog. the store opens at 9am and there is only 1-2 stylists on site. then within the next 15-30 minutes the rest of the employees waltz in late. i'm fine waiting for a haircut if you are busy, i'm not fine waiting for employees to get their coffee on the way in and showing up late. i think the classic saying needs to be enforced here. if you're 15 minutes early, you're on time, if you're on time, you're late, and if you are late, don't bother showing up. operationally, this delays you all day long. this is now the 3rd time i've dealt with this issue at this location. in the time it took me to write this you have lost the business of 6 people that don't want to wait.

the owner reached out to me after i left my review to apologize for kim. apparently she was a temp to step in for someone who was taking time off due to health reasons. after i requested a refund, she granted that and offered a free haircut to fix my disaster. unfortunately i was only home for the holidays so i could not take her up on the offer. i still stand by my advice to remember who has given you good haircuts and request them. if you don't remember either ask the manager for a recommendation or ask for your history or who you've had previously great clips still has a 4/5 from me with 0.5 stars taken off for kim (since she's not a regular) and rounded up since i can't give half stars

you get what you pay for. -.-there is a strong communication barrier with most of the barbers. regardless of what you try to ask for they're just going to stick to what they know. all in all if you want a cheap cut with a short wait this could be your place, but if you really care about your haircut (or need certain specifications for work or some other reason) this is not the place to go to.

the good:+  cheap.+  online check-in so you can beat the line.the not so good:-  i asked for a zero fade and had to have the whole fade redone because it was cut using a one.  my guess is they don't like going straight to zero because its a little riskier if not done correctly.  i didn't like that i had to call it out and have them use a real zero.-  my fade came out a little uneven on one side, and you could see the definite transition lines looking at my fade from a side angle which was unsightly.  some of the competitors can get you a nice zero fade for about the same price.-  you need to be clear about the height of your fade and show them.  i asked for a medium to low fade, but the fade was taken almost all the way up, meaning instead of a proper tapered low fade i ended up looking like i had a faux-hawk.  bottom line:come here if you need to get trimmed up for cheap and quick.  don't expect any styling to be done, and don't expect the talent to have an emphasis on technique.  you will have to be very explicit with your directions to avoid any miscommunication.

this is the 2nd time to visit this great clips in palo alto. daniel did a very good job with my fade. he's also friendly and has such a good customer service. definitely recommend to this great clips.

signed in on line. i waited to go in until my turn was minutes away. when we walked in my app showed i was at 0 minutes. the women at the register looked at each other and informed us there were a couple of people ahead of us. it's now been almost 20 minutes and they have taken all kinds of people ahead if us. everyone that walked in when we did who had not signed in on line were told that it is a 15 minute wait. why do they bother with the app if it's the same wait? i would have come in sooner. feels like something unethical is going on here.

incompetent and very poorly organized. i'm sitting waiting for my turn. then they had me wait while they take care of next costumer even though i had checked with them and supposed to be the next costumer. what a waste a time. what a place with incompetent staff. go there if you want a bad haircut by an incompetent staff whose main goal is to push for selling overpriced low quality shampoos.update: no that wasn't the case, i was told that i'm the next and i planned to be somewhere accordingly...  maybe your incompetent staff need a training to do more than just upselling shampoos and conditioners

have to sing areli's praises. i am new to the area and decided to try a cosmetology school for a bob haircut. i've had this haircut before and know how it is supposed to look and feel. unfortunately, the cosmetology school cut was a bust. the angle and overall shape of the cut was just wrong. panicking, i went to the nearest great clips in hopes that a stylist could fix the damage enough to tide me over until i could get a salon appointment. enter areli. she took me right to her chair and made sure to understand exactly what i disliked about my current cut. she took care of the shape and more. i left with the haircut that i was expecting and looking forward to. thank you, thank you, thank you!
i've been going to this great clips for many years and they are fantastic. the staff is excellent. they handle many different styles of hair with great professionalism.
i love evonne.  she is always so nice and does such a great job! even though it is a little far to drive, it's worth it to have her cut my hair.  she also cuts both my kids hair and they love her!

they do not take reservations on the phone, rather you check in online. i suppose it frees up their time to focus on cutting hair. the hair stylists here are a hit or miss. my go to hair stylist is a doll. she spends extra time with the hair style i want and you can tell she cares.

been getting perfect hair cuts and shampoos from these folks since i was a child of nearly 5 years old , these men and women have watched me grow up. very beautiful and sweet women that work here, even at 20 minutes before closing they cut my hair perfectly. i've given them a hard time many times but they still treated me right , so close to my house to.
annoying system ....why would i give my phone number for a hair cut?????  told them so ...but they don't get it.

what's in a haircut?i never thought much about it until my perspective changed. i had a diving accident in 2014. i'm paralyzed below my chest with no functional use of my arms or hands. so appearances above the chest are more important to me now - you gotta make use of what you have. that means goofy hair is no longer acceptable for me.sadly, it happens when my hair gets too long on the side of my head, because that's where the controls for my wheelchair lie. so i like my hair a bit shorter on the side of my head. i tell the hairstylist what i want, and i get what i ask for. you're gonna like that.i like that they save my haircut online so if i go to a different location i come out looking the same. make sure to use the online check-in to save time! you're gonna like that too.for any wheelchair users, the sites at evergreen square and tully road are approved by me - i have a huge electric chair. the ladies are happy to move their barber seats out of the way and i plug right in.consistency, flexibility, wheelchair compatibility, and all the latest tech. there's a lot i like.

waited over a half an hour before i left. the online check-in is bs...they go before someone physically waiting. i sat through 3 people coming in and stating they had checked in online and got helped before me, then a woman who hadn't even checked in online was helped so i left... and will never be back. do not waste your time with these jerks.

i've been going here on and off for a couple of years now. the wait is short which is always a plus. its clean and comfortable. and today id like to thank lina for the cut and i will for sure be back more!

checked in online for myself and two others. it was half an hour to closing and they looked very busy. the lady asked if we'd been there before and then asked for phone number after we were waiting for 10 minutes. she started counting money and the man said they can't take three people, nor two. they could have told us when we first got there that their online check in doesn't mean anything or better yet, not let people check in online after a certain time if they won't be served? so after reading the recent reviews, maybe it was a good thing that we didn't get service. not going back.
hit or miss, totally depends on the stylist; no minimum guarantees.went there after a long time to try and had a very bad hair cut this morning.

a week ago i have a 1 star rating after consecutive bad cuts. manager carmelita reached out and offered a free fix. scheduled it for a week later. a much better finish and overall experience. as previous stated there are good workers, just got to know who they are.

got my haircut today and i actually hate it. i asked that my layers be in a v-cut. nope. didn't do that. i felt bad if i said that i hated it but i really wouldn't go here again. it turned out to be terrible. great location. terrible hair cut. i appreciate that the lady tried to keep me preoccupied by talking to me about her kids, etc. but it was just not good. i would've preferred to be cut by someone else. truly disappointed.3/6 edited. after a not-so-good haircut experience, i went back & i must say, she fixed me up really nice. my hair is thick and harder to manage but she was extremely professional and so kind even though i'm sure she may have hated my review. i explained that i shouldn't have been so negative about it however i did appreciate her sincerity and her willingness to fix the problem. would i come back? yes. definitely. thank you great clips for your dedication to excellent service!

i usually come here to get my hair cut, but the last time i went i had a specific way i wanted my hair cut. i even showed how much i wanted yet they gave me an ugly, short haircut that looked nothing like what i wanted. i dont have the same hair type as the cutters so i was mad that they did whatever they wanted. do not go on a day where it isnt busy because the people who are there arent good. go during a busy time so there are more people to choose from.

1) wanted me full name, email, phone number and other personal info just to get on the list to wait for a haircut. seemed offended when i said i just wanted a haircut. 2) told me 35 minutes, i wandered around the farmers market and came back in 20 minutes, they said that i was late and they had been calling me (nothing on my phone)3) someone else had my phone number before i changed it and used great clips. the woman at the counter didn't believe that i wasn't sergio, no matter how many times i explained it. 4) haircut wasn't great. 5) there was a fly in the store, buzzing around my station, so the woman tried to use the blow dryer to blow it away. she ended up blowing a bunch of my hair from the cover in my face, twice; didn't bother apologizing.

i have been doing to this location for 6 years but today's experience was terrible. i usually do not request specific stylist and today i was assigned to an absolute moron. he just grabbed my front hair which are thinning and cut them to the roots making me almost bald.also, another lady cut my son's hair like a someone chewed it.both new people and seemed without any experience! i have now decided to request a stylist which i know, i think it is highly important even if you have to wait.i give this place 1 star for hiring completely clueless people.

i just very much appreciate the owners tamara and her husband going out of the way to make a wrong situation right. they sent me a personal letter when i had a bad experience and gave a very good reason to their price changes recently. thank for you being understanding to me and my issue and being honest about the circumstances. much appreciate the gesture and personal care.

it's really unfortunate when you have a business with a lack of customer service. what's worst is the business having a manager who is the prime example of inappropriate behavior and a lack of customer service. a few of the workers here speak their own language and are not courteous to how it affects the customers. to my surprised, i learned that it was the store manager "lien" that was bad mouthing other employees and making comments about customers (in vietnamese). please do not support a business that allows for this.

this will be the last time i attend this place. for starters, you know it's going to be bad when you hear one of the cosmetologist complaining about when she will get to leave work and the other two workers are basically telling her to stop complaining. it gets even worse when the one that's complaining ends up cutting your hair. i don't know how she managed to pass her license exam but man was she horrible and i wish i could remember her name so i could mention it here. i always ask for the usual same as last time style which the great clips system is good at keeping track of, but she couldn't for the life of her figure out how to fade let alone make it even. she hesitated to show me the back of my head until i asked and when i saw it i was extremely disappointed. it looked like the rocky mountains jagged! had it not been so busy i would have asked for her to stop and let someone else cut my hair. like i said this will be the last $20 i pay for a bad style cut. bye bye not so great clips.

9:04 am, saturday morning. i just called and they don't take appointments. the person said to walk in or check in on the great clips app. when i first logged into the app, the wait was 22 minutes. now 9:13 am, the wait is 13 minutes. so, if you wanted to get a hair cut at 10 am, you need to check in sometime before and hope you time your check in just right.

checked in online where the est wait time was 35 min. was greeted immediately and finished checking in upon arrival - actual wait time was less than 15 min. lina was my assigned stylist. she asked how i wanted my hair cut and i showed her some pics of how it's normally cut by my nephew. she cut it as requested and the result was spot on. i couldn't be any happier with the cut! thank you great clips and lina for the great service - you now have a new, repeat customer!

i've been coming here for my haircuts since it is close by my house. i've been coming here for two years and majority of the time get my haircut from lien. i am always satisfied with the haircuts i get from her. she always listens to what i want in a haircut. it is understandable that some haircuts i show her cannot be done due to the type of hair i have, but she definitely gets close to it as possible. i would definitely recommend her.

to be honest i've avoided coming here because for some reason i like to take chances on terrible vietnamese hair salons. since i was in the area, short on time, and in desperate need of a haircut, i decided to come in here. i was immediately greeted by a woman name karen. karen has got to be the most endearing hairstylist i've ever come across. she makes it a point to learn your name and say it at least 5 times throughout your haircut. she explains exactly what and why she's doing what she's doing. she actually reminded me to wash my hair after a haircut, i can't even be mad.as an athlete, my hair was pretty damaged due to all the chlorine and poor little pony tails it has endured! not to mention, my last haircut from some other salon left me with hair reminiscent of a 14 year old emo teeny bopper (thick on top, thin on bottom), needless to say, i hated it. karen fixed it right up erasing a weird rat tail like layer and rounding out the layers to the best of her ability. she wanted to cut a little more than what i was usually comfortable with, but she actually asked me & told me why! i like that she asked me first before she cut it because i know we all have horror stories where the stylist expressed a little too much creative freedom! long story short, my hair looks healthier and fuller without feeling heavy! glad i came in and can't wait to stop in for my next trim! :)

i've been going to this great clips or several years, never disappointed. the last couple cuts have been by theresa, she's fast and does a nice job. i'm not sure where the comments about rude staff come from, i've always been treated with the utmost courtesy.

terrible. rude staff, didn't listen to my instructions.  the great clips down the street by the toys r us is great but this one is a little closer so thought i'd give it a try. big mistake, i'm a guy and not terribly picky about my hair but even i think this is awful.  tried to correct the woman doing the cut and she blew me off. to top it off she rudely demanded a tip. i laughed and left, thank god my hair grows fast.

helena looks experienced but did a really shabby job with my haircut. she finished cutting my hair within 5 minutes and was more interested in getting to the next customer. the other hairstylist took more time and seemed to have done a better job. i'd not advise this location.
this is run by a by rude people who dont know how to cut hair. please never go there with kids. they are unfriendly to kids and just dont care about customers.
