honestly, i love this supercuts. i've lived in dallas for two years and it's the only place i've ever gotten my haircut since we moved here. granted, i'm a low-maintenance gal. i don't wear makeup, i own three pairs of shoes, and i don't like to spend more than $16 for a decent haircut. fortunately, i don't have to at this supercuts. sure, there are some flaws. they don't take appointments so wait times can be tough, but if you call ahead you can put your name on the list and they usually let you know exactly when you can come in to avoid a long wait. today i called at 11 and they told me that the next available time was 11:40. i put my name on the list, hung out at home for thirty minutes, arrived promptly at 11:40, and i was in the chair getting that black apron wrapped around my neck at 11:45. i don't think i've ever had the same stylist twice, but everyone i've had has been friendly and very good at what they do. i've never left this location unsatisfied with my cut. today i came in wanting a bit of a change from my regular straight, simple, just-past-the-shoulders hair. i showed mario a few pictures of what i was thinking of and he said it was no problem. he was meticulous and professional, and 45 minutes later i left with a short stacked bob, feeling light and awesome, all for only $16 plus tip. these guys know what they're doing, and it's a great place for a haircut.
the hair dressers are great but the company is a cheat. i had 2years worth of points accumulated that they nullified because i did not give them my phone no.

i luv this place! the staff is amazing! please call ahead for an appointment or you will be waiting! the location is very popular and a secret gem! they are always willing to accommodate you and the staff is so welcoming! the location is super clean, in fact i'm here now and two of the employees are cleaning! i have my regular stylist, which i won't share her name, since i'm selfish and want to make sure she does not get a line of folks. but, honestly most of the staff here has great skills! i'm just super paranoid, since i have long virgin hair. i just don't let anyone touch my hair. the price is reasonable especially since i use to pay $50+ for a haircut!

i absolutely recommend this supercuts.  the front desk greeter is always friendly, and the stylists are just as nice.  in addition, i began frequenting this location not long after i underwent an organ transplantation, so i had to wear a mask to guard against germs and whatever airborne debris might be in the air.  i was treated no less than anyone else, despite wearing this odd-looking apparatus.  when i mentioned my situation to the various stylists, they were absolutely understanding.  in fact, one stylist even put into the notes in my profile that the cutting equipment be sterilized, due to my situation. five star treatment, for certain, and five star supercuts location.

i have been going there for over 20 years and still have the same person cutting my hair.  i wait to get me hair cut until  bobby jones is available.  he is great, a real nice guy.  try him you will like him.
terrible experience. waited 40min after checking in w 3 ppl coming in after me getting a haircut prior to me. 2nd and last time i'll visit.

very disappointed at lack of service. arrived, put in my name for a haircut & waited while 9 other people were taken ahead of me -- supposedly with appointments , which seems to defeat the purpose of the shop to begin with.

i always get my hair cuts from supercuts but as i was in downtown i wanted to try a different branch. i have a very long pretty hair and not many people like to experiment with that. my hair stylist at this place also was not ready to cut it short. i wanted bangs and she was not very happy about it. but i insisted and she gave me bangs and a layer cut. i have been getting so many compliments for this new hair style. i trued getting bangs before but it was never the same. i love my new hair style

i've gotten inexplicably good haircuts and highlights at this location for the last two years.  before that, i patronized a number of small, independent salons throughout houston where i got surly service and bad haircuts, at a significant cost premium.also, wait time here is generally super short, and you don't need an appointment.

took my daughter to get a hair trim was charged an extra $10 for blow drying her wet hair. was not told a simple blow dry not even a blow out would be $10 and it's ever acceptable to let a 3 year old leave with dripping wet hair. i am so irritated. also the woman took a very long time and in the end when the hair was dry the back is uneven. i've been coming here to get my daughters hair cut and each time the hair trim was even and i was never left with my daughters hair wet out the door they always dried it.

do not go here to get your hair styled! i came here on the morning of my birthday party and asked for simple loose curls. that's it. the stylist sprayed down each section of hair with hairspray and curled it tightly with a flat iron. you could hear the hair sizzle and singe. she assured me it was fine. by then end of it (she had me faced away from the mirror during the process) i had what resembled a tight curly perm. i seriously looked like a poodle. i was near tears as i expressed to her that this was nowhere close to the loose curls i asked for. the curls were hard and crunchy and she brushed them back out and tried again. my hair took so much damage and i ended up paying the $40 and leaving upset with messed up looking hair on the day of my birthday party, i had to clip it up. later on after washing out the hairspray, i could see how bad it was damaged in the process. my hair is thin and always has been, but used to be sleek and smooth. now i have insane breakage all the way up to the crown. this is going to take a long long time to repair. save your money and your hair, don't go!

place used to be good. guess all the good staff left. there is now just one main lady there, and she is rude and nasty. she rushes through your cut just to get through more customers. she told me she couldn't cut my son's hair a certain way because her fingers were too fat - what?!!! she said this after rushing through my other son's hair while being disgustingly gassy. then she nipped him and said he was moving. i was right next to him, he wasn't moving - he has been getting his hair cut for years and knows not to move. i just drive further away for better quality service not just in hair but in personnel.

i would have given 0 stars but i had to give something. this place is awful. i went there to get my hair cut and dyed for a birthday present. i had just had a baby and wanted to feel pretty again. i showed the girl what i wanted done and she just didn't care or something because she did something completely different. she butchered my hair and the color was off too. i have to let it grow out now. it is hideous! i started crying because i was so unhappy. i will never go there again. i even completed the survey after leaving a review on facebook and someone from the home office contacted me. she told me to call her but there was no way to contact her! the whole company is awful. i have told everyone i know about the horrible job she did on my hair!

odd place. not sure exactly what is going on here. stylists are sitting around chatting and laughing while customers are just -- well, sitting around. seekingly takes forever to complete this one customer, possibly an hour or so. in the mean time, i can't tell -- are they ignoring us on purpose, as in, " watch how we are blowing you off! ha-ha!" or perhaps they are not not noticing the customers, and they forgot they are not just visiting with each other.does this place have an owner?this is not normal for a real business

they were understaffed for a saturday. miss shonte got my little guy in and out very quickly and did a great job cleaning up where i hacked into his hair. it was quick, affordable, and miss shonte will be seeing my little guy and my mister again.
consistently great hair cut by shonte & paige. they are always with happy smiles & friendliness to all clients.  and they keep a clean store salon.

marsha is amazing! she calms me. i feared people to touch my hair! feared it i say! but marsha fixed a botched hair cut a while back and did a beautiful job. she put up with me and my emotions so i only go see her now! i know she sees me coming too ha ha but she's patient, so sweet and does a super fantastic job every time. i even got someone else to absolutely love her too today. soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo yall are missing out! for sure! ask for marsha. mmmmmmk!

staff wasn't very friendly. i got a trim and when i got home i noticed a lot of hairs that were longer than the rest of my hair. my hair was pretty uneven so i had to chop off some strands to even it out. won't be going back. you get what you pay for.

this would have been a much higher review before last night. i've been here half a dozen times and, before last night, gotten very nice haircuts. last night changed everything. i told rose to trim my hair 1/2 inch. i specifically said that i was fine with coming back later for another cut if it turned out  needed more. well, rose trimmed 1/2 inch off the bottom all right. then she proceeded to cut 2 to 3 inches off all my layers. the woman totally scalped me. dont let rose touch your hair.
ask for marsha. i've never had a regular place to go and get a haircut until i walked in here one day and she helped me. since, i always call and make sure she's working before i come in.

marsha is awesome!!! i had 2 diff people recommend her and to be honest, i'm not impressed by most hair stylists, especially ones from chain establishments. but marsha knows her stuff! i have thick hair, and love layers. she cuts it right every single time and is very affordable. can't go wrong with her

1st time customer of supercuts....i am a black women and didn't think they could pull off the hair cut, but i was blown away on how good my hair cut turn out....shonte was very nice she also taught me to maintain my style in between cuts.
this place is clean and the staff is well experienced and knowledgeable. i do not believe that you should have to pay $50 and up for a good hair cut and this place is proof of that. i will be back.

i recenlty moved close to this location. i am very weary about who cuts my hair because i have been going to the same person for years before i came to this supercuts. my first time coming here i happened to get jennifer. as you can see from previous reviews that everyone has mentioned her and they are all right about her. she did a really great job and from then i would always get my haircut from her. other than that the store was well kept and everyone was friendly.i gave this location only 4 stars because i called this morning and found out that jennifer is not longer at this location. i am not sure who or where i am going to go now, but if anyone knows of another person at this location trustworthy please inform me. very disappointed that she is no longer there.

i've been trying to grow out my hair forever, but my ends were so bad i was embarrassed to go out in public.  even though i have an amazing, reliable, long-term hair stylist in my life, i dared to just have someone trim my ends.  i stopped in on a saturday afternoon without an appointment and they were able to fit me in right away.  the girl who cut my hair was sweet, but i'm not really sure she knew what she was doing.  she sprayed my hair with a water bottle and then proceeded to trim my ends.  i think spraying it and not washing it may have been the issue since i walked in with hair that hadn't been washed since the previous day.  it looked ok when i left the salon, but when i went home and washed it/combed it out - i was literally in tears.  my hair was super choppy and uneven.  right away, i called my regular stylist and booked a repair cut.  the cut was cheap (i think only $16), but even that price was a rip-off considering i ended up having to spend extra time and money getting it fixed.  my stylist kept commenting about how crazy the cut was, and because it was so uneven, i ended up having to get at least another 1-2 inches trimmed.  so much for growing my hair out and just trimming the ends! :-( never going anywhere but my regular chick again!!

#supercutsbe prepared to have an extended wait especially,  if you have already put your name on the list in advance. my experience with this supercuts has also been when you call this location from management  stating " i don't have time" then abruptly disconnects from the call! better service at great clips at bunker hill.  i finally found former supercuts hairstylist, manuela lopez there! :-)#supercuts1106silberrdhoustontx77055#greatclips

when i walked in i spoke to the girl at the desk and let her know that i needed to get my haircut and asked if i may use the bathroom. when i came out of the bathroom i sat down and started to wait and then a lady who came in after i did... i watched her drive up, got service before i did (the hairdresser knew her by name) then when it was about to be my turn again, a family of six walked in and the guy hairdresser said that they had been in an hour before and they were next. what's so funny is their name was not in the book but yet he was going to put them in front of me as well. i am very sure that they knew each other and that is why they were being put in front of me. i guess the salon does not need new clients. i will never get my haircut at supercuts again

this review is just for abi. i have thick, curly hair and most stylists just want to chop it all off. abi looked at the picture i brought in. took the time to discuss exactly what i wanted. made a suggestion that she follow the same layers as pic, but not cut it as short as i wanted to be able to put it up still. she ended up cutting and layering it twice after i decided i wanted a little more off. looks like a $50+ haircut, but was only $20! will be asking for abi again!

love my new hair (cut & dyed)! great customer service! they take time to meet your needs & understand what is best for you. i was happy with the result.they also recommended me with great hair treatment product :)

i have gotten about 10 haircuts here and it's usually ok, but lately they have been super slow.  the last time i went i was there for about 1 hour and 45 minutes...they told me 30 mins. cut was average, not worth the wait.

i absolutely love my cut and color from here! i'm very picky but this supercuts outdid my expectations. this location also has excellent customer service. i'm a regular and i've never been disappointed!

my son and i came on a friday morning and there was only one customer who was  just finishing up, so no waiting. jackie did my hair, working from a picture, and she showed me what she was going to do before she made the cuts. she suggested texturizing and also styled the front the way i wanted. i appreciate that they didn't pressure us into buying products for our hair, but simply had them on s shelf if you wanted some. all that and a good price - we'll be going back.
this place is wonderful! great customer service and affordable prices for the services they provide!

brenda did an awesome job cutting our 14 year old son's hair.  he has a "callic" that he plays with to distraction.  she listened to what we needed and gave him a great cut that he can spike up!  he loves it!
i've been coming here for over a year now. i'm a creature of habit but why mess with a good thing. nelis cuts my hair just like i always do and i always leave with a smile. keep it up.

so for some reason yelp removed my complaint but bottom line the manager screwed up my hair a while back and it still has not recovered. matt and jackie are gone so there is no point in even coming here anymore. plus this place is always dirty. i just got this unclean feeling last time i was here. just save your time and money and go to a place that actually cares and cleans their clippers once in a while................
i walked in for a blow dry & style and amelea was my hairstylist. i was very pleased with the service and she did an amazing job curling my hair. if you are in the area stop by to see her.

this was my first haircut in houston, tx. i had previous good experience from supercuts so i decided to try this location. my hair stylist was maria which was very friendly and easy to talk to. i am very picky with my haircuts and not easy to please but maria did a great job. my hair looks great & i got exactly what i wanted. the price was  affordable $14.00 and they offer a deal which is get 10 haircuts and get 1 free card.

they always give me a great haircut. very friendly and always do their best to make my experience great! not expensive and excellent service. also, get the tea tree experience! its very relaxing and its feels so good! i always get that after my haircut.....

first time there, wasn't all that great. didn't like how the girl cut my hair. i had to wait about 30 minutes since i didn't have an appointment. shampoo/conditioner is 6 bucks. my total was around $20 and my hair is pretty long. won't be returning though.

i drive all the way from baytown, tx just to have my hair cut at this salon! i met jennifer 3 years ago when i lived at sawyer heights lofts and stopped at this location to get my hair cut! even though i live in baytown now i still travel 30 minutes because of the quality and friendly customer service i receive at this supercuts!!!

last time going to this location!! they obviously have people that don't know what they are doing! specifically showed them a picture of long layer hair cut and ended up getting a blunt straight shoulder cut!!!? did not catch the name of the person but he was a male.

it's the best salon i've ever been to. they are very helpful and make you feel more like a friend instead of just a customer. jennifer is amazing at cut, style,  and color. i wouldn't go anywhere else.

this is a typical supercuts. it's a typical hair cutting place. i've never had to wait long here, without it being obvious it was going to happen as the waiting area was packed. i've seen people go ahead before that had an appointment, but that's not shocking. all the ladies seem to do good work. i certainly am happy when i leave.

they don't honor their own coupons!!!the haircuts are just ok . .. the service is, often, not even that. i live in the same zip code and get supercuts coupons in the mail.  i go, and present the coupon, they tell me they don't honor those!!!!  i live just blocks from them.  i could walk!!   what supercuts are they for???  i am done.  might be time to support the local economy, instead of the chain.

worst barbershop i've ever been to. they said they don't have #3 clippers and just give everyone who asks a 3.5?? also the barber didn't listen to me 5 times during the haircut could, and cut way too short. couldn't blend the sides of my head with scissors as i asked for, and did a lob sided haircut overall. wouldn't recommend to anyone. to make it worse when i complained to the manager who was watching the whole haircut she didn't say sorry once and didn't accept that they did anything wrong. of course had to pay the full price never visit again

remember one name tommie!! by far the best stylist i've ever had. i have been a client for almost 6 years now every two weeks i see her. she always have a wait but it is worth it. i've told her for years that company doesn't deserve her. i am one of those customers that know what i want and won't take anything less then that. she does a great job every time.

i have been going to this supercuts for over 3 years now. my normal stylist is alondra and she does great on men's haircuts and fades. i've used a few of the other staff while my stylist is on vacation and they are all very friendly. i love the staff and the hours. also a new thing they offer is for you to check in online from a mobile app so i normally check in while i'm on my way. i've seen plenty of families come through and i've never seen an unhappy customer. give it a try!

don't even want to give my experience a one star. this lady butchered my hair. honestly the worst haircut i have ever received in my life. i don't know how i kept my cool, and most definitely don't understand how i still paid her!  she can't do good lines, she gave me a bald spot and tried telling me that's how my hair grew! her fade is horrible she made my experience traumatizing. don't waist your time,money, or hairline. sylvia will mess not only your hair up but your day!

do not go here. they utterly destroyed my hair. i went in for a simple trim of my shoulder-length hair, specified exactly what i wanted, and also specified exactly what i didn't want, just to make sure there was no misunderstanding. lady cutting my hair indicated she understood, then hacked it off exactly how i told her i did not want it done. and it was absurdly uneven, and i had to specifically tell her to even it out after she was done. it looked like a five-year-old had done it with a butcher knife. i left sobbing. this probably serves me right for going to supercuts in the first place when i actually cared how my hair turned out, but i figured it was safe enough since all i wanted was a very basic cut. this was clearly my mistake, as i could (and have!) literally done a better job cutting my own hair at home with a pair of sewing scissors. i will never go back here, and the only use i could possibly imagine anyone having for this place is to recommend it to their enemies as a practical joke.edit: just read a few of the other reviews, and it looks like it's one butcher who's ruining it for everyone. older african american lady was the one who obliterated my hair. she rushed it like mad, did a sloppy job, and i still want to cry.

i cut my own hair for a decade.  i know - not terribly stylish of me, but a short buzz is pretty easy to do on your own.  i should have started coming here sooner.  it doesn't matter who i get, they always do a great job.  parking can be a pain, and there can be a wait right after work, but i don't want to go anywhere else.

waste of time. called in the afternoon cause i wanted to get my hair colored as i had an event the next day to attend. was told they were open until 9pm and that i could come in anytime to get my hair colored. so i plan my evening accordingly as i had to be somewhere tonight at 9pm. come in at 8pm and am told that they close at 8:30 and the latest they do color is till 6:30... sounds to me like they don't care about getting business, whether new or a regular customer. this place has lost my business and i will never come back to supercuts. over priced anyway for their stuff.

if i could i would give this place zero stars!! they have the worst customer service. they discriminate against customers. i brought my son in and it was clear each of the stylists kept "conveniently" bypassing him to take the next customer. we were waiting an hour and after they passed us over 5 times i asked them why we kept being skipped. they fumbled with their words said they made a mistake yet still took a different customer and told me to wait and it would be just a little longer! ridiculous... very rude! i will never go back!

i'd give this place 0 stars if it weren't for one of the stylists being nice, but this place has lost my business forever.  twice in a row i arrived well before their closing time and was told by the manager that they are closed.  meanwhile their light is on and door is unlocked and several still there.  i guess they'd rather go home early than make money!  never coming here again!!!

i've been coming here for about 2 years and my barber/stylist.. whatever you want to call him.. is awesome. his name is aj and when i first starting getting my hair cut with him, he definitely took the time to listen to what i wanted and worked with me throughout the cut. 2 years later he's still doing an awesome job. this supercuts has just been updated and it's pretty nice. all the employees are very nice, the store is clean, and it's in a convenient area.
waited 30 minutes and someone walked off the street went ahead of me for total 45 min wait . go at your own risk to be bunked. really bad manager! i was not the only one that walked out.

i came to get my haircut with rita and she did a great job! having just moved here from laredo, i was afraid to come in with someone new. she was very knowledgeable and really made sure i felt comfortable with everything she was doing to my hair.

holy cow, i must say, this is by far the worst haircut i've ever had. i am asian and only recently moved to houston. whenever i move to a new place, i usually have trouble finding barbers that know how to cut asian hair well. usually supercuts hasn't done well in past locations, but i decided to give them a chance. i asked for a simple trim: #3 in the back and sides, and just shorter in front. the back and sides look fine since using a buzzer with a predetermined # is pretty impossible to mess up. the front though looks like the lady put a rice bowl over my head and cut around it. i told her it looked horrid, and asked her to fix it. she kept making it worse, and eventually i just gave up. i will have to go to a different barber just to get this monstrosity fixed.
seriously 22 $ for a normal hair cut which just takes ur 3 min. not going back again.
well run, friendly staff, consistently good cuts. aj is gone, so now i usually go to taro. he's always taken care of me all the way down to ear hair and eyebrow trims.

i've been getting my hair cut at this super cuts for almost 2 years.  i have never had a bad experience.  all of the stylists do a  good job.  when possible, i have aj cut my hair.  he always does an amazing job.  i always say that i will call ahead and make sure he is there before going, but i don't simply because i trust everyone there.the salon interior was recently renovated due to the staff winning some kind of "best salon" award.  you can't beat it for $14.95!
what and under rated gem! coya's abilities and professionalism made my day. everyone there is great. thank you for a consistent store and inviting atmosphere.

just had the worst haircut here by far. i been coming here for the past couple of months. and i dont have a preference on who cuts my hair. but today this older african american ladie literally cut my hair in under 3 minutes. she rushed my hair cut so she can get the next guy, this lady next to me finishes her customer, and my stylist told her to "clean your station before you take the next person" and "im buying time so i can get the next guy". i feel so mad that i even gave her 2$ tips. this wasnt worth 15$, i can get this at a $5 mexican salon down the street. so pissed, i felt like a second class customer, as if im not as important as the next guy she was trying to get. he probably tips her big. but i dont care, im a customer as well.

i walked in on a saturday afternoon and expected the wait to be long but i was seen within 10 minutes. i got helen who was super sweet and did exactly what i wanted. she also would check with me before she did any final cuts to ensure i liked what she was gonna do which i really appreciated! she was fast but efficient and did a great job, will definitely go back to this location.
gloria is the best hairdresser! don't go with anyone else!! make an online appointment if you don't want to wait too long.

very impressed with the service provided by eunice! first the wait was not long, even though there were three people waiting. i had not cut my hair in a while and starting to look like a witch with long boring black hair. lol  so i requested layers. eunice walked me through the cut explaining how she was giving me vertical layers while keeping my length. cost $17 and coupons are available. i will definietely go back.
it's a trap!the price makes it really appealing (it's so cheap), but there's no attention to detail. they just try to get you out as quickly as possible and don't seem to care about doing a good job.
don't let eunice touch your hair. she needs to be fired! i asked for high and tight with finger length on top. a day later i wash my hair and its multiple lengths on top, very short in the middle.
the ladies here cut my hair very well. it's walking distance from my work and makes it convenient to go to during lunch

i've been coming to this location for 8 yrs, it's never overly crowded and i've been using michelle and gloria for yrs. these ladies are awesome. they know exactly how i like my hair cut. look them up the next time you need a cut.

i needed a haircut in a hurry for an interview and tried this place out since it's so close to home.  i setup an appointment online and showed to see there was only one stylist in the entire place.she performed a rush job on my cut and kept looking at her watch as if she had other things to do.   when i indicated i also needed her to wash my hair, she didn't seem pleased.   long story short and to no surprise, the hair cut was over done and uneven.    luckily, my hair grows fast so the damage was minimal but, this is a lesson learned that you get what you pay for.

i had been needing to cut my hair for a while but just hadn't gotten around to it. i'd made an appointment earlier in the week for a "fancy" salon but when i arrived they hadn't officially confirmed my appointment. so a few days later i walked in here and had zero minutes wait time.a lovely lady named helen immediately helped me and did my hair. she listened to exactly what i asked - 6-8 inches off and layers - and did exactly that, while double checking what i wanted as we progressed on the process. what more could i ask for? she knew what she was doing and was professional. unlike some places that charge extra for longer hair it was a flat rate which i really appreciated also.if you want a good haircut of exactly what you want and aren't interested in all those fancy frills like "free mimosas" this place is great. they also didn't feel the need to force product on me which i also appreciate. go see helen! great experience!

been a regular since moving to houston 4 years ago, but this place has gone way downhill in the last few months.  all of the old stylists/barbers have left (not sure if it's a corporate policy change?), and the appointment system is suddenly jacked up (2 hr wait with an appointment!?! wtf).  expect a long wait for an even more mediocre haircut.  time to find a new shop...

i had several good experience with supercuts at different locations but this encounter was just bad. i usually go somewhere else but that place was closed on sunday so i had to resort to supercuts. how hard is it to cut a guys where with clippers and scissors. i got home and noticed that my sideburns were uneven between my right and left. there were portions of the top that were different length/ ignored. although the price was ok, i would rather spend a few extra dollars to get a good haircut then have to go back home and fix the problem myself.

the people here are very friendly and know what they are doing. far better than tgf where i went before. also, you can make an appointment or checkin online. but even without that i never had to wait!i totally recommend this place!

the good reviews say it all. i was looking for a quick haircut and was far from my usual tgf -a mixed bag lately- and... sorry tgf but you've lost a customer. this supercuts is nice, clean, pleasant and, very important in montrose, provides easy parking. i had no wait late on a sunday afternoon and had the good fortune to be helped by eunes, who apart from doing a great job with my hair is also a great lady: experienced, professional and a joy to talk to! will definitely be back.

i saw gloria and she was awesome. i am african american, have very thick coarse hair and a pixie cut (of all styles). she was personable, very skilled and gave me exactly what i wanted. the only reason i'm giving four stars instead of five is because of the wait (but to be fair, i didn't have an appointment) and she didn't use clippers to edge up the back. no worries, my hubby usually does that for me. i will be back for sure. solid cut and service

i have been getting my hair cut a the this location for several months now and have never been disappointed. they have an app,which allows you to check-in on your way so that you are not stuck waiting in a long line, which is a huge plus. it seems the busiest times are the afternoons and especially the weekend afternoons. the stylist have always given me a quality cut and a great price, so i will be back.

so, i had to be somewhere after work so i decided to pack clothes for the gym before going out.  well it never fails, of course i forgot my running shoes and i had wore dress shoes to work. just great!!  lol well then i needed to kill time and i have been meaning to get a hair cut; therefore, the logically thing to do is go get a hair cut!!  i walked into this supercut and i was greet by melanie.  she asked for my name and email to put me on the waiting list.  then, i sat down and patiently waiting for two people in front of me to get a hair cut.  there were two cosmological there and it was actually pretty quick.  melanie was the next one free when it was my turn so she shampoo my hair and started making conversation with me.  it was kind of nice instead of just sitting there in silence.  after the shampoo, she walkede me to the station and asked how i'd like my hair cut.  i explained it to her and she did exactly that. before she started cutting she made sure of the length i wanted too.  overall, i had a great experience here and melanie was super nice, friendly, quick, and professional.  i would definitely go back for a hair cut if i was in the midtown area or after work! =)

this is the best place in midtown when you are looking for a good hair cut, but don't want to pay the same price as if you were buying a new car. jessica is fantastic! i have been going to her for the past five plus years and she always does a great job. she will cut her goad however you ask her her to and you never feel rushed or like she is too busy to take the time to do a good job on your. i wouldn't go anywhere ales. great location, good parking and if you call ahead you can usually get in and out in no time.
got a really bad haircut here yesterday. couldn't have been worse. lady apologized after. have them a second star bc everyone is very nice. in short, nice ppl, crappy haircuts

first time i went to supercuts and my now new hairstylist javier rivera was amazing! great communication with me understood what i wanted and gave me tips and opinions that i love to hear through the process of cutting my hair. he was well groomed, clean and had a great appearance, which is a good plus to me! i will def be coming back again to him!
friendly staff great cutreasonably pricedexcellent selection of productsno appointment needed

marissa is terrific! she colored and highlighted my hair & a cut. she was right on with her suggestions. she listened to what i wanted & took her time cutting my hair. i loved my color, highlights and cut.

on saturday, i made the mistake of getting a haircut at a salon closer to my home. again...big mistake....really nice person...bad hair cut. fortunately, glorious was working on sunday morning. i quickly made my way to her and she worked a miracle, as always!  i started going to  glorious over 8 years ago because it was convenient but now i have learned that convenience is not as important as quality, patience, style and experience.  i have learned my lesson. #supercutheights #glorious #4ever
i have been seeing glorious here for many many years and she is just that- glorious!!!  i trust her because she has decades of experience and gives amazing service.  i recommend her highly!

in the area and decided to try this supercuts rather than drive the few extra miles to my regular salon...big mistake!i explained that i only needed a shampoo and then a trim to get rid of split/dry ends. this was by far the quickest hair visit i have ever experienced. i found it convenient until i got home and realized it was because the stylist didn't pay attention and missed a bunch of hair!! i still had chunks of hair with split ends and ended up taking my kitchen scissors to trim it myself. who has time to go back and demand a fix?!?on another note, the way the stylists were chatting with each other was excessive and maybe that attributed to the lack of care in my haircut. also, the stylist stood at the register while i was paying which always makes me feel uncomfortable like they're waiting to see how much of a tip they get. will not go back.

i brought my daughter here and they upsold me without asking for my permission.  i looked up and my daughter was getting her hair washed...too late to say no.  it's too bad bc her tipn would have been well worth it if she had trimmed her hair we originally asked.
did not take direction and completely botched my boyfriend hair.  they cannot cut tapper fades. do not come here for a tapper fade.

by far one of the worst haircuts i've ever had the displeasure of receiving. don't go!! save your money. have your wife, cousin, random stranger on the street cut your hair before you go here, you'll end up with a better trim. so here is the rundown of what happened, and why you should never visit this place. i walk in sit down in the chair, and the entire time i feel like i've interrupted the employees goal is session. they were talking and making inside jokes the entire time and my hairstylist never really listened to what i was saying. i asked for a fade with a 1 guard and after she fumbled around for a min or so in her messy work station she finally pulls out a 1.5 guard and secretly slips that on thinking it will work. first the fade line is not even, there looks like there is patches of missed hair that just got passed up with the clippers. she also missed trimming the hair around my ears and my neck line. had to go to cutthroat barber shop to have them fix it. do not go here...ever

recently i've been looking for a new place to get a haircut in the area because my other one had switched to a different place. well i came across this location because it was close to my job. well i just wanted to say that i am very pleased and lucky to have found this location because kelly is the best. she does a great job on the style that i want and she's also very personable. although she does cut my hair very quickly, she cuts it the way i request it. if you do decide to go here ask for her. you will not be disappointed.

had the "anti-gray" treatment for men yesterday.  i have had it done before, at another shop, and was pleased with the results, very subtle.  the treatment consists of finding the right color so it doesn't alter your existing hair color, only minimize the gray.  they are supposed to choose the dye formula based on your existing hair color.  apparently this technician thought brown was close enough and i ended up having my hair dyed.   it is quite obvious.  to supercut, if your technician doesn't know what they are doing then do not allow them to work on clients.

i get nervous trying a new place because i've had some pretty horrific haircuts growing up but i've been surprisingly satisfied with supercuts.  they aren't the best cuts and it's not really for style or to impress but it gets the job done to a level i can live with.  linda cut my hair and she seemed like she knew what she was doing.  she was fast, asked questions, and did a pretty good job.  i was a walk in and had no wait right after work.  they offer the 10th cut free and give you some coupons after you check out ($5 off, $4 off, $3 off).  good experience and will probably go back.

my hair is thick, straight, and full of more cow licks than a weekend at the lilith fair, so the fact that these guys can even make my haircut look competent consistently is enough for 3 stars.but the fact that they're the only supercuts i've ever been to that stocks current issues of wired, sports illustrated, spin, and probably a few others that i can't remember nets them an extra half star. honestly, i'd be thrilled by any thing that wasn't jet or ebony, but this is above and beyond. the other extra half star goes to the awesome staff. they're always talkative, but not pushy talkative. they'll chat, but they'll also stfu. it's a perfect middle ground. every single person i've encountered there is awesome. i would honestly give them a whole other star, pushing the total up to 5, based on the excellent music played, courtesy of each individual employee having their own pandora station, but 5 stars to a supercuts would be ridiculous, and i'd lose whatever credibility i had left after the lilith fair joke. but seriously. go get fro-checked at the one on 43rd and then come to this one, you'll see what i'm talking about. this place is the best supercuts ever.
gloria gave me a great cut! the tea tree treatment was wonderful, complete with hot towel wrap. enjoyable experience.

being out of town and needing a haircut don't mix well for me.  i have a usual stylist at home with a set appointment every other week.i was desperate, and having seen a supercuts tv commercial the night before i decided to  yelp the closet location to where i was staying.upon arrival, i was greeted kindly.  checked in and waited for the next available stylist (i wish i would have gotten his name).  when called back the gentleman listened to my requests, did a great job of keeping me updated, offered mirror to see the back multiple times, carried on a good conversation, offered shampoo which i accepted and got a nice cranial massage that felt amazing and topped off with a warm towel over my face that smelled minty.  all while laying in a massaging chair.my expectations were exceeded!  left feeling rejuvenated.

so i just got my haircut from this location and i am writing this review still confused about my service. why confused? because this was my 2nd time using supercuts but my 1st time going to this location. my first experience was at the kirby/main location and my walkout price was $20 (not including tip) for a basic cut, shampoo & blow dry. at this upper kirby location, i walked in and said "i want a shampoo, trim & blow dry" and my total came to $58...$58!!!...for what i thought i was going to be the exact same cut i received at the previous location. whenever i went to pay out and she said the total, i thought i misheard her, so i asked her again. nope, she said $58. i was shocked in my thoughts but didn't say anything....but i should have thinking back on it. i even saw a sign by the cash register that said "ladies special: cut, shampoo & deep condition for $26" and i didn't even get s deep conditioning so i still don't know why mine was so much more. yes she did spent more time cutting my hair than the first person and i guess she "styled it" versus just doing a basic blow drying like the other person did, but i didn't ask for it and just though it was the way she blow dried vs. the other girl i had previously. but still, even if that was considered to be a "style",is that warrants a $38 difference from my original experience i had at the other location???? see why i am confused! i just moved over to this area so that's the only reason i went here instead of the other location. if i want to pay almost $70 for a haircut, i would go back to my fancy salon. ugh. only thing i can think of is that she asked if i wanted to keep my long layers and i just said "you can, they are prolly all grown out so just an inch trim is good." she ended up doing more layers than i had before but whatever, it's hair, it will grow out. still bummed because i was hoping to like this much more convenient location. i would also like to add that my 2 stars is based solely on the price situation. the location itself was nice, clean, friendly staff and played good music so just wanted to make that clear.

i called ahead and the hostess said "no wait".  i arrived to a all the chairs filled and 6 people waiting. the hostess said i was next. then they took 3 people before me.  20 minutes later i was still waiting and walked out.  no one updated me or explained the wait.  i wouldn't recommend wasting your time.
the lady went shorter then we asked and my child was so distraught.  probably not going there again.

i have been coming to this location on and off for few years as it is conveniently located but today was probably my last day. the "stylist" was in some kind of rush and had this idea of what cut she wanted to give me. in spite of repeatedly tell her she did what she had in mind and kept literally running through the job even though there weren't many people waiting. she was opening this drawer in from to take things out and kept banging my leg every time and didn't even say sorry or anything.  this place has steadily increased prices by about 30% over the last 2 years which is outrageous for a cut that lasts 15 mins at max. i would suggest guys to find different place instead of coming here
been going here since i moved to houston and it's really convenient and olivia is the best! the app keeps it easy to check in and the men's special is great.

i recently decided to try cheaper haircut options, and supercuts is about 1/2 as expensive as my usual salon. based on some decent reviews here, i think it's just very hit-or-miss, and not worth the risk.i showed up as the store opened at 8:30, and the stylist sighed at me as if i was inconveniencing her. she spent the whole time sighing and slapping my head with the comb. she argued with me when i asked her to make changes. she did not ask me if i wanted a mirror to see the back of my head; i had to ask myself when it became apparent she expected me to leave. supercuts has a shampoo option, but she didn't ask me if i wanted it. i unfortunately didn't get her name, but it's not like i'll be back. other people seem to have favorable reviews of this place, so just go at your own risk.
i got a haircut and the wait was not long and results were good. tons of parking and near a bus stop.

i had dulce or dulche and she was rude. i normally come here and get jose who's wonderful but i was in a rush and he wasn't in. i sit down and she starts combing my hair and complains about it being tangly (my hair tangles extremely easy) and tells me about 4 times that my hair is damaged. i'm well aware hence the hair cut. so she cuts an inch off and i decide to cut another inch off.. she said to me with an attitude "that's what i told you in the beginning when i said your hair was damaged" and acts as if it's wasting her time if i cut more off. won't ever get her again.

came here expecting the same quality/value i've received at previous supercuts. it was a mistake. in fact it probably soured me on the whole supercuts franchise. i used to go to supercuts because my haircut is simple, so i prefer to spend very little to get it done. supercuts used to be "budget" but still decent results.that has changed. this location charged about $17 (i was used to abour $12.95 at the sugar land location), and none of the hairstylists (all females) were friendly at all. if i'm going to spend $17+tip on a haircut, i'm going to go to a real barber. no more supercuts for me i guess.
i went by this location at 815p and they had the door locked i leave work at 8p this place deserves no stars

i have been going to super cuts for a while to get my hair cut . and every time i went i was unhappy with the way they cut my hair. well i went to get my hair cut on saturday july 2, and i took a picture in with me for an example of how i wanted my hair cut. the lady who cut my hair never asked me how long or short i wanted my hair. she just started cutting and she cut my hair way to short. i am very unhappy and mad. i will never go to super cut again. i am done with them.

i went here for a while because i don't like to pay an arm and leg for a haircut.  ya it was cheap but it got the job done for two to three weeks at a time.  went through three or four different stylists before i settled on one.  everything was going well for while then it seemed like they started rushing through my haircuts.  slowly but surely the quality went down.then i noticed that they had changed the front desk person a few times.  i finally quit going after i had scheduled an appointment and when i arrived they said they didn't have it down and no more slots where open.  i let the first time it happened slide but after the second time i was done.  on to the next one.  it's too easy to find another spot to cut my hair and probably do a better job.

i can't believe i went here for a haircut. and i can't believe i'm now writing a review about it...i chose to go to supercuts because i recently spent a great deal of money on a ouidad haircut and later decided i wanted to get some length taken off my hair, but didn't want to spend a lot at the aveda salons that i normally go to. i really just wanted a few inches taken off my overall length and thought - how badly could supercuts mess that up?i went after work, on a monday, around 6 pm. it was fairly crowded, mostly with men. they were very friendly and were playing 104.1 the whole time i was there. the hair stylists definitely seemed like they're most accustomed to doing men's haircuts. they asked me if i wanted my hair shampooed and cut or just cut. were they going to cut it dry??initially the stylist did not even ask me what i wanted to do to my hair; i think she just assumed i wanted a trim, but when i asked her to discuss it before she washed my hair, she was very receptive. the stylist encouraged me to cut my hair "all one length" instead of with layers (i think she really just didn't want to have to do the layers). after cutting my hair (which she did very quickly and kind of without combing it first...), my stylist had to help another stylist with a more complicated cut, so they had someone else blow-dry my hair. the lady who blow dried my hair seemed very nervous and used almost an entire bottle of straightening serum on my hair. however, she did a good job , so i can't really complain about it. the entire time they were cutting and blow drying my hair, they had it parted down the middle. when the lady was finished blow drying my hair, it was still parted down the middle. i laughed and asked if i could use a brush because that is not normally where i part my hair. she looked at me like i was crazy. really? how many people part their hair right down the middle??anyway, overall, i am very satisfied with the haircut. i definitely won't go back to supercuts for my regular haircuts, but it was a not a terrible experience. i would go here if i were a man...or if i had little boys who needed haircuts. the saddest part is it wasn't even that cheap. with tip, $50! i should have blow dried it myself at home...

ladies, do not cut your hair here! if you are detailed about your hair, don't come to this location. the lady was careless of my directions and just cut it even when i asked her to follow my slanted angle cut. the manager had to help her fix it! literally just cut your hair yourself before going here. it's no wonder i was the only girl in the salon. maybe it works for men but not women... just dont.

i have been getting my hair cut here for about a month now and have never been disappointed. there is rarely a wait and the prices are great. the service and personality of the stylists are great. you will feel welcome here.
i do not recommend this place. the hair dresser was not helpful. she just wanted you in and out asap so she could move onto the next customer.
ask for the men's special w/ tea tree shampoo, its pretty relaxing.it can get packed w/ men getting cuts before a wknd, but service is good, fast, and friendly.
horrible skills ,they cant even make the sides identical ,what an amateurs,just wasted 17$.

i've been going here for about a year and i'm always satisfied with my haircut. i think i had one bad haircut but never saw that stylist again.  always quick as well.  overall i would recommend this place to any guys.

i got a haircut for $16. i paid an extra $3 for a shampoo, as i needed to go straight out afterwards for a meal. it seems the hairdresser i had does not care too much about the customer. while my hair was being washed, she used only her right hand and did not thoroughly wash it. i could see her staring into space (and not at my hair) the entire time she was washing my hair. as a result, the right side of my head was clean - i'll give her credit. the left side however was still had a lot of loose hair (see below). maybe she could have tried a little harder. side note, it didn't look like her left hand was broken or injured as she was using it for other stuff. i could be wrong, but if i pay an extra $3 for a shampoo wash, i'm hoping my hair is decently washed, and that the amount of loose hairs is reduced. when i went to pay at the counter, i brushed my hair, and you can see hairs all over the hand. only reason i am giving 2 stars is because the manager there offered to blow dry my hair as she can tell there was a lot of hair, even after washing it. my hairdresser said she'll do it and then resumed to blow dry it very quickly, but was not very thorough. after i stepped out of the salon, i brushed the back of my head once with my fingers through the hair. i had a palm full of hair (on the left). i feel like the quality (at least at this site) was just not there. baseline 1 star. giving a second because the manager seemed to be nice, and a 3rd total because prior supercuts from this place was decent. at this time, with the current employees they have now, would not recommend.

never go here the lady was rude made fun of my haircut, rushed me out the door to go sit down and watch family feud and got annoyed when she wanted a tip.  she dinnt listen to any request to how to cut my hair and was very rude never ever coming back again she bragged she had been hear for 10 years worst experience of my life.

the lack of service at this location has gone down. not to mention the price! it's almost like every time i come the price in a men's hair cut goes up. i will no longer be coming to supercuts for the type of hair cut they gave me they were literally done in 5 minutes they didn't take the time to give me a proper cut and the lady acted like she didn't want to be there. what will no longer make me come back to supercuts is the service and new price. if i'm going to pay $17.00 plus tip i might as well will go to a real barber shop one that knows how to cut hair.
this place is amazing! it's a very comfortable waiting area, and you're always greeted with a smile. the stylists treat you like family. kerri is fantastic. if you get her, you won't regret it.

i was in need of a quick, easy, last minute hair fix before my vaca since my normal stylist was out of town.....so i broke down and decided to give supercuts a try. honestly, i was very hesitant because i am used to "high-er end" salons (that charge way too much for simple basic cuts) and a high end salon this is not......but hey, it was quick and fast and that it what i needed. i was surprised to find out that there was a location right across from krogers on main in the same shopping center as smashburger. i called before driving there just to make sure they weren't busy and she said they had 2 stylists working with no wait. got there and yep, no wait because i was the only one there lol. alicia (if that is how you spell here name) greeted me, got my info and told me to come on back. may i add, she made zero small talk.....barely spoke at all. i had to ask her name, ask for a shampoo. i mean you don't have to be all chatty but the basic simple friendly conversation would have been nice : /  and after she cut my hair, she took my cape off (while my hair was still wet) as i asked confused "can you blow dry it??" she replied "it will be an additional $1." i mean, she was nice about it but it just really confused me and caught me off guard because i just figured that it was included.....or figured she would have asked. prolly should have told her it was my first time here so she could have pre-told me about this "build your own package" kind of a thing. still, super weird to me but i guess its just a basic  in-and-out kind of a place......which i can dig.let me break down the pricing situation for you: basic women trim/cut: $16shampoo: extra $3blow dry: $1walk out price for my 45 min appt = $20long story short, i liked my cut so i would say it was worth it and that i would return again.

on a tuesday morning, for $16 (plus tip) diana gave me a super great haircut! i like it better than my $35 plus tip haircut at my previous hairstylist in austin. she didn't wash my hair but sprayed with a spray bottle and ended with a quick blow-dry to freshen up. she did long layers, a v-shape in the back, and cut off the dead split ends. i wanted it kept long, simple but classy, and healthy and that is what she gave me. i felt she really knew what she was doing - very efficient and proficient.5ish minute wait as a walk-in. very clean location. conveniently located next to kroger and the its fuel station for my grocery shopping.definitely will be going back to diana for my next haircut! :)

i went because of 9.95 coupon. they asked for your name and i told them i don't want my name registered just for a haircut so they said just make up a name so what's the point of getting your name?then she asked why i looked upset so i told the lady that of course because you insist of asking my name and i didn't want my name registered and get emails and robocalls and just mails to my mailbox. anyway when i paid with my credit card she looked at my receipt and said your name is ****. what a jerk.not coming back.
friendly staff, fast service and as good as it gets! great new salon!

the stylist that cut my hair seemed like she would much rather be somewhere else from the second i entered. she wasn't friendly to begin with and sprayed water in my face at one point. at the end, she didn't even attempt to dry my hair so i walked out with dripping wet hair. (i would have gladly paid a dollar for my hair to be blow-dried, but i didn't know that was an option at the time) i've been to this supercuts before and was pleased with my stylist during that visit, but after this visit i would not recommend that anyone go for a walk-in haircut here

i came in for a quick haircut and only asked for a low fade on the sides(1&2). the stylist does a 1 on the lower part behind the head and the rest of the sides were a 2. next thing i know, the stylist starts cutting the rest of my hair(enough for a small topknot) before i could ask for a small trim and a thinning. my hair ended up blending with the sides and it was uneven everywhere. make sure you stop them before they do something you don't ask, or hopefully they know not to do something no one asked for.
quick and friendly service. never had any issues. and the prices/ offers are pretty good too.
quick cheap and friendly service for men and kids. not suggesting this place for women, they are not particularly precise in the details. but overall great, if you need a basic haircut.

my husband just came home from getting a haircut and it is by far the worst haircut i have ever seen. he was angry and frustrated because she couldn't get it right after he showed her pictures of his past haircuts. she did not blend at all so it literally looks like she took a buzzer to the sides of his head and didn't touch the top. he didn't remember her name but she should not be cutting hair. he is now on his way to another salon to get it fixed. absolutely horrific experience. i advise everyone to stay far, far away.

i had two haircuts at this place. wonderful experince. i will definitely go back. i am picky on my hair and i always give tips and directions on how i want my hair to look. they were very respectful and did exactly what i asked. you barely find a supercut to do a custom haircut for you. most barbers know some routine styles and they follow that. the check-in and welcome was great as well. i recommend this place.
great spot for a quick haircut. i have been here a couple of times and was happy with their work. right by tmc so very convenient to drop by while on lunch break or on the way to work.

just discovered this location. it's very spacious and there are many chairs, which make the wait way less than most hair salons. very friendly services. and easy to get the look you want. would definitely come back.

i came in today, with the knowledge that my hair cut wasn't going to be the same caliber at my regular salon but i this was the only opportunity i had to get haircut prior to giving birth. when i walked in i glanced at the pricing, noting that it would be 29.00 for a haircut iii. they were able to see me promptly, and as i was walked to the shampooing station in the back. the stylist mentioned the haircut costing 18.00 and the cost of the shampoo and product being additionalthe haircut was everything you would expect going into a super cuts. layers needed blending and were pretty basic, again this was what i was expecting. she then began to blow dry hair. she used a comb and parted it on one side and did brush it once she was finished. the only hot tool she used was blow dryer. this was all completely fine, and what i expected. i will say, the staff was very prompt and my stylist was friendly and my issue is not necessarily with her.the shock came when i checked out, and was given a bill for $84.00. after they itemized the receipt, i realized i was charged sixty dollars to blow dry my hair. they would not refund my money because it was "styled" despite not using a single hot tool.  i was told that the blow dry that is "just removing some of the wetness from the hair." i would have been much happier with the entire experience if someone had discussed this up front.

i don't like to spend much on my trims. supercuts is nicely priced (i spent $20, tip included). this location is the nicest supercuts i've been in. the venue is newly remodeled, modern and fresh. the staff was very nice and i had no wait time. great place to go for a quick spruce-up!

growing my hair out for my wedding in march, but needed to trim it up to get rid of some split ends. told the guy i just wanted a trim 2 inches off at most. straight across the back. i have super straight hair so this task should not be difficult for a professional. walked out of there with uneven hair, jagged ends and 4-5 inches chopped off! i would go back and ask for my money back and for them to fix it but i don't want i lose anymore inches! time to pay someone else to fix it :(
i've been pleasantly pleased with this supercuts.... very friendly and efficient. i have a hairdresser however for in between cuts and basic salon services i recommend this location.
awesome haircut joint, ask for tina!
carolyn was awesome. i took my niece to this location for her birthday. carolyn was wonderful with her and took her time to get the cut right and did it with a smile. great job!!!

omg i went today there and i left crying!!! i told the lady i wanted my hair short in the back and longbin the front like a bob cut!!! but nooo she freaking cut all my hair to the shoulder length no long layers or short layers. i'm soo disappointed!!! never again coming back!

worst place to get a haircut. they have people with no training cutting hair . i took my daughter today to cut her hair and i told the girl twice clearly that i wanted only 3 inches cut and in a v shaped in layers. well she kept cutting and cutting because she could not get the the hair cut right. i went and told her she was cutting to much and she said she had asked my 12 yr old if it was fine. who asks a 12 yr old? when i had already told her how i wanted it cut. after my daughter having waist long hair her ended up shoulder length. her name is juliann ozuniga !!warning!!!! do not go here's

this place is great and yesenia is lying she didn't do it wrong it's probably just her because from what i know that hair cut can't be done without making the sides look smaller if she cut hair she would know that so you doing just fine julieann ozuniga just fine.

always busy especially during lunchtime and after office hours since this supercuts is in downtown surrounded by office complexes. normal waiting time for walk-in is not bad, perhaps 10-30 minutes max since most clients are men and we just need a quick haircut. however they do have apps that enable you to check in ahead of time so the waiting time can be reduced. my go-to stylist is martha; she is awesome and gives excellent service. she ensure that she understands my needs and expectations before she started to work. i'm always very satisfied with her work results.once in a while on afternoon just before the weekend some women came in as walk-ins to get their hour plus full treatment before going out - dyeing, curling etc, that it backed up the whole system and some of us guys just have to cancel our pre-approved appointments. with the type of clientele they have (mostly male, time-conscious businessmen and professionals), perhaps it's best to ensure that there is maximum allocated time per client for special cases like these in accordance with the number of stylist they have, to ensure we all can get good timely service with no pushback or cancellation.

the supercuts app does not work! i used it to reserve my spot, show up on time and was informed they did not receive my appointment in their system. i showed them my phone app but that did nothing for me. very disappointing!

gloria, the only good stylist there is gone now so there is no reason to go back. in addition, they moved it to the allen center food court where everyone stares at you while you are getting your hair cut and there is no glass partition like at hair places in the mall. it is like you are an animal on exhibit in the zoo. if you are curious gloria is now at norba's hair salon (116 pecore st) .
i live downtown, it's quick and convenient as long as you make a reservation ahead of time. they are always short staffed so if you walk in be prepared to wait a little.
good, quality haircuts. pleasant stylists. great value.

big shoutout to my girl maria molina. ain't nobody touching dis head, but her. she should work 7 days a week, just so i can get a haircut any day i want. :-) jk... anyway, i've gone through several locations and hair stylists before finding maria the great!! i've been in la for over 3 years, and super happy that i have this. my relationship with maria has certainly lasted longer than any of my boyfriends. that search continues! that's how i know she's a keeper. my hair isn't difficult to cut, but y'all don't know how many times people have messed it up. she can carry a conversation. nothing worse than complete silence while getting a haircut. this is the most convenient location for me. they're consistently busy, so i recommend calling to schedule an appointment or use their app to book one. also, this location offers a rewards program. earn yourself a free haircut after so many. one hour parking with validation.

super unprofessional lacking basic customer service skillsunorganized greeting customers when walking in seems to be the hardest things for the employees heresurprised they still can stay open much better and professional services availabile in the neighborhood not recommended

maria c. made me look my best on an important night! black tie event and the night was amazing because i felt good and i looked good. she always does an amazing job and does exactly what i ask for. she remembers how i like my hair but always checks in with me just in case i want to try something different. i always look forward to getting my hair cuts with her. at my last visit she recommended something called a flashback that would help minimize the appearance of gray hair and it was perfect. it didnt look unnatural. i'm not ready to age gracefully and i dont have to now. go see maria c....she is the one with great style and the amazing red hair!!!!

i should've known better than to go to super cuts in the first place, but i thought how hard could a bang trim be? apparently it is difficult. the woman who did my bangs had bright red hair and pretty messed up bangs herself. she cut my bangs extremely short and made them all crooked and jagged! i told her i didn't want them that short, and she did the complete opposite. i've never had such a horrible bang trim in my life. extremely disappointed. do not get your hair cut here!

maria curiel (the little red head latina ) does my hair every time per my request . she's so detail oriented,   patient and a perfectionist ! i come out looking better every time ! she's a little hidden wizard hair gem here and i thought i'd share my secret !

maria gave me a great cut. i have a ton of hair and just asked for a trim to get rid of some dead-ends, but she threw in layers and did a nice job! i gave her a tip that was almost equal to what the cut cost b/c honestly, it was so cheap and i was not expecting such a nice cut. i will be back!

been coming here for years and always find a stylist that i am happy with and keep coming back.  for the past 6+ months that has been maria c.  she's friendly, got a great attitude, and does an excellent job with my hair.  and can't beat the price of supercuts!

richard is my go to hairstylist at supercuts weho .. he is the best , professional , courteous, friendly and most of all he listens and provides me exactly the cut i want ... i would highly recommend richard he rocks!!!

unfortunately i will not be returning to this location. i normally always go to eric and he is fantastic and always gives me exactly what i want and listens very well. the past few times i have been missing him and i have been getting other stylists who do whatever they want. this past time took the cake and now i am walking around town with a mohawk because she didn't listen to me when i said skin fade. so she took in all the way up to the top of my head and took both sides in. not what i wanted at al and now i have to sport a haircut i literally hate.

if you need a blow out don't overlook this place! i was in a huge rush and major pickle. no other salons could get me in and all blow dry bars were booked. i called them up with fingers crossed and they got me in!  i didn't know who was going to do my hair when i got there but i got erik!! he was awesome. i have so much hair. and i can say without a doubt, it was the most professional and perfectly executed blow out i have ever gotten. (and i have gotten dozens). it was total perfection. i'm not even joking. he washed my hair super well, separated my hair into pieces and it was done very quickly. dare i say better than a proper blow dry bar??? i would go back and ask for him again. and the price couldn't be beat.

i've been coming here for years but the service is going way downhill.  the new guy who has a buzz was a total jerk.  need to revisit management.  i think this is why all the good cutters are leaving.

well... i am 30 years old, and i have gotten by far the best fade i've ever gotten in all of those 30 years.  her name is bethany, she is beautiful, talented, and knows how to fucking cut some hair.  hey seriously, i looked at myself in the mirror for eight hours trying to find anything wrong with that haircut and there was nothing, it was perfect.  she is the blonde with long hair and i for sure have a new hair dresser.  i have been traveling to her from korea town but now i'm moving to west hollywood and i'm excited!  go to her!!!!!

i had one really good experience and one really bad one so i gave it 3 stars it's an average, if i would have had my bad experiance the frist time i would have never gone back. lady with the red hair messed up my hair cut looked labsided then she cut it super short, thank god hair grows back and grows back fast (: ... she probably saved me money lol but i hate my hair cut this short

i love my stylist she does a great job.this review is only for the hair color supplies. how can i have a great result if you don't have the shades in stock. if you are changing the supplier, first have the new shades on hand and then discontinue with the old ones.

thank you, maria molina‼i love the color and the cut‼ great job with listening and nailing my hair!great location, nice clientele, very friendly staff, clean shop!  don't let the fact that it's supercuts deter you--all talented hairdressers who are conscientious and want to please their clients!  def! going back for highlights with maria m!thanks again for the supercut‼

i've been coming here for years, and i was glad when i found richard after other stylists i used have moved on. he always cares about his work and is clear in making sure he understands what i want as he cuts. it's obvious that he takes pride in doing a good job, and i appreciate the work he does. i've driven out of my way to see him and will continue to do so.

$21 per cut.  $16 tuesday's (add the savings to your stylists tip).had a shaky start but found a particular stylist i like, so i call ask for them and set an appointment time when i need a great cut.  there's a few very good stylists here who do a great job and are very customer service focused. if you find someone you like get their name and call and ask for them next time.  going in randomly is chancy.

this is great place for haircuts and the pricing is a real value. they except reservations and take walk-ins. there's never a long wait. staff are very friendly and customer focused. richard is my regular stylist. he's awesome and always goes the extra mile to be sure my cut is just the way i like it. i highly recommend richard or any of the other great stylist.

i've literally had the worst cut of my life here.  i've lived in weho for over 12 years.  i've frequented here a few times.  (i guess i forget how awful it is...)  tonight i had an experience that will keep me from coming to this rotating door of inexperienced hairdressers.   where do i begin?  my hair is a "4" trim around most of my head - not too hard right?  then i ask the rest to be trimmed the same length.  if this is done correctly i style it perfectly how i want it.  how i want it is that i take a sharp comb and cut a part off of some of the hair on one of the sides forming a sort of strip of the longer hair forming the parted side, with the rest going in the other direction kind of messy.  a crucial step in making this possible is no 'blending' and also stopping with the 4 at the point of my head when it starts to curve inwards towards the center of my head from the side.  (ie shave the part of the head on the sides that is flat; but stop before it starts to curve.)  similarly in the back.  (ie stop before it starts to curve inward at the top.)  its crucial because i will often change my part from right to left depending on how i feel.  evenly cut with no blending.  tonight i gave these very explicit instructions to the girl there.  she nodded her head as if to understand, then proceeded to do a 4 shave all the way up my head past the curve leaving a patch, yes a patch of longer hair at the top - and on top of that the hair left was unevenly cut so there was no switching part.  making a pudgy face look even fatter.  ruining the style people are used to seeing on me probably for weeks!!!! the register asked if i wanted to leave a tip. i said, "no, it was the worst haircut i've ever had."  then she had the audacity to say, "you can come in up to 7 days for a restyle"  restyle what?!?! unless you can magically attach my hacked head hairs back in place to start over... what is to restyle?!?!  i can hear it now, "ok, how would you like to restyle:  do you want the saving private ryan or the ever attractive franciscan monk doughnut athelstan shave... because that's the only hair we have to work with..."so the bottom line is i have to style it as hitler hair towards one side (uneven hair) till it grows back.  and i have a job interview.  i'm sorry but an apology from the cash register doesn't help.  its like going in for a ball hair trim and walking out with an unsolicited vasectomy.  does an apology really fix it???  how about an offer to come in to restyle??  nope.
i always get a great cut here. both marias are excellent- tonight maria c killed my cut. thanks again guys xo

i came here on a friday afternoon before rush hour.   i was prepared to wait the 25 -40 minutes as i have read from previous reviews how long the wait can be.  it is highly advised to schedule an appointment beforehand as i noticed customers were coming in after me with appointments which took precedence.  the parking shares a lot with vons and it doesn't cost anything to park.the staff were very friendly and professional.  the atmosphere was pleasant and simple.  on the ripoff scale, typical haircuts for me range from $9 to $30 and this place is on the higher end of $21.  they offer to shampoo your hair at an additional cost which i declined.  some haircut places have a vacuum at the end of the clippers to collect excess hair, this place does not have vacuum so my head was full of freshly cut hair at the end of the haircut.  for the price, you get a good haircut to meet your specifications in a friendly atmosphere.  the wait may be an inconvenience if you decide to go as a walk-in.  they also do not offer retired veteran discount when i showed them my military id.overall, i was happy with my haircut.  this place is legit with 3 stars!

i really want to give them more stars but there long waits really made it difficult to do so. not sure i understand the appt. service, 8 have made an appt only to get there and have to 15 minutes more for the haircut? not only that but when you call they'll to place you on hold only to forget about you. then you call back and she will apologize and make up an excuse. but if your able to secure an appt. with trish i highly recommend it, she is really good. other than that avoid this place
been going before they were even there. always get a good haircut. clean and friendly the place to go for haircut.
my go to place for a great cut at a reasonable price.  friendly and efficient service.   check in on my phone and usually don't have to wait long once l arrive.

very poor time management! make a 5pm reservation and basically sat and waited for more than 30 minutes waiting for my call-ahead / pre-made reservation! explain what the point of a reservation is if you don't get served at the time your reservation is for!
