ok so i really have been avoiding posting a review on this page but i gotta do so now. i live real close to this location so really i go to it the most but i really don't have the desire to go anymore. i would have givin a 1 but some of the hair stylist are really nice. like linda and three others i see in there cutting hair the most. my main complaint is about the girl who takes the reservations with red hair. she never says anything unprofessional but her attitude shows all over! especially when the bussiness is busy. all the times i've been there i have felt unwelcomed by mainly her. she is quick to say there is no availability. doesn't even suggest a wait time unless of course it is a busy day she is quick to say it's a few hours long wait. i've had to sit there and wait on my free days. she doesn't even get my attention to tell me when it's my turn. i've always seen the workers get the next guests, even if she is at the front desk doing nothing but standing there. i came in on mothers day becasuse i am a mother who was having a really hard day. all i wanted was a simple braided hair style cause i had to work that day which i'm am a hostess at a restuarant and was gonna work a long closing shift.. the people before me where walkins! a man and his two kids i believe and only two people were sitting waiting. at the time mainly men and women with short hair who where doing trimmings where getting their hair done & most where nearly finished. when i first walked in she greated me with no smile. this was at 12 or 1pm. i tild her all i wanted was a quick and easy simple style. i told her i need to be at work at 4pm. she appologized and told me she was sorry that i may need to wait 4hours or so because of other reservations. i asked her even if i sit and wait? i told her i was a mother too and it was my day too. i had tears in my eyes cause i was soo sad i wanted to get my hair done. i didn't even have enough time to walk home and due it up nice myself. she said sorry but no. i said thank you and walked out. i crided and ruened some of my make up. i stood there and said you know what i'm not gonna let this un-empathetic lady ruen my special day. i walked back in and she looked annoyed. i told her to please add me to the wait list that i would sit as long as i could. i was hoping someone wouldn't be able to come in for their appointment and they could let me take a place. so i waited. reservations showed up and hot their cuts. then new walk in customers started coming in and were taken right away. i was so upset but kept my cool and avoided telling her how i felt. then 3:30 hit. i had to quickly run home and do my hair myself. i almost called off cause how emotional that all made me feel. she definetly helped my mothers day get worse than it was already starting and she probably helped made that my last trip there. i wouldn't recommend anyone to go there unless they get a more friendlier front desk women who knows hospitality skills and professionalism. even while guests are waiting for their haircuts she doesn't even speak or offer nothing like at least the stylist do when they aren't cutting hair. never heard of a place help reun a guests special day if anything i've always heard wonderful turn out stories but not with her. lol i even always tip real generously after getting a cut even if it wasn't what i was expecting. just the time and effort you hair take to help someone feel good is appriciative ...  but that girl needs more tranning or a replacement. i'm not the problem cause i see plenty of similar posts & its sad.. thank you.

i've been to this supercuts location twice. my hair isn't overly complicated (shoulder-length and pin-straight), and i've been satisfied with having 2-3" inches trimmed during both visits. my first stylist, sonja, suggested i try a new product that has worked wonders on my easily tangled hair. today, yeghine cut my hair and she did great job - thank you!next time i will make an appointment. the wait can be a little long here, especially on weekends.

hi neighborsi understand why super cuts only has two stars. wanted to get a hair wash and blow dry for my 14 year old daughter today. it's winter formal after all. tuesday i was walking with her to get an estimate. 30 dollars for wash and blow. when we arrived two hours before the event i was told it is 60 dollars. i felt trapped as it was last-minute and i needed it done. this was way overpriced for the service and go to world cuts in the bristol farms complex for a much better deal and service.

i got a haircut today by this lady whom i forgot her name. the haircut was good , but as i went to go pay. the lady who cut my hair was packing up to leave for the day which was 2:55 but the receptionist rudely told her to come back that she still has 5 mins.. the lady who cut my hair was still being professional but asking why theirs only 5 mins left the receptionist didn't care and told her to cut another head now.. this bothered me so much because one the receptionist was not professional at all , and also made the lady look stupid and feel uncomfortable when all she was doing was her job. the receptionist is always rude when i go so i wasn't surprised but be professional next time and pull her to the side instead of throwing a fit in front of the guess for her doing her job.
always love coming here for a professional and and affordable haircut. they're always available in a pinch and always give me a consistently good haircut.

i've had my run ins with bad hair cuts and poor customer service but wow do these people take the cake.the people here have to be the rudest people i've ever met. as i arrived to the front desk, the lady told us our wait time and we checked in. i asked the lady if they have anyone who can texturize my very thick hair and she immediately said, "your wait time is still going to be 45 minutes." then i said, "okay but i just wanted to know if anyone can do that for me." and her response was "well yeah everyone here can."obviously they can't even cut hair because after my boyfriend's simple hair cut (not even a fade or anything.), his hair was pretty choppy after she sped through his hair cut. we thought the lady who was cutting his hair would be nicer but she was just as rude. my boyfriend gave her a 25% tip and she just took it and turned her back to him with just a "thanks."she also called my boyfriend my brother even though we were holding hands and our extremely different appearances.(i'm a redhead and he has dark brown hair with darker skin.) that doesn't really matter but you'd think they'd make an effort to pay attention to the people paying for their own perms.tldr;these people have garbage customer service skills and the hairdresser was awful at a finishing a simple haircut.

first off i really hate leaving negative reviews. second i especially hate ( yes i know hate is a strong word) people with no common sense who don't listen! i stated several times please don't cut my hair too short, ( i'm a male) i wanted to say please don't fuck my hair up!  sure as shit she cuts it too short as well as uneven. and yes i know it will grow back. i can feel my blood pressure rise, oh and she's fucking humming to whatever lame ass song was playing on their shitty station. note to all hairdressers/stylists, please don't hum while cutting/styling a client/customer's hair, wtf how do you not know that!!!she could tell i was getting irritated, did nothing to try and mellow the situation out.zero personality and no service skills what so ever, who the fuck hires these people. and they're everywhere! it's actually my fault for choosing such a low ball place to have my haircut in the first place. thought i'd try and save a little money and it's close to my home.  um...., yeah no! note to supercuts,it would be in your best interest to hire better people. in fact i would be willing to screen your potential applicants. i could tell you in less than 2 minutes if they'd be a good fit or not. however i do understand the caliber of people applying and it must be frustrating knowing that all the really stellar stylists out there would never ever apply to supercuts in the first place. again i really hate leaving negative reviews
don't count on them to be on-time with your appointments.  expect 30 to 40 minuets delay beyond your scheduled time.  they just can't get it right!

i got a cut here a few months back by ruth, she's the one with a nose piercing. she was beyond awful. i had asked for a layered cut and before even wetting my hair, she went at it with the scissor. i'm no hair dresser but i do know that you can't cut across dry hair, it needs to be dampened first. i mentioned that to her as she was butchering my hair and she said this is how she learned it in school. luckily, there was a another hair dresser next to us, linda, who saw it all go down and came over and offered to take over. i used to be a regular there but since then i've been terrified of going back. it's not just that she ruined my hair because it does grow back, it's the fact that she was resistant to advice and acted as if she either was superior or just didn't care. i would caution anyone from having her cut your hair.

you would think a place called supercuts would be able to give descent hair cuts.... i was very wrong! my bangs are not straight  and it looks like a 10 year old cut my hair. the lady was so bad. she never introduced herself, looked like she wanted to go home, did not listen to what i wanted. please reconsider going to this place for a 'simple' trim. go to a real salon with professionals

i just wanted to give everybody a heads (smiles) up that carman and this shop is great. i have lived in many great cities and had some wonderful stylistics  do my hair. carman is on my "mt mount rushmore" of stylists. do your head and hair a great favor and give this shop a try.

we love sharyl! she cuts my whole family's hair and it looks great! she is very knowledgeable about different hair and which cut will work for you. the shop is very clean and the receptionist is helpful. an all around great location!

i've been coming here for at least 10 years and have always received the best service, cuts, color, and conversations.  i used to see john until he left, then linda, and now yehineh (prob not spelled right).  all were always kind & professional.  i like to try and call ahead for a same-day appointment.  i never have to wait very long.   linda & yehineh are fabulous.  this particular supercuts has a lot of repeat customers.

worse experience ever! to be honest, they say they don't take appointments, but by coincidence all the caucasians got called before us even though they came after us. wow. i've never felt so disgusted by a business. they should have said something about the fact that they take appointments. however, we were completely ignored. never ever coming here again. when we left, one of the employees rolled their eyes. so unprofessional.

i have a strange haircut that is not very conventional - basically all short hair and bangs except for one long braid. i am in the midst of experimenting with it, and every once in a while i need to discuss what would be better with a hair cutter rather than just my peers. but twice already, two different hair dressers at this location have managed to make me feel very uncomfortable. the first time, the lady was very intent on me getting rid of my braid after she had done the color in my hair (the color was done well, though). i decided not to get my hair cut there when she was pressuring me, so i left. but then a few days ago i decided to come back and give it another try, but i was met with a very aggressive lady who would rather not have a conversation about it and became frustrated with my questions. it's true that i was indecisive, but i wanted to know her opinion. in the end, she began to buzz my hair when i was not quite decided yet and it was a bit too aggressive. also, it wasn't very neatly done. basically said, don't go here if you want anything creative done. or if you want some sort of engaging conversation about hair. maybe there are a few cutters here that would do that, but the others are not so good. you might as well try somewhere else.

hands down the best hair crew in los angeles. i've been coming here for over 9 years and i've gotten to know and love these people.they are all knowledgeable about their products and do great hair. i've had everything done here from highlights, deep conditioning treatments, root touch ups, betty bangs, pixie cuts to layering my long hair.they know what they are doing. there isn't a lot of turn over in staff so the quality stays consistent. its always clean, friendly, with a fun vibe. parking is easy and free! after using their suggested products i will never be using drugstore products again. its affordable, smells amazing and keeps my hair from looking and feeling damaged. there are so many options to go to for hair in this city but i always end up here because i know i will have quality work done at an affordable price. its the staff that makes this place priceless. you can tell they all love their jobs, they all have tremendous hearts and do amazing hair. no snobs, angry faces or divas. professional,  friendly, clean and qualified.

so the haircut was fine. nothing special but fine for the price. and they said "you know a blow dry costs more right?" so my bad for not realizing that it would be more than the haircut itself. the kids cut was 20. the blow dry was 25. 25??!!might come back for a trim for her but will not do this again. make sure you ask for pricing for every thing they offer. wash? ask. dry? ask.
no wait, quickly helped. the gentleman who cut my hair was marco. he did it very well. i liked the way it turned out.

this team is amazing, friendly staff, and they give you what you ask.  earn points towards a free cut, i have 264 points lol. thanks guys for all your help. i love my cut, by rob. jacky, mary and crazy tony.. lol

i have been coming to this store since i moved to la back in 1999. i think that should tell you a lot right there. i've moved two more times since then and absolutely refuse to go anywhere else to get my hair cut. vickie, the manager, has become a good friend to me. i trust her and her staff each and every time because i know they are extremely professional. i have been to other stores just to check them out such as rudy's across the street. rudy's is fine. no problems with them, but i miss the closeness, the personal service i get from vickie's store. always a smile on their faces, some cheesy 80's music in the background  (the other day they were playing devo's "whip it"!). but be careful because they will have you buy every product in the store before you leave, the crafty salespeople that they are...ha ha! who cares, right? as long as the service is friendly and you get as fantastic a look here as you would at some glitzy beverly hills boutique. i've never left disappointed and always look like they trimmed 15 years off of my life. how can one complain about  a place that makes you feel and look young again? vickie and her staff are truly the best!
vickie is awesome! she pampersme with her friendliness and detailedness every time i come in to do hair cut and color. she makes me feel more beautiful after.

went in to get my mom a new look to lift her spirits up, and we got some help from tonee to find a nice shade to bring some life back into her. i loved the shade and the cut, and i know my mom appreciates it too. so thank you tonee we will definitely be back, you were wonderful and very entertaining! amazing work!!!

great service, great suggestions with hair styles and products and overall very friendly. parking can be a hassle with the parking lot not being very big and it can get crowded but its worth the wait.

the manager vicky called my name and took me to the chair i told her if she will give me a second to just go and wash my hands said no problem when i came out she was already consulting another customer and i asked her if i was next and she didn't know because there was other people waiting even knowing tha she had already taken me before so i waited and a girl tony very nice but cut my hair in 5 minutes i paid and left but the hair cut was not even and very short i was very upset so i went back to talk to the manager and that's why i found out tia vicky was the manager and i told her that i was not happy and she got money or of the register and through at me and very pestle walked away there for will never go there again

please read this !  this is my first & last time in this supercut store !!! i booked an appointment online and went there couple of months ago and i got mary ( older lady with glasses) to get a my hair cut ! horrible experience ! mary's got some attitude & she was done within like 8 minutes and then i asked her to trim my beard a little, big mistake ! i think she has no idea how to do a proper beard trimming as she did it super fast without any protection comb attach to the trimmer.i felt a slight pain in my cheek area after she was finished but nothing thought much of it at that time.after i shaved my beard completely a month later, i found a big red mark on my left cheek and till this day it hasn't completely disapeared !guys avoid this place unless the management gets rid off mary and hire some new friendly barbers who actually knows what customer service really means !!!

i don't recommend men coming here for a haircut. the cuts are un-even, choppy, and not blended. i have been to multiple stylists at this location and it has been mediocre at best. the haircuts are not cheap either, with tip my total comes out to 27$. everyone is very friendly and welcoming, for 5 stars for that. i'll go with another location in the future. hopefully management can reach out to rectify the multiple haircuts i've had unsatisfactory results with.
wonderful group all around. tonee is my favorite but all of them are good. great place for highlights or just a haircut. good prices on their hair products too.

this place is sometimes busy but if you make an appointment online which is super easy and convenient, you should be fine. everybody is friendly and welcoming, from staff to manager. i like berto , very popular, and mary, very down to earth. they will cut and converse with you which i like a lot cuz it makes the whole experience less awkward. don't hesitate to make conversation or certain requests related to your hair style. mary can be a little tough in terms of attitude but once you get to know her, she can be very funny. the hair cut is decent and the price is reasonable, i always pay $22 and $5 tips i usually add. my style is simple i guess , either military or short on the sides and medium on the top with a blend. i have never had an incident when i'm not happy with the outcome before. anyways try yourself and see!
tonee did her magic again, made me beautiful and five years younger! she is awesome and caring.

i've been coming to this location for many years.  tonee does a fantastic job on my cut and style and i always walk out looking and feeling great!   ask for her when you come in, or better yet, call ahead or use their app.  the staff here is very friendly and professional, and they take great care of the shop as it's always immaculate.  the prices are very reasonable as well.

came in with my daughter, mary helped us as she was combing her hair she is pulling her, saying her hair is tangle and dry. duh thats why we went to get her hair cut, she had attitudedefinitely wont come back. not recommended.

super bad service  ,i came in girl with curly hair white glasses didn't  even welcome me ,but another girl came in she welcomed her,anyways she signed me in and i told her i want a haircut  and shampoo. i asked her right before she started cutting my hair,if she could do my eye brows  too ,she agreed. well she started cutting my hair  too fast and too rough, so i stopped her and i said please be gentle, than after she slowly changed her speed lol,for my luck,the supercuts  machine that she was using started pulling my hair and it hurts  when that happens, so i told her the machine  is pulling my hair, shes like, wonder y,get a new or ask supercuts for new one ,i noticed she wasn't happy with me so far ,anyways, than my sides were not equally the same so i told her to fix it and uneven so i told her to make it more even and better ,at this time she was not happy and i wasn't either but is not my fault  that she don't know how to cut hair ,or is it that difficult hair?she lacks customer service and detail, i just want a haircut .they charged $20 dollars and they do a crappy job and they expect customer to be satisfy and not say a thing, i don't think so,i will not go there anymore.she washed my hair and dry it and than i was expecting  my eyes brows  to be done and i asked her and shes like oh they turned  the machine off already and i said you probably don't want to do it .not a big deal  but it shows how they treat customers  there .i went to pay and told the guy ,tall ball headed ,she told me she would do my eyebrows  too but than she refused so unproffessoinal. i pulled out 5 dollars for tip but than i changed my mind ,no she didn't  deserved  a tip for the lack of customer  service  and detail and told the guy ,it was a nightmare getting this haircut and she should not cut hair ,she don't know how and how to treat customers. sunday july 8th afternoon closing at 5 pm, girl curly hair and white glasses . the tall guy apologizes.dont go there crappy haircuts .worst worst worst super badcuts.

i have black chick curly hair and vicky handles it! she's not scared of the texture, understands the wave pattern and makes me feel pretty when i leave. the wash is great because of the water temperature (i know that sounds weird, but trust me), the technique and the vibrating chair! if that doesn't work, put your feet up. i love my cut and i'll be back for trims regularly instead of doing it myself and creating holes (bad girl). thank you vicky for working with your girl! :-)

i just got my hair cut at this location for the first time and it was great. i reserved my place online and they got me in as soon as i showed up. marco cut my hair, and although i was a little nervous at first because i've never had a man cut my hair, he was great. he really listened to what i wanted, was so sweet, and executed it beautifully. will definitely come back to him.

i can't speak for all supercuts, but i've had two great experiences at this location, specifically with vickie. i learned that she's been with this location for 30 years! i had been looking around for an affordable, reliable place to get a haircut and was tired of spending nearly $100 at nearby salons so i gave it a shot and was pleasantly surprised. both times, i received wonderful customer service and left with a happy haircut. and as with any salon, what really matters is the hair stylist who's working on you, so i recommend giving vickie at this location a shot. the receptionist armando is also super friendly.

my favorite salon in the world!! is super cuts . mayra and monique are like an artists they are talented and have wonderful personalities to match. for high  lights i trust mayra with my life! that lady knows what she is doing when it comes to hair. she is such an amazing person inside and out. it's truly a great experience with her all around. for hair cut - i just found my new favorite girl , maria . this was my first time working with her and she did a fantastic job with my hair cut . she  knew exactly what i wanted, i think she might read minds. cannot wait to get my hair done again.

i'm so sick and tired of coming to supercuts and having every single person give me a reason why i shouldn't thin my hair out with thinning shears. i'm 23 years old. i've had this thick hair my whole life. i know for a fact that layers are never enough. i don't need anyone's opinion about how they think it should be cut. hairstylists always want to do what they want rather than what the customer is asking. if i ask for layers and my hair to be thinned out, i don't need your two-cents unless you are going to spend the money on the haircut and the aspirin i have to take every single day from the haircut. supercuts needs to teach their employees not to throw 2 cents in. i've had every single person say something along the lines of "oh but there's people who wish they had thick hair like yours." okay and?! i told you i want layers and for you to thin it out - it wasn't a question. anyway... the people are nice ‍ but i'm gonna be going elsewhere. $20 ain't shit. rather pay $60. i've tried about 10 different times at different locations. girl bye.so i went back in and the poor lady tried really hard to make me feel better about the haircut that i was given by a previous stylist. i went to the counter and still asked for my money back, when angie -who cut my hair in the first place- came and said "well we fixed your hair and you said it's fine so we actually don't give money back". so i said "well it still looks like shit so i still want my money back". angie was definitely very passive aggressive about it and i tried telling her what she did wrong, she became even more passive. i told her that her friend shouldn't have come up to her while she was cutting my hair and she then says "they are a customer and i talk to all customers". uh no you say "i'll be right with you" and you focus on the customer that you have at hand. she was definitely very passively aggressive. i told her that i've been in management for years and that i just didn't feel like it was professional, to which her reply was "and i've been in it for 10 years and i'll still be here."like oh alright then so you can't take constructive criticism? cool.i didn't get the name of the lady who helped fix my hair but she was so sweet. i kept crying and she was really patient.

i been coming here to have mayra cut my hair for a long time.. then my son hair... now my daughter and husband comes too!!! but we are so happy that even though mayra is our for few months.... we have angie to the rescue!!!!!! yes!!! she is amazing and very careful and caring.... just like mayra!!! update!!! i still love our two amazing lady's!! angie and mayra!! they are kind and know how to cut all kind of hair ... that's a plus for anyone to know!

i had a very pleasant experience at this location. there is a large parking lot right outside so that takes the hassle out of getting a haircut in la! i called a few hours before to make a reservation and they were ready for me right when i walked in. the staff was smiley and the facility was kept in tip-top shape. unfortunately, i do not recall the name of my stylist but she did a fabulous job. i got a 1 on the sides with a fade and a scissor cut on the top. it looks great.  the price was rather typical at ~$19 and they do offer discounts for usc students. you never really know what you're going to get when you go to a supercuts, but i can definitely recommend the vermont location!

some of the biggest mistakes of my life have been haircuts and it took me awhile to find a place to rid of this anxiety and this place is it. if ur new ask for mayra or wendy they dope ! they're good people.

it was super fast i don't like to be in a salon for a long time and luis was fast and did a good job on my hair and my baby's hair which was his first time. and the girls that did my daughters hair did good too. i will definitely go back with my kiddos.

i got a good haircut for curly hair and a good price.  was very nice and patient.  then she immediately tried to sell me expensive hair products, and after i paid for the haircut she literally ran to the next customer as if i had evaporated.  i will probably go back, so i hope this gets read and they realize people already know what hair products they want, at least i do, did not like the sales pitch and quick dismissal after i paid.  i'm sorry i gave such a generous tip, she didn't even say thank you.

long wait times, horrible customer service.   staff doesn't disclose how their system places you in back of the line if you show up a late after calling ahead to allow the customer decide if they want to wait or find somewhere else to go.  staff didn't even apologize.  i've been coming here for years but level of service has gone down.  they have high staff turnover here.

angie is the reason i go to supercuts. she's incredibly nice and does a great job consulting before cutting/styling my hair. she's extremely talented with so many years of experience under her belt.:)p.s.she's extremely great with kid, especially with my 2 boys :)
just got a haircut and color at this location . totally loved it! my hair feels so soft and i love the color. would totally recommend angie!

this has become my go to barber spot. sometimes the wait can be long. but they do let you call ahead to put your name in line so when you get there you won't be waiting forever. every time i've been there i've been happy with my haircut. thank you

i give this super cuts 5 stars and if i had the option to give more i would.the young lady who cut my hair was absolutely phenomenal. i am the type to be very skeptical with trying new style hair cuts but boy!!!!!was candy right. you can tell sheobtains the passion in what she does. she took her time on me and after my hair cut i walked out of there feeling  bedazzled and not to mention ten  years younger.she had superior customer service.she was a great listener, very honest  and went beyond my version of what  was excepted. i am not from this area ,but will be definitely coming back to her.she is like the hair whisper!!!!

my family and i had been customers for two years, that is until two highly unprofessional employees made rude and unprofessional comments in spanish about our appearances. needless to say that supercuts has now lost loyal clients. way to go!!! i will make sure that corporate hears from me!!fantastic sams here we come!!

very unprofessional. i called an hour ahead for appointment and they confirmed it. but when i visited they said they couldn't find my name on system and forgot to enter on system so if i still wanted haircut i need to make another appointment.

i went right before they closed. alondra cut my hair. i wasn't very sure what i wanted so she was very helpful on figuring out, cut my hair well. she's very friendly and can hold a conversation. i was very happy with the service. she had amazing customer service. i recommend people to go here for a haircut.
love love this place! especially mayra! she's absolutely great! i can't stress this enough always satisfied with my cut!!

i had the most horrible experience today i called in at 11:53 was told there was a 25 minute wait got there within the window and now an hour later i am being cut. the receptionist wendy took to clients ahead me and when i spoke about calling ahead she was downright dismissive.  i have always come here but this might have been my last time. really disappointed

while looking for a new barber, i decided to just get a quick clean up over here at this super cuts. wendy gave me a nice fade but i was too skeptical to have her line me up hahashe was very sweet and funny. her skills are pretty good and i would probably come back here if my new barber didn't have time for me. definitely a nice store on vermont.

so bad experience. they are not professionals. they are just barbers. the fat woman barber just pushed very hard by using electronic clipper and that really hurts and make my skin red and pain. totally bad experience. would never be there again!
my son badly needed a haircut, especially in this heat. it was great service and his hair looks great. thank you!

guys (and i'm sure this applies to everyone as well), if you're looking for a great hair stylist who pays close attention to detail and ensures a quality haircut, please ask for vasilya. she always does a great job.  she is great to talk to and i can tell she takes pride in her work. i am lucky to have her as my hair stylist. again, ask for vasilya!
worst haircut ever. one stylist on duty, five customers waiting as i walked out. perhaps she was under pressure, i don't know. but i'll never visit another supercuts after today.

i've had good luck here over the past couple of years, but that ended the other day when i was in and out of the chair in less than 10 minutes, with the worst haircut i've ever had.lady, don't ask me how i want my hair cut if you have no intention of doing it.there are some lovely and talented people here. lupe, for example.you're no lupe.adios super ripoff!

supercuts is one of my favorite places to do our hair..... specially with alicia, this time unfortunately she wasn't there, so , we didn't have more options.this 1 star is for the girl who made my husband's hair... very bad job!! i'm very sad and angry because she don't have customers service skills!... i was sitting waiting for my turn when this woman for doing the job, at the beginning i was ok, but, then i noticed that she was cutting little bit to much his hair, so i went to her station i told her: please that is fine don't cut more, i will little long there for cover his bold spot.... she kept cutting, i was angry, worried and i stepped in her station for second time and told her: please stop!, i told you don't cut more!... and she rise her voice at me telling me: mam, i'm the professional here and spoke with him.... wrong !!... if i'm talking to you at the beginning you should listen to the wife!... you are the professional, but i'm the wife!, i'm coming here for about 5 years, and i know how he likes and how i want!... now i have to listen his complaints for every single day! alicia is totally different!.. always trying to keep good relationships with couples!!note: how ever your name is, try to be nice specially with couples, one relays on the other, not in you!, that's why they go together, if not... he will go alone! i'll keep going, because alicia only... lesson learned... no alicia, no cut. so sad.sorry for my english:/

i never feel compelled to give bad yelp reviews because i have experience working in customer service jobs. i know how awful they are.i always tell myself it can't be that bad. the wait is always 45 minutes, even if you're tricked into thinking that calling before or checking in on the app actually does anything. there are always all these empty stations, and i don't think i've ever seen more than 4 stylists working at once. the result:the stylists end up giving slapdash haircuts. they prioritize those who look the most upset waiting for their turn.this is a simple supply and demand problem. while i was contemplating during my wait, at least 5 different walk-ins came in. they were told the wait was 90 minutes and left frustrated without a haircut. i am not sure why a business would want to turn away customers willing to spend money. hire more stylists for all these empty stations, and customers will not have to wait.

nothing short of absolutely terrible. the haircut was not even passable. back of the head was shaved 3 inches above where the hairline is supposed to be. makes me wonder if this woman has ever done a men's cut before... got my money back for the haircut (still made me pay for the shampoo even though i was coerced into getting that) but it will be a month before my hair is even long enough for my gf to fix it.... just don't go here. by the reviews, the other supercuts in santa monica is way better. really regretting not going there.

horrible!! i wanted a blowout so i came here!! there was a blonde girl in the middle of a hair cut, she greeted me and was very nice. then the stylist that was supposed to help me myra ( i think that was her name) called my name ( i think she butchered it) she seems to have an attitude. i sat in the chair and she walked away taking phones calls!! i understand you need to deal with phone calls but don't leave your client waiting!! tell them sorry and take the call!! just just left me in the chair!! she had attitude!! after waiting i just got up and left!! very rude and has no customer service!! she needs to fix her attitude!! also the salon was dirty!! there was hair and candy under the seats in the waiting area!! i will never return to this location!! i'd rather go to dry bar!! myra you need an attitude adjustment!!

this is the best supercuts i've been to in santa monica. the employees here are all very nice and friendly and greet you when you come in. they take time with you and don't rush you out of the salon as i've seen in other places. they are great with both coloring hair/haircuts. i definitely recommend this salon!

i have been this salon last weekend.  i did color,.high lights, cut and blow dry by melissa.  she did really great job on me.  i never satisfied my hair in korea town or be very hills, but this time yes.she knows what to do and very creative.  i went out next day with my friend, they asked me where i did my hair.  i told my friend about melissa.  she is the best.i'll go to melissa again even she is little too far from me.  also, i told my boyfriend to go to melissa.thank you melissa!!
a simple buzzcut for $30. came home & just noticed, un-even, i should have taken a closer look before leaving. it is what it is, i'll try not to come back.

i love rafaella she's so terrific she needs to be promoted i've only had her for coloring and she's great i'm so glad she was found for me i don't know what i would do without her so if you want someone to do your coloring she is the one to do it she knows her stuff a+ a+ a+

check in online because it says there is no wait, when i arrive there is obviously a wait and the three women at the register are unwilling to give me an estimate of the wait time. i'm sorry but on a sunday i have more things to do than wait for an undetermined amount of time. a simple "oh 5 minutes" or "it could be an hour" is enough. i am not going to sit and wait for you to not give me an idea as to when i will be helped. update your online list because it is obvious that 10 people did not walk in in the 5 minutes it took me to drive in.
the girl that cut, i mean butchered my hair was nice but my hair is a hot mess! i wanted an a-line bob but left looking like a lego piece. whatever! maybe i messed by coming to supercuts.
i get my haircut there at least twice a month and autumn does an amazing job every time. finally i have a hair stylist i can count on plus she's a sweetheart! thanks!!

i am not a very happy camper right now with this place i know i'm not very welcome back here again and i don't care i was taking out of this wonderful persons care for my hair regarding coloring which is unfortunate i highly recommend this woman to anyone and i will surely miss her rafaella she's the only one that i could recommend as outstanding stylist i wish her well in her career. and i thank her for all she did trying to help me out
alicia the manager gave me a great haircut! i finally have an even cut and my split ends are all gone.  she also fixed my fringe and it looks so much flattering now! definitely a thumbs up.

i got a pixie cut and i'm trying to let it grow out. lupe totally knew how to cut my hair and help me continue to grow it out. love her! i always go back for a bit of a touch up so it continues to grow out.

i went in on thursday september 21st 2017 for a trim and the bleached blonde stylist (as i don't recall her name chopped a chunk of the front of my hair before i had a chance to stop her and have the manager intervene. i even showed the stylist a picture of me with my hair the way i wanted it cut prior to her commencing. i had a video shoot the next day and to top it all off the manager still wanted me to pay full price. i had to ask for a discount and she only discounted $2. i need to get in contact with the regional manager so that she can see what they did to my hair as it looks like a 3 year old cut it. i do not feel i should pay a dime for the cut, infact, i should be paid for potential loss of wages for work that required my long hair. please contact me as soon as possible to resolve.
worst stylist ever. last night i went to get a fade, chick gave me an undercut. i knew i was gambling with supercuts, but i was just too lazy to go to active barbers down the street. so annoyed.

loved the vibe here! from the minute we walked in we were greeted and given an accurate wait estimate. raphaela is amazing! she did an amazing job giving my grandma a new hair style. her hair had grown out so long and unmanageable and raphaela was able to create exactly the look we had described. i really appreciated that this location was so accommodating in making room for my grandma's wheelchair (we have had bad experiences at other locations).  thanks again for everything! see you soon :)

okay, so this is my go to spot for a haircut and rocky is my man here. i love this guy. he is warm, super nice, and a great person to chat with while getting your hair done. i typically start with a tea tree treatment and shampoo and then follow it up with a regular cut. rocky knows what he's doing after he consulted with my wife who gave him precise instructions on the cut that she likes on me. rocky has added some finesse to her suggestions and i really like the results. rocky recently had a rather serious accident which left him away from all the action for a good majority of last year. while supercuts made sure i was taken care of in his absence i was so happy and relieved to see him back. he's not just my stylist, he's more like a buddy. and he has now cut my hair, my wife's hair, and my mom-in-law's hair so yeah his style runs deep in our household. happy belated birthday buddy! and may you always keep smiling and bringing joy to people with your magical hair styling tricks. update: rocky is the saving grace of this place. any time he's not there service is awful!

second review.  shirley my last experience was ok but once again i find myself in a horrible situation. i called 45 minutes ago and put my name in. they gave me a wait time of 20 minutes.  so when i arrived i checked in just in case. at which point they could not find my name. so here i am nearly an hour from my call. which again i know waiting is a possibility but when you call in advance and don't have the confidence that your proper place was held, it's frustrating.  then the girl at the counter replies to me saying it's been 45 minutes.... "yeah there are two people a head of you we have a lot of colors today.  want me to take your name off the list?"nope. i didn't ask you to. what horrible customer service. unfortunately this is the last time i will come to this place.  first review was 2 stars.  the staff here was not adequate. if you tell your customers 15 minutes you should at least accommodate someone with 10 min of that time frame. we understand having to wait an extra 10-15 minutes but they kept taking in other customers that they seem to know and said they checked in before hand. well then should that be incorporated in to the time frame provided to the customer. if you told me i would be waiting for over an hour i would have done something else and come back. it was just poor man

i've been coming here for the last two years and it never disappoints. rocky, one of the hair stylist has always been amazing! the staff is so helpful and accommodating. glad this location is part of the neighborhood. did i mention rocky is amazing!?

araselli is amazing,can't say enough nice things about her as a person and a professional , she did a fantastic job on my cut , it was exactly what i was looking for. will definitely be heading back to her the next time highly recommend making an appointment with her. thank you araselli

staff is friendly and does a good job. however, would only go as a last resort. last 3 times i have had to wait over 45 minutes after making an online appointment. if you do come, would highly suggest arriving late as this seems to be how they operate - worse than the doctors office!

the worst. mediocre haircuts at best, and the world's worst queing system.i checked in online (at 5:50) and was told that i should be up at 6:30. its now 50 minutes (and counting) after that and there are still two people ahead of me. i get that it's hard to make accurate predictions of wait time, but this is ridiculous. there are only two people working.i was told "probably another 10 minutes" about half an hour ago. i'm beginning to forget my life prior to coming here. i think i had a family, but i can't be sure.edit: i just mentioned that i've been waiting an additional 50 minutes and was told (no apology) that "we can't predict the future". another customer just said he'd come back tomorrow and was told "it'll be like this tomorrow too". get your sh*t together supercuts.

have had fine experiences here in the past but today was quoted 1 hour for a haircut, waited 75 minutes, and then told there were two more people ahead of me... and there was only 1 person cutting hair in there! had to walk out because i was out of time to spare waiting. please quote accurate times or staff up!

the place is clean and modern, and busy. call in for an appointment or be prepared to wait. i thought this was supposed to be a discount barber shop chain, but the prices were actually a bit higher than the local ones.my barber, rocky, was very friendly but way too salesy. i'm not sure if that's his fault though as it sounded like every stylist had to offer at least 10 extra products/services during the course of a haircut. that's an aggressive upsell strategy but should realize how uncomfortable that makes some customers.he did do a good job with the little hair on my head. but i think i'll be going back to the mom and pops barbers that offer similar quality cuts without the sales pitches.

my hair turned out way shorter than i wanted it. i asked for shoulder length and i am now sitting here with chin length hair. i was in tears most of the day about it. she just kept cutting and cutting it's very choppy you can see the hard cuts in it and one side is longer than the other. i'm so disappointed. they said next time i came in they would set me up with a specialist but i won't be setting foot in a hair salon for an extremely long time. terrible experience. :(
god awful. avoid this location. they give you bad information on wait times and bad haircuts after waiting. many other better options in la.

lost a customer of 5 years today.  i've had countless stylists over the course of being a customer at supercuts; some were/are great and some are mediocre.  the vast majority of the time, the mediocre ones try their best and put forth a great attitude and effort.  today i experienced the worst stylist at supercuts.  every adjustment i asked for she had a rebuttal and reason for why i was incorrect in my judgement.  i asked if she could make a slight change on a fade and she questioned my request because my hair grew a certain way and she was correct.  at no time was she apologetic for any of her actions or behavior.  when i asked to completely remove the fade she completed a half effort job and i had to come home and fix the issues myself.  when i asked to take an inch off the top she consistently questioned why i would do such a thing and how she knew what was best because she understood how my hair grew.  again another half effort there.  the fact is, a bad haircut grows back but making a customer feel uncomfortable and unsure during the entire time, this is how you lose a loyal customer and future referrals.  i apologize to all the great stylists at supercuts because surely they contributed to me coming back time after time.  unfortunately this person is the straw that broke the camels back.
jessica did a great job on my hair. i just moved to the area and was in need of a new spot to just do simple trims here and there. i highly recommend her.

i have been going to the store in the marina for 3 years. i have my roots and high lights done there. sorry to say i will not being going to this particular  establishment.  i went to get my roots done (about a 2 hr process) . my hair is normally a light brown color with high lights. now my hair is so dark that all my high lights are gone and what is left is like tan high light. (this took 4 hours. )the stylist was a little rough, he used a comb with a sharp end on it to part my hair, he was very hard on the back of the neck. i made a grimace face and said ouch. he said oh sorry dear i will be easy. as he proceeds to the side of my head he swipes inside the ear on both sides. i have so much more to say, but it feels like i'm reliving this nightmare.

sloppy. no attention to detail on my 6 year old boys hair. i will need to re-trim around his ears and back of his neck. she didn't engage or acknowledge my son one bit!  the only interaction she had with him was to push his head down to crookedly trim the back of his neck.  not to mention she had absolutely no personality. probably said about 7 words to me and my son, total. at the end she handed me the ticket / bill and said here give this to the receptionist and tell her that her scribble said $22. not even a thanks for coming in, have a nice day or bye. ..nothing! then i noticed her apparent, regular came in, a nice senior lady, boom everything changed....she was all smiles and chatty....  night and day!   lame.

if you're looking for a high-end beverly hills level cut without breaking the bank, you've got to come see rocky. when it comes to getting haircuts i used to dread trusting my looks to someone else so i'd always pay for premium haircuts. a friend of mine told me about rocky at supercuts in the marina and i just had to check him out for myself and boy was i impressed. he not only totally gets me, but we always have a blast brainstorming about cool new things to try. it's a treat to have him bring out your best and you'll have a hell of a fun time chatting with him in the process! this is what the 5-star rating was designed for.

thank you to rocky for yet again another stellar job on my son's hair!  he is knowledgeable, talented with the clippers and scissors, and very experienced.  rocky is personable, friendly, and good with both kids and adults. my son is so happy with his haircut and says rocky is so nice.  it is very busy here every time we come, so make an appointment to cut down on waiting time.

visiting and had time to get a much needed haircut. went in on a whim and left super happy with the haircut cassandra gave me.she took the time to carefully discuss what i wanted and never rushed into styling. i really liked the outcome and it is exactly what i wanted. thank you so much.

i'm not giving them 1 star because they truly tried to please me but i already had a real sour taste in my mouth. when i walked in, there were only 2 ladies sitting in the waiting area. they happened to both be waiting for this little girl getting a cut. as time went on, people would walk in and they'd ask if they were so and so and almost immediately take them to a chair that was freeing up. i watched 5 or 6 people come in after me but get taken to a chair ahead of me. confusing for a place who doesn't accept appointments. apparently you can call and "check in" an hour ahead....so i sat there for 45 mins before i got real irritated about what was happening. the manager handed me $4 worth of coupons and the guy who cut my hair offered a free wash with my cut. i had worked an 11 hour day and just wanted to get home so i declined the wash. the guy really did work hard to get me out of the mood i was put in. the next problem was when he handed me the little mirror to see the back. i pointed out how my right side was lower down my neck. he tried to fix it my starting in the middle and going to my left side...the side that was already higher. i really didn't want to create an even bigger scene so i just paid(they gave me $3 off) and i left. when i got home, my fiance expressed that maybe i should stop getting $20 haircuts because it definitely shows. i had her fix my neck line as well as get some random hairs that were missed. i'm a guy so i care much less about a bad cut because it'll grow back but man, it definitely is going to affect my decision to return.
this place is awesome, basically i never had to wait more then 15min. to get a haircut. very friendly.never been disappointed with my haircut.
i love my haircut! the hairdressers were very professional, and cut my hair exactly as i wanted. only problem was that i had to wait an hour and a half. but they were busy and i didn't call ahead.

hi , i hardly give reviews but i had to for gina brown in the westwood shop , i used to go to a private barber but decided to try supercuts in westwood and met gina and i been using her for over 5 years , she knows exactly how i like my hair cut and because i have greyish hair and i hate it she does the perfect brown color on me every time , i will not use anybody but her , i think she is amazing and will continue to use her for as long as am around , see u in 3 weeks thank u gina ps: i dont understand why the bad reviews , she is always sweet and i think its unfair on what i saw written ,

i'm usually not satisfied with my haircuts and styling. so i don't often go get my hair done. but, i'm really glad i came to this supercuts. i got a fantastic haircut and am very satisfied. wait wasn't very long, but i checked in online. so that might have saved me some time. service was fantastic and the lady cutting my hair had a strong attention to detail. i didn't catch her name, but she had a tattoo on her chest. thank you supercuts for a wonderful haircut and you'll be seeing me again.

the worsti took by 3 year old son there today, and i have never ever seen such pathetic service.lousyi feel bad for my son, i could have closed my eyes and done better.there are empty spaces and long and out shape.shame on you guys for hiring no experience person.last time for me

absolutely worse experience and trash haircut i've ever received. i literally walked out mid cut. the lady (gina) who just cut my hair literally took about 10 minutes and was done. no edging or anything to clean up the little areas. she also went much higher after i told her twice not to go too high on my sideburns and actually pointed at where i wanted them. she said they were both the same length which clearly they aren't. had to go to a barber nearby and chose supercuts as only option because i'm away from my usual barber. attached are photos. i never leave reviews but this was crazy!

the staff is friendly and facilities clean. however at the end of the day the review should be about the haircut- that is where supercuts in my experience always falls short. go in for a basic crew cut and they can't get it right ( hair sticks up in the back and is uneven on the sides of the head).as a national chain they have a lot of employees who only cut hair for a few years then move on- not the same steady hand or experience as a barber who's been doing it for a decade...yes they can cut your hair, but so can your 8 year old niece with kiddie scissors, you want a quality cut go to a barber

we walked in with my 4 year old son.  hoping for a little touch up around the ear and neck.  the young african american young lady we had, i think was working with out a license or cheated her way through beauty school.  she had no clue how to use the electrical scissors and make a straight line.  my son's left and right side burns don't match at all.  we told her nothing from the top and she cut the front of his hair so much and so uneven, he looks bald.  i'm literally in tears.  if it wasn't for my husband, i would go in the store screaming.  shame on you in that store

i am so fortunate that i walked out instead of letting gina cut my hair. consistent with other reviews, she immediately demanded to know what clipper guard to use and seemed shocked that i didn't want the clippers. when i started to explain how i wanted my hair cut, gina cut me off demanding to know how much to cut off. i told her that i wanted the length of the front of my hair to be 3 inches, and she said, "i don't know what that means."when somebody's rude, doesn't listen, and doesn't know what "3 inch length in the front" means, it's time to walk out. so i smiled and walked out while she glared at me. then i came on yelp and saw that gina has racked up 7 1-star reviews with consistent comments about how she doesn't listen and cuts poorly. i went to the supercuts on pico & sepulveda instead and got a fine haircut from ydera.

this place absolutely butchered my hair.i've been going to supercuts for years in other cities. this was by far the worst haircut i've ever had. it was so bad, i refuse to go to a walk-in place from here on out. only salons for me. my experience: i walked in, and there was one lady sitting on the couch in the waiting area. one person ahead of me is typically not bad. i check in, and turns out the lady sitting on the couch was the stylist. she walked to a station with me, and had no clue what she was doing. she was scrambling to find razors and scissors. she even selected things out of the "soiled" drawer. it was evident she had never even cut hair before. unfortunately she already started the cut on me...without asking, she cut my sideburns completed off and turned them into a straight line from the top of my ear.... how is this even possible. i quickly realized this girl had never even been through proper training before. there were a number of other things, such as randomly blow drying me when she didn't need to, not offering a shampoo, not asking if i wanted the back square or round, and not knowing how to do a fade without leaving multiple lines. it is absolutely incredible someone like this was even allowed to cut hair. i am honestly considering shaving my head. my sideburns just look silly right now, and people have already told me so. no more chances for me. i'm paying for a salon from here on out.do not go to this location

my first time at this supercuts location. i stopped going because i had a lot of bad experiences with supercuts in the past so i was skeptical of giving them one more chance.. i came into the westwood location, was greeted kindly and waited a few minutes. this sweet lady gina gave me a haircut and it was amazing!!  it did not take long, and she fully understood what i was looking for!! i am very happy with my cut! i will def be back!! thanks gina!!
this was the worst haircut ever. stay away!!!!  i did not see the reviews before but i wish i had. now i am stuck with a terrible cut. you cannot trust supercut chains anymore.

natasha is simply the best. i first met her at the pico location. i'm super picky about dying my mostly grey hair and each time she's done a fabulous job working with me to pick the color and then applying it beautifully. the color does not fade and the only downside is because my hair remains so healthy it grows out super fast
thank you so much veronica, i was so scared to try supercuts but you gave me a wonderful hair cut, couldn't be happier. my spoiled beverly hills tushy will go to supercuts from now on. thank you v

the only place in la what was not completely booked. korian (koco) did a great job of making me feel comfortable and really trying to understand what i wanted in my haircut. my hair was already a bit short with a blunt cut at the end. she explained what she was doing, before cutting my hair, which i absolutely adored. no hairstylist had ever told me that i could get my hair layered and not cut off a couple inches off the ends! there's plenty of parking in the back, which i recommend. my haircut was around $20-25. if you are going here, call and book koco!!!

i had a great experience here, apart from the palpable hesitation when i told my stylist how short i wanted my hair. the service staff was friendly and helpful. and even though she kind of tried to talk me out of my idea, she was still very attentive to my desires and it worked out in the end. not sure why these reviews are low-- it's supercut, not a private salon. good experience though, i will probabaly be coming back

in this review, i refer to the supercuts on 1650 westwood blvd. los angeles, ca 90024 with the phone number 310-470-1558.awful, awful service at this store falsely calling itself supercuts.  i called the headquarters, and they said this location is not under the supercuts umbrella.  don't be fooled!both the stylist and the cashier had a nasty attitude, treating me with contempt and disrespect, and as if they were doing me a favor.  after this horrendous introduction, i received a sloppy haircut, and now my hair is unkempt.  i mentioned this experience to one of my friends, and she promptly told me that she had also received a bad haircut at this location.  i will never set foot into this store again; it is one of the worst experiences i have ever had.  1 star is far too generous.

firstly i worked for supercuts for 25 years as a manager and educator , my daughter lives in westwood and needed her haircut , since i live in another city with  no equipment with me , i called ahead for a wash, cut and blow dry , it was clear the stylist did not want to do any blow drying today since she quoted me 35 additional dollars for a total of 61 dollars for my daughters shoulder length layers . 21 for the cut , 5 for the shampoo , and 35 for a simple blow dry ?, right...pure laziness . all those years i served my clients fairly with a smile and without complaint and to get this, truly infuriated me . so we walk out with wet hair when all we wanted was a simple blow dry not a extravagant updo , because there's no way i'm going to have someone with a bad work ethic rip me off .

i will not return to this location nor have gina a short mexican woman touch my head again. she did not listen to the instructions given to her, had to be told to cut around the ears, but did not trim the eye brows, plus did not comb my hair. charged me $21.00 then had the nerve to ask for a tip. i believe this woman belittled me with her colleagues  behind my back after i left the location. i recommend not to attend this location unless you have a established hair coiffure.

worst experience i have ever had at a supercuts with staff and professionalism and cut!!! i will never take my boys there again. both stylist were complaining about my boys hair to me . although one did a decent job cutting my son's hair gina was complaining about me in front of me in spanish to the other stylist not knowing that i understood every word! she didn't want to cut my son's hair and tried her best to mess it up! and at the end when i tipped both stylist although i was not happy with my experience and hair cut the lady who rang me up complaint about the 15% tip i left each!

waited for 2 hours even though they said the wait was only 15 mins. shame on you! when it finally came time for the haircut, it was shockingly mediocre, yet not at all cheap. terrible place. would not recommend at all.

first, get more than 3 dang parking spaces. second, lovely customer service from 3 younger short ladies. smiles and said hello when i walked in. it's all downhill from there folks, some lady who honestly was probably drunk, came straight to me for a haircut, skipping the little 16 year old who had been there before i (i came to find out). then she cut my hair trying to be as fast as lightning. i'm guessing she was off at 4:30 or something. she then scraped the back of my neck with the same buzzer she cut my hair with. i'm pretty sure you have trimmer you could've used. as my neck sits here and burns from the crappy cut i received. also, the line up is crooked anyway. rrrrghh, why did i leave a tip..

i loved this place. i didn't make an appointment, i just walked in, and i didn't wait very long (i got lucky). blanca trimmed my hair. i was so desperate for a cut. she fixed my hair right up! i love how much volume it has now. thank you so much! i will definitely return for my next cut! highly recommend this location!

good luck to anyone trying to get good service here! worst customer service i have experienced in a long time... and to top it off it's happened a few times (should've written this review a while ago, but have tried to give them the benefit of the doubt). good luck trying to call ahead and get an accurate account of how long it will take. sadly a few of the stylist do a great job of cutting mens hair but the device in trying to get to a chair is horrible!! tonight i tried to walk in and was happy to see at least two stylist i am familiar with... was told i could write my name down and it would be 45 min. so i go run errands and come back to have to wait again. *also one time a lady was either so incompetent or rude that she tried to give me a mo-hawk and when i tried to get her to fix it, she handed the machine and scissors to another stylist. they couldn't even really look me in the eye as i asked how long it would take. hate to be impatient but this has happened before when i need to catch a flight out of town and this was the last straw... my kids hadn't eaten dinner and although i really needed a haircut, i can't stand when people can't be curtiss enough to keep an "appointment".

i called to make an appointment for my son. i was informed that they do not take appointments, just walk-ins. so i just took my son in after school... there's an hour wait. then she asks, "do you want me to put you down for that time?"what?? "i thought you don't take appointments," i said. "well, we take call aheads," she said. "and why didn't they tell me that when i called to try scheduling an appointment?" i asked. "i don't know."ugh.

horrible service celia is a horrible rude stylist if you can call her that , she has no manner she is rude to her customers especially if young , my son went in to get a cut he asked for a 2 then decided for a one she right away said w an attitude an intimidating tone " you asked for a 2 " sideburns?????long or short ? he was like huh , she said these long or short w an intimidating tone  as well , i complained to clerk and she said yeah she is rude ..... i say management get her out if you don't want health dept there as well due to unsanitary issues that were noted $18 dollars down the trash and a 13 yr old who said yes she was rude but what could i do ... she's an adult? because mind you i have taught my child to respect his elders but this lady should be let go please contact me for more info management ilozano1616@icloud.com

i moved out to downtown la a few years now and it's hard finding a great hair stylist. i decided to give supercuts in downey a try because of the rave reviews. i went in yesterday morning and i'm glad i did! i happen to get my hair cut by the stylist blanca (whom i read the great reviews about prior before). not only is she great.. she's fast, very friendly, and i absolutely love the style of cut she gave me!!! :dnot only am i excited for my new cut.. i appreciate the friendly staff, the reasonable price and how well organize they are with their valued customers..thank you blanca!!! you're awesome! definitely will be seeing me again for a next cut :)continue.. i came by tuesday, but blanca wasn't there! i took a risk in having joanna cut my hair.. and i'm glad a did! love my cute asymmetrical short bob! not only did you bring bounce to my hair, but i no longer feel self conscious in leaving my hair down. thank you joanna.. you're awesome!!!!

parking is a major issue with this location, and not making appointments.  you can call 45 minutes before to be put on the list.  i always like the cut.  usually we have the same stylist. they take mastercard and visa, but not american express.

i will never go back to this place!!! i have never been humiliated in my life like i did !!!! i went yesterday because my 6 year old daughter needed a trim and i took my baby with me because i had called ahead of time and they told me they would have a stylist available as soon as i came in. while my daughter was getting her hair cut, my little one was walking around and i was supervising and making sure she didn't touch or get anything. the stylist joanna so rude told me to make sure the baby didn't touch the product, and really got upset because i was already watching her and shes just a baby. i felt shamed-mom, she yelled it out in front of everyone that was there. then another stylist opens the door knowing that i had my 1 year old and i asked her if we can close the door because didn't want her to run outside and get hit by a car. she told me she didn't care and that i should hold her. basically told me to tie her down like a animal. never again come back again!!!! i will be also contacting corporate office. what i don't understand why i was treat so poorly and still want my money !!!!  honestly i would want a refund!!

stylist are always a hit and miss and to top it off you always get someone new, for some reason they can hang on to employees here. the wait and the customer service are the worse!even if you call in ahead you are bound to wait at least 40min after your estimated wait time. i always try to give places a second,third chance and this specific time lace has always been bad! so i would suggest you try some where else to  have a better experience.

update: called back the next morning and the manager blanca offered to fix my hair. i hurried over before leaving town and she repaired the mess that was done to my hair. because of the other lady, it was straight on the right side, slanted in the back and two different lengths on the left. she mentioned the lady that cut my hair said i wanted a slanted cut. well, her employee *lied* to her cause i specifically told her i wanted a simple straight bob. even if i did want a slanted cut, in what world does that mean straight and slanted in 4 different lengths?! anyway, the manager was friendly and gave me the perfect cut even though she had to trim it shorter than i initially wanted it, but it was necessary to fix it. couldn't be mad at her, not her fault another employee rushed through my hair and didn't care enough to make sure it was even. while i'm glad she fixed it, i still won't be returning. which is a shame cause i used to get my hair done here all the time years ago when i worked nearby.added one star since the manager made things right. had some issues reserving my appointment time on the website. kept getting an error so i just walked in. they said my time did go through and i was next. i wanted my bob trimmed & re-shaved in the back. i believe it was the supervisor on duty that cut my hair. she asked if i wanted shampoo and condition, i said yes so the shaved bits would be shampooed away from my hair. she sprayed down my hair then cut it at the right length i wanted. she showed me the back to make sure it was short enough. during the shampoo she asked if i would like a blowdry & style, i said yes but she said she didn't have time cause she wanted to take another customer to do a hair cut on him. what?! why? i was there first. asked me to wait 20 min so she could cut his hair then finish mine! i didn't want to sit around w/ wet hair so i declined. came home to dry it myself and noticed the cut is so uneven! one part is almost an inch longer than the rest. see the photo. worst hair salon experience ever!incomplete hair cut and unprofessional attitude! i only came here cause my usual stylist was busy the next few weeks. never again! now i'm going to have to try and even out the cut myself, and it's already short eno

very disappointed i do not recommend this place. i came here looking to get a blunt over the shoulder haircut and i ended up with a mushroom bob. not only is it not what i asked for but it's also very uneven. now i have to wait until my hair grows out to recut it. i believe the lady that cut it was named ana but i have to double check. my hair is curly and i didn't notice how uneven it was until i got home to straighten it. now i'm stuck with a mushroom head. i rated 2 stars because she was friendly and minimal wait time but the cut she gave me is really bad. if you must go to this location i would suggest a different stylist for this type of cut. i am adding pics for reference.

i love this spot! i keep my hair super short with a tight fade and let me just say blanca can get that done in a quarter of the time it use to take my barber to do it. i always check in on-line cause it's easier to reserve your spot. with the reservation i may wait no more than 5 minuets once i arrive. keep in mind, this place is always busy, which speaks volumes at how good these girls are. in addition to the good service, it's always a good time chatting with these girls. they are all super cool and funny but most importantly efficient. i've now turned several friends (male & female) on to this spot. so far we've all been good. thanks again ladies and see you in a week!

i have been a customer for this location for years. they have great staff, clean salon, great customer service. i started using the online reservation which saves me time because they are a very busy store. defiantly try their tea tree experience. highly recommended. a++
this is a great place to get your hair cut.  the service and people are very nice.  blanca is awesome!
i love their service, i came in and blanca huke me up.. i came out looking very pretty. thank you so much. she's the best. come to super cuts you wont regret it. money worth spend! thank u

extremely rude, uneducated so called stylist. joanna rodriguez has the worst attitude. she acts like she is doing you a favor by cutting you hair. someone should really pay more attention on how customers get treated at this super cuts location. i did not even get the haircut i wanted because of how uncomfortable she made me feel. i just wanted her to get her hands off my hair already. i strongly suggest you to go to the one on lakewood.

these girls are amazing! each & everyone of them. they are dedicated to their customers and service. super helpful. they listen to the customers needs. i have to admit my first initial visit was rough but for some reason these girls are awesome and aren't the same. totally personable. yes the wait is long, but that's expected. why rush especially on a hair cut? please don't rush on me. i will be back :)

i used to go here a little, but that's until the last woman who cut my hair about 8mos ago, left a huge long piece of hair without cutting it. i didn't even notice til i got out the shower and combed my hair out. how the heck can you possibly miss that? never going back. plus, they take forever, and that's probably because they are too busy talking and not cutting hair. no thanks.
got my hair cut and colored and blanca did an awesome job and color came out perfect!!  the store is clean and all the staff is very friendly totally recommend!

let me preface this by saying that i have been getting my hair professionally highlighted and colored since i was a preteen and am now 29.  also, please note the pictures i have included. i wish i could include the sinking feeling i have walking in public but my lengthy review will have to do. i am naturally blonde but have enjoyed keeping my hair super light with some slightly darker (medium brown) undertones... or as i was informed by one of the stylists are "low lights." well, i showed them 4 pictures of extremely blonde hair as the reference for how light i wanted my hair and one photo with the blonde & slightly contrasted shades alongside the blonde. long story short, my hair turned out way darker than when i walked in. it is currently a light brown from the light blonde that i was. i was charged $220+tip for a bunch of stuff i didn't agree to (deep treatments and 2 other things that were never explained to me). i was so upset that i couldn't formulate my questions right and every single girl who worked there made me feel worse by saying that it was my fault for getting low lights, that that is the reason my hair is now brown. no one had a consultation with me. no one showed me a sample of what colors they would be using. no one told me prices and when i asked, the response was "we'll have to see..." they made me feel so bad for coming in at 3:45p on a saturday, too.   (i left at about 7:15) i felt unbelievably uncomfortable because they made t known that they were so busy and that their manager who scheduled my appointment messed up by saying okay to me. two girls worked on my hair but neither of them told me what they were going to do. then every single girl was rude, defensive, and accusatory towards me about how dark my hair turned out. i feel so gross about how my hair looks (even though they kept saying "it's beautiful! it's beautiful")... i can't come back to have it "fixed" because i will be undergoing a surgery and out of commission for 3 weeks (which is after the amount of time that they will fix it)... and they won't refund me for the insane amount of "extras" that they added to my bill without my knowledge. i wouldn't have agreed to paying it in the beginning if i wasn't told that the manager could probably refund a portion of the bill and if it wasn't past closing when i left (i was so disappointed and shooken up that i couldn't even argue the price with them.). just be extreeeemely careful if you have naturally light hair and want highlights.  i can't get over how poorly these people treated me. from beginning to end i felt uncomfortable then disappointed and now like someone stole from me. i usually spend my money on high end salons like luigi bruni in michigan and charles ifergan salon in chicago but this is my mistake for trusting a low grade hair place like supercuts.  and when i mentioned what my cousin (miriah from charles ifergan salon) said about this places process, the rude manager, blanca, shut me down and said that everyone does hair differently so her opinion doesn't matter. well, hers does considering she's a upstanding colorist that makes supercuts look like the lowest grade hair establishment. don't go here.if they make a mistake you will have to pay... quite literally... and you will pay the price of an actual upscale salon that makes you feel good about yourself... now embarrassed.
every time i walk out of this store my hair is healthy and beautiful. blanca's been doing my hair the last couples times and she's a great. amazing colorist! very nice and professional :)

i didn't have time to go to my person for a haircut so i went to supercuts by my work.  ana cut my hair and she did a great job!  the only downside is that they are very busy and only two stylist were there and they have to stop what they are doing to either answer a call or speak to a walk-in.  supercuts, you need an receptionist for your stylist but overall, ana is the person to go to for a great haircut.  gina jackson

i walked in yesterday 15 minutes before closing and i was told that i was going to be serviced. the 2 stylist finished with their customers at the same time. neither one wanted to approach me or acknowledge me. i stood up and walked towards them. i said i'll just come back tomorrow since you're closing. neither one said sorry or thank you. i've been there before business hours and let's just say that they've opened late before. if you're gonna open your business late, do you think it's a good idea not wanting to provide services to late walk ins. the only bad outcome for me leaving this location is that i won't be helped by ana. ana gives the best haircuts. shame!
