my experience here is a joke. i was super early for a movie so i stopped by to get a haircut. i was greeted immediately by vivian who took me back after getting all my info, and she asked me what i wanted. i told her i wanted a trim and layers, because i've been growing out my hair and i've been pretty bored with it. she asked me where i wanted the shortest layer and i said i wasn't sure, and asked what she thought. her response was, "it's up to you." well....yes, i know that, but what kind of stylist can't even give professional opinions, especially when asked? she took scissors and cut an inch off my hair, used the same scissors to do one swipe down the hair on either side of my face for my 'layers' and literally, that was it. seriously -- my cut couldn't have taken more than five minutes. she didn't even make sure the layers were even. whatever. my hair doesn't look any different, so it could be worse, but man, what a bummer. from now on, i'll go somewhere else for professional opinions and some personality from the person cutting my hair.

i took my 6yr old for a simple cut. i just wanted four inches taken off the length. at the place the girl did a dry cut which i didn't think anything of. well we get home and after a shower i'm brushing her hair and it's completely lopsided. worst haircut ever.

i love my cut , root touch up and highlights by maxine.  stopped by supercuts after the stylist from a groupon i purchased was a no show and maxine filled the void.  everything happens for a reason.  i'm happy i got stood up and found maxine.

this is the 3rd time i've been to supercuts and i always leave satisfied.i have thick short hair and it's a pain to maintain it. i'm very picky with who touches my hair. my hair stylists has been claire (sorry if i misspelled the name) .. she is amazing! she knows how to clean up my hair without taking too much length off.i recommend and trust her

their website shows $12.95 for kids cut and also $12.95 for seniors over 62. so i take my daughter and my father to get haircuts. the haircuts could have been better and the staff there are unfriendly and unenthusiastic - fine whatever. i get to the register and all of a sudden the price is $14.50 for my kid and $16.50 for my dad. when i asked why the prices are different on the supercuts website my reply was: "they took those prices away last week". ya, right. f--- you and your f------ store. goodbye.

great haircuts and coloring and waxing!!the hair professionals know what to do!  very witty, personable and helpful.our family drives past many other salons on our way to this particular supercuts for a reason!!

came to this supercuts because it was close to my work and i wanted a trim all my ends off they were getting really gross and just not attractive looking. the lady who helped me listened to want i wanted and kept my length, and the other lady ( sorry i don't know the names) helped cut my hair. my hair is healthier and still kept my length and more layers. i love how it looks. definitely recommend this location the ladies know what they are doing !

i came to this location the other day with my daughter to get hair cuts. i explained that my hair was so long, thick and that it was getting too complicated to keep up with the military appearance since the bun was getting too big. i asked for a pretty basic hair cut, i would think... to cut three inches, straight across my back and to thin it out. when straightened my hair the next day, i realized that i had a lot of random chunks of hair that was longer than the actual cut. i had to have my husband cut the obvious parts until i could take some leave to get another hair cut. this is kind of the last thing i wanted to worry about. sometimes attention to detail can go a long way.

if i could give this experience of -5 i would. i wear my hair pretty short and i went in there and showed a picture to the girl that cut my hair and told her i wanted it cut just a little bit shorter than that picture because i have to get it cut too often and before i could say anything she took clippers and went up the back of my head. cutting it almost to my scalp.  i had been explaining to her what a bad year it been.. i've had 3 surgeries, my mom and dad both passed away and i was so looking forward to my birthday coming up that weekend because i hadn't been out much in the last year due to medical and i had to cancel my birthday party because she basically shaved my head. i'm not a confrontational person and i was extremely upset and i did not want to cry so i just paid her and left. i called the manager to explain the whole thing to her i sent her before picture and after  picture i was promised not only to get my money back but that i would hear back from the manager and that still has not happened so i will never ever go here again. luckily i am on medical leave and don't have to leave my house.  i put a hoodie on to walk my dog because i'm so embarassed of my hair ( or lack thereof)..

i wish i could remember the name of the lady that cut my hair.  it was the fastest, better looking haircuts i have ever had.  she didn't try to make small talk, which i really appreciated.  she cut my hair in about 7 minutes flat!

terrible haircut. she took only about 10 minutes to cut my hair and it looked uneven. i then told her and she said that's just the way my hair was. now i have to go back to get it fixed. i would never pay any amount to get my hair cut there again.

usually take a chance with other supercuts..but this place was clean, modern, and most importantly i got a great haircut.  darci totally listened to what i wanted and did it quickly and beautifully.  went late morning monday..no wait..and the best $15.00 haircut.  next time, plan on taking advantage of their color.

went here last week to find they had totally remodeled the place.  lookin' good supercuts! again, sara saved the day, color and cut and making me lovely to look at once again.  new color dye burns a little more than the old stuff, but the color is amazing!  go!  you know you wanna look good!  just go!no, they don't take appointments!

great staff, great customer service, great hair cuts!  the experience is as wonderful as the cut. they really took the time to understand and cut my hair the way i wanted it done. wow! -keep up the great work team.

i always get so nervous when finding a good hair dresser! i don't like when i sit in someone's chair and they tell me what i want or what they think is best for me! but what i really hate is when i go in for a trim and come out 4 inches shorter :/ i also don't want to pay $50 for a hair trim. i was extremely lucky to have colene take care of me! i was very picky asking if she can cut my hair dry, i just know that's what works for me. i was okay if it couldn't be done but i could just tell i could trust her, she definitely knew what she was doing! colene was so friendly about all my crazy request! i have been growing my hair out for years now and i just needed to be sure it didn't get messed up. i am beyond happy with super cuts and this location. i paid $17 for a trim. but i was also surprised to see they do waxing and color! this is my new spot for my hair and eyebrows :)

i got a really great haircut from kelsey 3 mos ago and so i returned 3 mos later for another.  she wasn't as enthusiastic as last time and left me with nothing short of loss for words. two other stylists picked up that i was not happy with the cut and made me feel better immediately.  cassandra and nicole rescued me and reassured me i wasn't leaving until i got the cut i wanted and was happy. thank you , thank you , thank you girls for making my day. you are the definition of customer service. i understand we all have bad days so i wasn't mad or anything at kelsey i was in fact a little disappointed,  but no big deal. this location has great stylists. i will be back.

i walked in for a cut and color around 3:40pm last friday, and i am so happy with my hairdresser cassandra! she did a phenomenal job and just knows what to do in regards to mixing the colors (i showed her a photo for reference) and trimming where it needed to be, which was 8 inches, so glad that i did! i felt a bit bad, cassandra had to stay after hours to finish up deep conditioning/shampoo/cut. she was very patience and i did not feel rushed at all! thank you again! :)

got a great trim and style while here on vacation. the male stylist was great, i forgot to get his name. i was in a hurry to make a portrait shot with my family. i totally recommend this place if you need a cut or style on a sunday.

robyn nicole is amazing!!! she listens and pays so close attention to every little detail. she totally gets it!!! she is fun, spunky and most of all the sweetest person ever!!! i love, love, love my hair and will continue to come back. in fact,  i don't see myself going to anyone else.... she is perfect in every way.

robyn is the best! i just moved to arizona from la and have had some pretty fancy hairdressers. she is so patient, creative and really works with me on my vision of my hair. i always leave happy and w hair better than i could of thought up by myself.

beware! i was just charged $45 for an awful braid, and didn't even wash my hair. i had her redo it once and then just said i liked it so i can go home and redo it. the woman seemed very inexperienced as she made my hair look nothing like the picture i showed her. it took three people to figure out how to ring me up. never going back!

just left this place feeling like a new woman! colene is amazing. she listened to what i needed and delivered that and more. my hair feels so much healthier and manageable. she made me feel relaxed and i had a good time chatting with her. she wasn't pushy about selling any products but made some awesome recommendations. i bought the olive oil shampoo and conditioner along with the super skinny serum which i am super excited to use. the online check in was easy and efficient. the hours and days this location is open is so convenient! great experience from the online check-in, to walking out the door. thank you, colene and supercuts, for probably the best hair cut i have ever experienced!

i went there to get highlights for my hair. joshua was very helpful. he listened carefully to what i wanted, and recommend exactly what would suit me and my hair type. the results turned out to be amazing. i decided to get a haircut as well. joshua helped me tame my voluminous, thick hair by giving me the right amount of layers, while still maintaining the length of it. it was a very good first experience for me. everyone working in the salon was very nice and pleasant. what i loved the most was that joshua answered all my questions very patiently.

really slow and not great haircut this evening. she worked on my hair for over an hour and never was able to really get what i was telling her i wanted. now that i know which one she is i will avoid her in the future. don't have a name because she didn't have a cosmetology license displayed at her station. normally this place is great but the lady who cut my hair this evening was a disaster.

new to the area and needed someone to fix a haircut that went wrong.  stopped in and joshua was available right away to help me.  super friendly, professional and he fixed my botched haircut! definitely recommend!

i came to supercuts for color a few years back as an emergency as i used to go to expensive high end salons but could not get in. i came in for color and it was the best service i ever received. i have been coming back for my color ever since. i am always complimented on my color. gavin, robin and joshua are great!!

hey guys. we also have a review system called my salon listens. that is sent to your email after a service. don't let all yelp reviews push you away from coming into our salon. :)  always working harder to improve and to deliver the best services. we welcome you in again. or if you're new we would be pleased to have you become part of our family.

this place is solid for a quick haircut that isnt gonna set you back 30 dollars for someone that gets their haircut twice a month 15 dollars a trip isnt so badif you want a good haircut then tell them how you like it- they stylists ive had have always been very receptive and talkative to keep me entertained

ok, i'm done. done i tell you. i cannot get a consistent haircut from these folks. my hair is simple. number 3 on the sides, trimmed on the top, kinda "boxy" style, and not a uniform buzz cut. i only have one cowlick at the crown of my noggin. these past 3 times, i tell the lady my simple hair cut. i have had to return later in the day or the next day to get all the straggler hairs, the uneveness, and basically my whole head re-cut. and they don't even get that right. they just run the clippers over it to even it out and i leave with a standard buzz cut. but this last chance was the last straw. the same lady, whom i dreaded seeing when i walked in and she said "come on back" was free and thus was going to cut my hair. she spent an inordinate amount of time cutting my hair, using all types of fancy scissors and giant plastic pitchfork looking things, but mostly spent the 45 minutes talking and really....not focusing on cutting my hair. when she was finished, i immediately noticed again, how she did not even bother to trim my cowlick. when i pointed it out to her, she says "i'm not finished, i just wanted you to see how it looks so far"...malarky! she then got out the clippers and basically gave me a very, very, very uneven buzz cut. and....the past 3 cuts from her, i still have all the scraggly hairs above and behind my ears that i just trim when i get home!since i left with it so short, i would have been pointless to get it corrected....that would just entail me shaving my head myself. so i'm going to listen to my wife and go to a barber or pay a little more at a salon or just go shaggy. i know it's only 15 bucks, but my hair is not that complicated and i guess i just expected a decent haircut every once in a while. but 3 in a row....the fool is me.
super cheap, nice people, and i was in and out with a new cut. whats there to complain about?

i love billi at supercuts.  i have been coming to her store for almost a year now.  my hair has never been healthier.  i color my hair and billi has done an incredible job with my color and style.    i have been tpo the expensive 'scottsdale salons' and have walked out very unhappy.   she is pleasant and fun to talk to. the price is great and the service is excellent!

kisha is a well seasoned stylist who not only understands hair but listens as well!  i loved that she didn't fill the time in her chair with pointless chatter as much as her pointed attention on how i requested my hair cut. she has such a natural sense- didn't take me right to the shampoo bowl but actually cut my hair mostly dry to watch it react to what she was doing it's been painstaking to find a stylist and a positive experience getting my hair done. bottom line is, i don't want the a-line you cut, i want the a-line that works with my cow licks and waning hairline like i communicated. :) thanks k!  you understand where it starts, listening.

we went here and ask for how long , the reciptionist say 10' waiting and after 15' wait i went to ask her ( cause i see her take couple people in ) she tell me to wait other 20' cause she have appoint them came ? what the hell she told me cause she didn't know appointments will came in ? omg  ....
they close at 7 i came in at 645 there was 2 barbers and only 1 person waiting but they "didn't have enough time to do my hair" i get it shaved. this place doesn't like to make money or cut hair

i was skeptical to come here because they butchered my hair in april 2015, but i wanted to give them a second chance. the woman who cut my hair did an amazing job! she made my hair look amazing! definitely will be coming back again.

i showed up early for my appointment and waited until my appointment time. the stylist instead took a walk in. i explained that scheduled clients should get priority over a walk in, but they obviously don't undersrtand how appointments work at this location. extremely frustrating as i've spent the past 10 days in the hospital with a loved one and i tried to take 30 minutes away for myself. this was such a huge waste of my time.
love coming here to get my haircut. jason always pays attention to details and does a great job.   i always look great when he cuts my hair. i strongly recommend you ask for him.
i always have a good experience. if you use the app to check-in you will not have to wait very long. have been using this store for about six years with no problems.

we've been going here since this location opened, and we'd never had a bad experience until today. my wife has psoriasis on her scalp, and it's noted on her account. every time we go, they say something about dandruff. read the notes, please, it's not dandruff! then today, the girl at the front desk told her she couldn't cut her hair today, because her scalp was irritated. she wasn't rude about it, but she was loud, and instead of reading the notes on the account, she advised my wife that she should see a doctor about it. thanks for the kind suggestion.
i've been waiting for 15 minutes for the store to open and still nobody has shown up. the hours posted say 9am, and it is now well after 9.
another great cut!  this place has the nicest people.  music needed to be a little more upbeat, but hey, i'm there for a haircut, not a concert.
not the best by far. i am going to stick to my location over at camelback .

why do employees have to be rude! this place was terrible from the first time i stepped in. it was as though i was bothering them. they were slow at cutting hair, unprofessional and i would not recommend them based on my personal experience.

i wish there was an option for 0 stars, cuz they don't even deserve one. we checked in and told them we had two people, and seeing as there was two of us standing there, i don't see how that would be so difficult to understand. 15 minute wait, not bad. wandered around, came back, i came up to the counter and the guy walked away, not a word, just turned his back on me and left. a little irritated, i turned on my heel and walked out, decided to try again in a few minutes. we come back in and the nice lady at the counter asked for our names, (unintentionally?) makes fun of my boyfriends name, and tells me that since the first idiot never asked for my name, i had to wait behind the other 5 people that came in after me. livid. guess you get what you pay for.

i went to get my haircut today. for the past several months i have been growing out my mustache and my hair. i now have a great handlebar mustache and my hair has begun to feather back nicely. i told the gentleman i was looking for a haircut to match my mustache, a longer hairstyle. i told him i wanted it a bit shorter on the sides and longer up top. he spun me around to show me a couple of pictures of men with buzz cuts. i said no, *much* longer. i mean come on, my hair was feathered back! so he nods like he knows what i'm talking. before i know it, he's using clippers on my hair! i say loudly (to be heard over the clipper) that he's cutting my hair too short! he smiles, nods and proceeds to buzz cut my hair!i'm shocked at this point! who would buzz cut feathered back hair without telling the customer??? i let the gentleman know again that he is cutting my hair too short. again with the stupid grin and nod. again with the complete disregard to what i'm saying. and he buzzes away my hair. my wife could hear me from across the salon. she's telling my daughter that i'm not happy, because she can hear my complaints. he cut off well over four inches of hair from the sides and back! i stopped him at this point and i remind him of what i asked for. just a bit shorter on the sides, not short! he tries to tell me that he misunderstood. i remind him that i well saying it's too short. several times. he ignored me. in the end, he finished my haircut and offered his apologies. the haircut itself looks presentable with enough product in it. i hate wearing product in my hair. although the haircut is presentable, it is not what i asked for. i remind the gentleman that i will now have to wear his apology for months, until my hair grows back out. do not get your hair cut here, unless you want someone else to decide how they're going to cut your hair. the stylist (vietnamese gentleman) does not listen!

went in yesterday to get my hair cut for summer.i waited for an hour , when the wait time was 20 minutes when i showed up and the girl was rude. i asked for an angled bob and they cut my hair without even doing the finger test to see if it was too short. after it was cut, i heard to late to go back and now i have a haircut that barely pulls into a ponytail like i asked for and short sides which i did not ask for. i used to go here all the time and this will be the last time.

first time reviewer... because of my frustration during this visit.the benefit of places like super cuts and great clips is that, while they may not have the best stylists, it is usually possible to quickly get in or out.  while visiting relatives, i stopped in to get a haircut and was told there would be 35 (seemed pretty precise) minute wait. there were three people in the lobby waiting on haircuts.  at this point i had an hour before i needed to leave for dinner so i decided to wait.after waiting for 30 minutes a dad and his two sons arrived.  one stylists took the dad, and i assumed he had a call-in appointment.  i was slightly irritated that they did not tell me there were three call-in appointments, as i doubted this gentleman would get his hair cut in 5 minutes. i didn't want to spend those thirty minutes waiting for nothing; however, i should have considered the sunk cost of my time. the second stylist took a person that was previously in the lobby. when the first stylist was finished with the father he took the second son.  even though it had been nearly an hour i was thinking, "at least i'm next in line for the stylist that is taking lobby patrons."  at nearly exactly the one hour mark the dad walked over to me and apologized, as he had noticed my long wait.  as i assumed, they had booked appointments over the phone.  i informed him that i was not upset with him at all, but what a nice gesture. the stylists did not inform me of this, the customer did.  the second stylist finished with her lobby patron and move on to... the third son. at this time (an hour and 15 minutes into my wait). my wife gave up waiting for me to pick her up, and started walking to this location from the nearby mall.  i informed my family that i would be very late for dinner.i finally was called back. no "thank you for waiting, no sorry for your wait, no explanation that they had to serve the call-in customer first," nothing. as i got my hair cut in silence, the stylist pinched my neck in the apron snap.  i couldn't hold back a small yelp of pain.  no apology.  silent hair cut continues.  usually a stylist will slap his or her comb against my forehead multiple times during a haircut.  truly a testament to their speed as they switched from collecting strands to cutting said strands.  this stylist got me right in the eyeball with the comb's teeth. another small yelp of pain.  no apology. i finally finished my haircut.  a total of 12 words... jason, how you like it?, this short?, strong hair, coupon?, and twenty dollars" were spoken from the time i sat down to the time i left.  i was offered 3, $2 off coupons. not only would i not return once, i would not return three times for sure. because i am not one to complain with no solutions in mind, here is how this location could have salvaged this situation, and should treat future (not me) customers. know the schedule for those customers that have called in an appointment so that you do not tell someone 35 minutes, then leave them waiting for ~1 hour and 20 minutes before they see a stylist.  if this egregious breakdown occurs, promptly inform the customer of your error and provide him or her of his new wait time, so he can make an informed decision whether he wants to continue to wait or cut his losses.  if the customer decides to wait, acknowledge the customer's wait and apologize for wait.  on final suggestion, please take the "walk-ins welcome" sign off your window.
prices just went down on color
i got my hair cut there last week. its a great place with awesome customer service. stephen cut my hair and it looks awesome definitely recommend him, he gave me exactly what i asked for.
good color, good stylists, and good conversations, it's hard to trust anyone with my hair, but stephen does amazing work! he's worked some magic, i definitely will return!!!!!!!!
clean,  very spacious,  amazing stylists! i'd definitely recommend this place for your next cut, color, or style.  definitely check this place out.

meh - this location is great because it is centrally located in tempe and easily accessible if you live on or near campus. the stylists are often inexperienced and unprofessional however. i would say this is a average location for supercuts, at best. expect a wait and know exactly what you want, since the stylists aren't great at helping you make a decision. this location would do better if they had more stylists and could reduce their turnover.

supercuts seems pretty good that it's close to campus. unfortunately i had an unhappy experience. called ahead prior to closing and asked if they had room and what time they closed. they said they stay open until 7pm and that they had a 2min wait. i call a lyft to get there prior to closing and come through the door only to be told that they don't have room to fit me in. i arrived exactly 30 minutes prior to closing and got there within 10 minutes of calling them.ended up wasting $5 to get out there. i wish the staff would've said something over the phone as opposed to giving misinformation.case in point, if you call in be weary of the info they give you.

i got my haircut yesterday from a great lady. while i can't remember her name, she did the very common "white boy" haircut.. common blend from a low 1 to a high 3, with a pompadour haircut up top. she blended it and helped even out all of the inconsistencies i was having in my hair and with previous barbers. definitely coming back!

i never give reviews but i had exceptional service with alexandra. she went above and beyond with my haircut. she not only gave me a good haircut in what i asked for but gave me a lot of advice in how to take care of my hair. i appreciate that sooo much. thank you!

went to supercut at rural and university cornerstone many times and i prefer alexandria when i make the appointment there.she is very particular when cutting hair and i like that  ..you  will know the difference if u give her a shot you will see! guys and gals ....
just had one of the best haircuts ever! enjoyed conversation with darcy and team, fun place to get a cut. thanks guys! great haircut too, best i've had in awhile as well.
wouldn't let me 8 year son use their bathroom, will never go here for haircut...,..ccxxxxxxxx cxxxxxxx.

please don't make the mistake i did and go here just because you see some (somehow perfect) 5 star reviews. i imagine those reviews were "bought" somehow. i went here after work today and had a terrible experience. i wanted about an inch off (i had very long hair) and now it is above my shoulder with sloppy layers (some so short they are probably 2 1/2 inches in length). i will own up to my own error in this, as i agreed to a shorter cut but not this short as i explicitly said below the shoulder and was very reluctant about the layers.furthermore, i've always been outspoken about what i call "hair salon bullying". this is a hair stylist belittling your current style/color in order to sell you a color or cut they envision for you (and potentially so they can make more $). "what is that crazy bleach job you have going on?" "so the last person who cut your hair, they obviously didn't know what they were doing, did they?" my stylist did all of the above, making me feel like, "oh nice, so you're telling me i've been walking around looking like sh*t the last few months..." it puts me in a vulnerable place and i want to hear the professional's opinion. however, that said, i took her advice and went shorter than i planned but it still did not come out as promised which was supposed to be longer than shoulder length. and the layers are so inconsistent, choppy, and poorly done that a friend asked me if i had a mullet in the front. just horrible. stay away!

don't go. they will butcher your hair. the employee turnover is crazy. you will never see the same person twice. only go if it's your last resort. seriously, the people here have no experience or commitment to the hair styling industry. they do it in the side to further their actual careers (if any)

i was very dubious about going here since i saw on yelp the number of low reviews this location has but was in desperate need for a bang cut so i decided to go and take the chance. i got melanie (who i strongly recommend; she's very nice and listens to needs) and she took care of my bang cut perfectly per my needs! it's been a week since i got them cut here and i am happy with how it looks. now keep in mind this review is for a plain hair cut and not dramatic styling or hair color. for simple hair cuts or trims, this place seems perfectly capable and is convenient bc of its proximity to school ^o^ have no complaints here.

this place is terrible. it was my only night off and i called ahead to see if they could get me in. they told me it would be 15 minutes before i could get in. almost an hour later they still hadn't said a single word to me. thanks for wasting my only night off. i should have gone somewhere else. now i have to do it myself! just terrible. if you are understaffed and can't fit me in then fing tell me. don't make me waste my time! i am furious.

can someone please tell me why tammy took liberties with my child's hair?  i said a trim not to hack it & shape it without asking first.  she has curly hair that used to be allb one length.  she went crazy with the clippers to the ends.  my daughter's hair isn't what we wanted & we left with frizzy hair.

always get my hair cut here. don't try and get your eyebrows waxed. two times so far i've been denied. once i was told oh i don't know how and another time oh the wax isn't warm enough! if you offer a service it should be available or post times it is available.

first hair cut salon in arizona for me and i'd say it went wonderfully. no one ever gets personal and asks that many questions to make sure you got the hair cut you came asking for. i would highly recommend it. also try their green tea shampoo and conditioner. just ask them about it. you won't regret it. the price was decent but everything was to my liking.

rip off and bad service. $65 later and they sent me out the door without even fixing my hair. i have never been to a hair salon that doesn't dry and style your hair after you've paid an arm and a leg for a service.  horrible.
stopped by asu to visit the boy and took him for a long overdue haircut. we waited about 10 minutes and the haircut did the trick.

my story goes like this.  i went in and requested a simple fade and explicitly requested that it be at medium height.  i even said "don't give me a marine hair cut".  i took off my glasses and don the cape, the women (who happened to be the manager) who was to cut my hair spun me away from the mirror and started to cut.  about 3 minutes later (yeah seriously 3 minutes!!!!! wtf) she stated she was finished, so i put my glasses back on to see what the finished product looked like.  how do you think she did, was she such a master that she could give a world class hut cut in record time?  nope!!!  she gave me a high and tight, seriously a damn hight and tight.  the one thing i asked her not to do she did, and the shit eating grin on her face said "yeah i know what you said but i don't give a crap, i just want to get back to facebook".  i was so pissed that i just bit my tongue and said nothing or else i'd have flipped out on this lady.  so, i get home and start to check out the magnum opus this picasso of hair styling had created and i find a huge, make that ridiculously huge chunk of hair the size of two thumbs uncut and sticking out from the rest of the disaster.  seriously wtf!!!!!!  i still to this day think she did that purposely because there's no way to miss some shit like that.  i get back in my car and return to the store, i politely wait for another stylist (even though the hair terrorist was free) to take me back and do some damage control.  i could tell she was having a hard time saving as much as possible because the blending was sooooo bad and uneven however, she did what she could and i appreciate that (oh she also told me that the hair terrorist doesn't know how to do fades correctly because she is classically trained or some crap).  this women knew she didn't have the skill set to cut my hair and put me in a booth anyways.  way to go supercuts, that's taking initiative, after all it's better to take someone's money once and not give them what they paid for so they'll never return than having them wait 10 minutes to get what they came for.  after this very pleasant and skilled young lady is finished fixing the debacle on my cranium i politely request a refund.  i actually shouldn't have paid for the hair cut in the first place but i wanted no drama.  nevertheless, i had to drive all the way back here to have someone do damage control so i was not feeling like i owned them any money for any of this fiasco.  of course i had to go through the hair terrorist to get said refund, and that went over like a fart in church.  it was obvious that she really really really did not want to refund my money, why, i have no clue.  after politely asking and explaining that the requested refund was based on principle, her retort basically amounted to the theory of using it to pay for the second haircut i got, yeah the one where they fixed what she jacked up in the first place.  she wanted to keep the money and transfer the "credit" to the other stylist.  seeing how as i was going to use the refund to tip the second stylist anyways and that by this time i was immensely annoyed with the hair terrorist and could handle no more of her crap i just agreed and left.moral of the story:  don't come here with any expectation because, apparently you don't need to know how to cut hair to work at this supercuts or for the matter to even manage the damn place.  to be fair though there is at least one talented individual working here.

my best friend and i went in here on a sunday, fed up with mall prices. i had the best  hair cutting experience ever! loved the men cutting our hair, and it's the best cut i've had in years! p. s. get the tea tree oil treatment.

bianca gave me the greatest joy by giving me a great haircut.  she knew what she was doing and cut to perfection.  that is rare for me to say.  i usually sign in online, but this time i was a walk in.  there was no wait time for me.  i highly recommend bianca if you go to this location.  i'm confident you will be as pleased as i am if she cuts your hair.

the guy that cut my hair was awesome!! he did a great job and was super friendly. the only reason this review is bad is because they didn't honor a coupon that apparently was only for another location. again not the fault of the employee but a bad policy of the company.

my family and i go to this super cuts a few times a month at times and always ask for amanda. one thing i appreciate about amanda is that she listens to you. i often ask for a trim at places and will get too much cut off :( but when i have visited amanda she hears me and cuts exactly what i asked for. my son and my daughter say the same thing. we have waited at times for amanda to be scheduled. :)

very happy with my hair! i had a basic cut and then balayage color. amanda rocked it! she is super friendly, knows the importance of listening to her clients, and was accommodating to all my requests. great attention to detail and excellent price! the other stylists were friendly too, and did a great job with their clients from what i could tell because there were many happy regular customers. this supercuts is a winner! and i had no idea supercuts even did color, but i gave it a shot and will definitely be back to see amanda in the future.

this is the worst haircut that ive had in my life. i told the hairdresses very simple instructions, even showed her a picture of my last haircut which was very simple, and still messed up my hair. its a girl with black hair with dyed hair on top. she is the worst! wont be going back there again

great supercuts.  i have been going to this location for at least 1 year now and have never had any problems or issues.  i always get my hair cut by the manager anthony which i am always pleased with.  the only down fall (it's not their fault) is sometimes the wait is long, but that should tell you they are good at cutting hair!

as a long time customer and a college student....i am a faithful customer....your rates are best one can find in the city....i just moved from san marcos, tx to san antonio.....after growing at my hair for a year i find cutting it hard...a man without his hair is like a women is who isnt pretty....that said going into a supercuts : i was completely dismayed.....while my hair was getting cut...my hair cutter was also cutting a little boys hair....i live in a classy part of san antonio and was recently invited to a ritzy party in downtown now i dont know if i can show my face....before the incident i looked like a respected individual ready for classes in two weeks....now i look like a punk with no hair going to the military....when i was receiving my hair cut i asked for my sides to be thinned not a mohawk..... if this is how you treat an individual much needs to be improved with your company and the faculty that represents you!.....

it was fall time and i just moved here not too long ago, and my hair was practically to my waist. since my hair is very thick, it made me sweat a lot, and i wanted a change. i went in and the service was very friendly. i sat down and told her i just wanted it shorter, because my hair just makes me sweat and i hated it. maybe a pixie? a side cut?  i told her i didn't want anything near cutting to my shoulders, because i have a round face, and it looks so stupid when i have shoulder length hair. (picture a beach ball with a wig on.) i also told her i wanted a darker color. she said she didn't have time to dye it, and i would have to come back the next day 10 am. i told her never mind on the color, and just do the cut.  she did an under cut to my ears, and shortened my hair. i told her i also wanted front bangs, and she said straight bangs wouldn't look good with my face shape, so she gave me this weird side bang (which i hated afterwards) her co worker offered to color my hair since she was off soon. she brought out the color wheel, and i told her i didn't want anything red, since i have lots of red tones in my face. she showed me this beautiful dark brown/black with purple highlights, which wasn't overwhelming for work at all. and next to it was this red violet color. and she said "this one suits you!" i said it was a bit too red for my taste, and she said the red isn't that noticeable. so she dyed my hair. i was there for almost 3 hours. with my glasses off, i cant see whats going on, so she finishes it i put my glasses on and she turned me around. side bang, shoulder hair, and it was a dark red/burgundy color. i wasn't sure how to feel. i liked the undercut a lot. i paid 75 for everything. (which i'm never doing again) about a week later, i hated the hair color so much i ended up re-dying it back to a dark brown.the length has grown out, but i never wear it down, because it's too hot!i feel bad for not saying anything ( i think one of the ladies was still learning to cut hair), but i wont be coming back here.
i will never go back. i got my hair cut and was totally not happy. i went back 2 days later to get a redo and i'm still not happy.
this place is short staffed often only having one stylist even on saturdays. the stylist are often not well trained. the store has stayed in disrepair for several years.

store doesn't close until 8.employee didn't want to work so said they closed at 5... where does it say they close at 5 on a tuesday? nowhere!! lazy ass employee.wouldn't even come to the door to tell me why they were closed early
staff was not interactive. but stylist did a good job. overall satisfied with the service but could improve customer interaction skills. thanks to my gal for making me contribute to yelp.

advertise to skip the wait by making an appointment online, well, the workers there do not know this... visited on saturday, 11/26/16, and made online appointment for 5:30pm.  i get there 10 minutes early, and the decide to take another customer before me.  then, a few minutes after my appointment, the girl cutting hair tells me that they are taking another customer because he got to the salon before i did...  what's the point on online apts if you're gonna pull this crap?  horrible!

i think this is a great place for a quick and affordable haircut and style. i've been to this location on a few occasions and its always busy and there appears to be a number of regulars. this is our go-to place for my guy's haircut in between trims that i give him. i find the stylists i be nice and helpful and relatively fast. if you do not know what style you want i recommend that you do some homework first. they do have some style books but not many and you won't find tons of magazines in in the waiting area -- so bring something with you if you are waiting on someone -- but the wait is generally never over 30 min total unless you are in a peak time like saturday afternoon or back to school time.

i must say for a place to recieve so much traffic. one would think there should be more employees working here. i was told 30 minute wait but it has been 1 hour and 30 minutes. they forgot to mention customers call in instead if waiting so they come first. if thats the case then they need more hair dressors.

this supercuts is great. very good customer service and even better cuts. i've been coming to supercuts ever since i was younger. they're always kind and greet you when you walk in the door. it's always best to call in ahead of time so that way when you get there, you don't have to worry about waiting 30-45 minutes for a cut. highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice haircut.

came here a few days ago.  the place is a disaster.  it was at least 30 minutes wait before they took me in, considering that i reserved a time slot on line.  but that is just the tip of the issue.  there were only 2 individuals cutting hair.  they were not even cleaning up before the next customer is serviced.  they had everyone's hair scattered all over the floor.  it was disgusting.  it was late and i just went along with it.  i shouldn't have since my hair was cut by some 3rd rate stylist.  well, i'm not coming back here again.

they don't have enough stylists for the demand. they also don't notify you of your place in line. especially vs online checking. i sat waiting for over 40 minutes before being told that i was still behind 2 more people because of online check ins. this is not the way to do business. i'm going back to great clips.

if you want a lazy and half assed cut, come here!i brought l my brother in for a haircut today and while waiting, we noticed the hair stylist clarissa, seemed very rude and unwelcoming while talking to other guests that walked in the door. unfortunately, that's who we got but we gave her the benefit and requested that she give him a fade with 2 on the sides and a 3 on top (realize that boy's hair grows extremely fast and we request the same thing every month and get the results we want). i also explained that my terminology may be wrong but i explained the look, short on the sides, and longer on top. she started cutting, and customers flocked in and i see her just buzz his entire head so then i go up to clarissa, already in awe at what she did and ask her to fade his hair, the least she can do after giving him a military cut, not what we asked for, she replies "there's too many customers waiting." i gladly gave her no tip, and not to mention, she had nails that were 2 inches long, not sure how she's cutting hair at all to begin with. save your kids the embarrassment at school, take them else where.
friday at 10:00 am.  for the 3rd time only 1 employee and long wait.  i dont know why this place is not staffed but i wont be coming to this location anymore.
very good experience here! everyone was nice and professional. my hair stylist was great! she did exactly what i wanted and i'm very pleased with the outcome.

terrible customer service. went in had to wait 25 min for my son to get a hair cut, when it was my daughters turn the girl got up and went to lunch, without a saying a word, making me wait another 20 min to get her hair cut

when i walked in, everyone was cutting hair, but one of the stylists looked over and acknowledged me, so i took a seat. two other customers came after me, and she wholeheartedly greeted each of them, even ensuring they were put on the list. it was only myself and those two customers who came after me in the waiting area, so i feel i was outright ignored. i guess because i have a beard, it's okay to discriminate against me and ignore me. this is pathetic if you ask me and i'm glad i'm the first to review these racists. as soon as she took one of the customers ahead of me, i simply walked out. i don't have time to argue with these low-lifes. what goes around comes around!

the staff always does a great job.   very welcoming and courteous.   michelle usually cuts my hair and does an awesome job,but if she is booked up, the rest of the stylist on hand will always do a great job.

5 stars! isis is a baller, ask for her! the staff here is consistent and good. i bring my son here at least twice a month and typically have isis cut his hair. every hairstylist here is good. isis is great. she is fast with kids which makes it easy on the kiddos attention span. her fades are quality top notch leaving no lines visable. i have had to use three other stylists for my son here. they all were good.tip: i call before i leave the house to get pur name on the list which takes you to the front of the line as soon as you walk in the front door. i think you can do this online too.

see posted pic. this was taken before getting it fixed at another place. she trimmed so high above my ear. it was unprofessional. she didn't tell me she screwed up, so she could fix it. had a co worker point it out. thanks for that. this place is a chop shop.

absolute worst haircut i have ever had.  went to get hair trimmed for a wedding.  told the girl i would like long layers and just evened up a little.  she butchered my hair.  all different lengths and basically a short shag from the 70s !!  i just wanted to cry.  still do.  there is no way to fix it until it grows out.  it will be about 6 months.  the only reason i am giving them one star is to write a review.  this chop job is devastating.  im completely embarassed.  the girl that cut my hair should be fired.  i dont believe for one minute that she went to school to learn to cut hair.

went in as a last minute walk in. i needed my daughters hair cut for back to school and they were able to accommodate us immediately.  mallorie was friendly and really good with my daughter.  (age 6). i am definitely going back for myself and all my girls haircuts..

crapercuts: what i asked for is not what i received. not even close. i asked for a shaped cut and even showed a picture, all i got was a buzz cut. my wife said i could do better myself and i have with my electric clippers from costco. don't be fooled by the advertisements or positive reviews. i am continually dissatisfied with this business chain.$14.99 wasted! i am will never visit this business chain again.

i have short wavy hair, cut like halle berry. i tried four other salons ranging in price and amenities, and i couldn't get a good haircut in san antonio.then i drove by and thought i'd try this salon - out of desperation and with no expectations.  jeannetta was amazing.  i haven't had a haircut this good since i left miami years ago.  and when i found out how affordable it was, i almost fell out.  for what i paid for one hair cut at a previous place, i can get three haircuts here.   and it's a nice, clean shop in a great location.  i'll never go anywhere else in tx.thank you jeannetta. you were not only very proficient, but kind and fun to talk to.

kortney always does an amazing job which is why i return regularly. i used to pay a lot more for haircuts and drive across town to get them because i assumed that meant better quality but she does my hair as well as any of them and is a lot more pleasant in addition to being conveniently located.the beard trims and shampoos are also great. the stylists are all very pleasant, which to me is at least as important as the skill. i recommend you go and ask for kortney (yes, spelled with a k).also, be sure to try to potato salad. it's pretty good.

could be the worst haircut i have ever gotten. my regular lady is out of the country so emergency haircut it is. i went in the for a trim and shape and came out a new man. oh yeah, definitely a new man.  maybe they shouldn't hire people right out of beauty school
this establishment processed an un-authorized over-charge on my credit card.  this stylist basically gave herself a higher tip.  i will never come back.

edit: ever since isis and kourtney have left, the place has really gone down hill. horrible service!very friendly staff. awesome, inexpensive haircuts. i have been going since i moved to the area 1 1/2 yrs ago. location is perfect for the vast sea of houses in and around indian springs/evans area.  so you actually get to avoid the chaos that is 281.

i arrived as they were opening,  there was no wait and the stylist greeted me with a smile.  the stylist did a great job making suggestions to style my hair and was very polite.  the haircut was great,  the shampoo awesome and the overall treatment very good. i think prior negative reviews may not be fair, i mean honestly...  i recommend it,  close home cheap and good service.  definitely planning on returning with my kids.

beware!!!  i recently had my haircut at this location and the stylist absolutely ruined my hair.  for the next few months, i'm going to have to wear my hair pulled back in clips due to the fact that the sides don't even match up.  i would go back, but i'm afraid they would just make matters worse.   spend the extra money and go to a salon where the stylists actually care about their work.

as a long time customer and a college student....i am a faithful customer....your rates are best one can find in the city....i just moved from san marcos, tx to san antonio.....after growing at my hair for a year i find cutting it hard...a man without his hair is like a women is who isnt pretty....that said going into a supercuts : i was completely dismayed.....while my hair was getting cut...my hair cutter was also cutting a little boys hair....i live in a classy part of san antonio and was recently invited to a ritzy party in downtown now i dont know if i can show my face....before the incident i looked like a respected individual ready for classes in two weeks....now i look like a punk with no hair going to the military....when i was receiving my hair cut i asked for my sides to be thinned not a mohawk..... if this is how you treat an individual much needs to be improved with your company and the faculty that represents you!.....
jezebel is fantastic. she listens to her customers to ensure they get the haircut they want. i've not been disappointed with her service.

i have been here 45 minutes   there are 3 workers but only 1 is cutting hair. terrible customer servicei can't imagine who owns this place and allows the workers not to work. don't waste your time. hi somewhere else

omg. if lisa actually cut hair as much as she talked there wouldn't be long waits. i dont think she knows how to cut hair and have a conversation at the same time. everytime she starts talking the cutting stops. even worse when she turns around to talk to the other employees. not everyone wants or cares about your conversations. who cares who is traveling to cancun this weekend. just cut the dang hair. and while we are at it get that damn mop out of tour face you cant even see with that hair hanging over your right eye. looks like my dog

the swatch i picked for my hair color was the brightest red and when elisa colored my hair and it looked almost black i asked why it was so dark.  "oh, i just mixed all the colors."  whaaaaaaaaaat?  my hair looked better when i walked in than when she was done.  instead of charging $45 like all the other hair stylists did (who had done a good job) she charged me $75 without much of an explanation.  it had taken her about an hour longer than the other hairstylists to do the same job and she reeked of smoke.  never again.

come in when the place was virtually devoid of customers. there was one gal finishing up a haircut, and another standing around doing nothing. the haircut gets finished, and then both stylists just stand around texting and chatting, while no haircuts get done.i got my haircut completed, and went straight to a meeting, where they suggested i get a haircut. i guess i didn't get enough lopped off of my curly mane. parking is easy here, and there's lots of places nearby to hang out at while waiting for your hair cut. the price was higher than i'm accustomed to paying for a hair cut, but i guess this isn't the drive-thru at rio's golden cuts.

7 people in the waiting area. 0 people cutting hair, down from 1 who just finished a haircut and is now outside.  app said a 5 minute wait, i've now been here 45 minutes with no indication that haircuts will start again soon, because the only other hairdresser here has been talking to some dude for 30 minutes. it's 11:45 on a friday.  jezebel cut my hair and did a great job- but the overall staffing needs some work.
does anyone know which salon brittani (sp?) moved to? five stars to her, zero stars to the witch that just jacked up my do.

i i have been getting my hair cut by lisa at this location for the last year and she is wonderful. she will give you advice on what cur to get if you're unsure and suggest different practices or cheap products to use. great service!

butcher job!  been here 5 times since moving to the area.  i don't believe i've seen the same girl twice.  they must have a hugh turnover.  for the most part the cuts have been acceptable.  i'm really not that particular.  i figure it'll grow back quickly.  however, this last time i got a girl named karina, and and absolute butcher job.  took most everything off the top, and left the back really long.  definitely won't let her near me again.

brittini did an excellent job and truly shows how loving what you do can result in a truly exceptional experience for clientele. this was my first visit here and because of the customer service will not be the last.

laura is a great and always has a good attitude. it took me a year to find someone to give me a good haircut in sa. i am glad i found someone who knows what they are doing.  if you do visit this location and need to get a cut ask for laura cause she does a good job and genuinely cares what your hair looks like after you leave...basically she has what others lack which is common sense.

i couldn't have been happier. the supercuts on stone oak blvd closed and i loved that place!(shout out to jasmine and stacy!)i've was hesitant about where to go, but finally had to get a haircut since i decided to go someplace close to home for a haircut, and i looked silly.  i decided to get the cut fixed at the next closest supercuts. this place was amazing!!  the salon is very nice; the stylists were so nice and professional!  my haircut was perfect!!   the stylists take the time to listen to what you want, ask questions, and then do exactly what you want.can't say enough good about this place. i'll definitely be back!

i am not sure about other supercuts locations, but be aware.... if your visiting this location make an appointment online! i walked in around 4:20pm and there was only one hairstylist cutting a gentleman's hair. first thing i thought was "awesome! no wait." then the hairstylist asked for my name, and told me she was booked with appointments until after 5pm.  my no wait, turned into a 40-45min wait, no thank you. so i thanked her and left. i don't blame the hairstylist for being the only hairstylist working, or even the fact she was booked with appointments. i do however think that no business can thrive if they have no supply to demand. they definitely need more hairstylists at this location. unfortunately i'll have to take my business elsewhere.

okay ! won't lie, i was a bit nervous to cut my longggg hair at super cuts. i always thought of them as a men's barbershop, but i was feeling wild and was open for anything ! upon walking in, i was greeted, told the waiting time and received a smile. i was next in line on brittany's chair, and she was extremely helpful attentive to my new hair look desires. she did a fantastic job ! and to top if off, it only cost $15! i would highly recommend her and will be coming back for my trims !

my husband went in for a haircut and came out bleeding with blood all over his shirt. the lady cutting his hair never stopped talking about herself and chopped off all of his hair. when he returned home, he had patches of hair left near his neck and has a huge section of scratches and cuts. he was bleeding and had been scratched up. the prices are also more expensive than the other supercuts just just 2 miles away. i get that if you walk in to a low budget barber shop you may get what you pay for, but does that also mean, blood, sweat and tears.

this location is fairly new and started off strong.  there were plenty of employees and it was in and out.  on my last three visits there has only been one employee and long waits with people who checked in online coming in before you.  unfortunately im going to have to go back to fantastic sam's.  this the supercuts located in bulverde shopping center in san antonio, texas, at bulverde & 1604.

i made an appt for 715 on my app and it said there was a 35 minute wait. so i got here around 715-716. i walked in and they said hello and to sign in. then about 5-8 mins later, the one stylist said "you checked in online?" and i said "yes ma'am!" she said "okay we'll be right with you." i sat down and about 20 mins later i am/was still waiting. there was another stylist who finished with a client and took another customer that came in about 15 mins after me. i usually don't come here, but i've been her before and never had any other problems. i'm missing my stylist bc she's on maternity leave......

i always get my haircut way past the time i should.  i like i can go to supercuts and get it cut the day i feel like i really need it.  recommend that you pick your stylist on line and set that appt. up.  this is a walk-in hair company so you may wait if you walk in.   love patty.  she is always friendly and gets the job done. very affordable.  thanks again.

i needed a quick trim before flying out to a wedding.  patty did a great job and now my hair looks great!  you can't beat the,$13.99 price either (i didn't need a shampoo or blow dry ... that'll run you only $20.00).  i'll be back in 6 weeks!

supercuts is always good if you're looking for a quick trim and an unbeatable price for ladies. really can't complain too much when the haircut ends up coming out to less than $20 overall.the stylists are nice, my only beef was that when i went in to get a trim the stylist didn't know how to trim my bangs. their not crazy, just side swept. i could tell when she got to them that she was really struggling with how to cut it and trim it. they kept coming out choppy and uneven all over. since i've had this hair cut for an extremely long time, i've seen the same technique used through different stylists over the years (and throughout different states). i hate to tell people how to do their jobs, but it's also how they learn. i mentioned to her how others have trimmed the bangs and she still seemed extremely lost. was just a concerning since bangs seem really common these days- this easy request turned into somewhat of a nail bitter for me. they didn't get butchered too bad though, i was able to fix them at home- and like i said you can't really complain with a price like that.
don't go on tuesdays.  only 2 people working and one helping run front counter.   expect a long, long wait due to them being under staffed.  try another place.
you get what you pay for....usually a hit or a miss it really does depend on who you get....i recommend scheduling ahead of time with the right person.

the service was fast and professional! they said "25 min wait" and they did not lie to us. i got my brother a kid's cut and she did an amazing job. the cut was sharp and only cost $10, but as i was standing in line another patron had a coupon, but was unable to use it so she gave it to me! the hair cut was only $7.95! i tipped $4 bucks and i will go back there the next time my brother needs a haircut!

great cut, great price - i have a huge amount of hair and jasmine did a fantastic job, from washing to finishing. she talked me through what she recommended, then cut it just like we agreed. add in a superb scalp massage and i'm sold. my husband and our sons also get their hair cut here and they are really happy with both jasmine and gracie. jasmine was working by herself and she did a really good job on my hair while also greeting new customers and checking them in. i didn't feel rushed at all even though she had a client waiting for their turn. great experience and i'll be back!

awful. just awful, i explained the simple cut and even showed her pics. i felt bad for the lady cause i shortly learned she had no clue what she was doing, by the time i stopped her, it was too late and my daughter paid the price right before a birthday party. this place is on my "never again" list. sadly my husband has gone there for over a year. do not go to this lady!

graciela gave me a great haircut!  she listened intently to what i wanted and though it took her extra time, wow, it is perfect!  thank you graciela!  i'll definitely be back cause on top of that, the price was great!  i am so pleased, yes, so very, very pleased.

my husband goes here and doesn't have trouble. i went in and there was one stylist working on someone's hair. she didn't even acknowledge me when i walked in. there was a family that came in as i did and they were acknowledged. i was sitting there and up came another stylist and took one of the family members before me. i just needed a trim and style. i will not be coming back. i can see what others mean by unprofessional.
this location is dated and the staff are unprofessional.  i've seen the hair stylists take personal calls during haircuts.  super long waits even when there is nobody there...
only one hairdresser on staff and she is not friendly at all. to me it seems like she hates life and hates what she is doing
literally my hair looks like i tried to cut it myself, with a viking sword, without a mirror, with only my left hand. it is truly unbelievable how bad they messed my hair up.

checking in online with their new app is  a complete waste of time. checked in 45 minutes early so once i arrived i could walk in and be serviced. to my surprise both ladies working that evening took multiple clients after me showing up and checking in. at that time i was told that i would be taken care of they did not inform me i would have to wait an additional 20 minutes and  three customer later i was next. then as i left the premises a large gentlemen came out after i had left assuming to make sure no trouble was to be started.... since when were workers spouses/ boyfriends allowed to start sitting in chairs behind the counter where stylists work and act like a hired body guard to super cuts employees ? i won't be returning to super cuts and the bad thing is i have been a customer since i was a young child.

the young lady that had done my hair  twice is perfect. i cant remember her name ( it starts with an  r ) but she has been perfect , i am an unconventional woman (( not the usual just a trim person and wear my hair in a flattop ) and she listens and does exactly what i wanted even doing a couple of design lines in the back . could not ask for better !!!

went with my husband. first stylist said she didn't know how to cut a flat top. we said we'd wait because three other stylists were there. after waiting 25 minutes one stylist took someone who came in after we did (he'd called for an appt so that's fine) but the other two went to lunch without saying a word. just disappeared. so we left. amazingly poor service. won't be back.
they did better than the barber shop on lackland afb but not the best haircut my husband has gotten.
1st time coming here, i needed 2 haircuts for my children came in without an appt.  and they took them super fast. definitely coming back again, great  and friendly customer service.

since when does it take two ladies to go talk about high lights costs and different colors. to make it worse both ladies left their stations to talk. errrrrrr. oh well, hair cut ended up ok but i do think they need more stylist.

i've been here a few times for myself and son. all times we were taken care of right away and our haircuts have always been on-point. the ladies are very sweet and after sitting there for a few hours having color done, i noticed a lot of regulars come through which was very nice to see.

i came in and was told there were 2 people in front of me.  there were two people waiting, so ok.  i understand that people check in online, but 4 people later i was still sitting there.  i get it, people have their regulars, but at least have the courtesy to acknowledge the customer still waiting as people after them are checking in and seen before them.

went and got highlights and it took about 2 hours. all the girls there were very professional and my hair came out great. i noticed that the store is very clean, cleaner than i have seen anywhere else. i noticed all the stylist were pretty fast, most of them told me hello while i was "cooking" as they called it. so basically it was a fun to group of girls who managed to interact with everyone. later on in the day i took my 4 year old son to get a zero fade and it came out excellent. defiantly a family environment. i will most defiantly be back. tuesday they have $10 haircuts.
the only person i go to is rosalina. she does a good job, so far my experience is the people are quite friendly.
one person ahead of me. waited over an hour to get service. the ladies on the weekend are super slow. never had bad service here before. however note dont come on sunday.

i will never go to another super cuts again. the people that worked there were rude to another customer, did not know how to cut hair. i know i was in trouble when i told them to cut my son hair medium fade 0 on the side and a 2 on top. and the lady said do i want to keep the sideburns.  lol did not know how to do a fade and another women had to finish it. my bad experience.

they did a decent job on my daughters hair, shaped it to frame her face, facility was clean and close to my house for a quick trim it works but i didn't like is that i waited 30 minutes after my appointment time.

sitting here waiting for 45 minutes, 2 hairstylists cutting hair, and many more keep popping from the back, just look out and go back to their little room in the back. wait is ridiculous, only reason i stopped here, again, is to give them a second chance from previous times months ago, again, same service. slow, and girls here seem to hate their job. for sure not giving them a 3rd chance.

i'm usually skeptical to go to places like this for a haircut because i'm super picky and sometimes i don't want to splurge for a simple haircut/ trim.  my friend recommended me to stop by here and ask for mary and omg every time i go i am  always satisfied!!! i can show mary a picture of what i'm aiming for and she always gives her honest opinion before she cuts my hair and that's what a good stylist should do! please please try it out and ask for mary she's the best you won't regret it!
best hair cut i've had in many years. come by and see mary i promise you won't be disappointed.

the skills of the stylists is average yet no one seems like they actually enjoy working here. it's frustrating to be told you're next on the list and then 5 people get called before you. their explanation was that other people had checked in online or called ahead but shouldn't that have been mentioned when we initially checked in? i'm fine with waiting as long as i have a good idea of how long i'll actually be waiting for.

supercuts does a fine job of cutting my hair. then again i have a very simple hairstyle. if you're looking for inexpensive salon treatment for your coiffure then i would give supercuts a minute. my biggest complaint is that they always leave too many cut hairs on my head and down the back of my neck and shirt. this happens not only at this location but every supercuts i have been to. immediately after getting a haircut i always go to the bathroom and wet my hands and run them through my head to remove all the little hairs. i don't know if this is due to improper training or desire to sell you a shampoo and rinse but this is not acceptable.

i visited this location when i was out of my state for a wedding. the place is nice clean and efficient. they're realistic on wait time and everyone greats you. it was my 1st time going there and i need a updo for a wedding. sarah jane ( i believe that was her name) who actually did my hair was nice and friendly. she kept making sure she wasn't being to rough with my head. i didn't know exactly how i wanted my hair i suggested somethings to her and showed her the dress i was going to wear. she did a fantastic job.

apparently the solution for a cowlick here is to cut it super short... despite the hair around it being about 2-3 inches long. i am not too picky about my hair. first, because i still have a decent head of hair and that makes me happy. second, it grows back. but when a stylist is as lazy or incompetent as to simply cut the cowlick extra short in hopes that addresses the issue i get a little upset. what makes the matter worse is when i noticed the hair on the back of my head was longer than other parts i asked her "why is not even with the front?" and she told me "because i don't want the cowlick to stand up." i did not notice the botched job she did until i got home and was extra mad because not only did she cut the cowlick extra short, she used the cowlick as an excuse for keeping the hair uneven on top my head! avoid this place! there are plenty of others within the couple miles.

haircuts are quick and usually decent, though quality can vary by stylist. my kids get great cuts here. i don't like to have my own done here, though, as nobody seems to be able to cut decent layers. i did get my bangs trimmed today while my son got a haircut, and while i was happy with my bangs, i was pretty disappointed with the experience. my stylist asked if i wanted a haircut too and i declined. she talked me into a half-inch trim, which she completed in under 5 minutes on my completely dry hair--didn't spritz it with water, let alone wash it--then charged me for a full haircut. i thought it was odd she didn't even wet it down, but then thought maybe she was being nice and still considering it a bang trim--nope. won't make that mistake again--or go back to this location.

for starters, i love this supercuts! i've been coming here for several years and have never left unhappy!! i recently got my hair dyed and my hair definitely took to the the color and it came out way too dark. i was so unhappy with the color. not anyone's fault, just wrong selection of color done by us. ‍ well i came in today and emma was so helpful and patient when trying to fix my color. she worked so diligently to make sure i left happy but also to keep my hair healthy. it was trial and error, but i'm so happy with how my hair turned out! i had to hug her at the end! definitely recommend this supercuts and emma!

i'm not one to write reviews, i actually created an account specifically to write how horrible this location is.hands down worst haircut i have had done. the girl had no idea what she was doing. she attempted to tell me she was done, i had to point out the obvious patches of hair she left. i would've asked her to fix it but i was worried she would leave me nothing to fix if she made it worse. i asked for gel and instead of her styling my hair i had to do it myself because let me quote her, "my fingers are stubby". if you can't apply gel to someone's hair you probably shouldn't be cutting it to begin with.there was another employee kissing her partner which was very unprofessional.i've gone to supercuts for awhile and this is by far the worst location and experience i've had. if i could give it zero stars i would.avoid if you like your hair!

i usually like going here, but the last time i went the lady who cut my hair seemed to be in a huge rush even though there was no one else waiting.just chopped at my hair with scissors with almost no attempt at making look like i didn't just grab scissors and do it myself

i checked in online, drove over there only to find they were closed at 5:45 pm on a monday night to film a commercial. perhaps you shouldn't take reservations if you're closed. perhaps you should change your website to reflect your random closings. thanks for wasting my time. if you can't do the simple things right, you can't be trusted with anything.
the best bang for your buck !!!!!great hair style and friendly atmosphere.

dee is my favorite.the ladies in here are always having a good time and atmosphere here is alway lively i've had 3 - 4 great hair cuts hereask them to go hard on you during the hair rinse,      you'll thank me later.

i have been coming to this location for well over 7 years! lenzy is by far the best! you may walk in as just a client but you leave knowing your part of the supercuts family! all the others ladies are friendly! love this place!!!!!

wow! i have been coming here for over two years now and this place has always exceeded my expectations. the ladies are friendly, welcoming, and professional. you can tell they love their job. i have been going to lyndsey the longest. she is amazing as well as dee! the prices cannot be beat and the wait time is not long. i've never had any complaints. i highly recommend. i will be back soon!
they did a sloppy haircut on me and my dad. the people were rude and i do not recommend this place.

the girl with pink hair named kayla cut my brothers hair who is very specific with the way he wants his hair and she was told to just trim the sides of his head and she ended up cutting off his hair on the top of his head and left him with a very sad and ugly hair due which left my brother crying after leaving the salon. supercuts is not the place you want to go to get you're hair cut (the way you want it.) this all explains on why the place was empty and only $15.

i came in and saw lyndsey yesterday and she did a phenomenal job on my short haircut. i tried cutting my hair myself to be short enough for work and it didn't turn out too hot. but anyway, she was incredibly professional and very kind to me. i would highly recommend and will definitely come back if i'm still staying here in town.
sarah did awesome job! she cut and style my hair perfectly. she listened my wishes and  gave me few suggestions and i end up walking out with big smile. i will def go back.
this is an update. lindsey and angie are still there and continue to do a great job. they also have dee and another young lady there who do great work as well.
great haircut for a reasonable price.  karen is the bomb, especially if you get a shampoo, and lindsay is good, too, with her spicy personality hahaha...
great and friendly staff! lenzy is a great stylist! dee is wonderful! you can't go wrong with either stylist!!
dee was absolutely awesome. i had an appointment at another place a little further down the road. but, they stood me up so i went here instead. i'm really glad that i did. i will be back. thank you!!

i had my hair cut today by dee, she was friendly, professional and did a great job on my hair. this was the first time i visited a supercuts and am very please that i did. i will definitely return. thanks dee!

very good and friendly! walked in without an appointment but didn't have to wait very long to be serviced. there were two ladies working and both were very nice and welcoming. the parking is ample and the service is great. it didn't take very long for her to clean up my hair and bangs, and she also gave me recommendations for good food places! decent pricing as well. i would come back if i was back in san antonio again. thank you for the great service! keep up the great work!

i had a good experience here: all the ladies were nice, and payed close attention to what i had to say. i hadn't gotten a haircut for a while, but each place i went to didn't listen to what i wanted. so in other words i am very protective with my hair and who cuts it. i'm a college student, i needed somewhere cheap but does good quality cuts. i'm very happy i found this place and i will be going back more and more.

lived in sa for 6 months and went here off and on. best supercuts i've ever been too. never got a bad hair cut here and could trust all the girls there. took one star off cause i would prefer to wait an extra two minutes than to walk through and sit in a strangers hair...

i wanted a cut that was shorter, long enough to pull up off my neck when needed, easy maintenance and still cute after a wash and go. chloe did exactly that!  love it!  i recommend chloe if you need a cut.

not pleased. i have been here since 430 for 2 haircuts.
